name: Dungeon Twister: 20th Anniversary Edition
description:
Enter the captivating world of Dungeon Twister, the famous strategy game created by Christophe Boelinger, with this revised and improved 20th Anniversary Edition.

In Dungeon Twister, 2 to 4 players take on the role of a team of heroes imprisoned by the Mad Archmage in an ever-changing dungeon riddled with deadly traps. Will you be up to the challenge of surviving and entertaining your jailer?

Players compete by strategically exploiting their adventurers' skills and the opportunities created by the maze's ever-changing shape. To win the game, eliminate your opponents by magic, force or cunning, and activate the mechanisms that will make them fall into a trap. Bring back precious treasures or escape alive to earn victory points.

With Dungeon Twister, strategy is at the heart of each and every one of your actions. The game features :


A tactical action system: plan your turn and choose the best action card to optimize your moves. Keep track of the cards played by your opponents to anticipate their next actions.
Multiple ways to win: take advantage of the enemy heroes' weaknesses and defeat them, control strategic points or dodge the battle and escape the dungeon to earn victory points.
An evolutive and interactive board: adapt your tactics with each tile revealed. Activate mechanisms to rotate them to your advantage, open up new opportunities or block other players' strategies. Strengthen your heroes with magic items scattered throughout the labyrinth.
Heroes with diverse skills: each adventurer has unique skills to overcome the maze's challenges or thwart your opponents' plans. Will you choose a skillful passe-muraille, a powerful ogre, or why not both?


For its 20th anniversary, Dungeon Twister is back with a whole range of improvements.


Reinvented art direction: dive into Dungeon Twister's labyrinth with completely revamped illustrations and designs. Each room and passageway comes to life thanks to a modern, dynamic and colourful art direction, offering a new level of immersion in the face of countless dungeon challenges. All this is possible thanks to the creativity of talented illustrators such as Guillaume Tavernier, Mylène Bertrand and Didier Poli.



Never-before-seen miniatures: Every character in the game, from the clever wizard to the mighty warrior, has been beautifully redesigned and sculpted. These new, finely detailed miniatures faithfully reflect their special abilities and strategic roles in the game.



Improved materials and enlarged tiles: We're thinking big for this Anniversary Edition. Every tile is now larger and thicker. The design of the dungeon corridors has been re-imagined for more surprises and challenges. The game boards are more sturdy and every component has been carefully chosen to guarantee greater durability and enhanced game enjoyment.



A well-stocked basic box: Vary your Dungeon Twister games with this new edition, which includes the Paladins & Dragons expansion and the module for playing with up to 4 players. Diversify your team settings and take on even more challenges!


—description from the publisher

name: Im Zickzack voran!
description:
Two field camps face each other in trenches. There are obstacles between these entrenchments, so that the advance can only take place in zigzags.
Each field camp has the same number of divisions and regiments, represented by large and small colored pyramids that tilt as you move. In doing so, they push enemy companies (red dots on the game board), which are captured by covering up. The goal is to take as many prisoners as possible and conquer the enemy entrenchment.
The starting position is indicated by the red border line, where the two large pyramids are first placed on the triangles that are outlined with a white double line. A small pyramid is placed to the right and left of each large pyramid, also on the triangles that are bordered with a white double line.
Germany moves first by tilting one of its pyramids and placing it on an adjacent field. The opponent does the same, so the game is played one move at a time. The pyramids can only be tilted by folding over one of the three sides in such a way that the rotating edge remains on the original line, so it must not be tilted over the top.
Whoever has occupied all 8 bright squares marked with points in the opponent's fortifications with his or her own or someone else's pieces can call “Stop”; the game is then over.
The party that has taken the most prisoners, i.e. can add up the most points under their pyramids, wins.

The game was published during WWI.

—user summary

name: Klar zum Gefecht.
description:
The game is played alternately by pushing all cruisers and pushing an ironclad. The cruisers are all set in motion with each turn; They may advance up to three spaces at will, but only in a straight line. Every cruiser must be moved as long as it is not on one of the small crosses within the large red crosses. In this case, it can be set in motion again from there at the player's discretion.
The ironclads are only set in motion one at a time and can travel as far as they want in one direction, i.e. unless it encounters another ship and is forced to stop.
Ironclads or cruisers can drive over the minefields, but are lost as soon as they stop or have to stop on them.
If a cruiser sinks a mine ring when leaving one of the harbor bases, which can only happen if the chimney was vertically on the base during the move, the 9 spaces that the mine ring touches may no longer be used by both parties.
No ship is allowed to jump over another one of your own or enemy fleet. This only happens when an ironclad is drilling a cruiser into the ground; it must do so as soon as the cruiser is within one of the ironclad's four directions of travel.
A ship that is wedged in such a way that it can no longer move will be taken away by the opponent on the next move. But as long as one of the ironclads can still move, the other ironclads that may be wedged in cannot be taken away.

Germany has won

if it has occupied the three crosses within the large red crosses with three cruisers and has also occupied the base closest to the coast with a cruiser or occupied it with a mine ring;
when the three ironclads have been put out of action.


England has won

if two of its ironclads come to rest in such a way that they completely or partially cover at least four of the former cruiser locations;
if at least 5 cruisers are out of action and one ironclad is still maneuverable.
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Soccer Blaze
description: Soccer Blaze is a free PNP (Print and Play) turn based dice game that simulates a soccer match. Using the rules as displayed in the rulebook, the main objective is to achieve victory, by, obviously, scoring more goals than the opponent team.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Siblings Trouble: Chance and Destiny Expansion
description:
Over the years, we’ve had lots of ideas to add to the game and make awesome new content. We're so excited to share this expanded deluxe edition with you! It includes all of the original stuff from The Siblings Trouble plus all of the content from the Chance & Destiny Expansion listed below in a really cool new box!

The Museum of Mystery and Spooky Old House are brand new, exciting locations! Will you see an exhibit come to life? How will you outwit the ghosts and witches?

More Stuff for All of the Existing Content offers a new sibling to play as, plus more options for treasures, big secrets, path cards, encounters, and bosses.

The Destiny Character acts as a story guide with a game mode to include a Gamemaster role, add more storytelling moments, and help support younger players.

The Journey Continues Mode gives you the chance to connect adventures and continue your story across more locations for even more epic tales!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Zipi y Zape: ¿Quien llegará primero a casa?
description: Zipi and Zape, playing their usual pranks, dismantle the statue on the Paseo. Their parents, outraged, go out to meet them and punish them. Who will get there first?

name: Role Quest: NSFW Mini Expansion
description:
The expansion includes additional curse and action cards and also introduces Item cards to the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Area Movement, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Pin y Pon: Cuidado con el lobo
description: Choose one of your favorite characters from the popular Pin and Pon toy series and run around the farm running away from the wolf.

name: Underbranch
description:
Underbranch is an abstract push-your-luck set building game of 64 multi-use cards.

The cards have two halves: a number half (numbers 1 to 10 in six suits) and an objective half (Flush, Straight, Even numbers, etc). The numbers are played on top of matching objectives, and the sets form columns where subsequent sets must fulfill the combined requirements of all earlier objectives in the same column.

On a turn, you have four action options:

Play a number card from a queue
Play a number card from the deck
Play an objective card from the deck
Draw 3 objective cards: play one, discard one, return one


The game ends when you cannot do any action, or do not want to do any action, or if the discard pile has 11 cards or more.

At game end, the sets that have been built between objectives are scored. You gain victory points based on the number of cards in a set and the set's level in the column.

Although mainly a solo game, the rules include competitive and cooperative variants for two players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mindbug: Percheval le Gallois – Carte promo
description:
Percheval le Gallois / Rittier is the official tournament card of Mindbug, released in 2024, and every participant gets it for free.

Card effects (translated from French/German):

TOUGH

You cannot lose HP.
Defeated: You lose the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Take That

name: Urban Insanity: Aliens
description:
Admit it, you’ve suspected that they walk among us. Aliens can appear in any part of the city unannounced and uninvited! And they do not play by the rules! They can abduct your Urbanites and take them hostage.
Watch your cities get infected with these little green maniacs who seem to teleport across the map and show up just where you least expect them.
Take me to your leader! Urban Insanity has just gone interstellar!

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Flutter: The Great Speculation Game
description:
Corner a stock by gaining possession of a preference share and four ordinary shares. The winner takes all of the counters in the pool.

The game is played with up to six sets of shares to match the number of players. Each player is randomly dealt five shares and pays 20 counters into the pool. A separate deck of exchange cards is used to buy and sell shares. Players can only hold up to 5 shares in their hand.

The player to the left of the dealer (or previous player) names a share to deal in. An exchange card is then turned over. The exchange cards give three outcomes - quoted, call, or dividend.

With “quoted”, that player may sell any of the named shares to the pool at the quoted price.
With “call”, every player must put a specified number of counters into the pool for each share of the named share.
With “dividend”, every player takes a certain number of counters out per share held and preference shares take double that amount.

—user summary

name: SlideAscope
description:
Embark on a thrilling, tile-matching adventure with SlideAscope! Score big by strategically placing tiles to match sides and create cascading combos. Tiles slide down, opening up new opportunities to match. Outsmart your opponents and aim for the highest score to emerge victorious in this exhilarating game of spatial reasoning and critical thinking.

—description from the publisher

To play, pull tiles one at a time to create a 5 x 8 grid of 40 tiles inside the frame provided, allowing the orientation of the tiles to be completely random. It is ok if shapes sometimes match up. The starting grid will be different each game.

Put the remaining tiles face down near the board to form several draw piles. Each player draws a starting tile.

Players take turns scoring as many points as possible each turn by matching the sides of the placed tile to the sides of the tiles in the playing field.

The center of each tile is numbered 1 through 4 for scoring at the end of the game. Around the outside of each tile are a selection of half-shapes. There are six half-shapes in the game. Your goal is to place a tile to match two identical halves of a shape to create a whole shape. Then, collect the tile you matched, leaving the tile you placed.

As tiles are matched and collected, the remaining tiles above will slide down, possibly creating more matches and earning you more points.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

—user summary

name: テンテンルーテン (Tentenruten)
description:
Tentenruten is a set collection game using cards with different numbers on the top and bottom. On your turn, you can choose to score a set, keeping one to show how many points you've earned, and passing the others, upside down, to your neighbor; or flip your hand, passing any one card to your neighbor, and they may choose the orientation.

The game end is triggered when either one player has played all of their cards or scored a certain number of points. The player who played all of their cards or scored the most points wins.

name: Songoku
description:
Songoku is a card game heavily steeped in the story of the Monkey King and buddhism.

In the game, players reveal virtue cards, compete for sutra cards, and trade various goods.

The player with the most points wins the reward card stack is exhausted wins.

name: The Ghost of Crimson Sky Ranch
description:
Welcome to Crimson Sky Ranch, nestled on the outskirts of dusty Texas. The ranch, once known as a quiet and uneventful place, now holds an air of mystery and unease due to a recent incident. The young owner of Crimson Sky Ranch, Samuel Blackwood, was recently found lifeless in his residence with no visible wounds, and the scene was devoid of any conventional clues. With Samuel having no reason to die this way due to his young age and good health, the officers at the local police department are left scratching their heads. With no evidence linking anyone to a committed crime, they’ve had no choice but to write the case off as an unfortunate event of natural cause, thereby closing the investigation.

The townsfolk however, having a history of telling myths and legends around the ranch, believe otherwise. They whisper of something supernatural among them. The people were quick to dub the potential assailant as “The Ghost of Crimson Sky Ranch" - a phantom that struck without leaving a trace.

Upon learning about this case, you feel a sense of unease and a suspicion that there's more to the story waiting to be uncovered. Being the detective you are, with a strong determination to solve difficult cases, you decide to reopen the case to pursue the truth. As the ghostly tales echo through the town, you arrive at Crimson Sky Ranch to figure out what truly happened.

—description from the publisher

name: Agents of M.A.R.S.: Objective Initiative
description:
Agents of M.A.R.S.: Objective Initiative is a small optional expansion for the core game, which adds a series of objective cards that can be drawn at the start of the game to guarantee that both players don’t have the same setup.

The expansion includes two 24 card decks.
The only difference between these two decks is the colour scheme used for the cards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Coverage, Hidden Victory Points

name: Antarktis: Die Wanderung der Pinguine
description: Emperor penguins with their waiter's livery and typical waddling gait belong to Antarctica like eternal ice. In real life they are arrow-fast swimmers and can dive up to 500 meters deep, but for this game you can only hike over the ice floes and not fall into the water. The goal is to get 5 penguins to the other side. Problems come with your opponent and a tactical difficulty: the playing field and thus the position of the ice floes is constantly in motion and changes after each move. They first pull a penguin and then push a blue playing field stone from a believable side into the playing field. If you do it wisely, you can push opposing pieces out of bounds (back to start) and pave the way for your pieces for the next move.
mechanics: Map Deformation, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Slide/Push

name: Cyber Defense
description:
The modern high-tech world is full of digital perils. The internet age has brought a cornucopia of knowledge and technological progress. However, we are prey to digital predators. Cyber Defense thematically explores concepts in cyber security. Modern computer systems are vulnerable to cyber attacks, and there is a constant vigil to keep computer systems safe against cyber attacks through cyber security measures. Common types of cyber attacks include Phishing, Man-in-the-middle and Distributed Denial of Service (DDOS) attacks. In Cyber Defense, one player plays as the Hacker who is trying to crack a password. The other player plays as the Defender trying to keep their password safe.

OBJECTIVE – The objective for the Hacker is to try to deduce the Defender’s password. The objective of the Defender is to try to protect his password.
GAME PLAY – Each turn, players develop battlegrounds, play card effects, and resolve battlegrounds. Winning battlegrounds allows the Hacker to try to deduce the Defender’s password. When the Defender wins battlegrounds, they can strengthen their password and reduce the effectiveness of Hacker attacks.
GAME END AND WINNING – The game ends after three rounds or if the Hacker has cracked the Defender’s password.
THEME – Cyber Security

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Deduction, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deduction

name: Searching for Legends
description:
Searching for Legends is a competitive cryptid-centric board game where 2 – 6 players collect supplies, travel the world, and hunt local and legendary creatures!

The number of creatures catalogued in our game allows for near-limitless replayability, and features many obscure and lesser-known cryptids; sure to educate and entertain!

Gather supplies and weapons, thwart your friends with Plot Twists, and complete your Legendary Assignments in our easy-to-learn, one-of-a-kind game! Compete with your friends to become a Legend! Happy Hunting!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Movement Points, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Clinic: Deluxe Edition – 69th Blue Expansion
description:
This is the first stupid Clinic Deluxe Expansion with adult contents. It must be taken with a big dose of humour...

It contains 6 new big modules, 98 new tiles, 56 new Wooden Meeples! Visit the Sperm Bank, use the Condom Vending Machine, treat your sexual addiction, smoke Therapeutic or not Cannabis, make some Genetic Research to solve the Zombies case, or use your new risky Cryogenic tanks and treat the patients at the end of the game !

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Medical, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement

name: Clinic: Deluxe Edition – 69th Pink Extension
description:
This is the second stupid and bad taste expansion for Clinic. Released with the 69th Blue Expansion, it must be taken with humour...
It contains adult themes like Cosmetic Surgeries with your new Pop star meeples, gynecologist new doctor and contraceptive pills, the new Obesity institute... Discover the secret of the very inside of the Clinic with lustful doctors, lubricious nurses, and seductive secretaries...

A new set of 15 Randomizer cards and a pink-blue pills tokens have been added on the punched board to replace the real pills for wet fingers!

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Medical, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement

name: Dungeon Rummy
description:
The first game set in the Misfits Universe. Four reckless (and not great) heroes decided to throw themselves against (not that) fearsome foes for a pump of adrenaline.

Each player has his own deck with 26 cards following a traditional deck of cards (with a twist). They will face monsters requiring specific combination to be defeated: three of a kind, four of a kind, canastas (or just good old damage)

During the Monster phase (they are always faster) they will inflict damage on the heroes. If a deck runs out, a hero is knocked out or they can’t play any cards the game is over. If they defeat the boss, they win!

—description from the designer

name: Into the Unknown:  Russia 1941
description:
This is a kind of distillation of my previous hex-and-counter Barbarossa games, onto a standard US wargaming 22x34" mapboard.

Refined Disruption mechanics, including a Both Disrupted (BD) result which reminds me of the old Engaged result in some past games. If the Axis player does not want to exchange, he can accept a Disruption result against the defender instead of a 0.5 exchange result, or a BD result in the event of a 1.0 exchange.
Accept the losses to get a major breakthrough? Luck can be pressed on offense or defense.

Basically corps to army level with selected panzer divisions for small change.

Half-month turns which should play 33% faster than for Death Struggle.

Hidden Russian units. Overall Russian strength may not be known until game's end, and that can affect victory requirements, up or down.
The big if slow Russian mechanized corps are just as clumsily dangerous as ever ... if they exist.
How hard to push? How big a risk to take? ... as historically!
Some solitaire potential on the German side.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Push Your Luck, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Dastardly Dog Dogpocalypse
description:
Dastardly Dog's Dogpocalypse is a 2-8 player card game for families and parties, it takes 5 minutes to learn and 20 minutes to play. Race to the Winners Bone with Rainbow-Farts, Dogapults, Go-karts, jet packs, and more or you can attack the other dogs with UFOs, Zombies, Mini-Nukes, Lightning Strikes, dog catchers, and more but don't forget to yell woof or you'll have to restart.

A family-friendly card game that's perfect for all ages, Adults, Teens, and Kids. It's 2-8 players so it's great for small get-togethers or it doubles as a fun party game to break the ice and stay cool!
With fast-paced action, each round only takes about 20 minutes to play, so much fun that you will. Be Dastardly, Play Often!

Learn to play in as little as 5 minutes with easy-to-follow full color illustrated instructions.
This edition contains all 144 cards from both the Original Game and Wave 2 Expansion Pack

—description from the publisher

name: No Ni Ma! Krakowiacy i Górale
description:
Small game that makes you get to know the Polish highlander and Krakow dialects. During the game you are collecting sets of cards. One with the most of the sets wins.

Przypomnij sobie czym jest borówka, ceper czy dudki

No ni ma! to tradycyjna popularna gra karciana - oparta na pamięci i blefie. proste zasady! Dynamiczna rozgrywka i świetna zabawa! Gra przybliża również gwarę krakowską i góralską

name: Battlegammon
description:
A variant Roll and Move game inspired by the classical Backgammon. The main idea is to avoid the frustrating feeling of pawns constantly returning to the starting point, besides, by setting victory conditions that ensure a reasonable game while also providing tactical variation and enjoyment.

Players have 10 pawns in their colors, setting them according to the instructions on the board.

—description form the publisher

name: Scrabble: National Parks Special Edition
description:
Enjoy this beautiful version of the classic game of Scrabble with a National Parks spin! Enhance your score with special features such as playing National Parks Cards and earning bonus points for playing National Parks words.

Note: This game has cards and extra scoring rules which are not found in Scrabble: The National Parks Edition.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Spelling, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Kryptex
description:
Kryptex is a competitive deduction game for two. Through logic, you will have to compete to be the first to decipher your opponent's secret key before he deciphers yours. Your mission will be to masterfully move the cubes to find the best combinations and decode all the clues before your rival, that will be the key to finding out your opponent's secret word!

—description from the publisher

name: Zoogitives
description:
A big casino has been robbed by a group of crafty animals: The Heist of the Century. The thieves hid in different countries and are believed to have changed their appearance. The police offer forgiveness and the loot to anyone who denounces their accomplices.

Zoogitives is an investigation and deduction game for 3 to 6 players. You will have to guess who the Heist of the Century thieves are, and where they are hidden.

To solve the puzzle, you will have to use the dice strategically, write the clues down to discover the secrets of the other players and protect yours, and create hypotheses on your deduction table. If you succeed, you will keep the loot. Will you be able to succeed ?

—description from the publisher

name: Sparks
description:
This robot factory needs you! With the assistance of your trusty animal companions, mechanical marvels will soon start rolling off your assembly line — then you just need to add some spark to bring those robots alive. Explore the junkyard to gather dice for constructing robots or upgrading your factory. Keep a keen eye on your line-up of charming animal aides; they're the cornerstone of your winning strategy.

In Sparks, each player runs a robot factory and takes turns being the active player. As the active player, you play one of your production tiles to take a number of dice from the junkyard; all other players then take one die each. All players simultaneously use their dice to complete robots or level up their factory.

Players can also use spark to activate the abilities of their completed robots, or use cogs to recruit their animal assistants. You start the game with six assistants, each with a unique ability, and you should shape your strategy around them. The variety of assistants ensures that each game provides a different challenge. In the advanced game, players draft the assistants, providing more strategic options.

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Lier
description: Monopoly version based on the Belgian town of Lier.
publishers: Groep24, Hasbro, Winning Moves International Ltd

name: Symbodle
description:
A team of archaeologists discovered a cave in the Inca civilization that had never been explored by the human race. People from all over the world flocked to the site to investigate, and you are no exception. Since it was an uncharted territory, danger lurks in every corner of the cave. As you studied the cave, the ground suddenly began to tremble beneath you. Rocks began to fall, and your group scattered to seek for safety. Fortunately, no one was hurt. Unfortunately, everyone is now trapped in separate places. You found yourself surrounded by a bunch of strange symbols on the wall, and with your communication devices still functional, you tried to exchange messages to decipher the symbols, hoping for a chance to escape among the gibberish writings.

—description from the publisher

name: CoraQuest: Slippery Jim
description:
Originally sold at Pax Unplugged 2023

A new enemy for CoraQuest plus a QR code for a linked downloadable quest, a family dungeon crawling game.

Special ability: At the end of Every Enemy Phase roll one white dice to make a teleport check. If the result is a sucess then Slippery Jim teleports.

name: Trimod
description:
A minimalist solo fantasy game where you play using only three cards and one die. Each quest have a map card, a quest card and an event card, composing a complete adventure. You'll choose different paths and enter locations, where you'll roll the die to face challenges, also you have a single atribute value, your modifier, which will alter throughout the adventure and affect your results.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Minimap Resolution, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Track Movement

name: The Corporate Anniversary
description:
100 years of Edelberger Schokolade. That’s 100 years of customer loyalty, ambition and tradition.
A perfect occasion to celebrate the anniversary as a private function. And it would have been the best anniversary in the company’s history, hadn’t it been for the insidious murder of the sales manager.

Who killed Oliver Borgmann?
It’s most likely that the murderer was among the guests. But who was cold-blooded enough to commit such a crime while colleagues were happily celebrating next door?

Take a look behind the scenes of a chocolate manufacturer located in Germany and untangle a web of intrigues, blackmail, nepotism and excess in Oliver Borgmann’s Last Celebration.

—description from the publisher

name: Survival of the Fittest
description:
Survival of the Fittest is a wildlife themed, fast paced, strategy game which will see you square off against your friends and family as you battle it out to see who will survive. As with all things wild, there is an element of luck involved, as the roll of the dice will prompt your next move, but then comes the strategy; do you attack or defend, run and hide, or stalk and pounce? Every decision has a consequence, every move could be fatal, so keep your wits about you as you prepare to strike.
Survival of the Fittest can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players, and each variation requires a new strategy and a new way of surviving. Depending on the type of lion you are, the game plays between 30 - 45 minutes and keep in mind that there are obstacles that are introduced during the game, so be careful not to get blocked in… or out!
The third big element to the game: can you convince the other players to help you when you need it, even though you both know you are doing your best to try to eat each other’s prey? Survival of the Fittest is an interactive game where having alliances will definitely help you…but look out for the double cross!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Through Hell and Back: B-17 Expansion
description:
Climb up and strap into the B-17.
This expansion for Through Hell and Back includes;


9 new missions with custom artwork and new locations. A V-1 rocket facility is in France, and refinery and chemical plants are in Germany.
9 Historical bomber squadron cards from the 447th BG.
Escort cards. P-38s make their entrance into the game.
10 Novice crew cards.
10 Veteran crew cards.
A new system for having squadron mates fly with you.
1 game board featuring a B17 from the 447th bomb group.


—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, World War II

name: Suros: The Board Game
description:
In Suros The Board Game, you take control of three scientists that don't mind getting their hands dirty. These scientists all have a similar problem, mutated monsters have shown up on their planet and are wreaking havoc! Join forces to study your enemies, learn their skills, make weapons from their dead bodies, and solve the mystery of the black Ichor that is mutating the beasts on your world.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Multiple Maps, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Kemet: Rise of the Gods
description:
Kemet: Rise of the Gods brings various new and long-awaited features to Matagot's 2020 strategy boardgame Kemet: Blood and Sand.

These modules includes, amongst other things, a 6 player mode, a solo mode and two new tile colors, Amber and Amethyst, with various other modules, content and quality-of-life components to be announced soon. Rise of the Gods is the culmination of the effort of Kemet's design duo formed of Jacques Bariot and Guillaume Montiage. The french designers took the opportunity to bring new features to Blood and Sand, while drawing inspirations from the Ta-Seti and Seth expansions of the first edition of Kemet to imagine the two tile colors.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Recruit
description:
You're recruiting for an epic quest but must avoid having redundant leaders on the team. You'll score points by collecting cards during this trick-taking game but will lose points for collecting duplicate face cards (Jack / Queen / King).

Remove 1 joker. Deal 13 cards to each player. Dealer may declare gameplay variations while dealing. Display 1 card to determine the trump suit. With 2-3 players, discard up to 4, draw to replace; with 4 players, pass exactly 4 cards to your partner (across the table).

You must follow the led suit if possible. If you can’t follow suit, play any card. Joker is a "super-trump" and takes the trick. Otherwise, the highest trump takes the trick. Otherwise, the highest in the led suit takes it. Aces are high.

Score the hand: 1 point per card taken. For each face rank (J / Q / K), lose 5 points if you took more than 1 of that rank. With 4 players, don't combine partner cards (or scores) until the end. Play 4 hands.

—description from the designer

name: A Charlie Brown Valentine's Game
description:
Charlie Brown, Lucy, Sally and Snoopy are excited for Valentine's Day and they believe the perfect way to celebrate is by giving and receiving valentines and chocolates.

In this Peanuts valentines edition game players move around the board, collect valentine action cards and chocolates and deliver valentines to their friends.

The first player to share their love and mend their broken heart is the winner!

Sweet valentine fun for you and your favorite Peanuts pal.

—description from the back of the box

name: LikeU
description:
Introducing LikeU Cards, the ultimate card game for breaking down barriers and fostering meaningful connections between people. Whether you're at the office, on a date, or spending time with family and friends, our game is designed to put an end to awkward conversations and help you connect with others in a fun, engaging, and meaningful way.

120 curated questions split into two groups, the yellow questions explore what makes us fascinating, and the blue questions uncover what makes us human!

Our game features a variety of thought-provoking prompts that encourage players to share their own stories and experiences, creating a safe and inclusive space where everyone can feel heard and valued. From lighthearted questions to deeper, more reflective prompts, our game is designed to help you connect with others on a level that goes beyond small talk.

What sets LikeU Cards apart is its versatility. Our game is perfect for any social situation, from intimate gatherings to larger parties. It's also a great icebreaker for new colleagues or clients, helping to break down barriers and foster a sense of connection from the get-go.

—description from the publisher

name: Skurkarnas Skurk
description: A card game with 2 decks and rules. A stick-taking game played in rounds until 3 sticks is reach by the winner. The theme setting is a school with a headmaster and 10 iffy looking misbehaving pupils.

name: Ultimate Thumb Master
description: Ultimate Thumb Master is a 74 card party game for 3 or more players that is quick to learn and easy to play. Players take turns drawing a card and completing the task to determine if they will give or take drinks. Once played, cards are stacked atop an overturned cup (not included with the game) with the exception of “Master” cards, which are kept face up in front of players. Players with “Master” cards can use their abilities at any time until the same card is drawn again, at which point they must stack their card. When being stacked, cards must have two corners overhanging any previously stacked cards which is indicated by lighter colored corners printed on the card backs. The game ends when the stack is knocked over, and the player who causes the cards to fall loses, and must finish their drink! Inspired by traditional party games, Ultimate Thumb Master introduces many new and exciting elements making it the ultimate party game.
mechanics: Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: The Knight's Riddle
description:
An exciting investigative game set in a Maltese landscape during the era of the Knights of St John. Through the elimination process of the Knights, Places and Objects, solve The Knight’s Riddle by uncovering who did the act, where and using what. The first player to solve the case, wins.

—description from the publisher

Logħba investigattiva eċitanti f’ambjent Malti ta’ żmien il-Kavallieri ta’ San Ġwann.
Bi proċess ta’ eliminazzjoni tal-Kavallieri, il-Postijiet u l-Oġġetti, solvi l-Każ tal-Kavallier billi tiskopri min hu l-ħati, fejn u biex sar l-att. L-ewwel plejer li jirnexxilu jsolvi l-każ, jirbaħ.

—description from the publisher (Maltese)

name: Fortune Heroes
description:
Fortune Heroes is an original, captivating, and intriguing game where you and your friends will embark on an epic quest that will test your endurance.

Navigate perilous trails, uncover forgotten treasures, and outmanoeuvre rival heroes in a world of mysticism and danger. With each hero wielding extraordinary powers and the impending Great Flood threatening to wash away all hope, destiny beckons. Will you rise above the tide and claim your rightful place among the Fortune Heroes?

Embrace the unknown. The adventure of a lifetime awaits!


beautiful card illustrations and artwork in this original exciting game
combine both skill and luck to create the best possible path without being washed away by The Great Flood
ideal to be played with family or friends in a cosy atmosphere or even outdoors


—description from the publisher

name: Game of Population
description:
48 cards grouped together into 12 sets of 4. Sets are called 'Books' in such games by the publisher.
Rules are similar to Quartet games nowadays.
When asking for a card from another player, the questioner must state a country, the Book it comes from AND the population in that country. If the questioned player has that card he must pass to to the questioner. If he does not have the card he must draw a card from the deck and end his turn.
The winner is the player with most books when all have been collected.
Game must be made for trivia buffs with the population of countries in 1896 in their heads!!

name: Dunkelflaute
description:
In German, the term "dunkelflaute" refers to a period in which energy demand is high but electricity production is low, as in winter on windless days with little sunlight. This expression underlines the importance of planning and diversification in our energy mix.

Dunkelflaute is a competitive game in which players try to build a resilient energy park to guarantee sufficient electricity production on each turn. To achieve this, players must invest wisely in different energy sources and allocate their budgets to maximize production while limiting risk.

On each round, players have three discs of different values to allocate to three different purposes: to purchase new tiles for their park, to purchase new houses to power, and to purchase dice to be used that round. Players then roll the dice and try to place them on the tiles they've bought to power the houses they've purchased. The number of houses a player has managed to power in his park will determine the value of his discs for the following round, and so on until a player ends the game by buying a twelfth house. The round then ends as normal, and the player who has powered up the most houses wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Fixed Placement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Income, Random Production, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Dice of Steam
description:
Embark on a riveting journey of strategy and fortune in Dice of Steam! Dice of Steam is a roll and write print and play strategy game prepared for 1-4 players in mind. It takes about 30-60 minutes to play, and suits players of age 12 and up.

Become a railroad investor. At the turn of the 20th century many train companies are fighting for expansion of their tracks and stock values. That is a great moment to turn the opportunity to your advantage! You have the power to influence expansion strategies and acquire shares. You will lay the tracks for various companies, gain investment from the cities reached and exchange them into shares of various train companies.

By controlling the track expansion, you influence stock values. Try to predict which companies will be worth the most and invest in their shares while they are still cheap! Help your favorite companies to expand, so your shares will reach even higher value! But watch out to not overinvest as the shares can lose value at some point.

Forge your destiny, outsmart your competitors, and watch your fortune rise with Dice of Steam, a game where strategy meets tactics.
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Investment, Market, Paper-and-Pencil

name: The Emu War 1932
description:
Finally, you can now experience the true war of total annihilation against Australia's greatest threat! Giant birds!

This box contains all units used by the army in the great emu war and shed load of terrifying emu! Its everything you need to start recreating the emu war, so that it is never forgotten!

Solo or two player game, contains miniatures and rules.

—description from the publisher

name: SG Gwint
description:
The goal of SG Gwint is to offer the opportunity to play Gwent, which we all love, in a form worthy of the title "well-balanced card game." Unfortunately, the old good Gwent is not that, and it's no wonder. In The Witcher 3, players collect their decks on their journey towards the title of Gwent Grandmaster, and the variety of cards ranges from unusable to absurdly strong.

We approached the new version with respect for the original version and the preservation of the spirit of the game. However, we also utilized the space for innovation - in addition to balancing the strength of the cards and their abilities, we added some of our own, created a few new cards, and replaced the card illustrations with those from the online game GWENT to give them a fresh touch. Furthermore, we replaced the existing interface with our own for enhancement.

How to play SG Gwint

Objective:
The objective of Gwent is to win two out of three rounds by having more points on the board than your opponent.

Setup:
Each player begins with a deck of cards that consists of unit cards representing different factions, abilities, and values. A standard deck contains a minimum of 25 cards. Player takes 10 cards and can change 2 of them.

Gameplay:

Round Structure: The game is played over a series of rounds. Each round allows players to play one card per turn until both players pass consecutively.

Board: The board consists of three rows for each player: melee, ranged, and siege. Each row can hold a certain type of unit card.

Unit Cards: There are different types of cards: melee, ranged, siege, and special cards. Unit cards have a power value and sometimes an ability.

Leader Cards: Each player has a leader card that can be used once per game, usually having a powerful effect that can influence the game significantly.

The Hand: Players draw a certain number of cards at the beginning of each round. Players can mulligan (exchange) a few cards from their hand if they wish.

Scoring: The player with the highest total power on the board at the end of each round wins that round.

Winning a Round: Winning a round does not mean winning the game. Players need to balance winning rounds with conserving cards for future rounds.

Round Length: Players can play as many cards as they like in a round until both players pass. Passing means the player ends their turn and cannot play any more cards in that round.

Card Effects: Many cards have special abilities that can influence the game, such as boosting other units, damaging enemy units, or affecting the game board.

Tiebreakers: In the event of a tie at the end of a round, the player who won the previous round wins the game. If neither player has won a round, the game continues with another round.

Strategy:
Gwent requires strategic thinking, bluffing, and careful resource management. Players must decide when to commit powerful cards and when to hold back to secure victory in later rounds.

name: Nessie
description:
In Nessie you are part of an expedition into the dark waters of Loch Ness, searching for ancient treasures while trying to find the mysterious Nessie.

But watch out! You'll have to know when to back off, because if you load your boat with too much treasure you may sink, losing everything and... scaring Nessie away!
Whoever has better sighted Nessie, and collected the most treasure, will win the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Nautical, Party Game, Prehistoric
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Push Your Luck

name: Museo. Objetivo Gadir
description:
Do you like museums? In this game, you will run a new museum from the Phoenician period. Starting from scratch, you must manage to group the different Phoenician objects in their corresponding display cases. The showcases will display the pieces that are shown to the public who come to visit your museum, so you will have to try to collect beautiful pieces from the Phoenician past to win the game. The more different pieces in your showcases, the more points you will score!
However, this won't be an easy task, be prepared! many things can happen to disturb the peace of a museum. You must be careful with school visits, including building works and renovations, as they may prevent you from working that day. And don't forget to maintain good relations with other museums! Sometimes they may ask you to lend them an object temporarily for display... and this could leave your display case without the most important piece!

—description from the publisher (translated)

¿Te gustan los museos? En este juego tu papel será dirigir un nuevo museo de época fenicia. Al empezar de cero, deberás conseguir agrupar los diferentes objetos fenicios en sus correspondientes vitrinas. En las vitrinas se exhibirán las piezas que se muestran al público que acude a visitar tu museo, por lo que tendrás que intentar reunir hermosas piezas del pasado fenicio para ganar la partida. Cuantas más piezas diferentes haya en tus vitrinas, ¡más puntos conseguirás!

Sin embargo, esto no será tarea fácil ¡prepárate!, pueden pasar muchas cosas que alteren la tranquilidad y el silencio de un museo. Tendrás que tener cuidado con las visitas de centros escolares, ¡incluso con las obras y remodelaciones en el edificio!, ya que podrían impedirte trabajar ese día. ¡Y no te olvides de mantener buenas relaciones con otros museos! A veces pueden solicitarte que les prestes temporalmente un objeto para que sea expuesto… ¡y esto podría dejar tu vitrina sin la pieza más importante!

¿Estás listo? Pues ve eligiendo qué vitrinas prefieres y ¡a trabajar!

—description from the publisher

name: Cosmic Frog: Devious Pack
description:
This is a fixed set of 12 expansion cards for use with Cosmic Frog. The pack contains six new Ability cards, five new Action cards, and one new Splinter Strike card.

—description from the publisher

name: Cosmic Frog: Gluttony Pack
description:
This is a fixed set of 18 expansion cards for use with Cosmic Frog: Find Muck. The pack contains six new Ability cards (one set of six cards for the dice-based deck; one set of six cards for the chip-based deck), five new Action cards, and one new Splinter Strike card.

—description from the publisher

name: Offworld Empires
description:
Offworld Empires is a light 4X space strategy game for 2 to 4 players. Each player chooses a unique space civilization with its own strengths and weaknesses and builds their space empire in a far flung galaxy.

At the head of your galactic empire, you will explore an unknown galaxy full of various planets, asteroids, wormholes, and much more. Use colony ships to settle on new planets and gather their resources, or send your marines to pacify those that resist your expansion.

Erect buildings to harvest food and grow your population of workers, search for new technologies from a unique tech wheel, assemble spaceships to secure your own airspace or battle enemy fleets, and appoint senators to vote military or economic laws that will give you an edge over your opponents.

The customized worker placement mechanism is a key point of the game. Every player can build the buildings of their liking – provided they have the necessary resources – and assign their workers to them to maximize their efficiency. You need to find the proper balance between population growth, scientific research and raw production, or choose to specialize in a single domain at the expense of others.

Will you manage to lead you galactic civilization to victory?

—description from the publisher
categories: Civilization, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Income, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Puzzle X Crime: The Gift of Murder
description:
The venerable Lord George McAllister is dead - shot with an old duel gun on the sofa of his hunting room. Everything points to a suicide - if it weren't for Chief Inspector Paul Higgins, who is plagued by doubts.

And so he asks you to search the crime scene...

Can you confirm the thesis of suicide or is there perhaps something even more terrible behind it?

Are you ready to become the master of the puzzle and detectives? It's time to solve the case!

Puzzle X Crime is a combination of exciting mystery and puzzle fun! First, the crime scene is assembled from 406 puzzle pieces, then the puzzlers slip into the role of investigators. Which objects in the motif should be examined more closely? The numbers on the back of the puzzle pieces lead to playing cards and envelopes with important evidence. Is it possible to combine all the clues correctly and get on the trail of the perpetrators? Puzzle meets crime game! The popular game principle, in which you examine a case file with evidence and solve a criminal case, is now also available as a Ravensburger puzzle - Puzzle X Crime! The highlight: the puzzle is also printed on the back with numbers that provide valuable information on how to solve the case. Then intuition, combination skills and criminalist sense are required. Together with the enclosed playing cards and the evidence in envelopes, the puzzlers gradually determine the murder and can find the perpetrator, murder motif and murder weapon. Also ideal as joint puzzle and investigation fun! No game material has to be destroyed and the Puzzle X Crime can be played again.

Contents:
- 408 puzzle pieces with printed back in two different colours
- A suction cup for flipping puzzle pieces
- 72 playing cards with valuable clues
- 10 envelopes with different evidence material
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Perspectópolis
description:
In this semi-cooperative game of strategy and deduction, the fate of the friends lies in your hands.

Embark on an extraordinary adventure in the whimsical world of Perspectópolis! When Alice and her friends stumble upon a mysterious wooden box bearing the inscription "Perspectópolis," they are transported to a dimension where reality bends and twists in fantastical ways.

As players, you must take on the roles of Alice, Ethan, Mark, Olivia, and even Whisper the cat as you navigate the mind-bending streets of Perspectópolis. Your mission? To find the elusive amulets, rescue Whisper, and unlock the portal back home. But beware, Perspectópolis is filled with enigmatic inhabitants and perplexing puzzles. Each turn, you'll explore the pentagonal-shaped board, seeking clues from the locals to uncover the whereabouts of the amulets and your companions.

Will you unravel the secrets of Perspectópolis and escape back to Villa Willowbrook, or will you be forever lost in this surreal dimension?

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Deduction, Fantasy, Puzzle

name: Ninjas En Apuros
description:
A card game where the objective is to be the last ninja standing.
Players draw a card from the deck each turn and are eliminated if the drawn card is a trap and they have no "escape" card in hand. The rest of the cards provide ninja tools and skills that players can use to avoid losing and to hinder their opponents.
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: League of Six: Complete Edition
description:
One of the first games by the now world-renowned Vladimír Suchý, presented in an innovative design with a new expansion. The game, featuring fresh modern graphics, includes the original version with slightly adjusted mechanics to make it more player-friendly. The game also includes the expansion Loyal Retinue and a new expansion for two players, introducing the option to play with any number of automated opponents.

What is the game about?
This game takes you back to the year 1430, a time of unrest sweeping across Europe. Nearly a century has passed since the establishment of the League of Six — a coalition of affluent towns in Lusatia formed to safeguard their economic interests and maintain peace in the region.

Players take on the role of tax collectors dispatched to this troubled territory. As aspiring young aristocrats, they aim to distinguish themselves to earn a coveted position at Sigismund's court.

The objective? To amass the highest tax revenue for the king while also garnering support from influential estates. Success ensures a place by King Sigismund's side.

Spanning six turns, each representing a year, players visit one of the six cities as tax collectors. Collected goods are stored in royal or estate reserves, granting players sway in King Sigismund's court. The player who accumulates the most influence emerges victorious.

—description from the publisher

name: Flint's Fist
description:
A two-player game using the principles of L'Attaque (and, later, games such as Stratego) where your playing pieces are hidden after secret, initial placement and then moved - turn by turn - to try and 'take' your opponent's pieces.

When attacking, both Attacker and Defender are revealed and the piece with the higher value wins - removing the other from play. Ties mean the pieces remain in situ.

The ultimate goal is to take your opponent's "Treasure" piece before they take yours!

—user summary

name: Escape the Murder Mansion
description:
When you were invited to a weekend at Dalrymple Hall, you expected wining and dining in the lap of luxury. Instead, you got a murder.

Someone has killed Sir Eustace and locked all the guests in the house, trapping you inside with a body and a murderer. The only way to escape is to find the killer before they start bumping off the witnesses. Could it be the widow, the cold and forbidding Lady Anne? Or perhaps the victim's son, the scheming and money-hungry Benedict? Or maybe the butler did it? Anyone in here could be a murderer, and it's up to you to find out who. No-one's leaving until you do.

Play as either a traditional escape room, or across an evening as a dinner party, for a night you'll never forget... As long as you get out alive.

—description from the publisher

name: Furylands: Ashes of Avalon
description:
Introducing Furylands - Ashes of Avalon from Warrios Games, a cooperative fantasy roleplaying board game for up to four players. Forge your hero, embark on quests, challenge dangerous foes and find incredible items to boost your power.
Create a totally customized character using an innovative skill pairing system. There are no restrictive, predefined classes in Furylands - you create your class. Play a massive campaign with over 40 hours of content and virtually endless replayability.

Play one of twelve characters, each with their own special traits and starting items. There are no restrictive, predefined classes in Furylands. Characters start as a blank slate for you to mold into your ultimate adventurer. Mix any two of the nine skill lines together to create a totally unique character. Customize your character even further as the game progresses, adding life, mana, skill power and skill variety.

An extensive skill system is one of Furylands' defining features. There are 120 skills to master across 9 skill lines - Fire, Frost, Chaos, Shape Change, Necromancy, Poison, Archery, Martial and Spirit Magic. Mix and match skill lines to make a completely unique character. Any character can learn any skill.Combine Fire and Chaos to build the ultimate ranged damage dealer. Combine Martial and Shape Change to make a hybrid tiger, bear, dragon or wolf melee character. Combine Poison and Frost to make a poisoning, freezing assassin. Summon warrior or mage minions to do your bidding. Learn special skills by defeating bosses and use them against your foes. The possibilities are endless.

Play over 60 highly-detailed, full color maps while playing through an epic campaign storyline. Explore haunted ruins, cryptic dungeons, frozen landscapes and more. There are no reusable tilesets in the game - each map layout is unique and every quest challenge is different. Scenario setup is fast and easy.

Combat in Furylands is fast-paced and fun. Each of the game's five zones has a different set of monsters for your party to challenge. Monsters and bosses have unique abilities, ensuring dynamic and unpredictable combat. Enemies are controlled by game rules and don't require a GM.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Monkey Fun
description:
The monkeys are on the loose!

In Monkey Fun, you try to claim a connected area as quickly as possible with your gang of monkeys. The cards you play indicate on which square you can place a monkey, but the other monkeys are already waiting to snatch this space from you...

name: Blood Suckers
description: Blood Suckers is a competitive card based game that sees each player take on the role of a different Blood Sucking critter in the animal kingdom. Using each Blood Suckers bonus, each player in turn order will choose from the available Hosts to suck blood from. But before they can successfully Attach to that Host, they must draw a begone card and roll a dice to see if they pass. At the end of each round, every Blood Sucker attached to a Host draws Blood from that Host.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Market, Multi-Use Cards, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers

name: Medical Mysteries: Miami Flatline
description:
Your patients' lives are in your hands. Will they survive the night? Work as a team to solve real life medical cases. Each patient has a mysterious medical condition, and it is your job to diagnose and treat before it's too late. Do you have what it takes to save their lives?

Medical Mysteries: Miami Flatline features four patient cases for you to tackle, along with a tutorial case. No prior medical knowledge is required; all information is provided during the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Battle Royale
description: In the tactical action game Battle Royale, you play cards to position your characters cleverly, then you roll the doom dice...and little by little, the island arena grows smaller and smaller. With skill and luck, you try to keep your figures on the island for as long as possible. Create majorities, push your opponent's figures off the island, and stay away from the explosions. Continue to fight for space until only one player remains.

name: Yoho!
description:
A strategic card game with a modular board in the Caribbean sea!

The ship of the famous captain Black Sam has just been sunk on the high seas and the remains of its cargo are floating adrift on the waters of the Caribbean. As a renowned pirate roaming this area, you cannot miss such a boon! Master the fearsome sea currents, foil your enemies traps and make your way to the coveted treasure!

Play as one of the 4 pirate captains and set sail! Find your way through sea currents to reach a chest or attack an enemy ship.
Open the chests and find out if you are rich or if you have been set up by Black Sam!
Manipulate your destiny by crafting a relentless strategy on the high sea to ensure your victory, by being the first to collect 3 gold coins.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Drawing, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: B17 Twenty Five Missions: Pack 4
description: This pack contains 15 additional missions (76-90) that can be played seamlessly with the B 17 Twenty five missions base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: じゃんけんノーボーダー (Janken No-Border)
description:
じゃんけんノーボーダー (Janken No-Border) is a fast 2-4 player game where each person simultaneously plays one of the illustrated Rock, Paper, Scissors from their hand. The player with the most wins at the end of 5 rounds is the victor.

The biggest feature of this game: the fact that you cannot tell for sure what card (Rock, Paper, or Scissors) you are playing until it’s too late. There are a total of 16 numbered cards and while Card #1 and Card #16 are clearly defined as Rock and Paper respectively, it’s impossible to say what range is defined as Scissors until the end of the game.

After five rounds of placing out your cards, you use the two remaining cards left in your hand to figure out what range of cards actually count as “Scissors” for each individual player — and therefore how many of the five rounds you actually won.

If you play with 3 players, there will be 3 rounds.

A playful game of psychological warfare that combines funnily illustrated cards with serious strategy as you guess what cards your opponent could possibly have left in his or her hand and play your own hand accordingly.

グーやパーなどの手が描かれたカードを同時に伏せて出し、じゃんけんをする２～４人用ゲームです。じゃんけん勝負を５回行い、勝った回数が多い方のプレイヤーが勝者となります。

このゲームの大きな特徴は、５回の勝負に使うカードをすべて出すまで各カードのグー・チョキ・パーが確定しないことです。最終的にじゃんけん勝負に使わなかったカードによって各カードのグー・チョキ・パーが決まります。
3人戦なら3回の勝負を行います。

人をからかっているかのような変わったカードの図柄と、相手がどんなカードを残しているのかを推理しながら手札を出していく心理戦が特徴的なゲームです。

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Marvel Crossover Vol. 5, Issue 14
description:
In this issue, Crossover Vol. 5 expands on the popular teams within the Marvel Cinematic Universe's Infinity Saga and includes new and reimagined characters. This 55-card set includes Iron Man, Thor, and more starts for the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

55 cards

name: What's That Word??
description:
Vocabulary word game for the whole family. The object is to have the greatest number of points after a set number of rounds.
The game is composed of 1000 unique and fascinating words. Each word is printed on one card which is followed by 3 choices for its definition. The word and its three choices are read aloud to an opposing player who will choose one of the definitions, after the player has made a choice the correct answer is read from the back of the card. There is also at least one sentence illustrating the proper use of the word. After all players have had one chance at a word, that completes one round, the game consists of 3-5 rounds. There are multiple rule variations to play depending on difficulty and and number of players. Including a solitaire version.

name: Dust: Moment To Turn The Tide
description:
The Dust is a rapid duel between two players or two teams.
It happens in a manga-styled world. Players choose their weapons and accessories to use in the battle. These items provide different abilities and styles. Many items have two ways to use. Switching the way at the right time can be vital to win the duel. Some items provide powerful one-time use ability but require dice to be consumed to charge it.
Every turn, players manipulate dice to trigger skills and perform attacks on their opponents. Whoever knocks down his or her opponent first is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Do Not Disturb
description:
In Do Not Disturb Players search for ancient treasures defying the Pharaoh's curse.
Setup: randomly lay 7 cards face down on the table (doors), one for each symbol on the back. The other cards are dealt among players to form their hand. By deduction, players have partial information about the contents of the 'doors' (because the cards in their hand, are not on the table).
Game: It is a cooperative game. Without speaking, on their turn, players can move the 7 cards on the table, either up (STOP) or down (OK), to communicate with other players which doors they would enter and which doors they would not enter. The 'expedition leader' of the round must take responsibility for entering the chosen doors, revealing the contents of the cards, hoping to find maps that will lead them to the treasures and trying to avoid Pharaoh's curses that may stop their search.
End: Players win if they can reach the treasure halls (by winning three consecutive rounds) and find at least one treasure (each map not found, because it was hidden behind doors players decided not to enter, reduces the treasure halls they can reach).

—description from the publisher

name: Meteo
description:
In Meteo players try to find the best weather conditions for last-minute holidays.
Setup: 6 face-up 'weather' cards are randomly associated with 6 face-down 'hidden sky' cards of 6 different colours. Each sky colour will then be associated with a weather condition. Each player can secretly look at only one "hidden sky" card. A draw deck is formed with the 'sky' cards of 6 colours.
Game: The players play simultaneously. The 'sky' cards are revealed one by one in the middle of the table, one next to the other. When two, or three, or four, or five sky 'cards' are revealed, the players can go on a last-minute holiday. That means that they can shout "Off I go", take all the cards present on the table at that moment and secretly have a look to another “hidden sky” card. Each player can go on maximum three holidays per game. If no one decides to go on holiday after five cards have been revealed (it’s Friday) these cards are discarded and players start another round (another week).
End: The collected cards by each players will determine their score at the end of the game, based on the value associated with their colour that at the end of the game are all revealed.

—description from the publisher

name: Blue Penguin
description:
In Blue Penguin each player tries to attract the cutest penguins: the smaller they are, the cuter they are. The problem is that penguins always follow the bigger penguins.

Setup: Place the 5 “Color” cards face up on the table in the following order: Blue (1-12), purple (13-24), red (25-36), orange (37-48), yellow (49-60). Place the corresponding Value card next to each Color card in the following order: 2, 1, 0, -1, -2. Each player receive two “penguin” cards to form their hand.

Game: Starting with the first player and then clockwise, each player plays a 'penguin' card from their hand and then draws a 'penguin' card from the draw deck. When all players have played a card, the one who played the card with the highest number on it collects all the cards on the table and becomes the new first player.

End: when the players have played all cards the game ends. Each player calculates the score of the collected cards not by considering the numbers on them but the values associated with their colours.
Cards with highest numbers on them are the strongest cards but correspond to minus points! Cards with lowest numbers on them are the weakest cards but correspond to positive points!
The player with the most cuteness points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Amos: Slovenčina v kostce
description: Amos: Slovenčina v kostce is a distinct entry in the Amos game series, focusing on the Slovak language. This particular version involves rolling dice that are marked with letters from the Slovak alphabet, distributed based on their typical frequency of usage. Players aim to form words from the letters displayed after a roll, organizing them either separately or interconnected like a crossword puzzle. Each letter is assigned a point value, and the game's objective is to gather the highest score by creating the most valuable words possible.

name: Gosu X: Rukgnarl Bonesreaper Expansion
description:
In the shadow of the chaos left by Abunakkashii the Corruptor, a new threat emerges from the debris of the Bone Wall, the once unbreachable frontier of the realm of Jalaanx, bringing with it a darkness that extends well beyond the night. This sinister force, embodied by Rukgnarl Bonesreaper, the king of shadows, prepares to plunge the world into an era of terror and despair unprecedented.

Rukgnarl Bonesreaper is an expansion for Gosu X. Inside the box you will find a new clan of 15 cards, 2 clans Tiles (Rukgnarl & Galmi), 10 Evolution cards, as well as new tokens (Shadowstep and Umbra).

—descriptionfrom the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Puzzle X Crime Kids: Stolen Time
description:
A mysterious letter arrives at the Scotland Yard post office - a former art robber claims that there are four art objects stolen by him a long time ago in his summer house.

The police know about your intuition and ask you for help...

What can you expect in the house? Are you perhaps on the verge of the recovery of art treasures that were long thought to have been lost and thus facing an investigative success of historical significance?

Puzzle X Crime Kids is a combination of exciting crime and puzzle fun for young detectives aged 9 and up! First, the crime scene is assembled from 264 puzzle pieces, then the puzzlers slip into the role of the investigator. Which objects in the motif should be examined more closely? The numbers on the back of the puzzle pieces lead to important evidence. Is it possible to combine all the clues correctly and get on the trail of the perpetrators? Puzzle meets crime game! The popular game principle, in which you examine a case file with evidence and solve a crime case, is now also available as a Ravensburger children's puzzle - Puzzle X Crime Kids! The highlight: the puzzle is also printed on the back with numbers that provide valuable information on how to solve the case. Then curiosity, combination skills and detective feeling are required. Together with the enclosed playing cards and the evidence material in envelopes, the young puzzlers gradually determine the murder and can find perpetrators, murder motif and murder weapon. Also ideal as joint puzzle and investigation fun with the whole family. No game material has to be destroyed and the puzzle X Crime Kids can be played again.

Contents:
- 264 puzzle pieces with printed back in two different colours
- A suction cup for flipping puzzle pieces
- 72 playing cards with valuable clues
- 8 envelopes with different evidence material

name: Puzzle X Crime Kids: The Lost Fire
description:
Suddenly the Panorama Express comes to a standstill. Wait, what is it? The incredibly precious necklace called "The Fire of Eschnapur", which belongs to the rich lady heiress of Schnackenstein, has suddenly disappeared! What happened? The investigations begin with the puzzle. It's time to put on your detective hat and become a puzzle master.

Get ready to solve the case and clear up the robbery! Are you up to the challenge?

Puzzle X Crime Kids is a combination of exciting crime and puzzle fun for young detectives aged 9 and up! First, the crime scene is assembled from 264 puzzle pieces, then the puzzlers slip into the role of the investigator. Which objects in the motif should be examined more closely? The numbers on the back of the puzzle pieces lead to important evidence. Is it possible to combine all the clues correctly and get on the trail of the perpetrators? Puzzle meets crime game! The popular game principle, in which you examine a case file with evidence and solve a crime case, is now also available as a Ravensburger children's puzzle - Puzzle X Crime Kids! The highlight: the puzzle is also printed on the back with numbers that provide valuable information on how to solve the case. Then curiosity, combination skills and detective feeling are required. Together with the enclosed playing cards and the evidence material in envelopes, the young puzzlers gradually determine the murder and can find perpetrators, murder motif and murder weapon. Also ideal as joint puzzle and investigation fun with the whole family. No game material has to be destroyed and the puzzle X Crime Kids can be played again.

Contents:
- 264 puzzle pieces with printed back in two different colours
- A suction cup for flipping puzzle pieces
- 72 playing cards with valuable clues
- 8 envelopes with different evidence material
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle, Trains

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Children of Lilith
description:
This Issue (Children of Lilith) will expand on the Underworld team which plays two roles, that of the underworld of crime and the more nefarious super natural underworld. This issue will explore the latter and bring the Darkhold Redeemers, the Nightstalkers, Lilith and the Lillin into the forefront of Vs. System 2PCG action. Images are sourced from the Marvel Comics themselves and feature art from the Midnight Sons storylines.


Explore the darker side of the Marvel Universe with Children of Lilith.
Join Morbius, Blade and Johnny Blaze as they take on the forces of Evil.
Play as Lilith for the first time as a Main Character!
Expand your Underworld and Defenders teams with 17 new characters!
Epic competitive gameplay to pit your team of Allies against your opponents


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: PLANET LAB
description:
2231 AD… Humanity has embarked on a full-fledged space migration plan, and you, as a scientist belonging to one of the four research institutions engaged in a fierce research battle, are involved in the “Human Settlement Planet Design Project”. Your mission is to create the longest-lived planet. The idea is to produce better simulation results than other research institutes at the once-a-month planetary research presentations.

To create a harmonious long-lived planet, you need to venture into space to collect materials, then conduct research to create the refined materials used to build planets. The key to creating a planet with a long life is to create a large amount of high-quality planetary materials.

Now, compete with your rival scientists to create the best planet!

------

What is PLANET LAB? Players repeat [Gather] and [Research] actions to collect space materials that are then researched to recombine into planetary materials. Various types of materials are required to make these "refined materials", but the rarer the material, the longer it will take to bring it back to the laboratory. If you are absent from your laboratory or take a break from carrying materials, a rival researcher might secretly come to use the materials you worked so hard to transport! Once you have finished building your planet, you can simulate the planet using your smartphone! The resulting planets will change depending on the combination of planetary materials used. Who can create the longest living planet? Determine the materials you need, predict your rival's actions, and sometimes sneak into their laboratories to obtain the best planetary materials!

— Description from the publisher (Translated)

PLANET LAB is a simultaneous action selection game in which players draft material cards in an effort to collect the right material sets to convert them into planetary materials. Higher-valued raw materials take longer to return to your laboratory - which can expose you to others using your materials for their own gain! Each round consists of a Morning, Midday, and Night activity. Your action selection takes place in the morning and based on your selected action, your Midday and Night action follow. The game ends when all the raw materials cards are collected and players assemble their planet simulation using their converted planetary materials.

The game advertises that this last feature (scoring of the planet) is done with a smartphone app; however, the base game can be played entirely without this functionality. If players DO use the application, the extended game play allows material cards to have a variable range of values, resulting in holding the determination of final winner until the very end of the game. The app reveals the winner by creating a hologram of each planet and then destroying them from last to second place. Only the winner's planet remains.
categories: Card Game, Electronic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: COLLATERAL
description:
Welcome to "collateral" a roll and write adventure print -n-play game.

In this game you will be the leader of a tribe that has been hiding for centuries in the vastness of the prairie. Your mission is to manage the tribe's resources and activities to ensure its survival and prosperity. You will hunt, cut wood, fish and cultivate the land to feed and grow your tribe. But the prairie is not only a place of abundant resources; it is also a world full of mistery and danger.
