When you are ready, you can send explorers to venture into the surrounding lands, solving puzzles, fighting enemies and uncovering ancient secrets. Each region hides a mysterious portal.

In the end, you will have to make a crucial decision:
Which portal will you cross to face the Collateral? With six possible bosses, each choice will lead to a unique and enthralling adventure.
Prepare to experience an epic saga of adventure and survival, where every choice counts and every risk can lead to extraordinary rewards.
Collaterals awaits you!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Die Fürsten
description:
Princes is a medieval-themed deck builder and the first game developed by German board game influencer Johannes "Hunter" Jaeger.

—description from the designer

Die Fürsten ist ein Deckbuilder mit Mittelalter-Thema und das erste selbstentwickelte Spiel von Brettspiel-Influencer Johannes "Hunter" Jaeger.

—description from the designer

name: Kynua's Stone
description:
During the Cretaceous a mysterious meteorite fallen altering the environment near the impact. Roll the dice to lead your dinosaur through the shattered landscape to reach first the Kynua's Stone and gain its powers before the collapse.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Map Reduction, Pieces as Map, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Burger Boom
description:
In this game the each of the two players have a balloon under their clothes simulating a belly. In your turn you usually "eat hamburgers", so the balloon simulating the belly is pumped. If the balloon explodes you lose the game.

In your turn the other players draws a card. Most of them are invitations to eat burgers, but some can have no effects (vegs burgers) or ever reduce your belly (go running).

name: Tweety & Sylvester Gone Fishin'
description:
Each player, in turn spins the spinner and moves any one of the three fish the corresponding number of spaces along the trail. A player may move only one fish per turn, but may move a different fish each time. Players may move in any direction, but in only one direction per turn. Play continues with each player in turn trying to 1) hook a large "keeper" fish on his own line, OR 2) hook a small fish on an opponent's line.

To land on a hook, players must spin the exact number needed. When a fish lands on a colored hook, the player whose fishing pole matches the color of the hook must move the t fish up his pole. He does this by continuing to spin, in turn, moving the fish up the pole. Each knot on the fishing line is counted as one space. He may not move or hook another fish until the fish on his has reached the top knot and is landed. If the fish is a "keeper" the player adds it to his collection. If It is a small fish, it is discarded to the game box.

Immediately after a fish is hooked, another fish of the same size must be placed on START.

HINT: Players use strategy by hooking a small fish on an opponent's fish hook. The opponent must then utilize his turns by moving the worthless fish up his pole.

WINNER

The winner is the first player to land two large "keeper" fish.

—description from the rules

name: Comic Book Killer
description:
Stargeek Comic Expo is one of the top comic conventions in the country. With over 50,000 attendees converging on the Collins Convention Center, the expo appeals to a wide range of fandoms. With a childlike sense of glee, you temporarily discard your fedora and trench coat in favor of superhero spandex. For this weekend only, you're no longer a Will Street detective. You're just one more geek looking to find an escape from all the death and depravity you see in your line of work. The only crimes you hope to see this weekend will be drawn in four-color panels and accompanied by tag lines like "Zap!" and "Pow!" Yet, you've read way too many comics in your life and know that the hero rarely gets a break. The criminal element never sleeps. When it’s discovered someone is killing con attendees who are dressed as the popular comic book hero, Knight Detective, you get pulled into the case. Now that a comic book villain has come to life and is loose at Stargeek Comic Expo, is anyone really safe? It’s up to you to find and stop this super villain before more tragedy can unfold. Who is the Comic Book Killer? Grab your utility belt, adjust your tights, and find out!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

name: Mets Baseball Card Game
description: A 2- player game with 2 decks of cards. Play against and try to defeat the Mets!

name: Black Card Revoked: Jollof and Fufu
description: West African flavored Black Card Revoked expansion pack covering back home, entertainment, pidgin, history, food & family life.

name: Cogs and Carts
description:
In Cogs and Carts you and up to three of your friends race to collect diamonds in a maze of rotating interconnected cogs.

All cogs are mechanically linked and turning a single cog will rotate all the cogs on the board - changing the maze in dramatic and meaningful way. At any point in time there are 8 versions of the board that exists simultaneously; they are accessible by simply rotating the cogs.

A game of Cogs and Cart begins with empty board; each turn a player flips over an empty cog to the track side, growing and creating a unique puzzle every time you play. The location of the diamonds also get randomized at the beginning of the game to shake things up.

Cogs and Carts is a culmination of two distinct goals - one is to play a game that make use of a gear or a cog in a meaningful and mechanical way just like one of my favorite Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calender. The other is the desire of wanting to play a more tactical and less luck dependent version of Tsuro; an aesthetically beautiful tile laying game.

The final result being a quick to learn fun little game that takes about 5 minutes to learn and plays in about half an hour. With each turn revealing a new fun puzzle to solve but not so disruptive that you cannot plan your move in advance. Finding clever route that net multiple diamonds per turn feels rewarding, just as snatching the ones your friends are aiming for right from under their noses.

How-To-Play

To setup a game of Cogs and carts flip all the cogs so that the empty side is facing up.

Place all the diamonds inside the bag. Randomly draw the diamonds out one by one and place in around the board in clockwise manner with the numbered side facing up until all 28 spots are occupied.

The number on the diamond indicates how many cogs from the edge of the board to place the diamond when adding it to the board.

Starting from the youngest player and going around clockwise each player choose which of the middle four cogs to place their cart.

The last player then chooses which of the diamonds to start adding the board. Add three diamonds to the board.

The first player is now ready to take their turn!

Each turn a player can do any, all, or none of the followings in this order:

1) Rotate the cogs by 45° any number of times you like.

2) Pick up one of the cog with its empty side facing up. Orient and place is back down with its track side showing. You may not flip a cog that is occupied by one or more cart.

3) Start moving your cart along a path that connects to the cog your cart currently occupies. Your cart will continue following this path until it encounters an unflipped cog, or your cart has fallen off the board.

- If you encounter an unflipped cog - your cart stop there for the turn.

- If you have fallen off the board, on your next turn you must enter the board from the track where you've fallen off.

As your cart travels along the path you will collect the diamonds on the cogs your cart entered. Any time a diamond is collected pause the cart and immediately add a new diamond to the board if one is available.

Remember that your cart picks up diamond when it arrives at a cog - so a diamond added to a cog that already has a cart on it will not be picked up. It is also possible to have multiple diamonds on the same cog.

Once your cart has come to a stop, your turn has ended.

When all diamonds has been collected, the player with the most diamonds is the winner.

If there are ties - the player who started later in the turn order amongst the tied players is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Race, Tile Placement

name: 12 стульев (12 Chairs)
description:
12 стульев ("12 Chairs") is based on the novel of the same name by Ilf and Petrov. You have to find a chair in which jewelry is hidden. The talent to properly manage a small amount, the ability to win bids, the ability to outperform opponents in ingenuity and memory, the willingness to put a spoke in the wheels of competitors, and, of course, a little luck - this is the key to victory in this dynamic and exciting adventure.

Вам предстоит найти стул, в котором спрятаны драгоценности. Талант правильно распоряжаться небольшой суммой, умение выигрывать торги, способность обходить противников в смекалке и памяти, готовность вставлять палки в колеса конкурентам, и, конечно же, немного удачи — вот залог победы в этом динамичном и увлекательном приключении. «12 стульев» принесет много удовольствия людям любого возраста. Игра не требует долгой подготовки и изучения правил. Ее всегда можно взять с собой и поиграть в дороге, на природе, в кафе, институте и других местах.

name: Around the world in 80 days
description:
The meticulous and punctual English gentleman Phileas Fogg wagers half of his fortune at the Reform Club in London, claiming he can circumnavigate the world in exactly 80 days. Alongside his loyal valet, Passepartout, Fogg embarks on a journey filled with challenges and wonders. Join this adventure around the world, traveling by ship, balloon, and train.
In Around the World in 80 Days, you must meticulously plan your route around the world using transportation tickets that vary in price, distance, and duration. Each turn, tickets are acquired and used to advance on the global map, measuring the distance each ticket allows you to travel. Additionally, you will face unexpected adventures based on Jules Verne's Extraordinary Voyages, thereby gaining prestige at the Reform Club.
As the game progresses, it is crucial to carefully balance your resources and time. A calendar measures the passing of days; careful planning is essential to win this race. Choose your route destinations wisely to always have enough cash to continue your journey.
With the help of iconic characters from Verne's novel, like Princess Aouda or Detective Fix, you can temporarily alter the rules to benefit your strategy or hinder your rivals.
Around the World in 80 Days is a celebration of the adventure book that redefined travel literature. Prepare for the thrill of a true global odyssey!

—description from the publisher

name: Mich in the Downgeon
description:
Mich in the Downgeon is a Flip and Write game that combines figure drawing with resource management.

Players must explore the Downgeon, defeat enemies, get loot and use all their items to advance faster than others.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Animals, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Chaining, Events, Line Drawing, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid

name: Green Team Wins: Holiday Party
description:
Green Team Wins is back with Holiday Party, a 105-card expansion that decks the halls, lets it snow, and jingles all the way. Mix (and mingle) these new questions with your other Green Team Wins cards — or tear off the gift paper and play with them right out of the box.

Finally, something fun to do at a holiday party...

name: Visitors
description:
A cooperative deck-based game where players are aliens who have crashed on Earth. Our scout craft landed and suffered damage; we must dig through solitaire-rows to find good parts and avoid both junk parts that won't help our ship in the long run, and obstacles which require our special skills to overcome.

Collect all six high-quality parts and then collect your toolkit and summon the Mothership, or else fail and be stranded on earth forever...with all its unfriendly obstacles.

name: Gnightly Gnomes
description:
Players cooperate as small house-gnomes, performing charitable favours while the humans sleep. Each task on the 9-tile map merits a reward, but there are dangers lurking, including meanies who will attempt to capture a gnome who is not careful.

All the gnomes must survive until morning, with their tasks completed, to collectively win.

name: New Choice: Improv Your Life!
description:
Imagine playing a game where you're just out of high school, and you're on a big adventure to help pay for college. You get to travel in any direction, make friends, and play improv games that use your talents like speaking, singing, and acting. You can even win scholarships and grants! It's easy to improv, just 1 sentence at a time. And the best part is, You can get super creative and get money by making goofy rhymes and getting people to laugh and clap for you. And, at the end, your team has to remember 5 things that the other team said, to have good relationships. There are 4 ways to play, too! 1. As yourself, 2. In costume/in character, 3. With dolls/puppets, 4. In any language everyone can understand, including Klingon.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Income, Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Scrabble Flip
description:
This a new twist of the classical word game Scrabble aimed for kids.

In this version your get your letters throwing rings on a board using a flipper. The board has all the letters of the alphabet, so depending on the place where the ring lands you get a letter.

When you make a word, you remove all the rings on the used letters and add them to your "word pool", and will turn into points at the end of the game.
mechanics: Auction: Dexterity, Push Your Luck, Spelling

name: Lupus in Tabula: Edizione Luna Piena – Cosplayer Promo card
description:
Promo card that represents a "Cosplayer", distributed first during "Lucca Comics & Games" in November, 2023.

(Her effect activates during the second night)

"Choose a villager (human or werewolf). For the rest of the game, during the night, open your eyes with him and pose for photos. Win with your faction."
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Attackers!
description:
Attackers! is the definitive fighting game. Play your cards right, perform unstoppable combos and take on all your opponents to be the last player standing.

Discover its three game modes and enjoy the most fun and dynamic games. Up to 9 players to enjoy with family and friends.

In Attackers there are 6 different characters printed on the cards, each of them has a different ability, in your turn, you can play as many cards as you want or can, you can even combine cards to make even more powerful abilities.

The main objective of Attackers is to survive, and be the last player standing. Try to eliminate your opponents while keeping your lives safe.

Do you dare to face the craziest flies in the world?

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Real-Time, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon Days
description:
Fill your week of dungeon creatures, scoring the most points in the process. Each creature has unique rules of play, with traps and spells cancelling scores and removing creatures, as well as lots of interaction between creature types. A short take-that strategic game. One deck is needed per two people playing.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Take That, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: DIMOI Spicy
description:
DIMOI games are designed to foster conversation among players, providing the perfect opportunity to discover, rediscover, or simply share memories with your loved ones.

The Spicy version is a spin-off of the Couples edition, offering intimate challenges to be undertaken as a couple.

DIMOI Spicy Couple Edition is the ideal couples' game to explore new horizons and continue to thrive and reinvent yourselves!

Share your desires during a game created to spice up your couple life!

Whether you've been together for a few months or for years, DIMOI Spicy Edition is the perfect game to keep the spark alive in your relationship and enjoy quality time together to reconnect and break the routine!

name: Halls of Teknor
description:
In this dungeon crawler you take on the role of two adventurers looking for the tomb of the fabled robot god Teknor.

You’ll enter an underground maze of rooms roamed by ancient dangerous machines. You will fight them with meaty dice combat and rad power moves. Slaying them will yield you loot which you can bring and upgradable gear . Or you could also delve deeper and rack up your loot multiplier. But beware: if you die you lose all loot you have not brought back.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Paycheck to Billionaire
description:
Start with a Paycheck, Manage Daily Bills, Invest Smartly, from Startup to Business Empire. ----A Game Changer, not only in the Game.

How to Play
setting up the game start by putting the game board in the middle of the table
Shuffle the event and Shop cards and put them in their spots on the board
every player picks an Eye of Providence token and places it at the start space
each player gets $500 paycheck and then picks five event cards but keeps them a secret by placing them face down
during the game you can choose a car and a medical insurance card but once you choose you can't change them
having a car allows a player the option to roll one die or two dice on their turn

own and use a venture
if you land on an unowned Venture you can pay the designated amount to Own It by taking its Venture Card
next time you land on your Venture you can pay the same amount to upgrade
by adding an upgrade token if you land on someone else's Venture you have to pay the bill based on its level you can sell your Venture on your turn to the bank at the net asset price or at the negotiated price to another player
use a card if you land on a event card space take the top card from the event card pile
if you land on the card shop space pay $100 and take the top card from the card shop pile but remember you can only use one card per turn and you have to use it before you roll the dice
if you get a recurring card keep it out so you remember to pay or gain every time you pass or land on start you get $500 but also have to pay any recurring costs and add any recurring income use cards go to the bottom of their pile except for recurring cards which stay in front of you

helicopter
if you land on helicopter space or use a helicopter card you can go to any space on the board landing on start by helicopter gets you a paycheck

Hospital
landing on the hospital space means paying a $2,000 bill but if you have insurance it costs less stop sign token use a stop sign card to place a stop token on any space the first player who pass or land there has to stop at the space upgrade token
you can use upgrade and downgrade cards on any venture to add an upgrade token or remove an upgrade token a venture could upgrade up to level five

how to win
if you can't pay a bill you're out of the game the last player standing wins

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Market, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Cupcake Dragon
description:
Dragons love two things.

Sleeping on huge piles of treasure and eating delicious treats... Especially cupcakes!

Frosted. Chocolate. Cupcakes.

As the mayor of your village, you are duty-bound to provide your citizens protection. And as it happens, the absolute best way to secure that protection is to use cupcakes and loot to entice a dragon to come live in your village.

BUT REMEMBER:
Dragons eat quite a lot and your treasure better be piled high for maximum comfort!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Train Trek
description:
In Train Trek, players experience travel by placing landscape cards each turn. The tracks accumulate into a path for plenty of scoring options. Enjoy this relaxing and carefree game with friends and family, or play it solo. Train Trek is all about that travel vibe and can be enjoyed at home, abroad, at the pub, a restaurant, even on a train!

Players lay a card then decide how to best score it. Should it cover up part of another card, be placed adjacent, maybe turn it upside down to continue a really good track, or even tuck part of it underneath another card. The challenge with finding the perfect placement depend a lot more on what your longer goals may be.

Most scoring options require the connection of two Stations, but each of the four score sheets has a different track scoring. Connect two of the preferred landscape and you’re on your way to using your special power to move any one card that doesn’t have any other card on top of it. This tricky bit of strategy is going to keep your opponents guessing as you place it in just the right spot for those extra big points!
Let’s take a ride on this Train Trek!

Each turn the player will play 1 card from their hand or the face up card in the offer. The placed card can be played partly under another card or two, partly over a card or two, or even next to other cards. Players are encouraged to continue the track, but this is not necessary.
After the card is placed, the player will assess the path they formed with the tracks on the card to another card or more cards that continue the path. In the event of two stations being connected on this path, the player will be able to score in any area of the player sheet as long as they meet the criteria. Or they can ignore the stations and aim for the path to connect multiple landscapes of the same type. Doing so will start to fill a track which allows the player to move a "top" card. Top cards are cards that do not have another card over them. The player can move a Top card to another spot on the landscape of cards to create another scoring opportunity for themselves.
Players will find plenty of strategy with placing cards and then moving cards to create those scoring paths. There are cards for multiple player counts. In solo play the player will use 18 cards, in two player there are 27 cards that are used giving each player 13 turns. In 3 player there are 36 cards and for4 players 45 cards. No two cards are the same allowing for plenty of variation. Players may which to use the starting card and then shuffle the rest of the cards to form a different deck depending on their player count.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Trains, Transportation, Travel

name: Pete the Cat: I Love My White Shoes Game
description:
Pete the Cat goes walking down the street wearing his brand-new white shoes. Along the way, Pete steps in piles of strawberries, blueberries, and other big messes! Does Pete cry? Goodness, no! Pete keeps walking along, singing his song while strumming his guitar. Help Pete change his favorite white shoes to new colors. Be the first player to collect each color token to win!

Scatter all color tokens across Pete’s neighborhood in the gameboard. Give each player their own Pete board. Pass Pete’s guitar to the youngest player to begin play.

On their turn, players push the button on the guitar to determine which color token to collect from the gameboard. Then turn Pete's color wheel board to match the collected token. This wheel will change the color of Pete's shoes. Keep playing until one player has collected each color token.

—description from the publihser

name: Splintered Lands: Founders' Pack
description:
The Founders’ Pack contains 14 promotional cards for the Splintered Lands deckbuilding game. This pack consists of new, unique characters, and alternative art for base game cards.

Many of the characters featured in this pack were created using the likeness of one of our backers and were designed with their input and support!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Constrained Bidding, Deck Construction, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Secret Recipe
description:
Grandma Evelyn, the best baker in the area, has decided to retire from baking and pass on her book of recipes, which she has carefully selected and perfected over the years.

Interested? Well, it looks like you’re not the only one, as the family and friends are all secretly hoping the book will be theirs. So who will be the worthy successor?

Grandma Evelyn has decided to put you all to the test. She has sent out letters containing recipes to all interested parties. But wait – it looks like the letters only contain parts of the recipes.

Can you get the missing information from your family and friends by trading in some of the information from your part of the recipe? Prepare for a series of clever clues, fast wits, and pacts made and broken, to see who will impress Grandma the most and win her collection of award-winning recipes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Victory Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Targeted Clues

name: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
description: In 20,000 Leagues under the Sea is a flip & write game where you must control the Nautilus.

name: Three Battles for the Jacobite Rebellion
description:
A short set of miniatures rules for refighting the battles of the 1745-5 Jacobite Rebellion, published in Wargames Illustrated 134.
These rules are developments of the author's previous ruleset for the mid C18 but with period focus on the '45, so feature modifiers specific to the campaign, e.g. the effect of the 'Highland' charge. These rules are basing and figure size agnostic, although the author uses small units of 8 x 15mm figures for foot regiments.
The rules included 3 scenarios: Prestonpans, Falkirk and Culloden. None of the scenarios is particularly big. The first two scenarios favour the Jacobites, the latter the Government forces.

name: Valhalla: Dwarves
description: This expansion contains 40 cards. They are shuffled in the main deck at the begging of the game. New warriors and new type of tactic cards have different and more complex effects during battles.

name: The British Way: Enemy of My Enemy
description:
The British Way: Enemy of My Enemy is an expansion for The British Way, including two entirely new games on “prequel” conflicts using the Malaya and Palestine maps, and also expanding the base game experience with new variants for all four conflicts originally covered. The British Way: Japanese Occupation puts the British and the Malayan Communist Party (MCP) on the same side in their efforts to resist the Japanese occupation of Malaya during World War II. The British Way: Arab Revolt allows players to explore the brutal suppression of the Arab Revolt (1936-1939) that preceded the Jewish insurgency covered by the original Palestine game. The two new games involve entirely new mechanics to capture the unique features of each conflict and can each be linked to the original Palestine and Malaya games, which also allows them to feed into the “End of Empire” Campaign Scenario. The two new games in the expansion allow players to explore how British attempts to combat earlier threats to colonial rule involved collaborating with local armed groups that they would later end up fighting against (Jewish paramilitary groups in Palestine and the MCP in Malaya), ironically strengthening and preparing these groups for two of the conflicts featured in the The British Way.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Political, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers

name: ASL Action Pack #19: Roads to Rangoon
description: Roads to Rangoon, the 19th “action pack” for Advanced Squad Leader, follows up Action Pack #9 To The Bridge! with more action in Burma between Japanese (and allied Burmese Independence Army troops) and British Commonwealth forces in March and April 1942.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Hidden Agendas
description:
Hidden Agendas is a 3-6 player game all about political shenanigans which parodies the US Congressional system. In Hidden Agendas players take on the role of a political operative, each with their own secret Agenda. Play as the outspoken Activist, the cunning Ambassador, the hot-headed General, the slick Lobbyist, the seasoned Party Leader or the conniving Opposition Party. By creating, debating and voting on Bills, players compete to see their Agenda achieve victory by the end of the game with careful strategy, political maneuvering and a healthy helping of bribery, blackmail and deceit.
Gameplay is a mix of strategy and party-game elements with players having to make calculated decisions about which Legislation cards to play when creating Bills so as not to give away their true intentions. During the debate stage of the game, players will argue for which Bills to Kill and which to Pass into law. Either by enticing rhetoric, or a well-placed bribe of sweet Taxpayer Dollars, players will try to Pass enough Legislation matching their Agenda to win them the game.
—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Action/Event, Bribery, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Sudden Death Ending, Turn Order: Pass Order, Voting

name: Peak Path Pursuit
description:
This game has the theme of 4 adventurers competing to climb a mountain, where the players try to reach the finish line at the 64th box. Each player spins the roulette to determine the number of moves, with positive numbers making them go forward and negative numbers making them go back. There are obstacles that must be overcome, such as ravines and mud, while creeping plants can provide benefits. Players will also get items that are useful for harming other players or benefiting themselves. The first player to reach the finish line will be the winner, with the game ending when 3 players have reached the finish.

Permainan ini bertema 4 petualang yang berlomba untuk mendaki suatu pegunungan, di mana para pemain berusaha mencapai garis finish di kotak ke-64. Setiap pemain memutar roulette untuk menentukan jumlah langkah, dengan angka positif membuat mereka maju dan angka negatif membuat mereka mundur. Terdapat rintangan yang harus dilewati seperti jurang dan lumpur menghadang, sementara tanaman menjalar dapat memberikan keuntungan. Pemain juga akan mendapatkan item yang berguna untuk merugikan pemain lain atau menguntungkan diri mereka sendiri. Pemain pertama yang mencapai garis finish akan menjadi pemenang, dengan permainan berakhir ketika 3 pemain sudah mencapai finish.

name: Frozen II: Path to the North
description: A collaborative game where players have to work together to create a path of leaf cards without using their hands. Instead, players must try to direct the cards into place by blowing each card individually. The path is completed when the leaf cards connect with the start and finish cards and all three character cards are included in the path. If the players succeed in doing this before running out of action cards, they win the game together.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fortune and Glory: A Life of Excitement Promo Card
description:
Promotional card 019 for Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game.

EVENT

PLAY IMMEDIATELY

Every Hero may immediately draw 2 Event cards.

name: Fortune and Glory: "I Don't Think So!" Promo Card
description:
Promotional card 001 for Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game.

EVENT + MENTAL

Play to cancel any Event card or Villain Event.

or

Play to cancel any City card on the D6 roll of 3+.

name: Fortune and Glory: Down for the Count Promo Card
description:
Promotional card 034 for Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game.

EVENT

Play when you or another Hero defeats a Minion or Villain for that Hero to collect an extra D6 Glory.

name: Fortune and Glory: Tommy Gun Promo Card
description:
Promotional card 002 for Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game.

GEAR + RANGED WEAPON + GUN

COMBAT +4

name: Fortune and Glory: German SMG Promo Card
description:
Promotional card 035 for Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game.

GEAR + RANGED WEAPON + GUN

COMBAT +1

Once per Fight Round, Reroll any number of your Fight Dice.

name: Hockey Hardware: The Original Game
description:
Hockey Hardware is a tabletop game made for hockey fans, gamers, and fantasy hockey GMs, but anyone can play, have fun, and win. No hockey knowledge or experience is needed.

This game is socially interactive, competitive, and unpredictable. No two games are the same, and no lead is safe. Players must use a combination of luck and strategy to win.

At the start of the game, take on the role of a hockey player. You will start as either a Forward on Line 2 or as a Defence on Pair 2 in either the East or West Conference.

On your turn, collect as many hockey stats as you can by rolling dice, avoiding Adversity, and strategically playing Game Cards. Game Cards reflect different hockey actions that can help you get ahead or push your opponents back.

The more hockey stats you collect, the more likely you will earn different Trophy Cards. Players compete for 11 Trophy Cards throughout the game, which consists of 15 rounds divided into 3 periods and 2 intermissions in a Game Schedule.

The player with the most Trophy Cards by the end of the Third Period earns the Champion's Cup and wins the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Fantasy, Math, Memory, Number, Sports
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Delayed Purchase, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Hidden Victory Points, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Lose a Turn, Memory, Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Order Counters, Paper-and-Pencil, Score-and-Reset Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Slide/Push, Stat Check Resolution

name: 京都異世界ツアー (Kyoto Different World Tour)
description:
The Kyoto Tourism Association planned to attract tourism from other worlds, in addition to a pinch of tourists reduced by the Corona Swirl.
The heroes, fairies and demons come from the door to another world where the excellent Yin Yangji of Kyoto employees.
The three people enjoyed Kyoto tourism with the Yin Yang and SP Police Officers, but the brave remains discovered at the last time of Ininjai Taisha Fushimi.
The "mokaru stone" which is a wish has been dyed into the blood...

Artwork by Mudder Mystery Mini Series
Explore the criminals of killing braves and backgrounds in a unique world of Kyoto x Another World.
Despite the mini size, the mysterious world and gimmicks in the game are must-see.

name: Dungeon Pen
description:
Dungeon Pen unfolds in the mythical world of Scythius—a medieval fantasy realm created by Compagnie du Yucca for our live-action role-playing games (LARPs).

Step into the roles of daring adventurers or nefarious underworld scum, all cast into the dreadful dungeons of the infamous Ursula, necromancer of the endless mountains.

For too long, you've languished in a cramped cell within a vast, damp hall. On the rare occasions you're allowed out, you've managed to gather a small treasure, which you guard meticulously beside your bed.

Mostly, your days are filled with nothing but the taunts of fellow prisoners and the sneering laughter of the jailers.

Then, on one dark and indistinguishable night, when the jailers have neglected to bring food, the gates of two cells swing open. Your heart pounds with adrenaline—not to escape, as any sane person might, but driven by all those insults endured, to snatch your rival’s treasure.

Gameplay Overview
Players find themselves on opposite ends of the Dungeon-Prison map. The objective is simple: navigate through the dungeon, seize the opponent's treasure, and return to your cell first to claim victory.

Each turn, maneuver your character with a strategic pencil flick, then draw an event card that needs immediate resolution. The dungeon throws challenges at every turn, from monsters and magical barriers to perplexing walls, testing every player's resolve.

As you navigate the map, any element you encounter (be it debris or treasure) can be collected:

Debris: Draw from a deck filled with various equipment and advantageous items that could tilt the scales in your favor.
Treasure: Capture your opponent’s treasure and make a swift return to your cell.


But tread carefully—the dungeon is fraught with peril, your adversary is unyielding, and your life points are precious. Every move could be your last. Navigate wisely to survive and triumph.

—description from the publisher

name: Dune: Kwisatz Haderach Edition
description:
Imagine you can control the forces of a noble family, guild, or religious order on a barren planet which is the only source for the most valuable substance in the known universe.

Imagine you can rewrite the script for one of the most famous science fiction books of all time. Welcome to the acclaimed 40-year-old board game which allows you to recreate the incredible world of Frank Herbert’s DUNE.

In DUNE you will become the leader of one of six great factions. Each wishes to control the most valuable resource in the universe - melange, the mysterious spice only found at great cost on the planet DUNE. As Duke Leto Atreides says “All fades before melange. A handful of spice will buy a home on Tupile. It cannot be manufactured, it must be mined on Arrakis. It is unique and it has true geriatric properties.” And without melange space travel would be impossible. Only by ingesting the addictive drug can the Guild Steersman continue to experience visions of the future, enabling them to plot a safe path through hyperspace.

Who will control DUNE? Become one of the characters and their forces from the book and . . . You decide!
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Fighting, Negotiation, Novel-based, Political, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Bribery, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Force Commitment, Map Deformation, Negotiation, Predictive Bid, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Skull of Freedom
description:
Skull of Freedom is Pirate/Navy themed in the 17th Century era. There's six faction to choose from. 3 of them are pirates factions and 3 of them are navy factions. Each player chooses each factions they want to play. The faction has no effect at the game mechanics in current version. Each player have 6 cards and dices to roll either to attack or to repair their ship. This action is determined by the cards they put out and if they do nothing, they pick one card. The last ship standing wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Type HT Bounty Hunter Mini Ship Pack
description:
Sleek, maneuverable and deadly, the Type HT is equally suited to crime or constabulary. But it’s as a bounty hunter that the ship truly shines. Whether motivated by justice or credits, these intrepid captains scour known space for their mark. And they rarely fall short.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Fool's Blade: Screaming Forest
description: Includes 30 new cards! 2 new classes, 8 new sword pieces (2 full new swords), 6 monsters, 5 tavern cards, and 9 quest cards: 3 action, 3 gear, and 3 curses.

name: Midnight Hero
description:
Midnight Hero enables couples to find greater pleasure by using competition to reconcile different preferences and re-introduce novelty. You will take a journey with your companion to learn what makes them excited and what they shy away from. This game is not for the timid, because the real-life outcome of your evening is shaped through competition rather than the standard formula.

While this game cannot solve all barriers to intimacy (health issues, sleepless nights with kids, or wider relationship issues as examples), it is designed to help break down common barriers to sexual intimacy in healthy relationships. Some of those common barriers are:

Initiation of sex can be an awkward song and dance
Switching from everyday life to being intimate can be a difficult transition
Trying new things can be intimidating, and for some it is hard to even know what to do
Sexual preferences often differ and those differences are frequently ignored rather than explored.

The game is played in 3 phases

In phase 1 you play a game of would you rather.

Step 1: Deal 10 cards to each player from the foundation building deck

Step 2: Player 1 reads 2 cards at a time from their deck to player 2 (tip do not show cards while reading)

Step 3: Player 2 selects their preferred card and the remaining card goes to player 1. The cards should be distributed face down.

Step 4: Player 1 repeats steps 2-3 until all cards from their hand are distributed.

Step 5: Player 2 now follows the same steps 2-4

Step 6: Both players turn their cards face up and organize by color

Phase 2 you’re playing to get to 9 points first.

The board needs to be set up with the bonus cards up top while the scoring cards are in a pile with 5 cards turned over just below that. The moonlight tokens are stacked below the scoring cards and 2 blocking tokens are given to both players.

The player who has the next birthday starts. If this isn’t your first time playing, the loser from the previous round starts.

A player has 2 options for their turn.

Option 1: Select 3 moonlight tokens (or 2 of the same color if there are 4 or more of the same color available)

Option 2: purchase a scoring card

The Scoring cards and foundation cards subsidize future purchases by discounting the purchase price by the number of cards you have.
When a scoring card is purchased the point value purchased is in the upper right hand corner. The first player to 9 points wins the phase.
Players may also use their blocking token during their turn. This does not count as their turn, however it removes the scoring card from the line up.

If a wild card is drawn the scoring cards that have not been purchased need to be reshuffled.

Bonus cards contain no point value and are earned when a player obtains the minimum of scoring cards displayed on the bonus card. The bonus card holder may be different than the Midnight Hero (winner of phase 2) however the Midnight Hero collects any remaining bonus cards at the end of phase 2. These do not require an extra turn to obtain but do require to be picked up during the turn of the player securing the bonus card.

Phase 3 is all about rewards.

The Midnight Hero gets to select one foundation card and 3 points worth of consequences from the scoring cards. The bonus cards are performed before the foundation and scoring cards are performed.

—description from the designer

name: Lucha Libre
description:
Synopsis: Lucha Libre, the spectacular combat sport from Mexico, combines traditional wrestling with unique cultural elements. Characterized by masked wrestlers (Luchadores), acrobatic movements, and strong symbolism, it reflects Mexican heritage and identity, drawing fans from around the world for its dynamism and flamboyant style.

In this game, you will experience a fight between four Lucha Libre celebrities: on one side El Santo and El Cavernario, and on the other side Blue Demon and El Bulldog! You will see that everything plays out as much in the audience as it does in the ring!

Gameplay: Simultaneously roll as many dice as your luchador's energy allows, and try to combine them to execute the best moves, which will earn you Fans and drain energy from both you and your opponent.

If you're not satisfied with your dice results, don't worry, spend 1 Fan to reroll as many dice as you wish... but be careful not to lose their support.

And remember, switch your wrestler at the right time, when they are rested enough to change the course of the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Trash Heap
description:
In Trash Heap, players take on the role of scavengers in an underground world. Each turn presents a massive garbage puzzle, and players must decide whether to accept the potentially space-consuming puzzle piece. Declining incurs a compensation fee, while accepting grants the full compensation. Players must strategically manage their space, earning additional compensation for collecting pieces of the same series.

Various module cards are also provided to add more challenges for players, ensuring each game offers a unique experience. Balancing the accumulation of garbage with financial sustainability becomes crucial as players navigate this intricate underworld.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Grid Coverage, Push Your Luck, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Fates of Madness: An Adventure Card Game, 2nd Edition
description:
Fates of Madness is a single-player or cooperative role-playing adventure card game. Take control of a party of adventurers out to destroy the evil lurking in the wilderness. The party's skill and resilience will be tested by Scenarios and Monsters, and their determination will be rewarded with potions and treasure. Fate cards determine success or failure; Madness enters as the journey continues.

This horror-themed adventure uses art from Legendary Games' Gothic Horror Compendium.

For a better play experience, the revised Second Edition includes an Adventure Guidebook with updated Game Rules, glossary, tutorial, hints, and 7 replayable branching adventure modules written by game designer Jimmy Sanders. It's like having a game master in the box!

—description from the publisher

name: Krakel-Orakel
description:
Krakel-Orakel is a co-operative drawing game for people who can't draw. Each player gets a a dry-erase pen and a board that has many random lines on it. At the start of each round, each player gets a card with a word on it and has to draw it on their board — but by drawing only on the lines. In effect, they have to find the image in the lines.

When everyone is done, as many cards as there are players are shuffled in with the cards originally dealt. These cards are spread openly on the table, then each player in turn picks a card with a word they think nobody drew on their board. Once everyone has had a turn, only the words that were originally dealt should remain on the table, so any face-up card that was not drawn by anyone is a mistake. After four rounds, the group wins if they have made fewer mistakes than there are players.

The cards feature words of two difficulty levels, and the group decides together which level to play.

name: Hogwarts After Dark: The Werewolf Threat
description:
In a parallel universe to Harry Potter's wizarding world, Voldemort's power has been defeated, but a new threat is emerging - the Werewolf species under the leadership of Fenrir Greyback. At Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, a dark time is approaching as students and teachers begin to transform into werewolves in the shadows.

Ordinary citizens, werewolves, and wizards must use all their skills and intelligence to triumph in the game of life and death. Trust, suspicion, and cooperation will be decisive factors in the battle against the dark power of the Werewolf species.

—description from the publisher

name: Norsemen
description:
In Norsemen, as the leader of the Vikings, you have to travel to foreign lands and build settlements and forts. Lawspeaker are dispatched and hold meetings. Sufficient ships ensure supplies and provide resources.

Norsemen is an exciting Euro style game in the expert game range for 2-4 players with a fascinating mixture of resource management, worker placement, deck building and push-your-luck elements.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Mindbug: Tag Team
description:
Mindbug: Tag Team is an add-on pack for Mindbug introducing the ultimate 2vs2 experience. Double the strategy, double the fun in this fast-paced tactical team duel. This add-on introduces 2vs2-specific cards to create combos with your teammate. It offers a fast-paced gameplay with only 3 cards in your hand and 3 cards in your deck.

Here is how it works:

Mix the Tag Team 2vs2 pack with any other Mindbug set(s).
Team up with a partner and share 3 life as a team.
Each player gets 6 cards: 3 in their hand and 3 in their deck.
Equip yourself with 1 Mindbug and 1 Mindfrog. Use your Mindfrog wisely to seize control of one of your teammate's creatures at a crucial moment for a tactical edge.


In Mindbug, you summon hybrid creatures and send them to battle against your opponents. But be careful: your opponents may use one of their Mindbugs to take control of it.

Outwit your opponents in a fascinating tactical team duel in which having the best cards and playing them at the wrong time can be deadly for yourself.

Mindbug combines the accessibility and fairness of a simple card game with the strategic depth of a complex Strategy Card Game. The result is a skill-based dueling card game that feels utterly different from all the other card games you have played before.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Das große Quiz der Dialekte
description:
A trivia games in which players have to decipher words and phrases from various dialects of the German speaking regions.

Cards come in four categories with a different task each: translate a word (multiple choice), find the right answer to a question (multiple choice), find the picture showing an item, and translate a sentence. All players answer the questions simultaneously, a correct answer yields one point. The player with most points after ten cards is the winner.

name: Lost in Translation
description:
Lost in Translation is a cooperative game in which players interpret the meaning of unusual expressions from 35 languages. These are expressions that mean something entirely different from the sum of their parts. English examples (not included in the game) would be "to spill the beans" or "to beat around the bush".

The game consists of cards with one side showing the expression in the original language (and a transcription when non-Roman script is used) and a literal translation into German. The other side shows the actual meaning of the expression. One player draws seven cards from the deck, shuffles them under the table and reads a meaning, then shuffles the cards again and spreads out the cards with the literal translations on the table. The group now has to guess the phrase with that meaning, then flip that card. If correct, the group gains a point. If not, they will flip another card, etc. After flipping ten cards, the game ends and the group tallies their points - the more, the better.

There is also a competitive mode in which players read a literal translation and then write down explanations. A vote on the funniest/most original/most creative answer yields a point; the player with most points after 10 cards is the winner.

name: Swanchyboy Studios Pirates
description:
In Swanchyboy Studios Pirates players take on the roles of sailors during the Golden Age of Piracy. Through a series of turns, players will build their crew, acquire ships, trade goods, and complete missions, all in an effort to gain the most victory points by game’s end.

In this immersive world, players will encounter four powerful nations, The Spanish, The English, The French, and The Dutch—vie for dominance, each with its own ambitions and strategies. As you set sail, remember, the seas are not just home to merchants and adventurers but also to ruthless pirates who will stop at nothing to claim their bounty.

Each nation starts with NPC merchant ships laden with riches, tempting targets for daring pirates. These merchant ships sail the seas, carrying valuable cargo waiting to be plundered by those brave enough to attack.

The pirate NPC is a constant threat, lurking on the horizon, ready to pounce on unsuspecting ships. While they chase everyone, their primary targets are those who choose not to engage in combat, making them easy prey for the ruthless pirates.

Provoking the ire of a nation comes with consequences. Once a player attacks a ship of a particular nation, that nation will unleash its naval might. Naval ships from that nation will relentlessly pursue the aggressor, seeking retribution for their attacked brethren.

As a captain, you are not alone in this quest. You can recruit sailors at different ports, each with their own skills and abilities.

Combat between ships and crew is resolved by dice roll; the amount of dice will depend on the specific abilities of the ship or crew.

Ships also use dice roll for movement and the amount of dice will depend on the particular ship. You have several options at ports as what ship to purchase and use in your adventure.

Your goal is simple: to become the most famous captain on the high seas. But achieving this goal will require more than just skill and cunning. You must be prepared to face challenges from all sides, whether it be battling rival ships, delivering precious cargo to distant ports, or searching for hidden treasure beneath the waves.

Navigate the treacherous waters, recruit skilled sailors, engage in epic battles with other ships, and embark on daring quests for gold and riches, Each player is a sailor looking to be the most famous in the Caribbean.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Miniatures, Nautical, Negotiation, Pirates
mechanics: Action Drafting, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Illustrated Book Titles
description:
A party game in which players need to recognize various books.

RULES

The cards should be placed about the room, so that they can easily be seen. They must not be handled.
Competitors are provided with a Scoring Card for writing down their solutions.
The winner is the one returning the most correct card. In case two or more return correct cards the winner is the one who makes the first return.
As the cards are handed in they should be numbered.

name: Woodworms
description:
Collect wood to build different kinds of furniture. But watch out for woodworms. The first one to build all furniture wins.

On your turn your either build furniture with previously collected wood. Each type of furniture requires a different amound and kind of wood.

Or you go collect wood from the forest. The forest is represented by the face down cards spread over the table<

You flip over and collect cards until you decide to stop or flip over a special card.

When you flip a special card you handle the action of the sepcial card.

If you pull the worm, your wood has woodworm! you must discard all your collected wood and it is the next player's turn.
With poison you can neutralize the woodworms and you will not lose your wood.
Trucks allow you to steal someone else's cards. And the forest ranger causes you to discard down your collected wood.

name: Slanguage
description:
Slanguage, the party game of SLANG WORDS! Test your knowledge and be creative by guessing meanings of common slang words used over the last century. This unconventional party game creates tons of laughter when players make their best to convince the judge that they KNOW the right answer!

The judge rolls the die for one of the categories to play. They read the Slang and players will write their answer on their erasable sheet and add the decade they think the slang dates from. Once everyone wrote their answers, the judge mixes the cards and read all the answers and chooses which one they prefer, giving the slang card and 3 points to the player. The winning player reads the definition and the decade and players score if they got the decade right. Players play 5 to 10 cards and the player with the highest score at the end wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Panda Rei
description:
He slept! He slept! The king of the jungle fell asleep!
The news echoed throughout the forest that the lion was in a deep sleep, and now, the animals were in an uproar to find a new king, someone who had an air of nobility capable of pleasing mother nature and reigning with authority.
Then, the monkey asks the others: ‘Why don’t we choose Panda and make him King?’

Panda Rei is divided into 2 rounds, each one with 11 turns of card competition between players.

In each turn, players will play cards from their hands on the table trying to win to have the preference in choosing the cards played to be placed in front of them to be scored at the end of the game.

Normally, to win a dispute, the player must have played the card with the highest value on the table, however, if there is more than one equal card on the table, the card from the largest group repeated on the table with the highest value is what will win the dispute.

The winner of the dispute will receive 2 cards from those played on the table and will be the first to choose from those available, following the order of receipt and choice of cards for the players to the left of the winner of the dispute. This way, the last player (the one to the right of the person who won the dispute) will not receive a card in the turn.

At the end of two rounds, players will check the cards in front of them and count the points. The player with the most points is the winner!

—description from the designer

name: Swamp Monsters TCG
description:
Swamp Monsters TCG is a satirical and strategic trading card game that humorously parodies contemporary political and cultural ideologies. Players select from six pre-established factions, each embodying exaggerated caricatures of real-world political personas: Est-Left, Est-Right, MIGA, Libertarian, Leftist, and Alt-Right. Set in a swampy political landscape, players choose a Champion, deploy Heroes, Operatives, Traps, and more in their swamp to strategically engage opponents. The game’s turn-based structure involves resource management, card deployment, and attacks, with the objective of diminishing opponents’ Champion Political Power (PP). “Swamp Monsters TCG” offers players a unique blend of strategic decision-making and humorous satire, inviting them to navigate a hilarious political arena while strategizing to achieve victory.

In a multi-dimensional universe a rift has opened between the Earth and Mars. From the other side of the Rift, humans of Earth are being manipulated by beings from the planet Devora. Devora has been at war for hundreds of years, and a few beings have learned powerful abilities that allow them to absorb energy from the rift between our world and theirs to gain amazing new powers. This metaphysical energy eminates from humans under great distress, and Devorans have learned they can increase this energy by telepathically connecting to humans to cause chaos on Earth.

This game is a 2-6 player deck building strategy card game, where players compete to be the "last man standing" in a turn base trading card game. To begin, players place a pre-selected Champion card this card is the leader of their deck. After turn order is determined, players take turn moving through the 5 phases of their turn(Draw,Resource,Deployment,Action, and End Turn). Players aim is to deploy Trap, Utility, Event,and Capitol cards to gain a tactical advantage. Persona cards (Heroes and Operatives) are used to defend their Champion and attack enemy Champions. This TCG utilized a three resource system (morale, influence, and crumbling fiat currency) to pay for deploying Persona cards, using abilities, or amplifying card actions. In a world twisted by chaos fight for control to regain balance for all mankind.

—description from the publisher

name: Balaio de Gato
description:
Two different litters of kittens were born and are discovering the most comfortable way to take long naps, in a cattery specially prepared for them. Which litter of kittens will get the most comfortable nap first?

The Game in 3 Steps:

Distribute the baskets throughout the cattery;
On your turn, move one of the kittens from your litter to a new pen;
Line up your kittens in the room, or accommodate them in the same type of basket so they can take a comfortable nap while you win the game!


—description from the designer

Duas ninhadas diferentes de gatinhos nasceram e estão descobrindo a forma mais confortável de tirar longas sonecas, em um gatil especialmente preparado para eles. Qual ninhada de gatinhos irá tirar a soneca mais confortável primeiro?

O Jogo em 3 Passos:

Distribua os balaios pelo gatil;
Em seu turno, mova um dos gatinhos de sua ninhada para um novo balaio;
Alinhe seus gatinhos no aposento, ou acomode-os em um mesmo tipo de balaio para que eles tirem uma soneca confortável enquanto você ganha a partida!


—description from the designer (Portuguese)

name: SENH4
description:
In SENH4 (code), players take on the role of hackers competing to be the first to unlock one of the codes in a digital matrix. Using colored code blocks, each player tries to recreate password patterns that are revealed and hidden in the matrix every moment to win the game.

The Game in Three Steps:

Implant Secret Code Blocks in the Matrix: Start the duel of minds by positioning your blocks strategically, preparing the ground for cyber combat.
Reprogram the Structures to Reveal SENH4 Patterns: Maneuver the code blocks with precision, changing the digital configuration to discover the secrets of the Matrix.
Replicate SENH4 with Your Code Blocks and Definitely Control the Matrix!: Master the digital power game, using your cunning to replicate SENH4 and claim hacker supremacy.


—description from the designer (Portuguese)

Em SENH4, os jogadores assumem o papel de hackers competindo para ser o primeiro a desvendar um dos códigos de uma matriz digital. Utilizando blocos de código coloridos, cada jogador tenta recriar padrões de senhas que se revelam e se ocultam a cada instante na matriz para ganhar a partida.

O Jogo em Três Passos:

Implante Blocos de Código Secretos na Matriz: Inicie o duelo de mentes posicionando seus blocos estrategicamente, preparando o terreno para um combate cibernético.
Reprograme as Estruturas para Revelar Padrões de SENH4: Manobre os blocos de código com precisão, alterando a configuração digital para descobrir os segredos da Matriz.
Replique a SENH4 com Seus Blocos de Códigos e Controle Definitivamente a Matriz!: Domine o jogo de poder digital, utilizando sua astúcia para replicar a SENH4 e reivindicar a supremacia hacker.


—description from the designer (Portuguese)
mechanics: Grid Movement, Mancala, Modular Board, Pattern Building

name: Runes: The Game
description:
You and your fellow players are brave Vikings. On a foray through the far north, you discover a black treasure chest with ancient rune stones. By skillfully placing the rune stones, you can unleash the powers of the runes. Don't be intimidated by the rituals and use them to your advantage.

Runes is a quick-to-learn placement and strategy game for 2 to 5 players. Place the stones, so that as many runes as possible match. The better the stones match, the more coins you can discard. If you place golden rune stones, you are rewarded with double number of coins. The first player to discard all their coins wins the game.

But now the rituals come into play. For each black ritual stone you place, you receive one ritual card. You can use rituals at any time, even when it's not your turn. You can use them to gain an advantage or drive your opponents to the brink of "game madness". And if you make a special effort when placing the rune stones and they form a line or circle, you will be rewarded with extra coins.

Runes impresses with simple basic rules, a high degree of variety through a constantly changing playing field and different strategies that lead to winning. In addition, an extra portion of game dynamics through rituals that can be played at ANY TIME.

Dive into the world of runes and rituals but always watch your back, because "Only ONE can win RUNES".

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Medieval, Mythology, Puzzle
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Misión Antártida: Expansión Inclemencias
description:
Discover the exciting Misión Antártida expansion with the new Inclemencia cards! Immerse yourself in an even more challenging world full of unexpected events with these two new additions that promise to take the fun and uncertainty to the next level.

In Misión Antártida: Expansión Inclemencias, you will face extreme weather conditions that will test your strategy and your ability to adapt to the unexpected. From unforeseen blizzards to sudden avalanches, these cards add an element of surprise to every game, keeping the excitement and tension going throughout.

Are you ready to face the challenges that Antarctica has in store for you? With "Inclemencias", the excitement has never been so intense! Dare to explore this new territory and discover how far your skills will take you in "Mission Antarctica: Inclemency". Get ready for an even more exciting gaming experience full of unexpected twists!

name: The Bad Egg: Three's a Full Nest, Four's a Crowd
description:
A Card Matching, Dice Rolling, Point Salad Game
w/Press your Luck & “Take That” elements.

In a world of culinary eggs, you need full nests with the largest eggs for the most return for your labors. Don’t crowd your nests or you will downgrade their value and miss out on extra revenue. Filling special orders in a timely manner will gain you additional earnings. Make sure to avoid or discard any bad eggs or you may lose ground in building your egg empire. Fortified eggs have added effects that may assist or hinder you in hatching your plan for success. In an eggshell, you must roll with your chosen strategy in pursuit of an eggcellent income and take a chance, whisking it all in hopes of turning the largest profit in the egg industry.

Object: Have the most points at the end of the game.
Roll and place dice; competing to gather Nest Eggs and Fortified Eggs. Gather 3 of the same egg type and you have a Full Nest. More than 3 and your nest is crowded. Fortified Eggs may be good or bad depending on your situation in the game. Individual Egg Timer objectives will give you extra points based on the eggs you gather and the full nests you have. Avoid Bad Eggs or you may lose points.

Includes "Single Layer" Solo Play

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Hot Potato, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: MythFits
description:
Whoever says Big Foot isnʼt real hasnʼt played Myth Fits — the family strategy game where mythical (wink, wink) creatures unite in the forest while evading roving photographers. Use special skills to slip through the trees, run fast or even fly across the tiles you play on each turn. Be the first to build a path to connect your creatures and you win the game. If you canʼt connect your creatures, work stealthily to collect photos of your opponentsʼ creatures as an alternate way to win. Will your sneaky moves bring you victory?

—description from the publisher

name: WordWeaver Adventures
description:
WordWeaver Adventures is a family friendly, co-op word building game where adventurers travel to beautifully depicted regions around the world. In each of these regions, they will be challenged by teachers to channel their energy through spelling words. Meet the goal and move to the next challenge with the teacher's praise. Fail and the teacher will make things more difficult. WordWeaver Adventures is highly modular and difficulty of play can be scaled to accommodate a wide variety of play groups and styles. A playthrough can be a breezy 15 minutes or a strategic 60+ minutes. Adventure awaits!

Theme: This game is set in the 18th century Philippines, Vietnam and Japan with animals from each region. The animals are either indigenous to or can be found in those regions. Whenever they are dressed, they are dressed in period specific attire. For example, the Court Musician is a tiger dressed in an 18th century Vietnamese dress (ao dai) and playing a Vietnamese instrument.

How to play: To play the game, players select a region with a corresponding Head Teacher and Assistant Teachers. Players will select an Adventurer board and draw seven tiles to put on their board.

Players will flip over one Assistant Teacher card at a time and be faced with a "Challenge Value" (CV) from that teacher. Each player will spell a word. Once all players have spelled a word, the point values are added up across all players and compared to the CV. If the total is greater then or equal to the CV, then the players will redraw back up to 7 tiles while placing all used tiles back in the tile bag. The next player will then flip over the next Assistant Teacher.

If the players do not meet the CV, the Teacher will "crack a tile slot" of the current player. All players must return all tiles back to the tile bag and then redraw. If a player has a "cracked tile slot" they draw one less tile for each cracked tile slot. For instance, if the current player has one cracked tile slot, they can only redraw 6 tiles instead of seven.

The next player then flips the next card and play continues until all Assistant Teachers have been challenged. The Head Teacher features a much larger challenge and multiple rounds to meet that challenge.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: Sangram
description:
Sangram is a Hindi word, often used to refer to India's 'struggle' for freedom against colonisers. This game gives players a taste of that struggle through simple mechanics, in just 30 minutes of game time. The aim is to build the strongest army out of all competing kingdoms. But beware....as history has shown us, infighting between the kingdoms makes it easy for foreigners to enter in the name of trade and slowly take over the entire subcontinent.

Players start with 3 warrior cards, each having a 'strength' number which they contribute to the kingdom's army. In each round of the game, first, players send one warrior each to battle, activating the special power of that card. Then, in the order of motivation of those cards, players can recruit 1 extra warrior from the market of volunteer warriors. Unfortunately, these recruited warriors attract some coloniser tokens. So the choice of recruited warriors depends on multiple factors - the coloniser count, motivation, strength and the special power of that card which could be useful later. Finally, in the training phase, all players gain 1 Army strength. However, if players have more than 4 coloniser tokens, they are weakened from within and don't gain that extra 1 Strength in that round.

This mechanic creates a constant tussle between choosing to activate warriors which attack other kingdoms, or warriors which keep the Coloniser tokens from piling up. This was a dilemma that rajas often faced at that time in India. Ultimately the winner is one who finds the fine balance between both paths. The first player to reach an Army Strength of 18, through smart recruitment, attacking opponents and consistent training, becomes all-powerful - the ruler of the entire subcontinent of Bharata!

—description from the publisher

name: UNO Flip! Stranger Things
description:
UNO FLIP! flips classic UNO game play with twists like a double-sided deck, special FLIP card and tougher penalties that add a competitive edge…and with a theme inspired by the supernatural TV thriller Stranger Things, fans will really flip over this edition! There is a "Real World" side to the deck, which plays like the classic UNO game, and an "Upside Down" side where penalties are super-tough. Play the FLIP card, and all cards in the player's hand, the draw pile and draw deck are flipped over to reveal an entirely new set of numbers and colors on the opposite side. The holder of the FLIP card determines which side to play -- and when cards are switched back around. The "Upside Down" side of the deck includes action cards that really shake things up, like Draw Five and Skip Everyone. Strategize to rattle the competition and be the first to get rid of all cards to win. When players are down to one card, they still can't forget to shout "UNO!" This fun family card game is perfect for 2 to 10 players ages 7 years old and up, especially fans of the show. Colors and decorations may vary.

Inspired by the hit supernatural thriller, UNO Flip! Stranger Things adds twists to classic gameplay with elements that offer a competitive edge!

The collectible edition features a double-sided deck and special FLIP card designed with characters and images from the show!

Play the special FLIP card and all cards are turned over, including the draw pile, to reveal an entirely new set of numbers and colors on the opposite side!
The 'Real World' side of the deck plays like the classic UNO game; the 'Upside Down' side includes penalties that are super-tough, like Draw Five and Skip Everyone cards!

The first to get rid of all their cards wins, but only if they don't forget to shout 'UNO!'

—description from the publisher

name: Cribbage Dice
description:
Love cribbage? Love Yahtzee? Then Cribbage Dice was made for you.

Never heard of Cribbage but love Yahtzee? Add a fun twist and breathe new life into the beloved classic.

Got a group of more than four people that all want to play cribbage? Cribbage Dice can accommodate as many people as you can crowd around the table.

The goal of the game is simple: to roll the best cribbage hands you can and be the first player to reach 90 points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Twilight Struggle: The Cold War Movies
description: One sheet of optional 007 movie playing cards, complementing the article "the Movies of the Cold War" in C3i magazine #37. 8 new cards titled after James Bond movies and featuring new events.

name: Star Trek: Ascendancy – The Final Frontier
description:
Boldly go where no one has gone before. In Star Trek: Ascendancy — a board game of exploration, expansion and conflict between the United Federation of Planets, the Klingon Empire, and the Romulan Star Empire — you control the great civilizations of the Galaxy, striking out from your home worlds to expand your influence and grow your civilization. Will you journey for peace and exploration, or will you travel the path of conquest and exploitation? Command starships, establish space lanes, construct starbases, and bring other systems under your banner. With more than 200 plastic miniatures and 30 star systems representing some of the Star Trek galaxy's most notable planets and locations, Star Trek: Ascendancy puts the fate of the galaxy in your hands.

The great unknown lies before you; with every turn is a new adventure as your ships explore new space systems, encounter new life forms and new civilizations, make wondrous discoveries, and face challenging obstacles, all drawn from the vast fifty year history of Star Trek. Will you brave the hazards of Rura Penthe to harvest vital resources, race to develop Sherman's Planet before your rivals stake their claim, or explore the mysteries of the Mutara Nebula on an ever-growing, adaptive map of the galaxy. With an infinite combination of planets and interstellar phenomena, no two games of Star Trek: Ascendancy will ever play the same!

Star Trek: Ascendancy – The Final Frontier contains the Star Trek: Ascendancy base game, all seven expansions released as of 2023, as well as new planets, civilizations, and tech cards; new alternative ships; and "an exciting requested race".
categories: Civilization, Exploration, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: GigaWatt: Energy Revolution!
description:
GigaWatt – Energy Revolution! A fast and easy version of the original, that lets you race to transition the energy system against other players in just 45 minutes. Reach out to us to make this part of your company end-of-year gift.

Each turn in this game you decide how far you want to push your luck, while you prepare for the other players’ moves, and build up to a climactic ending of the game. The cards in your hand let you build wind turbines, upgrade the power grid, install batteries for flexibility or close down a coal plant.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling

name: Free Tacos
description:
You are throwing a taco party, but you're broke. Luckily, the taco trucks in town are giving away free tacos, if you can get to them without your opponents getting in the way.

Players simultaneously choose which taco truck to go for. If they are alone, they get all the truck's tacos and side dishes. If two or more players run into each other, all the food gets wasted and discarded.

Which truck players want to go to will change as they try to build the perfectly balanced taco party. When the game ends, if players have more tacos than side dishes, they have to discard the excess tacos before they count their score.'

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Random Production, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The TIMBER! Game
description:
TIMBER! is a unique stacking game that brings out both your competitive and creative sides! Simply combine the green “Leaves” and see how big the tree will grow!

Be careful though, as the tree grows taller it becomes more and more unstable. One wrong move and the whole thing comes crashing down!

TIMBER!

—description from the designer

name: Agent Challenge
description:
Strategy card game of matching symbols to targets to complete challenges. Each player has a agent with a set of symbols and a special ability. Each agent ability allows the player to break the basic game rules in some way. Completing challenge cards allows you to upgrade your agent to improve their ability to match more symbols on future turns. Captured cards also count towards your final score.

—description from the designer
