name: Australis
description:
Stand your ground in the East Australian Current where you have to make your way as a sea turtle!

You have a chance of winning Australis only if you have a wide range of strategies. Choose the right dice cleverly to form growing schools of fish and settle corals on different coral reefs. At the end of each phase, you will compete with your dice in an exciting contest.

Which of you will be the best in this ecosystem of incredible diversity?

name: Chaos Ramen
description:
Each player becomes a chef, where they must demonstrate skill, dexterity, and speed to win.
Throughout all the rounds, all chefs will roll their Ingredient Dice trying to complete Order Cards in their preparation area. They can re-roll the dice as many times as necessary until completing an order. Once the dice are placed on the Order Card, they must quickly ring the Bell.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Push Your Luck, Speed Matching

name: Warzone: Imperial Bridgehead
description:
This box set contains:

An impressive full-color model, for you to construct from 16 A4 sheets of cards.
Two exclusive new Warzone miniatures - the Capitol Covert Operations Specialist and the Imperial Ordinance Officer.
A 32-page booklet with comprehensive new rules for fighting in-and-around buildings and structures, and for fighting underground.
New templates and counters.
A scenario set around the Imperial Bridgehead and exciting background text to bring the whole thing to life.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: QBlockz
description:
Players have to follow the stacking pattern and stack blocks on a rocking board trying to keep the balance. As the tower gets taller, each move becomes more challenging. Working together you build the tallest towers or use strategy to force your opponents into making a mistake.

There are different ways to play, competitive and collaborative creating varied experiences. The game rules ensure the stability of the blocks and encourage upward growth. The game offers different ways to play, collaborative and competitive styles. The different game styles unlock a completely new feel to the game.

Building from a clear board means spending less time setting up after a game ends to play again. The block's color dictates where you can place it. These move choices and options make the gameplay more interesting; picking a color is like rolling a die.

​Gameplay can be fast-paced or slow and strategic. You choose how you want to play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Pattern Building, Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing, Team-Based Game

name: The Old Steamer
description:
Players cooperatively roll the die and flip cards to try and assemble a full train attaching cars behind the steam locomotive - however there are derailment and breakdown obstacles that must be overcome.

A perfect score is 12, but all games end with some measure of success.

name: The Greyhound Races
description: The Greyhound Races is an Australian war years game. It is a table top race game where 4 metal greyhound dogs are pulled along by cord attached to a winder. The Greyhounds move by sliding along the table whilst being pulled. The first to the winning line is the winner.

name: Oh So Fluffy
description:
Oh So Fluffy is a game of fluff and fuss. It can be played by 2-5 players.

The objective of Oh So Fluffy is to build collections of table cards and while doing so also preventing the opponents from doing exactly the same thing by being mean, persuasive or just by pure luck.

A turn in Oh So Fluffy usually consists of three phases. Cards however, sometimes have the power to add both complete extra turns and other fluffy things to mess with this nice order. Usually all this is pretty straight forward and explained in a cute way on the cards themselves.

First player to achieve a collection with 5 table cards of the same kind wins.
Yes, it’s as easy as that!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Move Through Deck, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Orcwood Showdown
description:
On the streets of Orcwood two bitter rivals end their feud in the only way they know how, a fight to the death. This two-player, fast-paced, sword fighting game has you slash, dodge, parry and thrust your way to victory.

Both players play their move at the same time and suffer the consequences accordingly, if both players are still alive then continue to the next round. Strategy and cunning will see you to victory in this epic duel.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Number
mechanics: Action/Event, Chaining, Hand Management, Memory, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Close the Case: Der Fall Hildenberg
description: As a team of investigators, the players are contacted to solve a cold case, a possible murder, that is considered hopeless by the police.

name: Dream Guardians
description:
Dream Guardians is a 1-4 player cooperative non-traditional deckbuilder, played with a traditional deck of cards. Players play as Dream Guardians, virtues who act as guardians of joyful dreams in Dreamland. They have to venture through the dream in search of Nightmares. They have to defeat the Nightmares with positive vibes to keep Dreamland positive, bright and shiny. If they fail to do so, Nightmares will turn Dreamland into a dark, grimy Nightmareland.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Dead By Daylight: The Board Game – Malicious Expansion
description:
Enhance your Dead By Daylight: The Board Game experience with this expansion! Play as one of the new Survivors and utilize their unique perks to escape from a new cabal of terrifying Killers with horrifying abilities you've never seen before!

Play as 4 new resourceful Survivors with their own unique perks!
Play as 3 new Killers with horrifying powers that defy logic to hunt your prey!
Explore 2 new twisted realms within The Fog - Forsaken Boneyard and Withered Isle.
Bring the game to life with 10 hauntingly detailed miniature figurines!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Good Dog, Bad Zombie (Second Edition)
description:
In Good Dog, Bad Zombie, you bark, sniff, and lick your way through the apocalypse to save the humans you love. Zombies roam the city, but you and your dog friends have found refuge in Central Bark. You’ll have to cooperate as a pack of dogs to sniff out humans in hiding and bring them back to safety. But beware! The danger of the city could turn your pack feral before you get a chance to build your forever home.

The second edition version of the game features new art, upgraded components, and new playable dog characters!

GDBZ aims to provide players with an immersive dog's-eye-view of the zombie apocalypse. Track down the humans from their smells, lick one another for boosts of energy, and bark at anything and everything!

On their turns, each player may take two actions, which can consist of running to different locations, playing energy cards from their hands, sniffing scent tokens, and giving each other licks in order to draw more energy. Each energy card has an ability, such as: Run, Herd, Bark, Chew, and Good Dog, the last of which allows each dog to perform a unique and powerful ability. Some cards can be chained together for elaborate, tactical turns. At the end of each player's turn they will have to roll the dice in order to add another zombie to the board, which may eat unsuspecting humans or get into Central Bark.

If too many humans are eaten or too many zombies get into Central Bark, the Feral Tracker will reach 10 - and we become wild dogs, forgetting our love of humanity . However, if the players rescue enough humans(6 on easier difficulties, and 8 on expert modes), we all win the game!
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Fields of Armistice
description:
The pettiness and greed of warring woodland factions has decimated their once-thriving farmlands. Cold, hungry, and ranks depleted from the harsh winter, their leaders reluctantly agree to an armistice. Exchanging weapons for farming tools, each faction strives to make amends with their ancestors by cultivating the war-torn soil before the next frost.

Over three seasons, players compete to establish their faction's dominance by drafting tiles and tokens to plant, grow, and harvest during the day while sabotaging their opponents from the shadows of the night. Using their workers, resources, and the help of supporters, they must overcome catastrophes to reap the benefits of each unique season and restore glory to their faction.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Events, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Take That, Tile Placement, Trading

name: The French & Indian War
description:
The French & Indian War is a two-player wargame of the conflict between the British and French Empires for control of North America during the wider Seven Years War. There are two opposing players: British Empire (Britain or British) and French Empire (France or French). Each player represents the high command for their respective forces in North America. There is also the possibility for intervention by American Indian and Spanish Imperial forces. The game has several scenarios, representing different starting situations. The game system models the effects of command control on campaigns conducted across vast distances of largely frontier terrain, and as part of the larger Seven Years War.

Each game turn represents a campaign lasting one year. Each hex represents 85 kilometers (50 miles) across. Each regular unit represents one or two battalions or equivalent-sized groupings of companies/squadrons. Provincial and militia units represent regiments or brigades. Some of the light units represent detachments of one or more companies. Indian units represent groups between 500 to 2000 warriors. Commanders are key leaders, their staffs, and guard troops. Riverine units represent flotillas of boats.

name: Eagles of Rome: Caesar
description:
Eagles of Rome is a grand tactical two-player system for battles of the Roman Era, from the Republic through the Empire to the early Byzantine era. Caesar covers the battles of the Late Republic to the Early Empire (roughly 120 BC to AD 250). Players command armies of various types of forces, from Roman legions to barbarian hordes, with distinctions between melee and fire combat, plus special tactics. Morale is a critical factor. Caesar is played in scenarios. Each scenario represents a historical battle. The rules are in three sections. The first contains the Standard Rules common to all games in the series. The second is the Optional section, which gives rules that players can use at their option or not. The third is the Scenario section for specific battles.

Each hex on the map represents 100-200 meters across, depending on the battle. Each game turn represents 15 to 45 minutes, depending on the intensity of the action. Units represent three to five Roman cohorts, their equivalents, or amorphous groupings of irregulars (1,000 to 3,000 men, based on the era and efficiency of the army). Leaders represent single great commanders, war chiefs or the staff of a legion or other higher formation.

name: Abstratus Pop
description:
Build your Pop world with your hands and imagination!

In Abstratus Pop, players must represent their secret words through sculptures using colorful, transparent pieces and mirrors.
With special chips, players interact with each other, being able to limit, exchange, take or negotiate pieces.
Abstratus Pop invites you to dive into the POP universe in a totally innovative way, where your imagination, deduction and ingenuity will be put to the test.
Be the most Pop in the match
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pattern Building, Real-Time, Take That, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: 11 Days War: WWI East Front, 1918
description:
11 Days War is a two-player wargame, covering the final Central Powers offensive on the East Front, February to May 1918 (Operation Faustschlag), to include both the initial 11 days of offensive operations against the Bolsheviks and the ensuing pursuit in the Ukraine. The game pits the Central Powers (Germany, Austria-Hungary, their allies) against the Bolsheviks (or Reds, plus their allies). Additionally, there are third power forces called Greens which may come under the control of either player. There are three scenarios, representing different starting situations. The game system models warfare in the chaotic situation of the Eastern Front during the opening of the Russian Civil War. Further, the movement rules model the situation of operating in later Winter and Spring thaw, where railroads were vital.

Each game turn represents one to ten days of operations. Each hexagon (hex) on the map represents 60 kilometers (40 miles). Each unit represents anything from a brigade up to corps. Strategic markers represent specialized forces, such as airpower, and agitprop (agitation and propaganda).

name: Prey  vs Predator
description:
You're playing as a tribe leader to gain the strongest community of animals. Over the course of 10 rounds, you'll play animals into your community and use actions to get ahead by playing extra animals or taking them from other leaders. Each round will end by facing a Predator as a group. The strongest fighter claims the defeated Predator as their trophy. But if the Predator wins, the weakest fighter loses an animal to the Predator. Which tribe will come out on top as the greatest in the land?

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hidden Movement, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That

name: CENTCOM: Persian Gulf War 2001-2003
description:
CENTCOM is an operational one-player simulation of US-CENTCOM military operations in Afghanistan and Iraq during 2001 to 2003 and optionally 2005. The player controls the forces of the CENTCOM (US, NATO, Northern Alliance, and other Allies). The game system controls the opposing OPFOR forces (Al Qaeda, Taliban, and Iraqi). The objective of the game is for CENTCOM to destroy both the forces of Al Qaeda and Saddam Hussein thereby establishing the basis for a stable Persian Gulf.

The standard scenario covers the period of October 2001 (the initial US invasion of Afghanistan) to June 2003 (the anticipated conclusion of Operation Iraqi Freedom). The optional scenario extends the game to early 2005. The player mobilizes forces and conducts operations by expending Expeditionary Warfare Points (EP). When a rule calls for the OPFOR to take an action, you the player must execute that action.

OPFOR actions can be affected by the Persian Gulf Instability Index (PGII), which can shift throughout the game and generate events. CENTCOM can also be played by two or more players, controlling different parts of CENTCOM operations. This is explained in the Optional rules.

Each game turn represents from three weeks of intense combat to six months of logistical buildup and counterinsurgency operations. Each hex represents 43 miles (69.2 km). Units range in size from brigade groups, divisions, and corps.

name: Gates of Vienna 1683: Battles of the Age of Kings
description:
Gates of Vienna 1683: Battles of the Age of Kings system is a grand tactical two-player system for battles of the latter half of the 17th century to early 18th century. It is based on the 30 Years War Battles system with revisions to account for tactical developments of post 1648. Revisions include artillery mobility and an increase in tactical flexibility. The rules for Gates of Vienna are in three sections. The first contains the Standard Rules common to all games in the series. The second is the Optional section, which gives rules that players can use at their option or not. The third is the Exclusive Rules for each battle to include deployment, reinforcements, victory conditions, and special rules.
The game rules represent a combination of playability and realism and model the overall effects of the weapons and tactics of the great era of pike and shot, and include combat, leadership, and morale. Players command armies of infantry, cavalry, and artillery, each with their own special capabilities, as well as the great leaders who took the field in this era.

Each hex on the map represents circa 500 meters. Each game turn represents 45 minutes to 90 minutes, depending on the intensity of the action. Most cavalry and infantry units represent one or two regiments or battalions. Each combat strength point represents 100 to 300 men, depending on the quality of the army and assignment of light guns to the unit. Each artillery unit represents four to twelve heavy or medium guns.

name: Words for Nerds
description:
At the start of each round, 2 unique vowel cards and 6 unique consonant cards are laid out, then revealed simultaneously. Everyone has 30 seconds to write as many words as they can that use the revealed letters; using a letter more than once is allowed. When time is up, players check and score their words, 1 point per letter; the player with the highest total gets one game point.

Then the player with the Bonus Round card (which rotates each round), points to a letter card, thinks of a word starting with that letter, and writes it down. The rest of the players quickly take turns guessing the letter, with the one who guesses it getting one game point. If after 3 times around no one guesses, the player gives a clue and guessing continues.

The first player to 10 game points wins.

There is also a deck of Spice Up cards, and one is revealed each round, affecting how that round is played, e.g. more or less time, additional letter cards, double points for words that include certain letters, handicaps for certain players, team play, etc.

Words for Nerds contains:
- 75 consonant cards
- 20 vowel cards
- 3 wild cards (shuffled into the consonant deck)
- 25 Spice Up cards
- 1 Bonus Round card
- 6 pencils
- 1 pad of paper for writing words on
- An electronic timer

name: Dungeon Dice Online
description:
Dungeon Dice Online is a board game for 1 to 4 players with the theme of attacking dungeon in an online RPG game.
Dungeon Exploration × Deck Building × Dice × Battle with Monsters

—description from the publisher
publishers: あんきろわーくす (Ankilo Works)

name: Sounds of Fun: Barney Electronic Talking Board Game
description:
Actual character voices and realistic sound effects bring Barney and Baby Bop to life!

The wonder of sound - in a board game!

Listen to Barney and Baby Bop, then use your imagination to pretend you're a frog, or "moo" like a cow. You'll identify colors and numbers, and play other fun games. Lots of basic learning skills - wrapped up in an interactive, fun game... it's Super-dee-duper!
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Last Week Of Summer
description:
It’s the summer of 1986, you just graduated high school and you have one more week of summer before it’s time to head off to the real world.

Last Week Of Summer combines turn programming and worker placement with a variety of mini games. Each game, players set up their town using 5 of 8 locations: Pick up a movie at the Video Store, get high scores at the Arcade, skate at the Roller Rink, grab some Fast Food, hang at the Quick Mart, get the coolest (but not too cool) albums at the Music Store, get the latest fashions at the Mall, or just kill time at the Comic Book Store. Each of these locations links 80's theme to a classic mechanism - set collection, tile placement, market manipulation, racing, mancala, push your luck, dice rolling, and more.

Players plan their day and then simultaneously move from place to place as they compete to make friends with the coolest kids in town, get invited to the best parties, and complete location specific goals. As you complete goals you make memories by placing cassettes on locations (these represent the songs that bring you back to those summer days). Whoever has the most cassettes after 7 days is the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Mancala, Push Your Luck, Race, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: The Starspeaker
description:
In this in-hand solitaire mystical space voyage, commune with the stars as you search for a new home for humanity. Choose a star to guide your way, then heed or reject the compelling voices of other stars on your journey.

The star card you choose has a goal you must fulfill to find a home for your people. As you travel through the deck, choose between three star cards at a time, each with a number that represents a competing value. Each star card belongs to one of three suits, or sectors, and has two sides that represent heeding or rejecting that star's call. Cards may also have omens that allow you to take paths that you would otherwise miss.

Each choice you make is added to the course you chart through the heavens, a fan at the back of the deck, which will guide the remnant of humanity for millennia to come. Each card you do not choose spins to its opposite side, limiting your choices for the next turn. When all star cards have been chosen, flip the course and sort the cards by sector to score and see if you have fulfilled the goal of your guiding star.

Lead the way, Starspeaker. The future is in your hands.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Puzzle, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Relative Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Word Games
description:
The Word Games set has cardboard letter tiles in 4 colors -- red, blue, green, and yellow, with close to 100 tiles in each color. The bottom of the box has brief rules for several games.

The main game is "Word Making, Word Taking", which has also been known as Anagrams. Central tiles are revealed one at a time, and any player may call out a word that can be spelled from the exposed tiles, and place that word in front of them. They can also call out words that can be made from one or more revealed tiles combined with other players' words, possibly rearranged. The first player to have 10 words wins.

That game mixes all the tiles together, the number of sets used depending on the number of players. The other games have each player use just their own set (color) of tiles.

- Words Galore: Form as many words from your set as you can in a given time.

- Sentences: Make a sentence using as many letters as possible from your set.

- Crosswords: Make a crossword using as many letters from your set as you can.

- Word Lines: Players take turns calling out a letter, and everyone takes that letter and places it in one of 6 lines of their letters, trying to spell words in each one.

name: Hexopolis
description:
Hexopolis is a 2-player abstract competitive strategy game. Both players control a chip and place a collection of paths, walls, and cells to create an expanding, evolving board. Their objective is to destroy their opponent, which can be accomplished either by jumping on them from higher ground or surrounding them directly with 4 or more walls.

The core mechanic of Hexopolis is "overriding", in which players can place one connector (a path or a wall) over another to redefine the logic of the board.

—description from the designer

name: Das Schwarze Auge: Aventurische Würfelspiele
description:
Be it in taverns, parlours or field camps – many different dice games are played on the fantastic continent of Aventuria, in the world of »The Dark Eye«. With the rules, cardboard coins and dice contained in »Aventurische Würfelspiele«, these games can now be played in the real world.

All those little games of luck (and some finesse) are meant to function like quick card games do—as a way to win some copper coins when Phex, the god of luck, smiles at you.

Aventurien, ein Kontinent der Geheimnisse, der Abenteuer ... und der Würfelspiele!
Im Laufe der letzten Jahrzehnte wurden eine Vielzahl unterschiedlichster Würfelspiele aus der Welt
von Das Schwarze Auge beschrieben.
Jetzt gibt es endlich eine Komplettsammlung dieser Spiele, direkt spielfertig mit passenden In-Game-Würfeln und Spielmarken (Pappmünzen)!
Egal ob als Gimmick für den Rollenspielabend in der Taverne, zur ambientetauglichen Unterhaltung auf dem nächsten LARP oder einfach beim lustigen Beisammensitzen im Freundeskreis - mit der Aventurischen Würfelspielsammlung wird es garantiert nicht langweilig!

name: Knüppel aus dem Sack
description:
Both dice are rolled at the same time. The players move clockwise around the turntable according to the number rolled. A pawn is drawn according to the number on one die and another pawn is drawn according to the number on the other die, or the player adds the two numbers rolled and draws according to this sum with only one pawn.

If a space is already occupied by a cone, it is thrown out and must start again. If a double is rolled, that player must move the turntable clockwise or counterclockwise by as many spaces as a die shows. This can cause pawns to be knocked over and they have to start again. After a double the player rolls the dice again. The pawns are also allowed to take a detour through the hostel depending on the numbers thrown, if there is a free space there.

The winner is the player whose 3 pawns are the first to be in the target space of the same color.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Magic Fox Hunt
description:
While searching for spell components, an evil Witch has captured you and your fellow Wizards and turned you into foxes! You managed to escape while the Witch was deliberating what to do with you, but she can't be far behind! Welcome to the Magic Fox Hunt. In this one-vs-all game, one player will be selected to play as the Witch, and the rest of the players will play as multiple Wizards (turned into Foxes) hiding behind cover, moving through the valley attempting to escape the Witch.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Fantasy, Memory
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Pieces as Map

name: Cartaventura: Résistance
description:
ENG NAME : D-Day

Cartaventura is a pocket-sized collection of historical adventures in the style of a "book in which you are the hero". With the help of cards offering different options, travel, explore and make the right encounters to provide the best possible ending for the hero you play. Each scenario takes place in a different time and place in history.

Scenario D-Day: July 1943, Normandy, France. At the age of 17, you're hoping to enjoy the sweetness of summer despite the terrible hardships of occupied France... However, faced with so much horror and injustice, you feel a growing rage within you. You must act, but how?

Cartaventura est une collection d’aventures historiques au format poche, façon « livre dont vous êtes le héros ». À l’aide de cartes qui proposent différentes options, voyagez, explorez et faites les bonnes rencontres afin d’offrir la meilleure fin possible au héros que vous incarnez. Chaque scénario se déroule dans un lieu et une époque différents de l’Histoire.

Scénario Résistance : Juillet 1943, Normandie, France. À 17 ans, vous espérez pouvoir profiter un peu des douceurs de l'été malgré les terribles épreuves d'une France occupée... Cependant, devant tant d'horreurs et d'injustice, vous sentez une rage grandissante en vous. Vous devez agir, mais comment ?
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, World War II
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Litter Tray
description:
A fast-paced push-your-luck game about cats and poo. Choose when to bank your poo and when to take the risk - lose poo if cats poo in an already dirty litter tray. Draw cards or play from your hand, rolling 1 or 2 dice each time - the dice show which coloured litter tray to play poo in in what combination. Decide when to risk another card and when to bank what you have so far. First player to pass 10 triggers scoring and, after everyone has an equal number of turns, the winner is the person with the most poo banked on their player card.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck

name: Monster Hunter Quest
description:
Monster Hunter Quest is a casual medieval fantasy solo card game. The main strategy involves managing your Reputation Points and choosing when to spend Actions to match Adventure Card requirements.

There are 6 different Quests with 3 Episodes each. Each Episode has different goals. The Player wins the game by achieving the goals for all 3 Episodes within a predetermined number of days.

There are 2 Heroes to choose from, the Hunter and the Huntress. They are the same except for the art work. Only one Hero is used to play the game.

Use Actions to match either a Success or Avoid Adventure scenario. Progress your Hero from Level 1 to 3. Earn Reputation and find Treasure as you strive to complete your goals. Experience a wide variety of scenarios using Modifiers. Meet helpful Allies along the way. Suffer loss of Reputation from Gossip and loss of Treasure from Theft. Battle Orcs, Trolls, Giants, Dragons and other Monsters as you travel across your kingdom, purging the land of dangers.

NOTE: this game is not associated in any way to the Monster Hunter franchise.
NOTE: This indie self-published game uses AI generated art.

—description from the designer

name: Verhexte Quadrate
description: You have 9 sqares with 9 numbers on the front and 9 numbers on the back. Players place the squares down following the rules of Sudoku. There are squares in 4 colours. This allows 4 players to play simultaneously. The player to solve their Sudoku board first wins.

name: Dungeons of Everternal
description:
Dungeons of Everternal transports players to the mystical world of Everternal, a realm filled with ancient secrets and mystical challenges. Here, the ruins of once-glorious civilizations hold the keys to untold powers and hidden treasures, making every dungeon a unique puzzle waiting to be solved.

In this print-and-play roll and write game, players adopt the roles of various heroes, each equipped with distinctive abilities and items. The gameplay merges classic dungeon crawling with innovative Tetris-style puzzle mechanics. Players navigate through meticulously designed dungeons by strategically placing tiles on their maps, which affects their progression and interactions within the game. The goal is to explore dungeons, defeat monsters, avoid traps, and collect valuable items and artifacts.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Movement, Resource to Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #65
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #65 was published in October of 2023.

Features

Harpoon Scenario: Escape from Aden

Fear God & Dread Nought Scenario: Patmos

Naming Chinese missiles, Part 2

The Guns of SMS Emden

Command at Sea Scenario: Vorschlaghammer

Localizing a Submarine Contact with Sonobuoys

The Iranian Navy & Revolutionary Guard

Weapons & Sensors in Iranian Service

K-3 is a Museum

The Hwasal Missile

The Northern Fleet Incident

Rule Changes and Corrections

Harpoon Q&A: Air ASW

Book Reviews

Mao’s Army Goes to Sea, by Toshi Yoshihara

Black Shoe Carrier Admiral - Frank Jack Fletcher at Coral Sea,

Guadalcanal, and Midway, by John Lundstrom

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Quest Snakes
description:
In Quest Snakes, you take on the role of a guild leader tasked to recruit heroic snakes into your ranks.

In the first phase of the game, players will take turns hiring pairs of Snakes.

Once you have a guild of 10 snakes, you enter the second phase.

In the second phase, quests are posted one at a time, offering loot to the strongest guild. Guild leaders will assemble a party of Snakes in secrecy. Once parties are assembled, guilds reveal their snakes. Snakes have power values assigned to them, and the party with the most power wins.

But be aware, some classes of Snakes are better equipped for certain quests. And snakes need to rest after the questing - the stronger the Snake, the more turns they rest.
The guild with the most loot after a set number of Quests wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Role Playing

name: Successor: The Crown is Mine
description:
Successor: The Crown is Mine is a multi-player game that pits 8 royal siblings against each other to see who is worthy of the Crown. Create your strategies, form alliances, expect betrayal, prepare to either retreat or advance.
Play as one of 8 Royal heirs trying to earn the people's favor, either by collecting Peasants and Nobles into your court or stealing them from your siblings. Look out for multipliers, special events, or even your own allies, because in this game, alliances are made and broken as soon as the next card is drawn.
Special events can turn the course of the game, granting one player a ton of points randomly or giving another player access to abilities unique to their Royal heir. But watch out, cause every card drawn brings the game closer to it's unexpected end.
Think you have what it takes to rule them all? Find out in Successor, The Crown is Mine.

name: Meta Worlds
description:
Meta Worlds is a bluffing game from Japan, combined with silly improvs, players take turns to draw a card from the deck, which also includes the Grimoire cards secretly created by the players.

On your turn, draw a card, read its effect without revealing it to other players, and then read out the card effect, or improvise a fake effect and read it out. Other players may challenge and say “I doubt it” in which case the cards must be revealed. There is an advantage and penalty for the winner and loser of the challenge, respectively.

The game's box art cover mimics the style of Nintendo Wii box art cover, and the creator has received Nintendo's approval for it.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Voting

name: Sneaker Heads
description:
Sneaker Heads is a game where players compete for popular brand sneakers at auction, sometimes reselling them, and competing for final points (satisfaction).

​This game consists of a purchase phase and a sales phase, and the key to success is maneuvering at the auction and anticipating resale. Find out which sneakers everyone wants, move around skillfully, and bid on the sneakers you want.

name: karasuuri
description:
"Priestess of Yin and Yang, let the ritual begin."

In karasuuri, visitors travel to a village to perform a ritual and pray for peace in the world. But some of the visitors are there to accomplish something very much the opposite. Two teams, sometimes deceiving and sometimes cooperating, struggle to achieve final victory for their side. The fate of the world depends on this ritual...

In this hidden identity board game, players secretly divide into two teams with the possibility of one player acting as the Mediator. The Yin team tries to use the ritual to plunge the world into darkness. The Yang team seeks to fulfill the true purpose of the ritual. Players play Prayer Cards against each other, trying to tip the balance in favor of Yin or Yang to win. Meanwhile, the Mediator exerts their own influence over the game, winning only if they can keep the score tied between the Yin and Yang teams.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: DayLily
description:
"Dance in God's tiny garden"

DayLily is a battle game where girls from various factions — Human, Necromancer, Elf, CaitSith, Dragon, and Dwarf — compete for territory using magical soldiers and their special skills.

Make full use of your character's unique abilities to compete for the magic crystals sleeping in the God's Garden. When a territory is chosen by the roll of a die, players play larger and larger Magical Soldier Cards from their hands. Don't worry if you can't play; if you didn't use any cards or special powers in this territory, you can draw more cards for the next battle. The winner of the territory takes the magic crystals hidden beneath it, and the one who holds the most magic crystals at the end of the game will be the winner.

The territories where you compete and the outcome of the game depend on a moody God. Let's collect as many magic crystals as we can before God get tired of us!

—translated and adapted from the publisher's description

name: Merchants of the Dark Road: Secret Villages
description:
As in years past, there is money and fame to be earned from buying and selling goods along the Dark Road. This winter, however, Highreach is alive with secrets and rumors... the clever merchant who takes notice can trade in something as valuable as any goods—information. Hidden paths to three secret villages have been discovered. In each village lies opportunity for intrepid merchants willing to engage the rangers, delvers, and pilgrims who choose to live in these small settlements off the beaten path. And everyone is talking about the latest news out of Farglen—it seems the Baroness of the Bards is missing! While on business in Highreach, merchants should keep their ears open for hints of what befell her, as these rumors are of great interest at the Ringway Inn.

This game introduces 2 new modules for enhanced gameplay in the Merchants of the Dark Road game. The first module, Secret Villages, adds 3 new travel locations to the road, expanding the rewards available and increases the opportunities players have to follow one another’s travel actions. Along with rules for wagon upgrades, this module adds a light sense of engine-building to the game.

The second module, Ringway Rumors, adds rumor tokens to the game board, as everyone wonders what happened to the Baroness of the Bards. These tokens help make certain district actions (Queen’s Commissions, Ruins of Yin, Dark Market) more dynamic and rewarding. They also provide players another opportunity to maximize their sales and strategize when they sell to heroes at the Ringway Inn.

Modules can be easily integrated into the base game and are designed to be played either individually or together. The expansion also adds solo rules for using the module(s) and a new solo/adventure mini-campaign for players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Follow, Pick-up and Deliver, Rondel, Set Collection, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: A game about sequencing screenshots of an old animation with 50 bits of writing by 50 writers.
description:
Try to place screenshots from Plane Crazy (1928) in the correct sequence.

Place 4 screenshots correctly to win!

Each card is double-sided; one side has a screenshot and a caption, whilst the other side will also show the timestamp of when the screenshot occurs in the animation.

The side with the timestamp also features a bit of writing, to hopefully spark thoughts and conversation about the nature of IP protection for art, animations, music, and game rules.

—description from the publisher

name: Ninjas Unleashed: Deluxe
description:
With this expansion, Prepare to be immersed in the rich tapestry of feudal Japan in Ninjas Unleashed, where the enigmatic power of celestial stones beckons. As a formidable Shogun, guide your courageous apprentices on treacherous missions, their success entwined with the fateful touch of these mystical artifacts. Witness the transformation of ordinary ninjas into awe-inspiring Elite Ninjas, wielding unparalleled abilities that shape the very fabric of destiny. Navigate the intricate dance of shadows, deceit, and strategic brilliance, as you fiercely compete for dominion and ascend to the pinnacle of greatness. Will you harness the true might of the Celestial Stones and emerge as the legendary ruler destined to mold the course of Japan's history? Brace yourself for an unparalleled gaming experience, where every move and decision holds profound consequences. Forge alliances, outwit rivals, and embrace the challenge that lies before you. Unleash your inner ninja, seize the reins of power, and etch your name into the annals of feudal legend. The path to triumph beckons—embrace your destiny and let the Ninjas Unleashed saga unfold.

The Deluxe version of the game contains additional cards and a rollable game board mat.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Sudden Death Ending, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Ninjas Unleashed: Twin Shadows and Rise to Greatness
description: Introducing the Solo Mode and Co-Op Mode Edition, this is an Expansion Deck of Ninjas Unleashed.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Paradigm Shift
description:
A board game inspired by the seminal work of philosopher of science Thomas Kuhn called The Structure of Scientific Revolutions.
Players come up with hypotheses by curating their hand of exemplar cards and run experiments to validate these hypotheses by drafting and rolling phenomena dice. If the experiment results support their hypotheses, player can get more influence on the paradigm board which represents swaying scientific community members to their framework for explaining natural phenomena. Watch out for paradigm-breaking anomalies in the results though, as they can easily lead to a paradigm shift! The game is played in a historical setting, during a transition period between two competing scientific paradigms, and ends once the paradigm shift is complete and one of the two paradigms is debunked by accumulating too many anomalies. Players who have influence on the paradigm board for the winning paradigm are victorious, with the player contributing the most support for the final paradigm crowned leader among the winners.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Murder on the Luxury Yacht
description: A wealthy man is found murdered on his luxury yacht after a party. Players must examine all the evidence and look for clues in newspapers, witness statements, autopsy reports, phone records, maps, photos, surveillance videos, websites and more. Players must find suspicious details in the evidence and reveal the killer.

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Never Tell Me The Odds Mission Pack
description:
Players can embark on a new Star Wars: Shatterpoint mission with this mission pack! Featuring a new Mission card and 9 Struggle cards, Never Tell Me the Odds Mission Pack adds more variety to games of Shatterpoint with new objective layouts and new mission special rules.

—description from the designer

name: Retratos en Juego
description:
Develop the imagination using various techniques of surrealism, developed at the beginning of the 20th century.

Retratos en Juego offers 5 gameplay modes:

Automatic Sequence

Deal five cards to each player and leave one face up in the center of the table. Participants must find a link between the letter on display and the portraits they received. Whoever discovers it first will place their card on the table and say it out loud. If the connection is accepted by the group, the game continues and the new search will have to occur with the last supported character. The first person to run out of cards will win. The sequence can be given by aspects linked to the characters (profession, nationality, affiliations) or by the elements that are part of the construction of each portrait. Associations linked to gender do not add up in this type of game.

Surreal Interview

The player on duty takes out a portrait and places it on the table for everyone to see. He must think of a question for said character and write it on a piece of paper, without the rest seeing it. Then he will fold the paper covering the writing and pass it, along with the letter, to the player on the right. Whoever receives the portrait will write the answer, as if they were completely certain about the question, taking the voice of the “interviewed” character. Then they will fold the paper again and pass it to the next player, who must now write a new question, always inspired by that portrait. The game will continue alternating the writing of questions and answers, as many rounds as the group wishes. At the end, whoever asked the first question will unfold the sheet and read the text created with everyone's contribution.

Poetic Metaphors

Place a portrait in view of the entire group. Each player must write a short poetic text or metaphor. They will be able to choose an element present in the portrait and cross it with an adjective or describe the character (without naming it) using what the construction of that portrait generates for them. For example, regarding Fontanarrosa, we could say: “His arguments were very sharp.” Everyone will write their metaphor on a piece of paper, fold the sheet so that the rest cannot see it, and leave it on the table. One of the participants will read the poetic texts aloud. Then, each player will vote for the one they consider most creative or original, taking into account that they will not be able to choose their own text. They will add one point for each vote obtained. In this game creativity wins!

Who am I?

A card is distributed to each participant. Without looking at it, they will place it on her forehead, leaving it visible to the rest of the group. Taking turns, each person will try to guess which portrait they got by asking questions about certain traits or qualities that she might have. The rest of the group will only be able to answer “yes” or “no” to the questions asked. If the answer is yes, you can continue asking until you receive a negative. In this case, it will be the turn of the player on the right to ask. The dynamic will be repeated until someone guesses the character.

Allegation

Based on a portrait obtained at random, one participant challenges another to substantiate or explain the presence of any of the elements with which the portrait is constructed. For example, someone proposes Edgar Allan Poe's “black cat” and both players have to explain what it means, arguing why it is there. The rest of the team will choose the argument that seemed most convincing to them. Players who spoke will receive one point for each vote obtained.

name: Combo Fighter: Plotmaker Edition – Pack 4
description:
Combo Fighter is a card-driven tribute to the classic arcade fighting games.

Take on the roles of iconic fighters and string together cards to unleash powerful combos.

But be careful. Your deck is also your life bar. Every move you make and every hit you take drains your energy.

To become a true Combo Fighter champion you must make every hit count.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Pasaje Alelí
description:
Create and tell stories from the myriorama (panoramic scene) format with the cards obtained. It may be oral or written, individually, in groups or collaboratively.

Pasaje Alelí offers 7 gameplay modes:

Alelí Passage

Take cards from the deck and arrange them as desired to put together the construction and a story. To accompany the inspiration, there are some questions as an example: who appears in the scene? What is he doing? What is his name? Where does it come from? What will he do next? What sounds are heard? What do you like to do? Who are your friends? How would she meet another character? What would they do together? and many more.

Any day

Take five cards at random and place them face up on the table. Arrange them in the order you choose and tell the story of that day of the characters that appear there.

Neighbors

Take three cards and name the characters that appear. Introduce the neighbors who are there and tell a story where these characters meet.

The sounds of the neighborhood

In turns, each participant takes five cards and puts them face up on the table. Then he has to make a sound that he thinks is “heard” in one of the cards. The other participants have to point out which one. Whoever guesses first keeps the card and the rest are set aside. When the deck is finished, whoever has the most cards will be the winner.

In this room there is… (memory game)

Place the deck face down in the center. The first participant takes a card, says In this room there is... completes the sentence with an element that he sees on the card and leaves it face up on the table. The next player takes another card, says In this room there is, repeating what the first participant said and adds an element that he finds on the new card. He leaves her arranged next to the first one (above, below or to the side) creating a scene. So on, until a player forgets or confuses an element. If you want to make the game more challenging, each participant shows his card with the element but then keeps it face down in another pile.

The tallest building in the world

Shuffle the deck, deal three cards to each player and place the rest in the center of the table. In turns, each participant begins to assemble their building, starting on the sidewalk. If he didn't get a floor card, he takes another one from the deck and the next player continues until they can start. Once the first path is in place, you can continue up through the rooms. Lastly, those with a roof are placed. If on your turn you get another floor again, you will place it next to the previous one, and you must continue adding cards to your construction. Play continues until one player has completed a building or the deck runs out of cards. Whoever has the tallest building wins. Then each participant can tell the story of their construction.

And what happened before and what happened after

Take a card, look at it and tell a story that brought the characters to that scene and describe what could have happened next.

name: Me Gusta Jugar
description:
Anthony Browne, the renowned British author, invites us to imagine, create and tell stories. Put together short stories about the protagonist's tastes, readings or interests based on what the illustrations suggest.

The game book is made up of 50 cards: 45 illustrations and 5 game forms. The deck reflects different scenes that feature a monkey who enjoys playing and having fun.

name: Golaço
description:
Golaço ("Great Goal" in Portuguese) is a fast paced game with simple rules for two to nine players.

The game plays in nine rounds.
Each round, place one field card and two team cards on the table.
Then, roll the five custom dice.

Each die has a visual information that may match with the teams. It may be a color of the uniform, the model of the jersey, the shape of the team´s shield, etc. Each match scores a goal. And there is also a die with types of "Golaço" like "a bicycle", "little fish" (a diving header), "olympic" (a goal from a corner kick).

Everyone looks at the dice and try to solve the final score of that play. Whoever says corectly the total result of the play and the type of Golaço gets one game point.

After nine rounds, the player with more points wins the game.

—description from the designer

Golaço é um jogo com regras simples, veloz e muito divertido.
Todos ao mesmo tempo tentam descobrir o placar e o golaço da rodada.
Mas fique atento pois pode dar zebra!

Como é o jogo?
A cada rodada, um jogador escolhe a carta de campo com características específicas e compra duas cartas de times de várzea.
Um time é o da casa, o outro é o visitante.

Role os cinco dados:
Um dado mostra uma cor do uniforme; um dado mostra um formato do escudo; um dado mostra um modelo do uniforme; um dado mostra o time da casa ou o visitante ou o apito ou a zebra; e um dado mostra como foi o golaço da partida, de bicicleta, olímpico, de letra, de peixinho, de placa ou de mão! Cada correspondência dos dados com as cartas na mesa, junto com as características do campo, marca um gol para o time correspondente.
Todos tentam descobrir o placar simultaneamente. Quem souber primeiro cobre a carta de campo e fala o placar com o golaço em voz alta. Se acertar, ganha o ponto e a rodada termina. Se errar, está suspenso na rodada e os dados são rolados novamente.

Após nove rodadas, quem tiver acertado mais placares vence a partida.

—description from the designer (Portuguese)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Speed Matching

name: The Game of Floods
description:
PLAN - COOPERATE - ADAPT TO RISING TIDES

Sea level rise threatens homes, businesses, and infrastructure. If no action is taken, low-lying areas will face storm flooding and, eventually be permanently inundated.

The challenge is how to apply the variety of solutions to our landscape. Cooperate to protect homes, businesses, and most importantly, the health of the Island's five communities over three phases of sea level rise expected in the next 100 years.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Income, Modular Board, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Chasseur de tête
description:
Dive into the crazy world of Chasseur de tête! This cooperative game takes you on a journey where laughter, discomfort and deduction are king. Gather your friends, combine your wits and try to discover 10 professions by playing cards of characters according to your feelings. Whether you're a novice or a pro at deduction, Chasseur de tête promises memorable moments and laughter at every turn.

Cooperatively introduce a player to a job using Character cards. This player will try to guess the job based on your clues and his or her impressions. Guess the jobs on 7 Jobs cards without losing your lives to win the game!

—description from the designer

name: 7th Sea: City of Five Sails – Tooth and Claw
description:
All out war has broken out in the City of Five Sails! The scheming Don Constanzo and his fate witches have successfully pitted each and every faction against the other. Now, each desperate leader must fight tooth and claw to keep control of their district.

This 112 card expansion for 7th Sea: City of Five Sails introduces new characters, schemes, and other cards themed around conquest, crime, and combat. Join us for our second competitive season, and help shape the City of Five Sails ultimate fate!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Pirates
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Candy Toss
description:
Let's all make a candy bouquet!

This is an action party game where you throw candies at each other and try to get more candies of your color in the candy bouquet.

Each player has a designated candy color. Players simultaneously reveal their chosen candy card, and players who match (resulting in "butting") try to throw their card onto the lace doily. Candy cards are worth various points, and the player with the most points of their candy color wins. But be careful, because cards that miss or overflow from the candy bouquet disappear!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Factoria: Forbidden Walkers
description:
Experience the aftermath of Factoria, where the game ended at 100G!

The Factoria: Forbidden Walkers expansion lets you enjoy the devastating expansion of an enlarged reproduction system with new complexity. Included are:


Special abilities for owners of Legendary Gear, which increases the competition for Legendary Gear and providing a catch-up mechanic
Addition of LV7 and LV8 relics
Addition of overpowered, forbidden technical books


These additions created a dangerous balance that could go out of control at the slightest mistake mistake. The expansion is not recommended for first-time players, but once you experience it, it's so appealing that you won't be able to go back to regular play... This is a dangerous expansion set that everyone who considers themselves a gamer should try!

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Modular Board, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: SUNNY BIRD, よぐゲーム (Yog Games)

name: Mishy Match
description: Deal all the cards face down. Cards have quadrants colored red, yellow, gray, and blue, respectively. Each quadrant will depict a rose, berry, whale, or sun. The middle of a card contains one of the color words that may or may not be written in the color that the word spells. Take turns revealing cards two at a time. When the color of the word on the first card (not the color spelled by the word) combines with the picture in the quadrant whose color corresponds to the color spelled by the word to create the phrase, "gray whale" or "red rose or "blue berry" or "yellow sun," slap the table. The slowest player takes the cards from both piles into his hand. Play until someone with no remaining cards is the first to slap the table and thus win.

name: Bushidan: The Samurai Journey
description:
Japan. Dawn of the Edo Era.
In the heart of the Land of the Rising Sun, young warriors are preparing to leave their master's Koryū, to embark on an initiatory journey across the country... to discover whether they possess the qualities required to become a true Samurai.
To do so, they will cross the territories of the 9 Bushidan, fearsome warrior clans, among whom they will have to find a Lord to pledge allegiance to, or risk remaining a rōnin, a renegade.

Competitive game in which players must achieve victory conditions through a strategic combination of cards collection and game actions, based on a mechanic of secret bids.

Goal: Be the first to fulfill 11 victory conditions in less than 12 rounds of play to be the first Samurai.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection

name: Nebula Drifters: The Lost Voyage
description:
Nebula Drifters: The Lost Voyage is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players, set on a vast, uncharted alien planet. Players assume the roles of survivors, marooned by a ruthless corporation that abandoned its colonization plans after failing to see quick progress. As one of the forgotten, you must rally your fellow survivors. Work together to gather resources, overcome obstacles, and tackle deep dungeons, deepening your bonds and enhancing your survival skills.

Each game session unfolds through a quest that challenges players to explore mysterious landscapes, discover ancient technologies, and adapt to the ever-changing environment. Choose your path wisely, as each decision impacts the group's overall success. With every day passing, survivors grow stronger and more adept, slowly transforming from castaways to pioneers of a new world. Whether playing solo or with friends, "Nebula Drifters: The Lost Voyage" offers an immersive experience of survival, cooperation, and adventure.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Push Your Luck, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: Mud Run
description: Mud Run is a card game where players try to complete obstacles in a race to the finish line. Each turn, players get to take two actions to try to get ahead in the race. Players may draw an action card, play any number of action cards from their hand to complete an obstacle or the front player may reveal an obstacle card to extend the course. The game comes with more obstacles than you use each game, so every game is different.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Map Addition

name: アマタノ儀式 (Numerous Rituals)
description:
There was more than warm hospitality extended to us as visitors to an unexplored land. As we speak to the master, the people around us stop and stare, showing expressions of interest, curiosity, suspicion, and disgust. But there's nothing to worry about. In my hands is a book left behind by a great linguist. Come on, let's learn all about the Numerous Rituals!

アマタノ儀式 (Amatano Gisiki / Numerous Rituals) is a communication game in which players perform rituals using the languages ​​of various cultures. In Interpretation (the cooperative game), players work together to perform as many rituals as they can in 10 minutes. The master speaks the language of another culture, the interpreter translates it, and the other players have to guess the ritual without looking at the language record. In the Study Session (competitive game), students compete to be the best at understanding different cultural languages. Players take turns as the master and exchange questions with each other. This mode tests both your ability to speak and listen to different cultural languages.

Both modes of play use only one language per game. Each language has various characteristics and ranges from easy to difficult to understand. There are 26 different languages ​​included in the Intercultural Languages ​​book. There is also a tutorial and a practice language sheet. As soon as you open the box, you can play and learn the game!
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Questions and Answers

name: Prickly Path
description: Players take turns moving their playing piece according to a die roll in zig-zag fashion across a large hexagonal grid consisting of 70 hexagonal spaces. Each player chooses whether to place one of his three types of cactus tokens onto the space that he lands on or to give his opponents a chance to place a token there. Play continues until all the spaces are filled. At that point, the players score for each group --- that is, all adjacent tokens are of the same cactus type --- that they have created. The larger the group, the greater the score for that group. The person with the most points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: Schmeckers
description: Each player places three one-story stacks, two 2-story stacks, and one 3-story stack of checkers (schmeckers) onto the board. Take turns moving in a direction indicated by the arrows in the starting square a distance of up to as many squares as the height of the stack. Capture opponents' pieces by bumping or jumping. The last player with schmeckers remaining on the board is the winner.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Senjutsu: Battle For Japan – Daimyo's Castle
description:
Daimyo's Castle is a quad-fold XL board

An extra large quad-fold board for playing higher player-count games of Senjutsu.

Features:

A stone courtyard area.
Castle walls and broken Castle Walls area.
The Castle gate area.


Fight on variable height surfaces and be careful not to fall to your doom!

name: Three Dice Blind
description: Start with a 5X5 grid with spaces numbered from 1 through 25. Roll three dice and use standard mathematical operations on the three numbers to arrive at one of the numbers in the grid. Cover that number with a marker. The first player to get five markers in a row horizontally, vertically, or diagonally is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Uno Flip! Transformers
description:
UNO Flip! card game adds an exciting twist to the classic game that includes Autobots and Decepticons from Transformers! Play a Flip card and the deck FLIPS from the Autobots' side to the Decepticons' side, which has penalties that are extra tough. Battle to get rid of cards with the Might of Optimus Prime Rule OR fight to see who must draw cards with the Tyranny of Megatron Rule! Only another Flip card can change things back. Makes a great gift for players 7 years and older, especially Transformers fans.

—description from the publisher

name: One Page Monster Hunt
description:
One page monster hunt is print and play, roll and write exploration, and puzzle game. For ages 8 and up, 30 minutes long.

Game objective: The players are exploring the map, gaining experience, collecting treasures, and trying to find altars where the enemy could be located and defeated.

Game components: One page game sheet per player, two d6 dice, and pencil.

Game modes: Solo with one hero, solo with band of heroes, competetive for 1 - ∞ players and cooperative play for up to 4 players

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: World Challenge Game Asia
description:
The board game that rewards your knowledge.

In World Challenge Game, players will answer questions to conquer territories. Fight to conquer the world and show that you are the one who knows the most! Answer questions, carefully consider the territories you want to conquer, and learn while proving that you are the best in World Challenge Game.

World Challenge Game Asia is a new version set in the Asian continent, featuring a new map, new characters, and new thematic cards. It is played independently from the original World Challenge Game and can be combined with it.

Choose one of the two game modes:

Conqueror, where you conquer as many countries as possible before the game ends, or Attack, where you attack and win countries conquered by other players to take control of the entire continent. In this mode, you can conquer a country that another player has won.

Each turn, a player will draw a card and choose one of the two existing questions, which they must read aloud, along with the four answers. The other participants will write their chosen answer on their card, marking an "X" in options A, B, C, or D. When everyone has answered the question, the answers will be revealed, starting with the player to the left of the one who read the question. If the answer is correct, the player can place a conquest token in an available border country, and the same goes for the rest of the players.

The Conqueror game mode will automatically end once the last country on the continent is conquered. At that time, the countries conquered by each player will be counted, so the player with the most conquered countries will be the winner of the game. If there are two or more players with the same maximum number of conquered countries, tiebreaker questions will be read to them. Players who cannot answer the question lose.

The Attack game mode will end when only one player remains on the continent, who will be crowned the winner. If the question cards run out, the game will end, and the player with the most countries will win.

—description from the publisher

name: Square One: Joker Ambassador Pack
description:
This Kickstarter exclusive expansion brings in an additional unique mechanic with a special Joker black sequence and a special Joker piece.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Resource Queue, Tile Placement

name: Tippit
description:
A simple game of balance, strategy and luck. The game can be played at simple levels for any child 3+ or with more sophisticated rules for those with a strategic turn of mind. Simply pick a cube from the bag and place it on the playing board. If the board tips enough for the end to hit the table you lose.

The board is simple with four scoring zones, but the cubes have a hidden twist, just when you thought it was getting easy - the cubes are all different woods and therefore different densities, the heaviest might be double the lightest in weight, changing strategically where you can place them. As each turn brings a new piece selected blind from a bag you won't know until it is chosen how the weight of the cube will affect your strategy.

—description from the designer

name: Mission Amazonia
description:
In Mission Amazonia a strategic deckbuilding board game you are part of a Brazilian team of rainforest protectors. From your headquarters (e.g. Pôrto Velho) you go on different missions north and south of the Amazon to curb the illegal exploitation of the rainforest. The poaching of exotic animal species, the prohibited logging of tropical timber or the poisoning of rivers through illegal gold mining are the order of the day. Now a race against time begins and the question arises whether you can work well together as a team and use your means (vehicles, night vision devices, satellite images, GPS, etc.) and skills wisely to slow down or even stop the extinction of species and the progressive deforestation?


Explore the Amazon rainforest on realistic maps (in the states of Rondônia, Pará and Amazonas) in 10 chapters where you can experience the deforestation in 5-year steps (starting from the late 1980s).



Use your equipment (vehicles, satellite images etc.) wisely and purchase new tools (drone, night vision device, GPS, etc.) at the right time.



The maps and new rules for every chapter are summarized in the 24-page chapter book. That allows players to jump in or out with ease.



Get more experience as a team over a 10+ hour campaign.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Set-up

name: Bydgoskie ścieżki pamięci
description:
Ścieżki Pamięci ("Paths of Memory") is an educational board game, prepared mainly for primary and secondary school students. The creators' intention is to combine entertainment and fun with providing knowledge about national memorial sites related to the history of Bydgoszcz.

The game has three basic variants:

classic memo;
combining memo with naming the objects presented in the pictures
combining memo with placing on the map the objects presented in the pictures


"Ścieżki Pamięci" to edukacyjna gra planszowa, przygotowana głównie z myślą o uczniach szkół podstawowych i ponadpodstawowych. Założeniem twórców jest połączenie rozrywki i zabawy z przekazywaniem wiedzy na temat miejsc pamięci narodowej związanych z historią Bydgoszczy.

name: Wędkarz doskonały
description:
The aim of the game is to teach players the regulations for amateur fishing in Poland.

The game is played in a series of round where player have to answer questions about minimum catch sizes and protection periods of various fishes found in Poland. The first person to get to certain number of points wins.

—user summary

Celem gry jest zapoznanie graczy – przez zabawę – z Regulaminem Amatorskiego Połowu Ryb. Gra ma również za zadanie uświadomić, jak ważne jest posiadanie karty wędkarskiej.
Wędkarz doskonały to pomoc dla instruktorów i inspektorów szkolenia wędkarskiej młodzieży w przygotowaniu jej do zdania egzaminu na kartę wędkarską.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Broom World Academians
description:
The Ravensburg National Library, located in the central ward of the ring-shaped satellite city of Rio Grande, is busier than ever. A few days ago, the mysterious government agency Drei Magier offered a huge reward for any information about the person responsible for the downfall of the legendary witch Wiese.

Broom World Academians is a competitive research game set in a unique magical world. Each player becomes a laboratory director and aims to gather collaborators faster than other players. Players can compete individually or as teams. 

All players simultaneously choose one of the three types of actions and its target, and if the action is successful, the player gains knowledge resources. Collaborator cards obtained with knowledge resources provide victory points. Players earn additional victory points through special abilities and collecting pairs.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Thrift Boutique
description:
You are the owner of a thrift boutique! Visit thrift stores and yard sales to collect awesome outfits and great bargains for your shop. During each shopping round, You can decide to feature an outfit on your mannequin, issue a promotion, travel to the local yard sale, or visit the local thrift shop. You may want to start with last week's discounted left overs on the clearance rack, or perhaps you want to be the first player to scope out what's new at the yard sale? You'll have to consider profits and probabilities. When the last player returns to her shop, the selling round immediately begins.

Take turns rolling the dice to see what sells. Factor in any promotions you may have in place that might allow you to adjust the dice totals up or down to increase the number of items you are able to sell. Once a 7 is rolled, the day is over, and it's time to go shopping again.

To win, be the shop that makes the biggest profit!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Educational, Math
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Income, Investment, Ownership, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement

name: Murder at the Graduation Party
description: A student is found murdered at a graduation party. Players must examine all the evidence and look for clues in newspapers, witness statements, autopsy reports, phone records, maps, photos, surveillance videos, websites and more. Players must find suspicious details in the evidence and reveal the killer.

name: The Shadow Of The Nokizaru
description: The kingdom is in ruins. Invaders from the west have decimated the island and the rulers in it. In the midst of the kingdom's turmoil, two powerful Daimyos rise to power. Working together, they expel the invaders and free the country. But all is not well. During the war, the Daimyos never fully trusted each other, and now that the common enemy is gone, that fact is about to be made even more clear. Both desire to be ruler, but only one can be crowned. As one of these Daimyos, you will have to lead your army to sabotage your opponent's castle. You will have to balance building your army, advancing your hidden ninjas, and halting the enemy advance. The Daimyo who can successfully advance all his ninjas to his opponent's castle before his opponent can do the same, will be crowned ruler over Japan! (Photos have been generated by Canva's AI art generator, Magic Media.)

name: Tic-Tac-Toe Bolt
description:
THREE IN ONE GAME - Enjoy a trio of Tic-Tac-Toe themed games in one box, perfect for groups of 1-4 players. Ideal for family game nights or friend gatherings, it offers quick-to-start fun for players of all ages.

INFINITE TIC-TAC-TOE - Experience the classic game like never before with Infinite Tic-Tac-Toe mode. Choose between head-to-head mode or playing against an adaptive AI that adjusts its difficulty based on the player's skill level. Say goodbye to endless draws and embrace a fresh and engaging challenge every time.

MEMORY FLASH - Test and enhance your memory with our Memory Flash game. Keep your focus sharp as you identify and recall the light sequences. Try to clear all 9 progressive difficulties in one go to beat the game!

COVER-UP TIC-TAC-TOE - Each piece comes in three sizes, and on each turn, you can place or move a piece. Larger pieces can cover smaller ones—connect three of your color to win! This strategy board game is perfect for exercising critical thinking and reasoning skills.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Electronic, Memory, Real-time
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: The Cult Member Killings
description: 17 members of a cult are found dead and cult leader is missing. Players must examine all the evidence and look for clues in newspapers, witness statements, autopsy reports, phone records, maps, photos, surveillance videos, websites and more. Players must find suspicious details in the evidence and reveal the killer.

name: Worst Idea Wins
description:
Worst Idea Wins is a card-based party game where players create the wildest, most un-boring and inappropriate Ads for the most insane products never created.

Players take turns acting as the CEO and sharing a PRODUCT card for the remaining players to construct their most over the top Ad to impress her/him with. The remaining players, aka “The Creatives” create their best/worst ad by choosing their best combination of SETTING, CHARACTER, ACTION, TWIST and end ANNOUNCER cards to wrap up their commercial.

Whichever player presents the winning combination, as judged by the CEO, wins that PRODUCT card and earns the dollar amount shown on the card. The first player to reach $1M wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Player Judge

name: The Deceit
description:
Throw yourself into New York's celebrity chef scene - a lavish world of fine dining extravagance and drama.

Abigail Remes, one of New York's up-and-coming chefs, has stumbled across what looks like one of her employees trying to swindle her out of thousands of dollars. Her bank manager has called, she seems to be in all sorts of trouble and needs your help to sort out the mess.

Solve all nine puzzles and break into the online vault to work out exactly what is going on!

name: あぽぐらし (Apogurashi)
description:
This is a story about girls fighting to survive in a post-apocalyptic world. Hordes of zombies, abnormal weather, and natural disasters attack the barely surviving humans. One day, they discover a clue that reveals the mastermind who led their world into chaos. Can they defeat the final boss and restore their peaceful world?

Players send out their characters to explore, gather food, and recruit allies. They must overcome natural disasters and outside attacks as they race to defeat the mastermind faster than anyone else. A player wins by defeating the mastermind or being the last one left alive.

name: ガッチャ~God Chance~
description:
An unprecedented opportunity is approaching for a kingdom that has flourished with martial arts and magic. The future of this world depends on the "God Chance," an ancient ritual to summon the legendary saviors. To perform this ritual, you must collect precious "God Summoning Stones."
