ONE player plays the fruit thief, trying to find all the perfect fruits and run back home without getting caught, in time to bake a pie for everyone for Mimose's birthday party tomorrow.

The thief will need to be careful not to leave clues so good it will help the detectives identify them. On the other hand, detectives will need to cooperate and share their dice, follow the clues and plan their moves carefully to win.

Based on a kids book series Mimose & Sam, published by Comme des Géants, written and illustrated by Cathon.

—description from the publisher

name: Trekking the World 2nd Edition
description:
In Trekking the World 2nd Edition, compete to be the ultimate world traveler by choosing itineraries wisely, gaining power with experience, collecting souvenirs, and taking fascinating tours at gorgeous destinations.

The 2nd Edition is a major redesign. Mechanically, here are the three biggest differences:


It's a drafting-&-racing game where you start each turn by choosing an itinerary. 1st edition was a set-collection-&-racing game where you start each turn by drawing cards with no thematic meaning.



In the new edition, you can get special powers for free by going to various destinations, which can be played in combos for big turns.



It has a solo mode.


There are many other changes as well. No rule is unchanged.

There are also component upgrades. For example, the art fills out more of each card, and the suitcases are now double-layered cardboard with slots for cubes, instead of cardstock.

Other ways 2nd Edition differs from 1st:


has quicker-to-learn rules
has higher decision complexity (gateway+ instead of gateway)
feels more like traveling
has more game-to-game variety
has more turn-to-turn variety
has more story: better integrated content and gameplay
is faster to set up
has an expansion that turns it into a mid-weight strategy game, with asymmetrical player powers
has less negative player interaction (no blocking, etc)
no more 1st player advantage
has bigger “big” turns (including card combos)
feels like it rewards you more, in greater variety


—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Arturus Rex
description:
King Arthur needs you! Dive into the legends of the Round Table as a Knight under the counsel of Merlin.

Will you slay Mordred? Save the knights from Morgan Le Fey? Build Camelot? Or will you try to accomplish the impossible and find the Holy Grail?

Make tough choices, finish quests in a tightly wound Roll-and-write game where players play simultaneously and using the same... we mean, almost the same dice as everyone. Merlin decided otherwise, and he's in charge while Arthur is battling Mordred.

Note: the game is not available separately, it is included in Dés-Papiers.

—description from the publisher

name: High Noon: Expansion Loot – Kickstarter Exclusive
description: More loot for those that went along for the ride. All the cards are marked "KS Exclusive".
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Player Elimination

name: 2 Serpents
description:
Remember the 80s arcade hit Snake? or the awesome lightcycle race from Tron???

2 Serpents is a Roll-and-Write game of these two, mushed together to make a quick dice-drafting game that's totally RAD!

Win by cornering your opponent and preventing them from moving. Collect power-ups that will allow you to bite off one of their 2 heads... Oh did I forget to say you had 2 heads on your Serpent? And you can also grow more with power-ups!!!

A very tactical game with push-your luck elements, Risk management and excitement. Bubblegum not included.

—description from the designer

name: カケルカ　ケルカ (Kakeruka Keruka)
description:
A card guessing game in which players play by multiplying two cards in their hands!

Kakeru Kakeruka is a card game in which you fight with two cards in your hand.

Before the fight begins, multiply the two cards in your hand to form a large number!

The numbers on the cards are 0~7, plus -1 and -50.

You can collect the large number by relying on the positive cards, or you can risk it and try to collect two negative cards to guarantee a win!

Each card has an effect when placed on the field. Use them to make a better hand or to determine everyone else's number!

Cards with an identical number are stacked on top of each other, and when there are three piles of stacked cards, the game is over! Should you go out now or wait until your next turn...?

name: First to Worst: The Party Game About How Your Friends and Family Rank Things
description:
In this fun collaborative game, players try to get into each others' heads by guessing how fellow players rank a variety of topics in priority order of 1 through 5. Match more right than wrong and victory is yours!

—description from the publisher

name: Keepers: Secret Cabal 2023 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available from backing Secret Cabal 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

To use these cards, simply shuffle them in with the other cards before the game states.

Can be used with Keepers or Moments

name: まっくらダンジョン (Makkura danjon)
description:
Explore the underground dungeon in this solo rogue-like game. Control the hero with up, down, left, right, A, and B commands. Collect relics scattered throughout the dungeon while defeating monsters lurking in the darkness.

The game of まっくらダンジョン (Dark Dungeon) comes with a clear file, multiple dungeons on grid paper, and a "dicil" (combination dice and pencil). By moving a transparent area of the folder over a map, the player has limited visibility as they explore the variety of ready-made maps. You can download "DLC" maps online and even create your own. Players also choose a difficulty level for each game and randomly assign locations for the relics and monsters, creating more replayability.

On each turn, the player writes down the combination of commands they will activate that turn, using the directional arrows (movement), A (Attack), and B (Defend). Combinations of commands allow you to shoot arrows or dash. As you take turns, you lose stamina points but gain skill points, allowing you to strengthen your skills or take more actions. You further increase your abilities by gathering relics, which function both as victory points and useful items, like tools and weapons.

Are you ready to challenge the Dark Dungeon? You can compete in a time attack, gathering as many relics as you can before your timer runs out. Or you can aim for a high score and try to gather all the relics before leaving the dungeon.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Action Retrieval, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Million Dollar Script: Setting Cards Promo Set
description:
Available from backing Secret Cabal 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Set of 8 cards that allow you to choose (or draw randomly) a specific setting.

The front of the Setting card replaces the Heroic card during Character Creation and similarly, the back of the card replaces a Villainous card.

name: EN-NICHI
description:
EN-NICHI (円日) aims to capture the fun of a Japanese festival as the players walk around the festival venue, visiting the stalls to play games, gain prizes and souvenirs, and catch the fireworks display.

Over the course of the game players walk among the 12 stalls, each hosting one of four card-based minigames as well as a specific way to gain or exchange minigame prizes or souvenirs. Minigame prizes can be scored at the end of the game or exchanged for high-value firework cards, while souvenirs can be exchanged for special omamori that can enhance the odds at specific minigames.

When the fireworks run out or the games empty up, the game ends, and everyone scores their winnings to determine the victor.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Recollection -リコレクション-
description:
Serena, a girl who lives in an old Western-style mansion, hears mysterious voices at night when her parents are away. A group of people appear in front of her, claiming to be trapped in the mansion. They claim to be her allies and plan to find a way out together. Are they really her allies? While she still doubts, Serena joins their escape.

Recollection -リコレクション- is a semi-cooperative game of hidden identities. The main character of the story, Serena, and the five characters surrounding her act according to their own motives. The game will be different each time, so you can enjoy it even more by imagining the story as you play.

Players take on the roles of the characters, secretly divided into factions of allies aiming to escape and traitors trying to prevent an escape. Players also have a secret mission they must complete before the game ends. If players successfully complete quests in the revealed rooms, they can obtain items essential to their escape. But if they fail, there will be a penalty. Each character has their own physical strength and mental status, and if either of them reaches zero, they become incapacitated and will be unable to do anything for a period of time, so be careful!

Every 12 in-game hours, a story card will activate. Once all story cards have appeared, the time limit is reached and the game ends. Determine which players share your faction, work together, and achieve your victory conditions within the time limit!
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Class Craft
description:
In Class Craft (クラスクラフト), players take on the role of teachers, building their classrooms to ensure their respective classes score highest in the midterms and finals.

Each classroom consists of two rows, each with 4 seats, and the players play 1 student from their hand onto an empty seat on each of their turns. Most students are only good at certain subjects, and some have effects that can be activated when played in specific rows, such as switching the positions of other students or changing the subject being tested.

There are six teachers with different subjects that rotate in a specific order each game; memorizing the order and manipulating the flow of subjects is vital to scoring well at both the midterms and finals.

name: Sláine: The Cauldron of Blood
description:
The most prized treasure of the Earth goddess Danu, the Cauldron of Blood was a sacred object that could offer up a never-ending supply of food. However, deep within its depths dwelt the spirit of the Goddess as Morrigan the Crone and her monstrous son Avagddu. Wielding the power of death, Morrigan could return a semblance of life to the fallen who were sacrificed to the cauldron. The Reborn were not truly alive but were more than capable of continuing the fight against their foes from beyond the grave.

Dedicated to Danu and to Lug the Sun God, Cathbad was the high druid of the Sessair and advisor to Sláine and his predecessor. Though many held him partly responsible for the capitulation of the Earth Tribes to the Fomorian tax collectors, he wielded considerable political and mystical power in the tribe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random

name: The Yellow House
description:
Van Gogh and Gauguin debate what is important for drawing. It's a very special climbing game for two players. You must play one card from the elements that have not yet been played this trick among the four elements: money, inspiration, passion, and skill. If the value of that element is low, you must play additional cards to increase its value before playing one card. The player who goes out first scores the last card played and wins the round. Win the game by winning three rounds first or by scoring the same element twice.

—description from the publisher

name: Drawing Swords
description:
You’re given a prompt and a pen. All you have to do is draw it. Except, there’s already something on your artboard. Some “thing” in fact. The only other rule is you must incorporate the “thing” into your drawing too. Get your teammate to guess the prompt in 30 seconds before the other team and see who has the dirtiest (or cleanest) mind!

—description from the publisher

name: Sláine: What the El?
description:
A prince among the alien Dark-Els, Elfric was an utterly depraved being that lusted after death and devastation. A being of magical energy, his mortal incarnation was almost impossible to destroy with normal weapons, and many were the battles where his body was pierced a dozen times and more by sword, arrow or spear without harm. Elfric’s magic also manifested itself in the form of a deadly gaze from a gem-like third eye in his forehead that could shatter armour and boil away flesh. Only with great effort and the aid of many allies was Sláine able to halt Elfric’s rampages across space and time, yet the demonic being was never utterly destroyed and will doubtless return to plague humanity another day.

Els were creatures from another dimension that exists at a right angle to our own. Dark-Els were evil beings, intent on spreading destruction for Crom Cruach. Sometimes these took the form of seductive human women to lure their prey into traps. They were spiteful, deadly fighters possessed of otherworldly power, often underestimated because of their appearance. Yet when slain their true forms manifested, as their bodies reverted into bug-like abominations.

Contains:

Elfric Serpent-Eye
3 x El-Women
1 x character card
1 x unit card

name: Sláine: The Badb
description:
Of the children chosen for sacrifice to the Lord Weird, those that caught his eye in some way were spared and raised as Drunes. Once grown to adulthood these formidable warrior-witches serve as priestesses and bodyguards to Slough Feg, utterly dedicated to the Lord Weird and the worship of Crom Cruach. Three of the Badb, Nemon the Venomous, Fea the Hateful and Catha the Fury, fought Sláine when he was to be sacrificed to the worm god in a vast wickerman.

This boxed set contains the following Warlord Resin figures and plastic bases:

3 x Badb
1 x unit card

name: Sláine: Formorian Sea Demons Warband
description:
An ages-old enemy of the Earth Tribes inhabiting Tir Nan Og, the Fomorians were a race of sea demons from the icy waters of Lochlann to the north led by ferocious warriors such as Balor of the Evil Eye and Moloch.

Whether they were performing their own offensives against the Earth Tribes or working in conjunction with the Lord Weird Slough Feg's Drune forces, the Fomorians provided a stern test for Danu's warriors with many being slain or enslaved – Fomorians prizing the tears of humans as a delicacy.

This boxed set contains the following Warlord resin figures and plastic bases:

3 x Fomorian Sea Demons (hook & chain)
3 x Fomorian Sea Demons (harpoon)
3 x Fomorian Sea Demons (greataxe)
1 x Fomorian Sea Demons unit card
2 x Feat cards (Feint and Warding Way)

name: Sláine: Formorian Champions
description:
Under Balor were a number of other important Fomorians, charged with brutalising the population and leading the Fomorian armies. These foul creatures thrived on the misery of their victims, collecting human tears to savour. By their commands were many of Danu’s followers put to the blade, hanged or burned alive, simply for the joy of causing death and mayhem.

This boxed set contains the following Warlord Resin figures and plastic bases:

3 Fomorian Sea Demon Champions
1 x unit card

name: Sláine: Drune Warband
description:
Worshippers of the Dark Gods such as Crom Cruach, the great time worm, the Drune Lords are evil priest-kings intent on wiping out Tir Nan Og, the Land of the Young. Committing a great number of slaughters and sacrifices in the name of their dark deities, the Drunes have already soured much of the land with their foul magics.

The armies of the Drunes comprise of the barbaric Skull Swords, Drune soldiers with hair breathing masks to protect themselves from the foul odours of their Drune Lord masters who rule the southern tribes.

This boxed set contains the following Warlord resin figures and plastic bases:

1x Skull Sword Champion (axe & shield)
1x Skull Sword Champion (great axe)
1x Skull Sword Champion (sword & shield)
3x Skull Sword (repeater crossbow)
3x Skull Swords (axe & shield)
1x Skull Sword Champion character card
1x Skull Swords unit card
2x Feat cards (Stubborn Block and Moon-torn)

name: Sláine: Drune Half Dead
description:
Crom Cruach is the Time Worm, master of entropy and decay. With the power of the great worm the dead do not have to lie still but can be roused from their inanimation by Sour magic. They remember little but the most basic need to fight and kill, and their twitching limbs are of little skill compared to their prowess in life, but warriors of the Drunes can serve again as Half-Dead when summoned by a Drune Lord.

This boxed set contains the following Warlord Resin figures and plastic bases:

6 x Drune Half Dead
1 x unit card

name: Sláine: Drune Heroes
description:
Supreme leader of the Drune Lords, the Lord Weird Slough Feg, a now insane twenty-thousand year old former Horned God laid waste to swathes of Tir Nan Og in the name of his foul master Crom Cruach. Leading his armies of Skull Swords and his wicked priestesses against the tribes of the Earth Goddess, Danu. One such priestess was Medb, a young girl taken from her village as sacrifice but showed great promise to Slough Feg, becoming a Druness instead of perishing in a wicker man conflagration.

Following several clashes with her nemesis, Sláine, she returned under the guise of Megrim, casting a glamour over the King of the Sessair tribe and bending him to her will. Aided by her dwarf assistant, Robym, she caused untold trouble for the Earth Tribes.

This boxed set contains the following Warlord resin figures and plastic bases:

1x The Lord Weird Slough Feg
1x Medb
1x Megrim
1x Robym the Dwarf
3x Character cards

name: Sláine: Earth Tribes Warband
description:
Facing the twin threats of the Drune Lords with their twisted Sour magic blighting the Land of the Young and invasions of Fomorian sea demons intent on enslaving mankind, the tribes of the Earth Goddess, Danu, are by necessity fearsome warriors.

Comprising many different tribes such as The Growling Shields, Tribe of the Shadows and the savage Sessair, the Earth Tribes often fight amongst themselves for dominance but are ultimately united in their devotion to Danu. Among the Sessair are a sect of warriors capable of undergoing a warp-spasm – a mystical battle frenzy allowing them to channel the power of the earth through their body and turning them into berserk, raging beasts, feeling almost impervious to wounds.

—description from the publisher

name: Sláine: Earth Tribes Heroes
description:
Amongst the Celtic Earth Tribes are mighty warriors who inspired their tribes to glory against the Fomorians and the Drune Lords. Sláine's former wife, Niamh, whom he was exiled from the Sessair for having a dalliance with, was an accomplished warrior and inventor. Mongan Axehead was Sláine's foster father, taking the place of the exiled Roth Bellyshaker.

The Tribe of Growling Shields was led by King Rudraige who had taken Niamh as his wife. Rudraige wielded one of the great treasures of the tribes – the Silver Sword of the Moon, whose terrible wounds could not be healed. Wielded by King Gann of Finias, the Flaming Spear of the Sun was a bloodthirsty treasure that returned, shrieking, to the hand of the thrower by command after passing through its target.

This boxed set contains the following Warlord resin figures and plastic bases:

1x Queen Niamh
1x Mongan Axehead
1x King Rudraige with the Silver Sword of the Moon
1x King Gann with the Flaming Spear of the Sun
4x character cards

name: Sláine: Balor of the Evil Eye
description:
Possessed of a deadly, baleful gaze that scorched all before it, Balor was the warchief leading the Fomorian Sea Demons against their enemies in Tir Nan Og, the Earth Tribes. Often seen sat atop a ferocious war elk, Balor proved a fearsome enemy for the people of the Earth Tribes. Laying waste to swathes of the Land of the Young as they swarmed south from the icy waters of their home in Lochlann the Fomorians also allied with the Drunes against Sláine's people.

This boxed set contains the following Warlord resin figures and plastic bases:

1x Balor riding war elk
1x Balor of the Evil Eye character card

name: Sláine: Beasts of the Forest
description:
The god of the animals and the forest is Carnun, Lord of Beasts. Just as nature is both beautiful and cruel, Carnun cannot be considered as good or evil, but an elemental force that must be reckoned with and appeased. Both the Earth Tribes and the Drunes offer worship to Carnun, and in reply the god may send his bestial minions to do the bidding of a petitioner. However, while Carnun may despatch bears and great-antlered stags to gouge and trample the foe, there are many smaller creatures such as wolves, badgers and porcupines that can present quite a threat, or rats, snakes and toads that overpower their victims in a vicious swarm.

Contains:

Bear
Wolf
Porcupine
Wild Boar
1 x unit card

name: The Game Of You
description:
Each round begins by giving yourself a weird NICKNAME, like Katie The Hammer, or Captain Chris.

Each player then gets some DESCRIPTION cards and distributes them to the other players.

Then, each player reveals all of the descriptions about themselves and picks their favorite one.

The player who "wrote" it reveals themselves and collects a point.

Hope you have a good sense of humor about yourself!

—description by the publisher

name: Apistocracy: Masquerade
description:
The Masquerade expansion adds a masquerade ball to the ballroom during the third week of the Season Phase. In order to attend you have to collect a mask on the Hive Board. They are clear tokens that you may set on your Player Mat character. There are clear cards that overlay the Ton and L&C cards in the ballroom during the third week. They mask the people on the cards and they provide both a wild crest and allow you to select the influence of your choice to gain on your influence track. Additionally, the expansion adds a a new card to the L&C deck with a masquerade specific end game scoring goal.

description from kickstarter campaign

name: Polarity of Power: The Game of Chaos
description:
Polarity of Power is a dynamic real-life-based card game that immerses players in a world of political intrigue, societal upheaval, and personal ambition. Navigate the complex web of power dynamics as you vie for control, but beware, as power always comes at a cost. Dive into the shadows of power and discover its true weight in this captivating game.

The game utilizes two main decks: the Tactics Deck and the Eco Deck.
Tactics Deck: Focuses on political actions and maneuvering. Includes:
Action Cards: Represent political actions with various effects.
Policy Cards: Enact social policies with lasting impacts.
Trick Cards: Allow for cunning tactics and manipulation.

Eco Deck: Focuses on economic development and industry management. Includes:
Industry Cards: Represent different economic sectors and generate national power.
Basic Attack Cards: Used to attack opponent's industries.
Basic Defense Cards: Used to defend against attacks.
Community Cards: Provide strategic actions with cooldown periods.

Additional Components:
Opportunity Cards: Introduce unexpected events and challenges.
Dice Cards: Used for random outcomes.
Role Cards: Define player (Hero) abilities and objectives.
National Power (NP) Tokens: Represent a nation's stability and strength.
Popularity (PT) Tokens: Represent public appeal and influence.
Action Point (AP) Tokens: Used to perform actions during turns.
Polarity Cards: Used in specific game modes.
Round Tracker Card: Tracks cooldowns, production, and industry strength or counting AP used per round.

Polarity of Power - A Game of Political Maneuvering and Economic Mastery
Step into the dynamic world of Polarity of Power, where cunning political tactics and shrewd economic strategies collide. Command two unique decks - the Tactics Deck and the Eco Deck - to outwit your opponents and claim victory.
The Tactics Deck is your arsenal for political maneuvering. Play Action Cards to influence the political landscape, enact sweeping changes with Policy Cards, and outsmart your rivals with clever Trick Cards. Will you sway public opinion, forge alliances, or orchestrate a cunning power play?
Meanwhile, the Eco Deck fuels your economic engine. Construct a thriving industrial empire with Industry Cards, engage in economic warfare with Basic Attack Cards, and defend your assets with Basic Defense Cards. Cultivate the support of communities through Community Cards and watch your nation prosper.
Choose your path to power in one of three captivating game modes:
1) Polarity of War: Form teams and protect your designated "polarity" player while aiming to dismantle opposing teams. The last polarity standing reigns supreme as the ultimate superpower.
2) Brawl Survivor: Every player for themselves! Navigate the treacherous political landscape, strategically utilize your cards, and outlast your rivals to emerge as the sole survivor.
3) 1 on 1: Engage in intense head-to-head battles, adapting to new roles every three rounds as you strive to outmaneuver your opponent and claim victory.

With unexpected twists and turns introduced by Opportunity Cards and the ever-present element of chance with Dice Cards, Polarity of Power guarantees an engaging and unpredictable experience. Manage your resources wisely, leverage the unique abilities of your Role Card, and forge your path to political and economic dominance.

Opportunity Cards in Polarity of Power
Opportunity Cards inject dynamism and unexpected twists into Polarity of Power, ensuring each game is a unique experience. These cards represent unforeseen events, challenges, or opportunities that can dramatically shift the political landscape.
Drawing Opportunity Cards:
Timing: Opportunity Cards are drawn at the beginning of each round, before any player takes their round.
Who Draws: In Polarity of War and Brawl Survivor modes, players take rounds drawing Opportunity Cards, following the established term order. For example, if Team A starts the round in Polarity of War, they draw the first Opportunity Card. In the next round, Team B would draw, and so on. Similarly, in Brawl Survivor, Player A would draw first, then Player B in the following round, etc.
1 on 1 Mode: Players alternate drawing Opportunity Cards at the start of each round.
Executing Opportunity Cards:
Immediate Effect: The effects of Opportunity Cards are resolved immediately upon being drawn. Players must adapt their strategies and actions accordingly.
One-Time Use: Once an Opportunity Card is drawn and resolved, it is removed from the game for that particular playthrough. This ensures that each game presents unique challenges and prevents repetition.

Examples of Opportunity Card Effects:
1)Sudden Economic Boom: Grants bonus National Power to all players with Industry Cards in specific sectors.
2)Political Scandal: Forces a player to discard cards or lose Popularity Points.
3)Natural Disaster: Damages Industry Cards or disrupts resource generation.
4)Technological Breakthrough: Provides a temporary advantage or unlocks new strategic options for a player.
5)Shifting Public Opinion / Issues: Influences Popularity Points for players based on their Role Cards or recent actions.

Opportunity Cards add a layer of excitement and unpredictability to Polarity of Power. They force players to think on their feet, adapt their strategies, and capitalize on sudden opportunities or overcome unexpected challenges. This dynamic element keeps players engaged and ensures that each game is a thrilling and unique experience.

Player Actions on Their Turn in Polarity of Power
A player's turn in Polarity of Power is a strategic dance of managing resources, playing cards, and maneuvering for political and economic dominance. Here's a breakdown of the actions a player can take during their turn:
1. Draw Cards:
Choose a Deck: At the start of their turn, the player chooses to draw from either the Tactics Deck (Action, Policy, Trick cards) or the Eco Deck (Industry, Basic Attack/Defense, Community cards). This choice allows players to tailor their strategy based on their current goals and the game state.
Draw Two Cards: The player draws two cards from their chosen deck, adding them to their hand.
2. Play Cards:
Card Selection: The player can choose to play any number of cards from their hand, as long as they have the required Action Points (AP) to activate them.
Card Types and Effects: Each card type has unique activation conditions and effects.
Action Cards: Immediately trigger political events or actions.
Policy Cards: Enact lasting changes to the game's rules or conditions.
Trick Cards: Played face-down and activated under specific circumstances to manipulate the game.
Industry Cards: Placed on the field to generate National Power and represent economic ventures.
Basic Attack/Defense Cards: Used to attack opponents' industries or defend against attacks.
Community Cards: Provide strategic actions and have cooldown periods.
3. Manage Resources:
Action Points (AP): Players start each round with a set number of AP (typically 5-7). Each card played has an AP cost, which is deducted from the player's available AP pool or Use the round tracker to mark the AP spent and keep track of your remaining AP for the turn.
(Players recover their Action Points (AP) at the beginning of each new turn. This means that any unspent AP from the previous turn do not carry over)
National Power (NP) and Popularity (PT): Players need to carefully manage their NP and PT levels, as reaching zero in either results in elimination. Industry Cards and certain card effects can increase NP, while Policy Cards and other actions can influence PT.
4. Other Actions:
Negotiate and Form Alliances: Players can engage in discussions and negotiate deals with other players, depending on the game mode and their current objectives.
React to Opponents: Players can respond to their opponents' actions by playing cards or utilizing abilities on their Role Card.
5. End Turn:
Discard Down to 2-3 Cards: At the end of their turn, the player must discard cards from their hand until they have a maximum of cards (typically 2-3)remaining. This ensures a dynamic flow and prevents players from hoarding cards.

The combination of card play, resource management, and strategic decision-making makes each player's turn in Polarity of Power a captivating and impactful experience. Mastering the various card types and their interactions is key to achieving victory in this dynamic and engaging game.

Game End and Victory Conditions in Polarity of Power
The climax of Polarity of Power arrives when specific conditions are met, leading to the game's end and the crowning of a victor. Victory conditions and the path to success vary depending on the chosen game mode, adding to the game's replayability and strategic depth.
1) Polarity of War:
Game End: The game concludes when only one "polarity" player remains on the stage. This means all other teams have had their polarity player eliminated by having their National Power (NP) or Popularity (PT) reduced to zero.
Winning: The team with the last surviving polarity player is declared the winner. Their ability to strategically protect their polarity while dismantling opposing teams leads them to triumph and the prestigious title of "Superpower."
2) Brawl Survivor:
Game End: The game ends when only one player remains on the stage. All other players have been eliminated by having their NP or PT depleted to zero.
Winning: The last player standing is crowned the victor, having outmaneuvered and outlasted all rivals in the fierce battle for political survival.
3) 1 on 1:
Game End: Similar to Brawl Survivor, the game concludes when one player's NP or PT reaches zero, resulting in their elimination.
Winning: The remaining player, having successfully navigated the challenges of shifting roles and strategic card play, emerges as the champion of this intense head-to-head battle.

General Gameplay Flow:
While the specific victory conditions differ across game modes, the core gameplay loop involves players strategically utilizing cards from the Tactics and Eco Decks to influence the political landscape, develop their economic power, and ultimately, ensure their survival or their team's victory.
1) Turns and Rounds: Players take turns within each round, drawing cards, playing cards from their hand, managing resources like Action Points (AP), National Power (NP), and Popularity (PT), and reacting to opponents' moves.
2) Opportunity Cards and Dice Cards: These elements introduce unexpected events and chance, forcing players to adapt their strategies and adding to the excitement.
3) Card Interactions and Abilities: Players leverage the unique effects of different card types and their Role Card abilities to gain advantages and outmaneuver their opponents.

In essence, Polarity of Power is a game of strategic decision-making, resource management, and adapting to a dynamic and ever-changing political and economic landscape. Players must carefully choose which cards to play, when to play them, and how to best utilize their resources to achieve victory in their chosen game mode.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Civil War, Humor, Political
mechanics: Acting, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Drawing, Negotiation, Role Playing, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Recollection -リコレクション- 新たなる来訪者 (Aratanaru Raihosha)
description:
"I'll repeat this over and over again, just to get you back..." A repeating world, an unchanging ending. New visitors appear in this closed world. Are they friends or enemies?

-リコレクション- 新たなる来訪者 (Recollection: New Visitors) adds new quests, new characters, new special items, and expanded rules to Recollection, a semi-cooperative game where allies and traitors attempt to escape from a Western-style mansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Canvas: Trilogy Booster Pack
description:
All New Content included through the Canvas Big Box Kickstarter campaign. (Trilogy Booster Pack not included with the Big Box and must be pledged separately.)


10 NEW Art Cards illustrated by Luan Huynh
4 NEW Scoring Cards
4 NEW Award Cards
1 NEW Signature Style Card
4 NEW Painter Cards



You must own all 3 Canvas games to use all the Trilogy Booster content.


—description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Layering, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Recollection Story -リコレクション ストーリー- 君に捧げる物語 (Kimi ni Sasageru Monogatari)
description:
Will she reach hope or despair at the end of this repeated story? "Hey, do you really think it's right to leave this world...?" The one who resembles me gently whispers in a sweet voice that if I run away from here, everything should be over. In front of the door that is blocked yet again, the one who resembles me laughs. “Where do you really want to be?”

Recollection Story -リコレクション ストーリー- 君に捧げる物語 (A Story Dedicated to You) adds new non-player characters, new special items, and gameplay mechanics to Recollection, a game where players attempt to escape a Western-style mansion.

This expansion allows Recollection to be played fully cooperatively and without the use of traitors. All characters work together to defeat the Familiar of Delusion lurking in the mansion within the time and obtain the Fragments of Truth, which will allow you to escape. However, if you fail to defeat the Familiar of Delusion within the time limit, Fragments of Ruin will accumulate. If you cannot collect all the "Fragments of Truth" within the time limit or if you collect 10 "Fragments of Ruin", the game will be over.

The ending of the story will change depending on whether you succeed or fail in your escape and how many Fragments of Truth you have collected. Each character reveals their own personal truth as well, which also changes depending on the ending you achieve as a group.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle

name: ＝イコール (= Equal)
description:
For those who like math! For those who are a little weak! Here we go!

Equal= is a trick-taking game with must-follow and trump cards suitable for children's learning, and equals spring. Place the cards you took and the four arithmetic tiles in your place, and the number calculated at the end of the game will be your score.

name: How To Do Anything
description:
Welcome to your first day working for HowToDoAnything.biz. Our goal (well, our shareholder's goal) is to definitively build the world’s largest collection of "100% accurate" How-To guides.

Each player gets a How-To PROMPT, like "How To Make Money Fast", or "How To Survive an Animal Attack". The object of the game is to pitch your article to the CEO as a worthy addition to the site.

The twist? You'll be given an assortment of items (some you choose, some of which are random) and you must utilize this STUFF in your pitch. When it’s your turn, simply explain to the group how you could accomplish the task in your prompt using only the objects on your cards.

If the CEO likes your article the best, you get published! Will it make sense? Probably not! But we've got a site to build!

—description from the publisher

name: Minotaur Corridor
description:
One thousand years after Theseus defeated the Minotaur, a mysterious hanging garden appears in Crete. People are disappearing, and there are rumors the legendary Minotaur has returned. A group gathers to enter the labyrinth. One seeks his lost compatriots, another of the treasure sleeping beneath Crete. Yet another seeks the reward offered by the king to slay the monster. Crete has truly become an island of desires.

In Minotaur Corridor, players travel the labyrinth of the crumbling hanging garden and find treasures with the help of Guardian Cards. The guardians also help fight monsters, defeat the Minotaur, and survive events. Cards may be traded between players, but a battle ensues if the other player refuses the trade.

You may intentionally call the Minotaur for battle, or it may attack when the monster spots a player or the Minotaur Roars card is revealed. Defeating the minotaur ends the game and awards a large treasure. The game may also end when the deck runs out, resulting in no one needing to face the minotaur, or if only one player is left alive.

— translated and adapted from the translated rulebook

name: PowerPlay Pop
description:
PowerPlay Pop is a new tabletop board game designed to immerse gamers in the captivating world of hockey team management and thrilling head to head gameplay. It combines strategic decision-making with rapid-fire competition, challenging players to assemble their dream team and dominate the ice.

In the game, players strategically acquire Player Cards with varying skill levels and salaries, while engaging in head-to-head Pop-games with rapid-fire action. The goal is to lead your team to victory through shrewd roster decisions and mastering the strategic elements of the game. A little puck luck doesn't hurt either.

Roll the 2 game dice to start your turn. Move your trophy token ahead on the board in the amount shown on the dice. Each team on the board has a 1, 2, 3, or 4 star rating that corresponds to the 4 poppers on the board. Pop the corresponding popper to represent the opponent's team score. Pop the corresponding one represent the player's team score. For every pop game points are awarded as follows: Win = 2 points for the winning team, TIE = 1 point for each team, LOSS = 0 points for the losing team.

With its innovative mechanics and immersive experience, PowerPlay Pop is a must-have addition to any sports fan’s gaming collection, inviting players worldwide to join the excitement and become part of the PowerPlay Pop team.

name: DragonStrike: Storm of Dragons
description:
New missions and new rules for new dragonriders such as spellcasters and archers.

Hex tokens to play with four new dragons.

Extra 3'x3' mat compatible with the core mat to expand the play area for larger battles.

Components for four additional players, increasing player count to eight.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Real-time, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Programmed Movement

name: Carnival of Shadows
description:
Carnival of Shadows: Sinister Showdown is a thrilling fusion of tableau-building, worker placement, action selection, and deck building mechanics. In this game, players immerse themselves in the dark art of crafting and manipulating custom carnival attractions, where every aspect contributes to the chilling atmosphere. From the haunting melodies of eerie music to the menacing presence of larger-than-life mascots prowling the grounds, players have the opportunity to create an immersive and unforgettable experience for their unsuspecting attendees.

Your objective is to construct the most captivating and sinister exhibit, earning the favor of Mr. Shadow by executing his nefarious commands in any way possible. With a diverse cast of asymmetrical characters, players construct and oversee their own tableau, recruiting followers and enticing townsfolk to achieve their individual or sometimes shared objectives. Whether your aim is to claim souls, sow chaos, or even protect the innocent, players must utilize their unique abilities and strategies to outmaneuver their rivals and establish dominance over the fairgrounds, all in the pursuit of appeasing their enigmatic master.

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Horror, Mature / Adult, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Chaining, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Multi-Use Cards, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Evil Dead 2: The Board Game – Deluxe Edition
description:
The Deluxe Edition combines the base game, the Evil Dead 2: The Board Game – Extras Pack, some quality of life graphical improvements, and new rules for solo and co-op game modes.

The cooperative version of the game lets you play either by yourself or with others in true cooperative fashion without the possibility of a traitor.

name: LOVE(LA)PLACE
description:
37 cards, 3 suits, each with the same number repeated only once. These card suits wind around each other like a DNA double helix.

LOVE(LA)PLACE is a deck of cards that includes the numbers 0 to 19 in 3 suits. However, each number only exists in two of the three suits (with the exception of 0, 10, and 19, of which there is only one of each, with 0 being an unsuited card). Rules for many games were available on the publisher's website following the LOVE(LA)PLACE's release.

Triangular Situation, the rules that shipped with the deck, is a must-follow trick-taking game for two or three players. As for each turn, Players must play a card that matches the led suit, with the 0 card acting as a wild that may be played at any time. Regardless of suit, the highest card wins, with ties going to the later card played. In a 2-player game, a player sets aside their winning card where it can be seen, because the round ends when a color has won three tricks. The final winning card of the round is set aside and the other cards are returned to the deck, and when a color has won three rounds the last player who won with that colors wins the entire game.

The rules for a 3-player game, except the lead passes to the left instead of alternating, the winning card for each round is recorded and mixed back in with the other cards,

Before each round begins, players may play one face-down card for a maximum of three throughout the game, which will work toward a tiebreaker. If no color wins three times before players run out of cards, players compete in a round-long tiebreaker involving any cards turned face-down.

name: 十人のクノイチ (Ten Kunoichis)
description:
It is the witching hour. You should order your kunoichis to invade the homes of villains! Earn kobans (large Japanese golden coins) as a prize for the heads of villains killed by your kunoichis. Each night, you must launch one assault after another until the end of the game. But the key to winning may be deciding when to hold back...

In 10 Kunoichis, each player has a hand made up of the ten ninja cards. Villains are drawn and laid out, and players may choose one of their ninjas to attack. Choose carefully, because only certain ninjas can attack the different villains. When all players who chose a card are ready, everyone calls out "Seibai!" (Punish!) and reveal their cards. If only one player plays a card, they will defeat all the villains they can. If multiple players are involved, ninjas act from fastest to slowest, with lower numbers being faster. Each ninja defeats all the villains they can before the next ninja begins. Play continues until all ninjas are played or the villain deck runs out.

To keep everyone on their toes, each player may also declare "Ninpo!" once per game. Declaring Ninpo reverses the speed of the ninjas, with 10 becoming the fastest and 1 the slowest. The effect remains until another player declares "Ninpo!" and the speeds return to normal.

At the end of the game, the player with the most kobans is the winner. Keep an eye out for the round where the Evil Merchant appears, because he doubles the value of all villains currently in play!

— adapted from the publisher's description

name: 惨劇の夜会 (Sangeki no Yakai)
description:
In 惨劇の夜会 (Tragic Soirée), you and your friends work together, using your different abilities to escape from a Western-style mansion.

It is a game of one versus many, in which a single player acts as the wandering killer and his murderous maids, while the other five players hide and try to escape. The team fighting to escape should explore each room of the mansion and look for the items necessary for escape. The killer player must hunt the others until they are too injured to escape.

In the additional Last Night mode of play, the escaping team may add another player in the role of a detective, raising the maximum number of players to seven. To win in this scenario, the escaping players must open a safe before fleeing the mansion.
mechanics: Events, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Sibling
description:
Sibling is a game of creating larger groups of pieces on the board.

Except for the first move, players place two pieces at a time. These two must be on the same line on the board.

When no more pieces can be placed, the second largest groups are compared to each other and the owner of the larger group wins. Therefore, you need to grow your two large groups so that they do not merge with each other.

This game is included in Generic Board "Hexagonal" set.

name: Snaketrail
description:
Snaketrail is a loop-building game.

Players add shared pieces to the board on their turn, but they must always be added next to the piece placed by the opponent just before. When a loop of shared pieces is formed, the player with more pieces of his or her color inside the loop wins.

This game was inspired by Bill Taylor's Slimetrail and Don Green's Snailtrail.

This game included in Generic Game Discs Color Pack.

name: Nuts Sorting
description:
Nuts Sorting is a game using six colored pieces representing nuts.

Each player is responsible for three colors each and moves a piece to an empty cell or removes a group of any of their pieces. The player who has a single group per his/her color wins the game.
 
This game is included in Generic Game Discs Color Pack.

name: Fruits Platter
description:
Fruits Platter is a game in which players put together six colored pieces representing fruits according to their colors.

The direction of movement is determined by the color of the piece, and the pieces jump in a straight line toward the corresponding edge. Pieces that are jumped over are moved to the empty cell as a row.

The player who has all three colored pieces in his/her charge in one group per color wins.

This game is included in Generic Game Discs Color Pack.

name: Candy Chain
description:
Candy Chain is a game of six colored pieces representing candies.

Each player is responsible for three colors and removes one or two pieces from the board per turn. However, all pieces on the board must remain connected as a single group.

The first player to remove all two of his or her colors from the board wins.

This game is included in Generic Game Discs Color Pack.

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Lagobond Nails and Lagobond Hoppers
description:
This is a set of three promo cards, that came with the Usagi miniature, which itself is not part of the game.

The set contains two gear cards and a glossary card that explains their use.

The Lagobond Hoppers allows a survivor to "hop" around the battlefield, while the Lagobond Nails are a weapon that provide some control over future attacks.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Medieval, Miniatures, Prehistoric
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Indomitable Survivor: Lordsruin Titus
description:
This is a single miniature that can be used in the game, together with four related cards.

Lordsruin - Titus is packaged in a graphic box that includes:

1 x Lordsruin - Titus hard plastic miniature
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and scenic insert
1 x Origin Branch imdomitable King monster resource
1 x Lordsruin pattern
1 x Lordsruin pattern gear
1 x Install guide
1 x Large matte art print

In the strobing darkness

The indomitable monsters that stalk the darkness unchallenged tend to grow features not normally found in younger specimens of the species. Survivors brave and lucky enough to survive encounters with these monsters gain indomitable resources. These unusual components inspire new configurations of gear worthy of these hard won treasures.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Medieval, Miniatures, Prehistoric
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Conspiracy: Abyss Universe – Mode Solo
description:
On this occasion, with the help of our publisher and Pascal Quidault, who illustrated the game, we are happy to offer you a completely free SOLO MODE, to download, print and cut yourself at home.

I am only a fan of solo modes if they meet 3 requirements:


the game must not turn into a gas factory


(everything must remain as simple as possible)

The gaming experience should be analogous to playing against real opponents


(I hate when a single player mode ultimately leads to playing - another game, different from the one I like in “real” games

you have to be able to lose against the game


(I hate when a single player mode simply asks the player to try to beat his record from previous games. To have the pleasure of winning, you have to run the risk of defeat. Not simply making a lower score than the previous time )

It is in this direction that Charles and I know how to work.

And I don’t think we messed up too much?
Try it and tell us what you think!!

—description from the designer

A cette occasion, avec la complicité de notre éditeur et de Pascal Quidault, qui a illustré le jeu, nous sommes heureux de vous proposer un MODE SOLO complètement gratuit, à télécharger, imprimer et découper vous-même à la maison.

Je ne suis adepte des modes solos que si ils répondent à 3 impératifs:

le jeu ne doit pas se transformer en usine à gaz
(tout doit rester le plus simple possible)
L’expérience de jeu doit être analogue à celle du jeu contre des adversaires réels
(je déteste quand un mode solo conduit finalement à jouer à un autre jeu, différent de celui que j’aime en « vraies » parties
il faut pouvoir perdre contre le jeu
(je déteste quand un mode solo se contente de proposer au joueur de tenter de battre son record des parties précédentes. Pour avoir le plaisir de gagner, il faut courir le risque de la défaite. Pas simplement faire un moins bon score que la fois précédente)
C’est dans cette direction qu’avec Charles nous savons travaillé.

Et je pense qu’on s’est pas trop plantés ?
Essayez et dites nous ce que vous en pensez !!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: 玉乗り象さん (Elephant Ball Balancing Act)
description:
On the swaying ball. Both the elephant and the rules are shaking! While trying to get rid of all the cards in his hand as quickly as possible, Elephant on Ball must also think about leaving a valid hand in order to win as many mini-games as possible. There are three types of rules when playing cards, and it is important to use the cards in your hand so as not to be thrown out by the rules that change with each mini-game.

Elephant Ball Balancing Act is a shedding/trick-taking games where you try to win the mini games as well get rid of your cards. The trick to not falling off the top of a swaying ball is to not rush and move unnecessarily.

name: アメのちクモり時々ヒョウ (Ame Nochi Kumori Tokidoki Hyō)
description:
A strange phenomenon in which "impossible things" fall from the sky "Fafroshkies" In this town, candy, spiders and leopards falling from the sky has become commonplace!? Relying on the weather forecast, they try to collect "Fafroshikies"

Ame Nochi Kumori Tokidoki Hyō ("Rain, then Cloudy, Occasionally Hail" or "Candy, then Spiders, Occasionally Leopards") is a trick-taking and set collection game where you divide your 9 cards into 3 cards each and try to get the things falling from sky.

name: ゲームニャーケット99 (Game Marcat 99)
description:
A group of cats decided to create a board game each and distribute it on Game Marcat. In order to widely distribute your work: the game system and theme match, artwork is excellent, and you increase your awareness through advertisement.

Game Marcat 99 is a trick-taking game for 3 to 4 players. The winner is the cat who can create an excellent game and distribute it the most on Game Marcat.
publishers: 三ツ星まかろん (Three Star Macaron)

name: Portici Magica
description:
Portici Magica is a two-player card game that combines elements of strategy, luck and set collection into a fast-paced and addictive challenge, making it perfect for short but intense gaming sessions.

In a magical city, players must collect orbs and activate locations to accumulate victory points. At the start of the game, the 18 cards are shuffled and laid out on the table (partly covered, partly not) in four rows that form the City. Each row is arranged offset from the previous one.

During the game, players take turns picking a free card, i.e. with no other cards underneath. Each collected card can be either placed in the player's inventory, to add orbs and amulets, or activated if you have the necessary orbs in your inventory.

The game ends when all City cards have been collected. Players add up the points from the activated cards and additional points based on the type of amulet most present in their inventory. The winner is whoever has the highest score.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Rio 2016 Olympics
description:
A solo statistical replay game covering the events of the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro. The game uses charts and dice along with a set of rules for each individual sport and a data sheet with the competitor ratings.

The events covered are: Diving, Swimming,, Open Water Swimming, Synchro Swimming, Water Polo, Archery, Athletics (all track and field,, Marathon, Walk, Decathlon, Heptathlon, Badminton, Basketball, Boxing, Canoeing, Canoeing Slalom, Cycling Road and Track, Mountain Bike, BMX, Equestrian, Fencing, Field Hockey, Football, Gymnastics, Rhythmic Gymnastics, Trampoline, Handball, Judo, Modern Pentathlon, Rowing, Rugby Sevens, Sailing, Shooting, Table Tennis, Taekwondo, Tennis, Triathlon, Volleyball, Beach Volleyball, Weighlifting, Wrestling.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Keystone: North America (Second Edition)
description:
In Keystone: North America, you and your friends will take on the role of biologists and work to build an interconnected ecosystem through the careful placement of cards. Use skills, introduce important Keystone animals, and perform wildlife research to maximize your points.

Keystone: North America (Second Edition) offers multiple ways to play, updated rules and refined style! Go head-to-head against your friends in multiplayer and see who can build the healthiest ecosystem. Or experience a narrative adventure that will take you on a journey across North America with the Field Journal. This fully illustrated book contains a solo or co-op campaign where you will solve puzzles, learn about amazing animals, and explore the different ecosystems that make up North America.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Tags, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: The Eternaut: Three Brothers Expansion
description:
This expansion contains 3 new scenarios related to the main story. You will embody Victory, Javier, and Diego, three brothers and skilled veterans who have to complete a crucial mission to fight the alien invasion. This task requires skills and military tactics.

Features:
Customize weapons - Through the craft action, you may customize your weapons, unlocking special attacks.
Companions - Characters may have a companion, each one provides a unique ability to be used during the game.

Contains 1 rulebook, 30 additional cards, 3 storybooks, 55 additional map cards, 15 story & rule cards, 1 chronicle diary, 1 utility punchboard, and 2 secret boxes.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Sight
description:
Sight is a game played on an Alquerque board using the line of sight mechanics.

Players place their pieces on the available intersection, and if there is friendly pieces on the "line of sight" of this placement, another pieces are placed on top of those pieces to form stacks.

If the player already has his or her own stacks at the beginning of their turn, then must move a piece from one of the stacks to the next available intersection. The player who has no legal move loses the game.

This game is included in ''Generic Board Alquerq'' set.

name: Alquad
description:
Alquad is a pattern building game using the Alquerque board.

Players attempt to create a regular square by adding pieces to empty intersections and placing their own pieces at their vertices.

However, even if you complete a square, you lose if your opponent creates a larger rectangle on your next turn.

This game is included in ''Generic Board Alquerq'' set.

name: Collapse
description:
Collapse is a game inspired by block breaker games.

Players capture pieces by moving their piece in a straight line and colliding it with the opponent's piece. The player who cannot capture the opponent's piece first loses the game.

This game is included in ''Generic Board Alquerq'' set.

name: Planetary Sisters
description:
The seasons are changing, and the event that determines the tone of school life has arrived ─ yes, it's time for a house change! You gather the students to start a new life in the dormitory you oversee. Students who want friends with similar hobbies, students who want someone with similar passions, students who want more variety in their community... Build a sisterhood that satisfies all their requests and build the reputation of your dormitory family!

In Planetary Sisters, players draft a set of cards representing students with a variety of interests and contributions. Each player has a personal deck that they draw their hand from, with their hand representing the dormitory full of students. The cards in their hand are used to acquire cards from the central tableau. Players must decide which cards they would like to get rid of, but those cards may be taken by other players. Players must also take into account how the cards they use and acquire relate, because the difference between them affects who will be start player for the following round.

After players have drawn all their cards and drafted their full dormitory, cards are scored. Cards show one or more elements; there are common elements, such as Food and Animals, and less common elements, like Axe and Shield. There are also rare, unique elements, like Knight and Queen. Points are scored using special formulas involving the number of elements and the number of cards containing those elements. Bonuses are rewarded based on how the player's dormitory related to the cards left in the tableau. The 2-player rules add variety to the way a player's final hand and the tableau create a score.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Generic Game Discs Color Pack
description: Set of additional colored pieces for the Generic Board series, including rules for the four original games Snaketrail, Nuts Sorting, Fruits Platter, and Candy Chain, which use pieces of three to six colors.

name: Reigning Unicorns
description:
Reigning Unicorns is a game where players race to be the first to get rid of all of their cards. This is done by performing the card's actions with other players that are performing the same action. The first player to get rid of all of their cards is the Reigning Unicorn and gets to wear the Unicorn Headband. The first player to win 2 rounds wins the whole game!

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Star Wars – Return of the Jedi
description:
Imagine traveling to Tatooine, Dagobah, Endor, and the second Death Star with the Monopoly: Star Wars Return of the Jedi Edition game! Players must secure as many locations, transports, and droids as they can in an epic battle against the Galactic Empire. The more property a player secures, the more credits they'll be able to collect from other players. Players can use Speeder Bikes and X-Wings to strengthen their position. But beware the might of Darth Vader and the Emperor! The last player with credits when all other players have lost theirs, wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Monopoly: Bridgerton
description:
Gather ’round, Bridgerton fans! This edition of the Monopoly game features artwork, gameplay, and components inspired by the series on Netflix.
In this twist on classic Monopoly gameplay, players move around the board buying as many properties as they can to raise their social standing in the Ton.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Primates
description:
Primates is an evolutionary board game where you can explore the evolution of more than 100 different primate species.

Evolve and try to outmaneuver your opponents as you forage for food and build social bonds.

As your primates evolve, they gain special abilities.

Whether you prefer the agility of gibbons or the remarkable memory of chimpanzees, the choice is yours. You determine which evolutionary path to take.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trouble Game: On the Moon
description:
Danger! Moon mission astronauts-- race to safety first to win!

A galactic spin on the beloved game. Race against your fellow opponents, to save your astronauts. Roll die to avoid losing fuel, oxygen, and your rover. Be the first player to get all your astronauts into the airlock!

name: EDEN: 2133
description:
The year 2133, Earth is ravaged following The Collapse. Humanity finds itself scattered amongst the Solar System. A lone planet orbits into our reach, Eden. A strange planet that houses mysterious ruins, and an astonishing new element, code named "Edenite".

The Council of Humanity implores 6 of the most renown factions, each with the task of serving as stewards of this new marvel.

EDEN is a strategic wargame. You the player, control 1 of 6 said Factions. Station your Ark on the map, and protect it at all cost. Players will fight to control territories on the map using their Battle Deck, waging the lives of their units. Spend credits to build structures and use Hero Abilities that will grant you special perks. Manage your resources well, and time your offenses right.

Each turn you will move your forces, Utilize your Assets, and Battle your opponents.

Wield your Battle Deck against your foes and refine it, Evolve your Hero by Equipping Hero Abilities, and negotiate with allies and enemies.

Be the last player with your Ark intact
Or
Be the First to Capture 3 others.

UNITE, DIVIDE, CONQUER.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: 量子カノジョ (Ryoushi Kanojo)
description:
Your girlfriend exists in a highly probabilistic, quantum mechanical state. Whether she is good at studying, what she does after school, and her age are all uncertain. You must identify your girlfriend's attributes within the quantum fluctuations and make them converge on a single person..

In 量子カノジョ ("Quantum Girlfriend"), each player has one of six heroine cards on a stand, and they are the only player who cannot see which card it is. Each heroine card has three attributes: how good they are at studying, what she does after school, and her age. As the round progresses, players try to decide if the attributes in the center of the table apply to the heroine card that they cannot see. On a player’s turn, they either place an attribute card in the center of the table or call out “Observation!” If more than one attribute answering the same question are placed, they are stacked, creating the possibility that any of those attributes could be true.

Once “Observation!” is declared, all players look at their heroine card. If more than one attribute card of the same type are in the center of the table, those cards are shuffled and a random one is chosen to be included in the final attributes. If the final attributes apply to only one of the heroine cards in front of the players, that player receives 1 point. If the cards apply to more than one heroine card in play, then no player receives points. When a player receives their second point, they are the winner.

name: 魔王様のお引越し (Maō-sama no o Hikkoshi)
description:
Moving into the Demon Queen's castle began with the Demon Queen's reckless behavior. However, her goblin's stats include Smartness 3, so they stack their luggage vertically. Will the baggage pass through the door or not? If it doesn't pass, will the goblins be burned by the Demon Queen's hellfire!?

Players take on the role of the Demon Queen's goblins, and it's their job to decide if items in the real world around them will pass through the castle's doors. At the beginning of each round, a door card is drawn. A corresponding colored string shows the physical size of that door opening, and each player may examine that string for 5 seconds. Then a command card is drawn, with an item such as the top of a desk or the length of a curtain. The designated player chooses an item in the real-life environment that matches the item. If no item matches the command card, the turn ends and the next player begins by drawing a new command card.

Players vote whether the item or the door opening is larger. If all players vote the same way, the turn ends. If the decision is split, the item is measured and the correct players each receive a point. If only one player is correct, they gain extra points depending on the round. The game ends once round 4 is completed, the command cards run out, or a player scores their seventh point. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Victory Lane
description:
Jump into the driver’s seat and shift into gear. This is your chance to outlast your rivals and end the day in Victory Lane!

Victory Lane is a quick-playing, push-your-luck dice game. Players must balance upgrading their car while trying to maintain position on the track.

Object of the Game: Be the first to complete three laps while navigating dangerous corners, managing your car’s resources and planning for the perfect Pit strategy.

name: Auras
description:
In this two-player strategy game, each peg placed on the board has an "Aura" which influences the spaces and pegs around it. By means of careful placement, an empty space can be claimed, or an occupied space can be turned into extra points. As more areas of the board come under your control, you approach the end game with confidence. Auras is an abstract game which requires visualization of many possible patterns, and deciding which is best, defense or offense, plan ahead or take control?

—description from the publisher

name: Desperate Rescue
description:
Desperate Rescue is a 2-player abstract peg game similar to Norse tafl games. The players have asymmetrical forces and different goals. One player is attempting to rescue a prisoner from a dungeon, and the prison guards are out to thwart their efforts. The circular board adds a further twist to the game play as the rescuers attempt to open a path of escape for the unfortunate inmate of the castle keep. The guards, however, need to ensure that this doesn't happen. The basic moves include the traditional jump-and-capture variety but with some restrictions.

—description from the publisher

name: Duckit
description: Duckit is a trick taking card game for three players that uses part of a standard 52 card deck. Each round, a duck rank and trump suit is established. The 4's are penalty cards, and players lose points for each one they capture UNLESS they can capture all of them. In that case, they lose nothing and their opponents are penalized. The first person to capture a 4 gets the quacker - a bonus card remaining after the deal. This card might be useful in getting all of the 4's, or it might help you avoid them.

name: Red Tides: A Tale of New Caribbea
description:
Red Tides: A Tale of New Caribbea is a 1-4 player cooperative dice battler with RPG elements set in the fantastical world of New Caribbea. Choosing one of four unique factions, players will first hunt the high seas to sink or board merchants for their plunder and cannons before taking on powerful Pirate Captains who seek to put the players in their place and, in the end, the tyrannical pirate baron John Davies.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Different Dice Movement, Events, Interrupts, Market, Relative Movement, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Set-up

name: Judge Dredd: Block War Expansion
description:
This expansion for the Judge Dredd Miniatures Game introduces a whole new level of play to your tabletop – the (in)famous block wars of Mega-City One!

Each player builds their own block with unique characteristics, gathers their residents together, and then unleashes them on the self-satisfied citizens of a neighbouring block - who have had everything their own way for far too long! Included are new rules for use in the Judge Dredd Miniatures Game; new characters and units, new Armoury cards to add to your deck, and a brand-new Block War deck that brings the sheer violence and chaos of a block war to the tabletop – along with a lot of Judges!

The block war campaign allows players to marshal their forces, from common citizenry to the (self-proclaimed) elite forces of the Citi-Def, and then play through a number of battles that show the key moments of the block war. As the war escalates, new scenarios are unlocked, damage can be done to the enemy block, and with enough of a rival effort, you may just be able to destroy the physical foundations of a block and send it crashing into City Bottom in a fiery cloud of dust, rubble, and falling citizens.

The streets of Mega-City One have just become a lot more violent… Judge Dredd: Block War Expansion contains:

80-page Block Wars A5 book
Pad of 100 City Block datasheets
15-card Block War deck
Three new Armoury cards
Two rampaging resident figures (in Warlord ResinTM) – exclusive to this set!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Judge Dredd: Justice Department Pat Wagon
description:
After the Lawmaster, the Pat Wagon is the most commonly sighted Justice Department vehicle seen on the streets of Mega-City One. Designed to be flexible enough to bring the Law to citizen riots and armoured perps, as well as fulfil the grunt work of catch and meat wagon teams, the Pat Wagon is well respected amongst Judges for being able to take just about any punishment the streets can give.

Contains one resin/Warlord ResinTM vehicle and five game cards.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Elementary
description:
Elementary’s vision is to close the gap between scientists and non-scientists, by providing a game that is fun for both.

For scientists, Elementary is an interactive, scientifically correct and quick game. Great to play with colleagues, but also the perfect way to share your scientific passion with your friends and family.

For non-scientists, Elementary shows that physics is not as scary as it seems. You’ll be able to play around with elementary particles and energy-mass conversion within minutes, requiring zero physics knowledge.

Elementary can be played in two different ways, depending on your level of physics enthusiasm. Easy Mode is meant for the novice player: get to know the elementary particles by combining them into sets. Classic Mode is for those looking for more interaction: it involves anti-particles, technique and sabotage.

name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Hunting for Answers: Parallel Investigator
description:
Hunting for Answers is a print-and-play rules set for Arkham Horror: The Card Game that provides an alternate version of Rex Murphy, previously released in The Dunwich Legacy Investigator Expansion.

In order to play this investigator, a copy of the Arkham Horror: The Card Game core set is required, as well as a set of curse chaos tokens featured in The Innsmouth Conspiracy Campaign Expansion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Keystone: North America Coastal Expansion
description:
Immerse yourself in the beauty of North America's coastlines in the Coastal Expansion for Keystone: North America. Encounter 28 captivating new species and explore exciting new game mechanics that will challenge even the most seasoned biologists. Dive deep into the narrative with a brand-new field journal containing 10 solo and co-op story scenarios, each offering unique challenges and opportunities for discovery.

Expand your Keystone experience and discover the wonders of coastal ecosystems in this essential expansion. Whether you're a seasoned player or new to the game, the Coastal Expansion contains hours of exploration and enjoyment.

-description from publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Tags, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Greatest Beach Vacation
description:
Are you ready for sun and fun? In the Greatest Beach Vacation, you and your fellow players compete to experience the best beach vacation. Spend 5 days snorkeling, surfing, shopping, playing volleyball, jet skiing and building the best sand castle!

In this roll & write game, you will roll your dice and attempt to score the highest in your choice of six beach-vacation themed activities. Each activity will present its own challenges and rewards. After five rounds players compare their scores to see who had the best beach vacation ever.

Looking for even more vacation fun? Check out the other Greatest Vacation games, like Game Vacation and Vegas Vacation. More themes to be announced soon!

name: Greatest Game Vacation
description:
Are you ready for the best game vacation ever? In the Greatest Game Vacation, you and your fellow players compete to experience the best vacation at a game convention. Spend 5 days playing your favorite games, eating delicious food and making the best cosplay costume!

In this roll & write game, you will roll your dice and attempt to score the highest in your choice of six game-vacation themed activities. Each activity will present its own challenges and rewards. After five rounds players compare their scores to see who had the best game vacation ever.

Looking for even more vacation fun? Check out the other Greatest Vacation games, like Beach Vacation and Vegas Vacation. More themes to be announced soon!

name: TerraFyte
description:
You are a Warlord!

We have two planets: one known as TerraFyte and the other, Bitpaþ. These two planets have been locked in combat for countless years and things are bleak on both sides. The leaders of TerraFyte approach you. You are a little-known hero from a place called “Earth.” They think you have what it takes to help save their planet from total annihilation. Being a kindhearted soul, you are happy to help this poor planet and its people. There is only one problem, though: due to the war, the economy has fallen into shambles. The inhabitants had to change their currency into a crypto-currency called Banana Bitz. Using Banana Bitz is a challenge, as there are not many who are willing to work for them. Other well-known heroes won’t even think about taking Banana Bitz as payment or even as a gift! Fear not!
