There are those who are willing to work for this crypto-currency: monkeys and heroes that really, really need the work. You can ask heroes such as Chinchebula or Star Fish to help defend TerraFyte. They are willing to take any form of payment. Will you use military might to destroy the other planet? Or will you use diplomacy to end this war?

TerraFyte, created by the small indie group Arkidogo Interactive, is a customizable card game featuring a 6x2 board for intense 1v1 battles. Think Magic the Gathering meets Hearthstone with a space twist—imagine monkeys in spaceships battling it out, inspired by old RTS games and featuring charming pixel art. Players take turns at the same time switching priority to see who plays next. The game has a rhythm that most card games do not have. The gameplay strikes a balance between accessibility and depth, offering easy-to-learn mechanics with strategic depth. Season 0 launched with two prebuilt decks that players can mix and match.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Pirates, Political, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Automatic Resource Growth, Chaining, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Drawing, Events, Follow, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Income, Interrupts, Move Through Deck, Moving Multiple Units, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Ownership, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Single Loser Game, Stat Check Resolution, Track Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Zone of Control

name: アリスは１番前がいい (Alice ha ichiban maegai)
description:
You've been invited to a parade in Wonderland! You were excited to attend, but it looks like they haven't settled on the order of the parade. If you leave it up to the residents of Wonderland, there's no telling when the parade could start. "We'll never get anywhere like this!" shouts the Queen of Hearts. "Let's ask a third party to decide it fairly!" And just like that, you're in charge. Choose how you want to organize the parade, and let's get this show on the road!

In アリスは１番前がいい (Alice should be in front), five Row Cards showing residents of Wonderland (the Queen of Hearts, the Mad Hatter, the Cheshire Cat, Alice, and the White Rabbit) form a parade line. There is a deck of Resident Cards showing these same residents, with each card displaying a priority letter from "A" to "H" and a majority value of 1, 1.5, or 2. All of a character's Resident Cards show the same action, but they will have different letters and values. Each player has a hand of two resident cards, and there is a common area with as many face-up resident cards as there are players.

Each turn, all players choose one of the cards in their hand and reveal it simultaneously. Players then acquire a card from the common area in order of priority. The played card's ability then activates, which rearranges the Row Cards in the parade, and the played card is placed in a column of matching cards in front of the player. After a pre-determined number of rounds have passed, the Row Cards in the 2nd and 4th positions are "awakened" and flipped over, revealing additional scoring rules.

After a number of turns have passed based on the player count, players receive victory points. A player receives 1 victory point if they have the highest value of Resident Cards for a character. The character at the front of the parade line is worth 2 victory points. Players also receive bonuses based on the awakened Row Cards. If any player has reached 10 victory points, the game ends, and the player with the most victory points wins. If that condition isn't reached, the game continues until someone reaches 10 points, with the ties going to the player who scored the most points in the final round.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Selection Order Bid

name: Echoes of the Sundering
description:
You have come to the Rooted Soul, the massive tree that stands on the border of the Anwyn Valley, in response to a crisis. For years a poisonous fog has filled the Valley. Soon it will expand and swallow up the rest of the land. Some of you have a nearby hamlet or village you call home. Some of you have heard that there are great and ancient secrets hidden in the Valley. Some of you long for a chance to prove your prowess. But all of you agree that the fog must be stopped before it poisons the world.

Echoes of the Sundering is a 1-5 player cooperative, open-world, deck construction adventure taking over 30 hours to complete. Players will create a party of heroes and explore the valley through a beautifully illustrated map book. Along the way, they will face dynamic, narrative-driven encounters and should they succeed, will grow in power gaining new cards to add to their deck and new items to complement their play style! The story reacts to players' decisions and no two play-throughs will be the same!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Irole
description:
Once upon a time, there was a girl who was blind. Four girls who were her friends wanted to teach her about the colors. The four girls decided to show their friend the nature of color by acting out the colors themselves.

This is a competitive card game where you compare the strength of the numbers written on the cards and reduce your opponent's "life" from 10 to 0. Each card has a color, and each color has a special power. Use the power of colors and the abilities of the cards to defeat your opponent.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Hand Management, Take That
publishers: ヴィレッジ・ブリッジ (VillageBridge)

name: Air Express
description:
You have built an airship company to acquire wealth and fame. The world of airships is still in its infancy. Who will grasp the trend, overcome obstacles, and win the title of best in the industry? Embark on an airship delivery game!

In a normal delivery game, you would load customers and cargo onto your own airship from the space where your piece is located, transport them to their destination, and earn victory points and money! So far it's just as you can imagine!

However, to move this airship in Air Express, you don't play a card from your hand or roll a die! Manipulate rolling balls that represent your crew — the board tilts as if you were steering it! — and try to drop them in the right space! You can truly feel the uncertainty of operating an airship! And without a license!

How many balls do you use? Will you modify the airship to increase its payload? Which course will you take to your destination? There are so many details to consider!

Choose the request card for the square you are in and load it with your luggage. Decide which marbles to use and roll them well by maneuvering. When you arrive at your destination, get victory points or money equal to the reward value! The player who earns a certain number of points based on the number of players wins!
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver
publishers: Lovely Creations Boardgame Lab, るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: BamBoom
description:
Tricks, traps and pandas… so many pandas! BamBoom is a strategic card game for 2-4 that pits armies of pandas against each other in a frantic nuclear arms race. Featuring cartoon style violence, unexpected twists and more panda puns than you can shake a stick of bamboo at, BamBoom is recommended for players aged 10+.

Grow your panda army and defend your camp against the tricks aimed at you by your opponents. Go on the offensive to become the first to gather four nuke parts and one nuke shell and establish nuclear dominance–but beware! Traps lurk in the deck, ready to be sprung at the most inopportune time. Each turn starts by triggering cards you already have in your camp, making a long-term strategy a must. When you draw a new card, you have the opportunity to attack another player. If victorious you can take a nuke piece from them, but be warned–if you lose, they will be taking one of yours. Players are limited by a certain number of cards they can hold, forcing you to employ strategy and cunning to secure your victory.

In a fast-paced game of twists and traps, only one thing is certain: nuclear war has never been this cute.

—description from the publisher

name: All Time Wrestling: A New Dawn
description: Expansion for All Time Wrestling that includes 4 new personas, 10 attack cards with special abilities and 10 new wrestling abilities to existing legends in the base game: Kurt Angle, Randy Savage, Andre the Giant & The British Bulldog.

name: Clone-a-Saurus: The Miniatures Game
description:
"War on "Petrel's Paradise"! Five Companies vie for control to restart "Project Clone-a-Saurus" and corner the market on the production of dinosaurs! Little do they know, it's open season and the island's dinosaurs are doing the hunting."

Clone-a-Saurus: The Miniatures Game is a tabletop skirmish game that allows players to simulate the thrilling clash between Predator vs Prey! Players can play as either Humans or Dinosaurs and take part in fun and dynamic battles 66 million years in the making! Supporting both Dino v Human and Dino v Dino combat, Clone-a-Saurus: TMG is the tabletop game for dinosaur enthusiasts and wargamers alike!

—description from the designer
categories: Miniatures, Prehistoric, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Phase Order

name: I'm stuck in the lift
description:
Good morning ma'am, I'm from my company.
Make no mistake, I always ace my delivery.
Take my card, my ID, and up the floors I'm gone.
But when the lift doors opne to aservice cone.
My quest is blown.
My heart and lift drop like a stone.
Now I atone by do'in it all over again,
This time be quick, get stars and win the game.

name: Paris 1900 Olympics
description:
A solo statistical replay game covering the events of the 1900 Olympic Games in Paris. The game uses charts and dice along with a set of rules for each individual sport and a data sheet with the competitor ratings.

It covers 16 different sports of the Games - Archery, Athletics, Croquet, Cycling, Equestrianism, Fencing, Soccer, Field Hockey, Gymnastics, Polo, Rowing, Sailing, Shooting, Swimming, Tennis and Water Polo - It is missing only the sports with 2 or fewer competitors.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bankagame
description:
Players choose their pointer and place counters on the sheet.
Banker announces the number that he chooses and sets the wheel in motion.
Backed pointers showing higher cards than the bankers are paid out at evens.
Tues and lower cards are taken by banker.

Also includes pontoon football game mode.

name: らくらく冒険者の幸せ異世界ライフ　ミニ拡張　～冒険者たちの間奏曲～ (Rakuraku Boukensha no Shiawase Isekai Life Mini Kakuchou ~Boukenshatachi No Kansoukyoku~)
description: The first expansion is a mini-expansion designed for 1-2 player counts, with the appearance of NPC adventurers. These NPCs can take on quests, but risk failing and turning it into an emergency quest.

name: Ducks in a Row
description:
Will you play your Ducks to your Row or add them to the pond to increase the value for all players. Can you swing the game in your favour, through triggering your ducks’ special abilities when you play them to your row?

Each round sees players balancing their hand of duck cards. Choosing to play to the shared pond to increase the value of ducks in everyone’s row. Or playing to your row, enabling you to trigger your ducks’ special abilities.

Timing can make all the difference when triggering a duck’s special power.

Each of the six families of duck has their own game changing abilities.

• Splash - Scare off a duck from the pond.
• Egg - Draw an extra card from the draw pile.
• Nest - Rehome a duck from your duck house.
• Head - Select up to two cards from your hand and swap them
with another player.
• Feather - Add a card to your hand from someone else’s duck
house or the discard pile.
• Foot - Draw a card from the persuasion deck to secretly
change the value of a column in the pond.

Everyone plays simultaneously face down indicating row or pond using their location selection card. Once everyone reveals their chosen card the real test starts, each player now plays their card from lowest value to highest value. Will two ducks clash, leaving one or more homeless? Will you trigger your duck’s ability with perfect timing to take full advantage of their power?

If you balance your hand of cards well, you'll be sure to ruffle the feathers of other players and come out on top in the pecking order.

Played over several hands, the winner will be the first player to 40 points. The variety of suits allows game play from two to eight players, and game play lasts between 20 to 40 minutes.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Ordering, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: Primitive War: The Miniatures Game
description:
During the height of the Vietnam War, an American search and rescue team known as Vulture Squad is sent to an isolated jungle valley to uncover the fate of a missing Green Beret platoon. As they hunt through the primordial jungle depths of the valley, they discover ancient horrors that not only threaten to unravel their minds, but to end their lives as well! When the casualties mount, the men of Vulture Squad must abandon their human nature and give in to their savage instincts in order to survive! ​

Embark on a suicide mission within the lush jungle valley, taking on the role of either Vulture Squad or the Dogs of War. Your objective is to outsmart and hunt your opponent while swiftly completing the mission. In this primeval jungle, danger takes many forms! Beware not only of enemy soldiers but of the jungle valley's dinosaurs that stalk the jungle with predatory intent. Their gaze is fixed and their stomachs yearn to feast on the ultimate prey... You!​

Set against the backdrop of the first book, Opiate Undertow, players have access to 3 In-Game factions; the Americans, the Russians, and the Dinosaurs!

Each match centers around a series of Objectives that a player must complete in order to achieve their mission and win the game. The game is centered around 3 game modes:

​Primitive Warrior: Players take control of either Human faction and compete against each other and achieve victory on behalf of their country. Players can play a free-mode game, a pre-written scenario, or a full campaign based on the events that took place in the first novel as well as all new missions created by the series' Author!

Hunted: Players take control of either the Humans or Dinosaurs to compete in a battle of tenacity and wits. Each player has two objectives, Survive and Hunt! Players can play a free-mode match or a scenario based on the events of the first novel!

Primitive War: It's a three-way fight for supremacy in the Valley! The Americans face off against the Russians to complete their mission... but the jungle is filled to the brim with vicious dinosaurs that are looking to make the invasive humans their lunch! Who will walk away victorious?

Primitive War: The Miniatures Game is a Tabletop Skirmish Game that uses a modified set of rules from Clone-a-Saurus that combines traditional wargaming with the fluid and chaotic violence of a rampaging dinosaur!

—description from designer
categories: Miniatures, Prehistoric, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Vietnam War
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Rally J
description:
You and your car, Ghost, have to compete in this year's rally race! Experience the simulated excitement of racing by maneuvering through tricky track, weighing risk and strategy between each heart-stopping turn. Do dice really do this? One can only hope! Good luck!

Fuel Phase

Move the Fuel marker down one spot.

Draw Phase

Draw Track cards face up equal to your current Speed and place them side by side. For example, if your Speed is 3, draw 3 Track cards.

Roll Phase

Roll Xd6 where X is equal to your current Speed. For example, if your Speed is 4, roll 4d6. This applies even if there are fewer Track cards in play than what is showing on the Speed card.

Maneuver Phase

Sum the value of the dice rolled and compare that to the sum of the Track cards in play. If the value rolled is equal to or greater than the sum of the Track cards, rotate the Speed card to the next higher Speed.

If the value rolled is less than the sum of the Track cards, do not rotate the Speed card. You must now decide how to make up the difference so it is equal to the sum of the Track cards. You can do that by doing any of the following:


Reduce your Fuel by 1 to add 1 to the sum of your dice.
Reduce your Health by 1 to add 1 to the sum of your dice.
Reduce your Speed by 1 (to a minimum of 1) to add 1 to the sum of your dice.


Discard the Track cards in play.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Racing, Sports

name: Eat Zem All: Ze Pack 01 Dylan
description: Dylan is ready to fight until his last breath to protect what is left of humanity. His keen senses are on the alert, he strings his crossbow with deadly precision.

name: Leyes & Lobbies
description:
Leyes & Lobbies represents the Argentine legislative system.

It is played with 3 to 12 participants, but the ideal is to play it between 4 to 6 so that there are crosses, without losing dynamism.

The objective is to get the laws that you get randomly approved when the law cards are dealt. For this you have to associate with other players and receive the support of powerful groups.

Depending on whether some of your laws are approved, you will receive more or less support, so the player must also design a game strategy, why they are going to fight first, what they have, etc.

name: Duped
description:
2-5 players attempt to score the most points while foiling their opponents in this take-that style card game.
After each round, cards will score their numerical value, but ONLY if they are solitary...any duplicated cards will not score points, but earn chips to help foil other players in the following round. Once all players have had one deal, the player with the most points wins! Try not to get Duped!

—description from the designer

name: Plate It Up
description:
Plate It Up is a party game of culinary creativity for up to 6 players. Each player takes on the role of an up-and-coming chef in a one-of-a-kind cooking competition. 

Inspired by a Scenario and Star Ingredient, chosen by the Head Chef. All players, Head Chef Included, secretly craft their own unique dish using a random assortment of ingredients and compete for culinary supremacy!

With over 350 scenarios and ingredients, Plate It Up is stocked with endless fun to be had again and again! 

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Ticket to Ride Syria (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: A fan-made expansion featuring the map of Syria, in which bonus points are accumulated by connecting surrounding countries and collecting ingredients for typical Syrian dishes. Learn more about the country's rich history with references to the Garden of Eden and the first alphabet in Ugarit.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Transportation

name: Roll Initiative: The Elimination Party Game!
description:
Roll Initiative is a thrilling and fast-paced tabletop party game crafted for 3-6 players. It strikes a perfect balance between simplicity and strategy, featuring rules that are easily grasped, allowing players to dive into the excitement within minutes.

The objective of the game is to roll your die and survive through round-based turns by rolling a higher number than your companions. Each player wields a character card that gives them unique abilities, such as the power to influence another player’s roll, boost their own roll, or make other players drink.

To make the game even more interesting, when losing a round you don’t just lose your life, you must drink it. Each round of the game offers a unique experience with endless combinations of rolls and abilities. Only one can claim victory and as long as your cups are filled to the brim, it’s considered anyone’s game!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: コンベアパニック！ (Konbea Panikku!)
description:
You are the owner of a workshop! Let's create wonderful products to become bigger and more famous than other workshops--and maybe interfere with the competition a bit. The battle to become the No. 1 workshop in this city begins!

コンベアパニック！ (Conveyor Panic!) is a game of manufacturing and expansion. You'll gain production power from the mechanical animals in your hand. Use these helpers to produce products from the central conveyor to earn fame. You can also build more efficient mechanical animals from the central area. Don't forget about the work cards, which have a variety of special effects.

Each player has their own personal conveyor, which functions like the deck in a deck-builder. Adjust the order and timing of the cards on your conveyor to draw your ideal hand. Earns 8 fame points faster than anyone else to win!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Market, Open Drafting, Resource Queue

name: Carcassonne: Snakes and Ladders
description:
A completely new type of mini-expansion for Carcassonne!
During your journey across the Carcassonne scoreboard you will meet friendly people who will help you up the ladders. But be careful, there are also dangerous snakes that will eat you and set you back in the points race.

The expansion comes as a sticker for the scoreboard.
You can stick this on the back of your existing scoreboard or order a stickered scoreboard from us.

Setup
Use the Snakes & Ladders-scoreboard instead of the usual one. Then, as usual, you place a meeple from each player on field 0.

Gameplay
This expansion does not change the regular gameplay.
Follow the steps as usual 1. Place a land tile, 2. Place a meeple and 3. Score points.

Score points:
As in the basic game, you count the points you collect in the game on this scoreboard. However, there are some special fields where the scoring meeples are moved.
• On fields 1, 16 and 32 is a bottom of a ladder. This is marked by a person.
• On the fields 13, 31, 39 and 48 is the head of a snake.
After you have scored everything, you look on the scoreboard where the scoring meeples are.
• If a scoring meeple is at the bottom of a ladder, it climbs "up" and is now at the end of the ladder.
• If a scoring meeple is at a snake's head, it is "eaten" and moves to the end of the snake's tail
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Map Addition, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Data Monsters: Gather and Measure
description:
Data Monsters is a trading card game for data scientists and nerds.

The players represent R&D laboratories. Each player has their own deck of cards, representing Monsters, Tools and Hacks. By playing these cards and activating their abilities, they try to defeat a card from the Challenge deck, representing a software project.

When the Challenge deck is empty, the player who has defeated the most valuable Challenges has won the game.

name: High Seas Battles
description:
A beer and pretzel game designed to be fast and fun with minimal rules. Each player controls a sailing ship attempting to capture or sink the other player's ship. Each turn player roll dice to determine which actions they can take such as maneuver, fire or reload cannons, start a boarding action, and more in an attempt to be victorious on the high seas!

—description from the designer

name: À la louche
description:
In this quiz game, your answer is always a number. Nonetheless, we generally don't expect you to find the exact answer, but rather to give a range in which it is. The smaller the range, the more points you get! So here's one: how many correct answers will you give? 12 to 15? Or more 4 to 6?
The game ends when a player reaches 15 points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Capture: A Medieval Wargame – Expansion Pack #1: Terrible Treasures
description: Kickstarter Exclusive. An 8 card expansion pack for the game... Terrible Treasures. It includes new Treasure cards for the game that do some very out-of-the-box things.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Dungeon Dice Online: Dark Ritual
description: Dungeon Dice Online: Dark Ritual (～ダンジョンダイスオンライン～　拡張第1弾『暗黒の儀式』) is the first expansion for Dungeon Dice Online, introducing two new jobs - the necromancer and the dark knight - as well as a new Damage Token mechanic, with skills that deal damage to you when used and monsters that strike at the start of combat.
publishers: あんきろわーくす (Ankilo Works)

name: オールナイトサモナー (All Night Summoner)
description:
At a magic school where aspiring magicians gather from all over the world, a dangerous group of girls are on a deadline! After a long vacation, five students haven't started summoning class assignment that's due tomorrow. The assignment: Catch a devil in your magic cauldron. Even if a student stayed up all night, it would be impossible. After trying to figure out how to finish in a signle day, they have an idea. "What if we stay up all night and work together?" So, five classmates have one last chance. Can they finish the assignment tonight, or will the night finish them?

オールナイトサモナー (All Night Summoner) is a cooperative game that for 1 to 5 players. If the player secures all the Tasudebi-kun Cards in in the deck before the timer reaches the skull, the players win. If the timer passes the skull, all players lose. In the advanced modes, if more than 3 Tasudebi-kun Cards are in play at once, the players will also lose.

On their turn, a player summons 1 to 3 Spirit Cards. Matching Spirits are stacked together in columns. Players then use either one matching Spirit Card or two different Spirits to form a contract with a one Spirit, which puts the Spirit face-up in front of them. The cards spent on the contract turn into Magic Points, which may be used to cast spells unique to each character. After drawing a new card, players may capture Tasudebi-kun Cards by paying matching contracted Spirits. If the timer has not reached the skull at this time, player now advance the timer. Be careful! Once the timer hits the red zone, players experience a Summoner's High, and they are no longer able to speak except to say "Dangerous!" Fortunately, they can also accomplish more than one contract per turn.

If any Spirit column contains three or more matching Spirits, it causes a rampage! The Spirits are discarded and the timer advances one space for each type of Spirit discarded. Players generally have one more turn to finish the game after the timer runs out, but if a rampage pushes the timer past the skull, the game ends immediately.

The first edition of All Night Summoner includes a crossover collaboration! Roko, one of the students from Discipline: 3 Years at Jeremiah School of Magic and Witches Whisk by 636GAMES, is available as a fully playable character.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: 沈黙ノ艦長 (Captain Silence)
description:
One player will be the captain of the space battleship, and the rest will be the crew. The crew reads a specified number of cards and reports the damage to the battleship being attacked to the captain. The time limit is only 1 minute, so there is no time to submit the reports in order. Players playing the role of captain should listen carefully to reports that can be heard overlapping other people's voices.

After 1 minute, the captain instructs the warp to the location with the fewest enemies, and if the player can fire the main gun at the location with the most enemies, the player wins.

This is a masterpiece of a party game that allows you to relive the world of movies and manga in a short time.

name: Maze Run
description:
Maze Run is a game where the first one to reach the exit wins. Its mechanics involve moving the maze and rotating the tiles, creating a strategy to win. Additionally, players will have the help of power treasures to gain an advantage and emerge victorious in this thrilling competition.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hila-dos
description:
Challenge your mind and concentration! 6 games in 1! Have fun with 6 different game modes and discover what makes these odd couples tick.he game contains 34 cards with four basic designs, a dice, and a turn counter. The game has four basic and two advanced modes. To start you shuffle the cards and to win you have to have more matches of disparate pairs than others.

The play modes are:

detail: match cards with close ups, colors must coincide
reflection: match card images with the exact reflection
shape: match two cards with the same shape and orientation but different color
opposite color: match card images with the reflection and opposite color
5x1: use the counter, roll the dice and begin the chase to match the pairs as indicated (basically the die faces are the above options)
random: fold counter on half and follow the arrows to perform what the die may say

name: Valhalla: King of the Hill
description: This expansion contains 8 cards and a miniature. The player who won the first battle in the game becomes the King of the Hill. This status grants him additional bonuses if nobody attacks him and also encourages other players to fight against him to become King of the Hill themselves.

name: Of Popes & Plagues
description:
Of Popes & Plagues allows 2-6 players to recreate Middle Ages and the outbreak of plague and pestilence. This is not a reprint of our cult classic Plague & Pestilence, rather a recreation with the addition of the Inquisition and reworking of many game mechanics.

This release will include the base mechanics of building up your village and population and then fighting to outlast your opponents once the plague breaks out… he who dies last wins. Gotcha cards and die rolls are to affect the outcome but the player must now make many more subtle decisions about when and what to build and when to focus on beating other players; populations down.

Tray, Jennifer, and Hillary have made modifications and additions to add depth and flavor to the game while keeping it accessible to family gamers.

Much of the base artwork has been retained, with additional cards (Inquisition, Knights Templar and Hospitaller, Monastery and Corsair Raid) added and the medieval feel maintained with the complete game colorized using an illuminated manuscript style.

—description from the publisher

name: Requiem: Downfall of Magic – Gifts of Death
description: The stretch goals box of Requiem: Downfall of Magic Kickstarter campaign. This expansion contains 4 additional Kickstarter exclusive heroes with new skills and strategies, 8 new companions to help your quest and 5 additional boss fight to test your skills and alternative enemies miniatures.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Linked Up Game: Emoji
description:
Link up expressive emojis in this fun game of making connections! Start with four links and play them on the board to connect the dots. For each connection you make, you earn cards. collect more links, play skillfully, and thwart your opponents to get ahead. If you're the first to complete a set of cards, you win! With quick play and compelling strategy, you'll want to link up again and again!

—description from the publisher

name: Bounce Off: Pop Out
description:
Set the timer and bounce the balls in to match the card or watch it blow!

Each player gets a card with a shape, players then set time and then try to bounce their balls into the basket matching the shape of their card. First player to successfully match their card wins!

name: Requiem: Downfall of Magic – Abomination
description: A expansion for Requiem: Downfall of Magic. This expansion contains a new quest with a epic boss fight. This is free with "The Order" or "Inner Circle" pledge.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Requiem: Downfall of Magic – Merciless Hunt
description:
A new 10-quest campaign will lead you on the trail of a mysterious beast. The creature is leaving a cloud of death and magic in its wake, spreading terror in the town of Nassesdorf, in the deep of the Black Forest. Those fortunate enough to cross its path have died, while the unfortunate have been transformed into hellish creatures.
But the beast is shrouded in mystery, and it will be up to you to investigate and uncover the truth about its presence.

New Enemies await you: The Beast, the Infected, and the Werewolves as well as an enigmatic new Companion: Colette the Red Hood!

—description from the publisher

An expansion for Requiem: Downfall of Magic. It is a 10 quests narrative campaign of 15-18 hours of gameplay. This expansion add 6 new endings, a recurring boss which will hunt you down every quest, a new investigation mechanics and a new hero.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Requiem: Downfall of Magic – Selene
description:
This Story-Expansion extends Requiem's lore and adds exciting new gameplay elements and a new Story consisting of 4 Quests.

The protagonist of the expansion is Selene, a Titanid represented by a huge and spectacular miniature, accompanied by her Handmaids, women mutated by her magical power.

An ancient pagan Temple in the heart of the forest seems to be the focus of mysterious supernatural activity, members of the Order are sent to investigate, but what they find will far exceed any expectations...

The Selene Expansion introduces many narrative elements in the intense and challenging Boss fight against the Titanid. Choices and situations will bring the fight to an end with as many as 4 possible endings.

In addition, this expansion introduces a new Potion: the Luckybrew, which can alter the course of fate. This Potion can also be included in the main Requiem Campaign, adding more opportunities for the Heroes.

Finally, one more new feature: the Class Skills. These introduce a new type of Skill Cards, linked not to the Hero but directly to their Class. Through these cards, each time you level up and gain a new skill, you can choose whether to add a Skill of your Hero or a Skill of their Class. This will allow you to customize your Character further and try out new and unseen Builds.
Like the new Potion, Class Skills will also be able to be added to the main Campaign!

—description from the publisher'

A mini-campaign for Requiem: Downfall of Magic that add 6 hours of gameplay. This contains 4 new quests, 4 new endings, a narrative boss fight and a new class skills for the heroes.

Crossover Expansion!
You will find content to play Selene in Requiem: Downfall of Magic, and in the games of the Black Rose Wars saga.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Mini Ladder Ball
description: Rapid fire shooting race, players shoot at the same time. Shoot until you hit a target, moving one rung up per target you hit. Winner is first to place their stick at the star!

name: Requiem: Downfall of Magic – Drunae
description:
From the misty swamps of the Dachauer Moos rises a new threat. An ancient pagan cult forgotten for centuries seems to have been reborn from the fetid waters of the marshes.
A mysterious Druid, dedicated to the dark arts, has gathered an army of fanatics under him. The Order has sent an initial group to investigate, but there has been no news for weeks now. It is therefore up to you to discover the secret lurking in the swamp's thick mists.

Drunae adds a new campaign consisting of 5 Quests, a new setting with new areas to explore, and new terrible Enemies to face.

The dreadful Druni Warriors will continually ambush you in the mists of the swamp, while the Shamanesses will unleash the forces of nature against you.

Not only that, a new Nemesis will put your skills to the test.
Agorix, once Magister of the Black Rose, has long since chosen the Druidic school's darkest and most corrupt path, deciding to exact revenge against so-called "civilization."

—description from the publisher

A mini-campaign for Requiem: Downfall of Magic of 8 hours of gameplay. This contains 5 new quests, 3 new endings, 1 new enemy faction and a new setting (swamp).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Requiem: Downfall of Magic – Istvan
description: A crossover expansion from Requiem: Downfall of Magic which is compatible with Black Rose Wars, Black Rose Wars: Rebirth And Nova Aetas Renaissance. Playable as a new hero in Requiem: Downfall of Magic, as a new mage for Black Rose Wars and BRW: Rebirth and as a new hero in Nova Aetas Renaissance.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: The One In Question: Harry Potter
description: One player picks a trivia question card from the trivia deck while other players review their cards and choose a character they think fits the answer. When all players have placed their card down, the player who chose the trivia card, turns over the character cards. Everyone who got it wrong is eliminated, next round continues. Last player standing wins!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: 요괴잡는 (Yogoejabneun)
description:
Monsters from many countries around the world have appeared. You must complete a magic spell to catch the monsters. Who will be the first to complete the magic spell and catch the monsters?

In 요괴잡는 (Catching Monsters), each player starts with a frame, a large monster card, and a transparent starter puzzle card. Each puzzle card covers part of the monster card. Players race to find four more puzzle cards that completely cover the monster image and capture the card. When all but one player has completed their puzzle, the round ends. Players pass their starter puzzle card to the left and begin a new round. The first player to capture four monster cards wins the game!

You can also play solo or cooperatively. This game is a collaboration between Yozzle Puzzle and the Meoshi World series of books.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Race, Real-Time, Score-and-Reset Game

name: PROFI-T-ABILTY
description:
PROFI-T-ABILITY is Hungary's first logistics board game with unique 3D printed elements, which are also available in a unique logo or labeled version.
The board game does not require logistics experience, but it develops financial, economic and logical skills, and encourages strategic thinking regardless of age. It is most ideal with 4 people, but can be played between 2-8 people.
The game shows the process of logistics, during which we have to adapt to today's unpredictable market conditions and changing trends. The goal is to develop your strategy and defeat your competitors. Be the best logistics specialist on the market, achieve the most PROFI-T.

—description from the publiser

A PROFI-T-ABILITY Magyarország első logisztikai társasjátéka, egyedi 3D nyomtatott elemekkel, amelyek elérhetőek egyedi logózott vagy feliratozott verzióban is.
A társasjáték nem igényel logisztikai tapasztalatot, azonban fejleszti a pénzügyi, gazdasági és logikai készségeket, továbbá stratégiai gondolkodásra ösztönöz kortól függetlenül. 4 fővel a legideálisabb, de játszható 2-8 fő között.
A játék a logisztika folyamatát mutatja be, mely során alkalmazkodnunk kell a mai kiszámíthatatlan piaci körülményekhez, változó trendekhez. A cél az, hogy kialakítsd a stratégiád és legyőzd versenytársaidat. Légy Te a legjobb logisztikai szakember a piacon, érd el Te a legtöbb PROFI-T-ot.

—description from the publiser (Hungarian)

name: Safari Witness
description:
With the sun sets, darkness reveals hidden secrets, crimes unfold amidst the Safari! Witnesses show up racing against time to assist the police in swiftly solving the crime cases.

In this game, as a crime witness, your goal is to provide as many valid clues as possible within a limited time to help police swiftly solve the crime. The game ends when a player obtains 10 Mugshots, and player with the highest score wins the game. With the Case Module and Advanced Mode, customize your gameplay experience by adding individual player objectives and activating special abilities through successful clue identification.

Unleash your inner detective, navigate the wilds of the Safari, and prove yourself as the ultimate Safari Crime Witness.

name: Mickey's Playground
description:
A Disney Question and Answer Game.

Players move Mickey, Minnie, Donald and Daisy on a path to School, where each move gives them an opportunity to earn a card by answering one of the questions. The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Pyramology
description:
There are 70 pyramids, all unique, using four colours which have a numeric value. All you have to do is match the colours of the pyramids to score the corresponding points. As the game progresses it gets more difficult, first matching just one face of a pyramid, then two, three, and finally four faces by placing pyramids into the 3 x 3 base and stacking the pyramids vertically.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Matching, Square Grid, Stacking and Balancing

name: どうぶつサッカー (Dōbutsu sakkā)
description:
どうぶつサッカー (a.k.a. Dōbutsu sakkā, which means "animal soccer") is a soccer-themed cousin of the simple Shogi variant Let's Catch the Lion! which replaces capture/promotion of a king with movement of a shared soccer ball.

Player pieces can move one space orthogonally or diagonally. Moving onto the soccer ball token allows kicking it either one or two spaces in one of the directions indicated on the piece. If the ball is kicked to another of a player's pieces, that counts as a pass and the receiving piece can kick it again.

Kick the ball into the opponent's goal area to win!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Sports
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Square Grid

name: Magic Maze: The Little Sister
description:
The Little Sister is a brand new character in the Magic Maze universe.

First included in Magic Maze Tower, this mini-expansion allows you to play with the Little Sister in the original Magic Maze game.

The expansion contains 2 new tiles and a new light blue pawn.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Real-time
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Map Addition, Modular Board, Real-Time, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Victory Garden
description:
In Victory Garden each player owns a homestead in the rural United States during 1942. By rolling dice you will choose an area of your homestead for you and your neighbor to work in.

Each round has two phases. In the work phase, you will roll dice to select areas of your homestead in which to build features that improve your ability to grow vegetables, canned goods, cultivate plants, collect water, and raise livestock. In the market phase, you will use your resources to contribute to community events or make delicious authentic recipes. If either of these doesn’t appeal, you can collect free goods from the community market to aid you in later rounds.

By fully cultivating an area of your homestead, stockpiling your goods for the troubled times ahead, utilizing your harvest to make a recipe or contributing to events, you will earn prestige trophies and victory points.

The player with the most prestige points at the end of the game is the winner.

Are you ready to dig your way to victory?

Victory Garden is a light roll/flip-and-write game, designed for ages 12+. The game involves dice drafting and resource management.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Market, Paper-and-Pencil

name: TIER LIST
description:
In TIERLIST, the challenge is to create a list of preferences about your friends and discover how much you really know about each other.

It is played cooperatively. Each turn, players will have a TIER LIST markable card with one of the levels in secret.

Each turn one of the players will read a card with a hypothetical situation: What wrong item would you accidentally buy from an online store? What would scare you the most when you get home? What would be the best superpower for you? And the other players must give an answer according to the level of the TIER LIST markable card they have. The player will look at all the answers and arrange them in the order they believe they fit on the TIER LIST. Once arranged, each card is turned over to see how many we have guessed correctly.

There are as many rounds as there are players, and at the end, we look at how many mistakes we've made. Depending on the number of mistakes, we score more points.

Designed for 5 to 10 players, TIERLIST is the ideal party game for enjoying fun moments while deepening mutual understanding. Get ready for laughter, revelations, and friendly competition as each player tries to show how well they know their friends!

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Ordering, Player Judge

name: Dungeons of the Oak Dell
description:
‘Dungeons of the Oak Dell’ is a dungeon crawling roll & write game for 1 to 4 players, inspired by old-school PC classics such as Dungeon Master, Eye of the Beholder, and Grimrock. Alongside rondel and dice drafting mechanics, determining how you will attack, how far you can delve into the dungeon, and what you will find, it also introduces an innovative and immersive fighting system, allowing players to almost feel every hit they deal to a monster. It is also crucial to hit specific parts of the monster’s body to finish it faster or disable some of its abilities. Each beast presents a different challenge, with unique skills and behaviors. During the game, players will also level up their heroes and delve into different dungeons full of traps, locked doors, treasures, and other surprises. Their goal will be different depending on the current quest.

The game will include a roguelike solo mode.

Rules are going to be translated into several languages, however the game itself is 100% language-independent.

-description from publisher
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Drafting, Line Drawing, Rondel, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Flying Squirrels Feeder Frenzy
description:
If there’s one place for a squirrel to get a snack these days, it’s from someone’s birdfeeder. There’s a feeder full of nuts in front of you, and you’re hungry! So, get ready to nab those nuts with Flying Squirrels Feeder Frenzy!

Race to fling your squirrels at the birdfeeder at the same time as the other players. Once a squirrel hits a target (with a satisfying SPLAT!), nuts come pouring out of the feeder, and everyone dives into the center to gather as many nuts as they. Then it’s back to the birdfeeder to release another section and nab more nuts!

—description from the publisher

name: One Piece: Luffy's Bento Panic
description: The Straw Hats prepare for battle in this grub-grabbin' free-for-all!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Impulse Movement, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Pirate Potluck
description:
Your fearsome presence must be accompanied by a culinary delight. However, in true pirate fashion, securing your ingredients will pit you against your peers in a spirited competition. Gather your wits and your crew, for only the most cunning and resourceful pirate will claim the title of Potluck Champion!

Ensure all Ingredient Chits are inside the Ingredient Pouch and place it in the center of the play area. Everyone is given $20 Million to start. Each player rolls the die and the lowest roll goes first. Then each player takes two random ingredients from the market. The first player must roll the die before their turn to determine the beginning market value. Then they may begin their turn.

During the initial game setup, the first player rolls to determine the market value and places the treasure chest on the corresponding section of the market sheet. Once their turn concludes, they pass the market sheet to the player on their left. The next player then takes their turn but will only roll for the new market value on their subsequent turn, after the market sheet has made a full round.

Each ingredient has two sides, a shown side and a hidden side. The shown side consists of two colors. The hidden side of the ingredient has a number (1-3) and a piece of a larger recipe. Each image is made up of six ingredients, and your goal is to collect as many ingredients from the same recipe as possible. Each recipe is a unique color, so collecting ingredients with matching colors is the name of the game!

The first player to collect all six ingredients of any matching color completes their dish and immediately wins the game! Otherwise, the game ends once all ingredients have been purchased from the market. If no player has completed a dish by this point, the player who has the most matching ingredients wins. If there is a tie, the player with the most money is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Dice Rolling, Market, Trading

name: Tula 2025
description:
Game about part of the fictional operation "Harvest", NATO attack on Moscow after the succesful battle of Orsha. Russian (rebels and pro-regime), Ukrainian and NATO units are involved.

Game is a part of fictional 2024 universe, it takes place after Orsha 2025 and shortly before Borodino 2025. It is published in the 48 Taktyka i Strategia magazine. Three scenarios are available.

All the game pieces are in the magazine, but at last one game of the series is required (for rules and markers)

name: Nevel 2025
description:
Yet another small battles for 2024, alternative history universe, this time fights for the city of Nevel in Russian between NATO forces and Russians, both sides trying to control this key city.

Game is expansion for Ardennes 2024. It is published in 47 issue Taktyka i Strategia magazine, but it provides board and three scenarios, while units counters, along with rules and markers from Ardennes 2024 are still required.

name: Pigmania
description:
Pigmania is a card game. The cards display different variants of pigs that have different meanings. There are point cards as well as action cards where you can win or lose points.

The aim is to be the first to score 100 points. At the beginning, a piggy boss is appointed to manage the points. The youngest player starts the game. The first player draws a face-down card and places it face up next to the face-down pile.
The player must take the action on the face-up card. He can draw a card again and again to collect points until he himself says “Stop” or draws a corresponding card to end the collection. The points are added up and written down.

The next player then has the choice of whether to shuffle the cards already drawn into the pile or not and draw the next card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: Soozie (スージー)
description:
44 Number cards
30 Operation cards (+, -, ×, ÷, =)
3 Wild cards


Player Count: Designed for young children, suitable for group settings

Setup

Shuffle the number and operation cards separately.
Each player receives a mix of number and operation cards (specific distribution not specified but should be even).


Gameplay
Objective: Players use their cards to form valid arithmetic equations.

Basic Rules:

Turn Sequence: Players take turns drawing and playing cards to form equations on the table.
Playing Cards: Players can play number cards and operation cards to build on existing equations or start new ones. Wild cards can substitute any number or operation.
Equations: Must be mathematically correct. If an equation becomes incorrect due to card plays, it must be rectified or removed from play.
Number Card Use:
Cards range from 0-10, each with unique visual designs.
Used to form or extend equations.

Operation Card Use:
Include plus (+), minus (-), multiplication (×), division (÷), and equals (=).
Used to build arithmetic expressions.

Wild Cards:
Act as any number or operation to complete or extend equations.



Special Rules:

Sequences and Sets:
Players aim to create sequences of numbers (e.g., 3, 4, 5) or sets of the same number (e.g., 5, 5, 5).

Multiple Equations: Multiple equations can coexist on the table. Players can add to any equation as long as the mathematical integrity is maintained.


End Game

The game ends when players have used all their cards and no further equations can be formed.
The player who used their cards most effectively to form correct and complex equations wins.


Educational Focus

The game encourages understanding and application of basic arithmetic and is designed to aid in the mathematical education of children.

name: Så Meget Dig!
description:
Which statement describes you the best?


"Would be the first to die in a horror movie", or
"Is the biggest bargain hunter"


---and which describes the person next to you the best?

In each round of the cooperative game Så Meget Dig! (That's so you!) you pass the game box clockwise around the table.

The two players sitting to the immediate left and right of the game box are the active players for the round, and one of them draws two cards and reads them aloud for the entire group. Example:


"Spends the most time on the toilet", and
"Is more calm during an emergency"


The active players secretly split these two statements between them, by placing exactly one face-down card in front of each of them.

The rest of the group now discuss who they think got which card. Once the group is in agreement, the two active players reveal their cards.

If the group guessed correctly, 2 points are scored.

Try to score as many points as possible!

Contains almost 6000 different, funny and strange dilemmas.

----- Challenge mode:
Guess correctly six times in a row to win. Won? Now set the bar to 8 points. Keep upping it - how far can you go?

----- 2-player rules:
Keep the box between you. Take turns being the active player.

The active player reads the two cards aloud, then secretly assigns one to each player. The other player guess

name: Das Original Fanspiel: Deutscher Fussball-Bund Männer-Nationalmannschaft
description:
Das Original-Fanspiel immerses players in the most iconic moments of the German national team and tells the story of the legendary football players who have shaped the German national team over the years.

All participants can expand their knowledge of the German national team in an entertaining way and challenge friends and family in a competition full of strategy, luck and tactics.

—description from the publisher

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Stronger Than Fear Squad Pack
description:
Star Wars: Shatterpoint players can add the first half of the Rebel Specters to their collection—a trio of power hitters and risk-takers! Kanan Jarrus was one of the few Jedi to survive Order 66. In hiding, he trained Ezra Bridger as an apprentice, offering a path back to his own destiny. Watching their backs is the “muscle” of the crew, Garazeb “Zeb” Orrelios, a Lasat with a particular fondness for beating up stormtroopers.

—description from the pulisher

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Make the Impossible Possbile Squad Pack
description:
The rest of the Rebels join Star Wars: Shatterpoint! Hera Syndulla leads the squad as captain of the Ghost. The Mandalorian Sabine Wren’s explosive firepower is only matched by her revolutionary artistry. The cranky and willful astromech C1-10P, more commonly known as “Chopper”, performs hasty repairs, and plays a key role facilitating their risky heists.

—description from the publisher

name: Western Legends Stories
description:
Western Legends Stories offers a unique narrative twist on the acclaimed Western Legends universe. Help found a frontier town – a beacon of civilization in the untamed American wilderness. Over six thrilling episodes, watch the settlement grow from a remote trading post to a bustling center of commerce, facing the challenges and opportunities that society brings.

Inspired by the open-world design of Western Legends, Stories offers deeper exploration and a dynamic action system. Build, explore, and carve your legend in this captivating new chapter of the West.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Map Addition, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Farplace the Game: Horse Expansion
description:
This mini expansion adds a 5th horse player to the game with cards to match. On rehoming an animal, the horse player rolls the horse die and moves double on a roll of 2 horse shoes. If the horse player rehomes a horse, they also move double on a roll of a single horse shoe.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Race, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection

name: Top 50: Le Jeu
description:
Test your musical culture with a series of musical challenges, each more sensational than the last!

Form 2 teams: Team VHS and Team Vinyl.
Accumulate points by playing the three rounds in succession. And win!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: サンスーキョンシー (Sansu Jiangshi)
description:
Arrange the Kyonshi and survive! This is a card game based on "Nana Narabe" (Seven in a Row).

During your turn, you'll play cards in sequential order to form a series of numbers. If you can't play a card, you'll be eliminated.

There are several conditions for playing cards:

Numbers must be in sequential order (ascending or descending).
Cards of the same color cannot be placed adjacent vertically, horizontally, or diagonally.
You can stack up to two cards (with their numbers combined).
Since you can split the numbers on the cards, it's a game that challenges you with combinations of color, number, and split digits.

When you feel stuck and unable to play, that's when "San-Suu" (Arithmetic) comes in! It might help you find a way to play your cards more effectively.

キョンシーを並べて並べて生き残れ！
「７ならべ」をベースにしたカードゲームです。
手番では数字が連番になるようにカードを出していきます。
カードを出せない場合は脱落になります。

カードを出す条件はいくつかあります。
・数字は連番で昇順（もしくは降順）
・上下左右に同じ色おカードは出せない
・カードは２枚まで重ねて出すこともできる（数字は合算）

カードの数字は分割して使うことも出来るので色と数字とさらに分割数字の組み合わせで頭を悩ませるゲームです。

ダメだ！もう置けないや！と思ったらそこで「算数（サンスー）」です！もしかしたら上手く置けるところが見つかるかもしれません。

name: カエルタワー (Frog Tower)
description:
Gather colorful frogs and build a Frog Tower. When four frogs come together, they perch on a lotus leaf and create a Frog Tower.

What kind of game is Frog Tower?
Frog Tower is a family game where luck and courage hold the key to victory.

On your turn, flip over as many cards as you like to collect frogs. That's all there is to it, but if you get too greedy, the frogs will scatter.

Just one more card... maybe one more... no, I have a bad feeling about this...
The ups and downs that arise with each card flip.

—description from the publisher (translated)

色とりどりのカエルを集めて、カエルタワーを作りましょう。
カエルたちは4匹集まると、蓮の葉に乗っかりカエルタワーをつくります。

『カエルタワー』はどんなゲーム?
『カエルタワー』は、運と度胸が勝敗のカギを握るファミリーゲームです。

自分の番では、好きなだけカードをめくってカエルを集める。
たったそれだけですが、欲張りすぎるとカエルたちは散り散りに逃げていきます。

あと1枚、もう1枚…いや、もうダメな気がする…
カードをめくるたびに沸き起こる一喜一憂の声

小学生のいるファミリー層や
カジュアル・ライト層のグループにぴったり♪

—description from the publisher
publishers: ぶれけけゲームズ (Burekeke Games)

name: 3PIZZA
description:
3Pizza is a card game, the person who runs out of cards in their hand wins.
The cards are removed according to whether they match in color or shape with the pile of cards on the table.

name: Nanga Parbat: Animal Powers
description:
The Nanga Parbat: Animal Powers pack adds a new level of tactical thinking by giving both players new ways to use their animals. The pack includes Animal Power cards. At the game’s start, pick 3 random Animal Powers cards to use for the game. On your turn, you may use a specified combination of 2-3 animals (based on the Animal Powers cards) to perform multiple powers and score additional points.

New powers include: switching a hiker and animal anywhere, switching a hiker and tent anywhere, gaining 2 bharals for trading. Plus, by allowing you to activate these cards for points, you can score in new ways without having to use your scoring markers.

—description from the publisher

name: Mêm'Pakap'
description:
The game you can't even dare to play! 400 challenges to play between friends; a special dice will pick a category for you, read the challenge on the card, and do it. You can pass up to three challenges in the game, if you do so the other players are allowed to insult your clothes. When you get a challenge in each category you'll do the ultimate challenge!

Categories go from cerebral to stupid, there are challenges for everyone!

name: Sorcière
description: The Witches Council has issued a decree announcing that the relics to the major powers would be hidden at the top of the mountain Great Peak. Each family of witches decides she has to find them for their own benefit. The Woodbane will seek to expand their power; Rowanwand the desire to acquire the knowledge contained in these relics, the Vikroth (great warriors) will draw a new combat power; the Brightendale use them to improve their medical knowledge; Burnhide exploit the relics in their search for crystals and precious metals; Wyndenkell want to use the relics to discover new spells, and Leapvaughn, although taking the whole thing lightly, just as much wish recover these invaluable artifacts. All players, as members of one of these great families, will leave in search of relics in a race to the summit of Great Mountain Peak. They must overcome obstacles and use all their expertise to thwart magick spells cast against them by their opponents. The players use dice to move their characters between the different locations, some spaces will award them with relics and some will have consequences (like the loss of an item). Collect the cards with the right items to cast the different spells and get advantages in the game. In their ascent, they can branch off to adjacent trails that will lead them in the forest of Westwood, the old Methodist cemetery, the dark cave and shop practice magick. These paths will allow them to earn magick potions helping them cancel the spells that will be inflicted. The first player to reach the summit of the mountain then retrieve the relics and will be declared winner.

name: Ichor
description:
The dark monsters of Greek mythology have gathered for one final assault on Mount Olympus. The Greek gods are prepared to defend their sacred ground. Who will prevail in this decisive battle of blood and Ichor?

Ichor is an asymmetric strategy game for 2-players by Reiner Knizia. In this mythological battle of wits, one player controls the Greek gods while the other controls the Greek monsters. On your turn, you’ll simply move one of your figures in a straight line as far as you wish, leaving behind a trail of your tokens on each space you pass over. You can never move onto or over a space containing another figure, but you can replace opposing tokens with your own. The first player to get all of their tokens on the board wins.

Each figure possesses a unique ability that can only be used once per game. Thus, the winner will be the one who best leverages their abilities, sets themself up for big plays, and blocks their opponent from doing the same.

Reiner Knizia has developed and evolved Ichor from previous versions of this elegant design by:

Polishing the existing character abilities while adding new ones
Introducing an advanced gameplay expansion that features powerful gate tiles and even more gods and monsters (called the Reinforcements & Gates expansion)
Focusing the competition on a dual-play experience that grows in tension
Providing nearly 50 million possible setups thanks to 2 game boards, 24 characters, and 8 gate tiles


Ichor is the second game in the Mythos Collection, a line of 2-player titles by Bitewing Games featuring strategy and mythology.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Hissy fit: Secret Cabal Promo Cards 2023
description:
3 new promo cards for hissy fit
Distract, Game haul bag and protective circle
First available in the secret cabal 2023 kickstarter

name: Sonic Speed Battle
description:
Sonic is back alongside some familiar faces in 3 high speed battle modes! Rae against other players, blast opponents that stand in your way, cand search for the lost Master Emerald Shards. Gather your friends and rivals to compete in the ultimate challenge!

Sonic Speed Battle consists of three separate card games, each being 2-4 players that use the same deck but in completely different ways! With 24 characters to pick from, the battles are endless!

Ready? Gotta go fast
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Set Collection, Take That

name: An Age Contrived: The Secret Cabal Energy Tokens
description:
Promo originally available in the 2023 secret cabal kickstarter.

A promo for an age contrived adding 20 plastic energy tokens to the game.

name: Crew Manager
description:
If everything went well, the voyage would reach the next port in three days. However, storms and extreme heat hit, pirates appeared, and civil war broke out. Players should adjust the number of crew members to fight against them and avoid using too many crew members.

Crew Manager is a card game that each player has 10 "Energetic Crew Chips". In the game, you hold the chips, put them out all at once, decide on the order, and then turn over the event card.
A number is written on the event card, and you pay a tip corresponding to the number of places.

When the card "Port of Call" appears, pay all the chips you have and receive a replenishment of chips. Then shuffle the deck and repeat this three times. The player with the most chips at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Gothic
description:
Gothic is a competitive board game that immerses players in a dark fantasy world brimming with magic, heroes, and perilous encounters. Set in a realm where the forces of Light and Darkness strive for dominance, players must strategically build decks around these opposing forces to seize control of powerful heroes and units in intense battles.
The game unfolds on a dynamic, procedural generated board, where tactics and exploration are key. Players navigate through treacherous landscapes, encountering hidden dangers and uncovering ancient secrets as they battle for supremacy.
At the heart of each game lies the encounter deck, shaped by players' choices of environment maps and scenarios. These selections not only provide players with secondary objectives crucial for victory but also introduce encounter cards that drive the narrative forward, immersing players deeper into a haunting storyline.

—descripton from the designer

name: Aircraft, Battle Force:  The Ships that Held the Line
description:
Aircraft, Battle Force (ABF) is a naval wargame that overs the Solomon Islands & Coral Sea battles & Guadalcanal Campaign of 1942.

Each player plots their task forces movement for 3 days (14 hours long) and 3 nights (10 hours each), and also each day’s air searches (time of launch, duration & direction), and also any air strike missions that may result from successful searches.

Each 1 inch distance on the map is 100 nautical miles, and the various latitude & longitude lines are shown on the map; the latter decrease in distance as they go away from the equator.

Game play is quick, and rules and play are easy to learn. A full battle of 3 days lasts between 30-45 minutes.

Successful plotting & execution of air searches are at the heart of the game, and moving your aircraft carrier task forces into the most advantageous & flexible location will help you survive the enemy air searches & strikes. Land-based air squadrons also offer reconnaissance & attack opportunities.

The time scale will telescope between 1 day and 1 minute game turns (the latter for air strike resolution).

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Communication Limits, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Impulse Movement, Line Drawing, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Minimap Resolution, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Movement, Push Your Luck, Relative Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Spooktacular
description:
It’s Halloween Night, 1986. The all-night Spooktacular Film Festival is running in full swing. But a storm is coming. Lightning strikes, overloading the power, and releasing a hundred years of cinematic monsters from the silver screen.

As one of those monsters, YOU are now free to wreak havoc. Terrify and devour unsuspecting moviegoers in a race to become the most terrifying monster of all time!

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Ravaged Lands: Corpsewrack Mausoleum
description:
Ravaged Lands sets are designed to expand your core Warcry experience with new challenges and thematic terrain. This set contains a vast array of plastic graveyard-themed scenery pieces, including mausoleums, grave markers, and fences.

This set also contains a 22"x30" double-sided game board to battle over – one side depicts the snowy ground of a cemetery, while the other features a wasteland that matches the gameboard from the Warcry Starter Set, allowing you to combine your scenery collections for bigger battles!

The set also includes a double-sided Warcry token sheet for keeping track of your fighters, plus 36 terrain cards – combine these with battleplan cards to set up your games. Whether you're looking to expand your Starter Set or beginning your journey in Warcry, this set is perfect for you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Digimon: El Juego
description: Board game based on the Digimon franchise, made by spanish publisher Falomir. Roll and move through the island to get to the final stage and defeat the evil Digimon that rises at the end of the journey.

name: Farplace: The Game – Board Expansion 1
description: A double-sided board expansion for Farplace the Game featuring two new boards to change the routes taken in playing the game. Themed MEOW and THE BROCK with cat and badger illustrative text.
mechanics: Race, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection

name: Realms of Darkness
description:
Realms of Darkness is a miniature wargame, based on armies of miniatures in the 28-32mm scale. We aim for an easy-to-learn, but hard-to-master ruleset.

The game is based on a ruleset that keeps players active throughout the game, even whith several players in the same battle. Realms of Darkness supports everything from skirmishes to large naval and siege battles.

The game has a constantly growing background that makes for many interesting battles and playstyles.

—description from the publisher

name: Zoo Tycoon: The Board Game – New Shores
description:
Build your dream zoo with more choices than ever with Zoo Tycoon: The Board Game – New Shores!

Dive into aquatic worlds featuring manatees, sea turtles, zebra sharks and many more. Feel the cold breeze from the new type of enclosures featuring polar species such as the majestic polar bear, penguins and muskox. Additionally, the world of Australian wildlife takes center stage: crocodiles, kangaroos, and koalas guarantee you lots of excited visitors.

Discover 3 different biomes with 24 new Main Species (represented by over 230 beautiful animal meeples) and 10 Co-Species. In addition, a large vivarium is now also an integral part of your zoo. Choose from 48 animal species (fishes, reptiles, amphibians and more) and fill your vivarium according to your wishes. It's up to you again to decide which direction you want to take. Do you design your vivarium with a focus on conservation, education, or popularity?

Get the full zoo experience with this first and final expansion of Zoo Tycoon: The Board Game – New Shores. Watch the zoo of your dreams come true, right in front of you!

Gameplay
New Shores complements the gameplay of Zoo Tycoon: The Board Game without making it more complicated. Since a completely new Animal Exchange with 3 new biomes and over 80 new species is available, there is an enormous amount to discover and familiar strategies to rethink. In addition, reptiles, aquatic/semiaquatic animals, and the vivarium bring exciting changes to the game mechanics. Especially the vivarium provides new strategic options that you should take advantage of. So, the game experience remains familiar but still refreshingly different.

With the modular Animal Exchange that comes with New Shores, you can mix and match old and new species for endless combinations of zoo fun. Zoo Tycoon: The Board Game has never been so diverse!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Economic, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Market, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: 24 Days Escape: 3D Adventskalender – Sherlock Holmes und das Castle in den Highlands
description:
Sherlock Holmes and John Watson arrive at a Scottish castle to help locate a long-lost family treasure. They soon find out that many things are not what they appear to be.

To play this 3D advent calendar, you first assemble a large model of the castle in which the story is set.
Over the course of 24 days you find mysterious objects and clues that help you find out about the treasure. Each solved puzzle brings you another step closer to the solution of the puzzle.

name: Escape Experience Adventskalender: Kleopatra
description:
In a museum, you find notes about a treasure left behind by Cleopatra, the legendary queen of Egypt. You set out on a dangerous journey to find her last resting place and the unimaginable riches.
Every day, you open a door and solve a puzzle. The solution will tell you which door to open on the next day. Solve all 24 puzzles and save Atlantis from impending doom.
In case you get stuck, there are digital clues available on the publisher’s website.

name: DIG: A Simple Game of Tile Strategy
description:
In DIG you are a treasure hunter on the edge of un-earthing the largest collection of precious stones ever lost to the sands of time...but watch out, you may not be the only one!

In this quick and simple game of drafting dig-site tiles and collecting stones, compete against your opponents as you traverse the ever-expanding Dig-Site to gather the largest collection and score the most points.

DIG is a game in which players take turns drafting dig-site tiles, moving player pieces, collecting and placing precious stones. The game ends after the last dig-site tile is drafted, and the player with the most points wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Pattern Movement, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Tried by War: La Guerre de Sécession (1861-1865)
description: Tried by War is a solitaire game of medium complexity, simulating at the strategic level the Civil War, from April 21, 1861 to April 9, 1865. The player is in charge of the federal camp, and the game system favors the resistance of the Confederate States which characterized this conflict, using fun mechanisms.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame

name: Outsiders
description: Outsiders is an expansion for APEX that introduces the Enemy, a cosmic threat allowing you to play Apex in cooperative mode, solo, and to link multiple games into a legacy campaign. Outsiders also contains 2 new civilizations with innovative gameplay mechanics: the Chaors and the Yatris.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Solo / Solitaire Game
