name: Dodos Riding Dinos: First Race
description:
Dodos Riding Dinos: First Race is an exciting tabletop racing and skill game where you compete using a team of Dodos and Dinos, known as "Dodino". Launch projectiles at your opponents, test your luck advancing with dice, or hinder others by taking cards from their hand; everything counts to cross the finish line before anyone else!

This family-friendly version stands on its own from the original Dodos Riding Dinos game, offering a 20-minute experience for 2 to 6 players that is simpler and more frantic than ever.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Flicking, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: BAD KITTY: The PURRRRRFECT Party Game for You and Your Posse
description:
Get the Party Purring with BAD KITTY, the awesome adult Party Game of hilarious, weird, embarrassing cats and the bad behaviors they indulge in.

Pair photo cards with witty caption cards to concoct hilariously outrageous meme combinations. This game provides the ideal opportunity to rally your crew and create lasting memories filled with laughter and fun!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Age of Angra
description:
Age Of Angra is a mythical tag-team fighting card game for 2 players in which synergistic duos of incredible creatures known as "Asura" fight spectacularly on behalf of their highly magical human Shepherds.

Humans now live alongside the Asura that came through The Breach. Many of the Asura are Wild Asura - cunning, animalistic creatures that are dangerous and destructive. But some of the Asura are Noble Asura - intelligent, sophisticated, autonomous beings of intent.

You and your opponent are Shepherds - humans whose inner magics resonate with the Asura. Shepherds enlist and cooperate with the Asura for a variety of mutual benefits, and they are as diverse in their motivations as the Asura.

As Asura battle, their emotions invoke meteorological phenomena that disrupt the environment around them. After activating barriers that prevent collateral damage, Shepherds then collect this magical energy in the form of “Magical Charges”. The Shepherd needs this resource to meet objectives, cast spells, and support their Asura in battle. Balancing these crucial needs is the very core of the Shepherd’s responsibility.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Take That, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Город счастья: Делюкс-издание (Happy City: Deluxe Edition)
description:
This edition includes the base game Happy City and add-on Happy City: Grozilla

Do you know how to build a city of happiness? You have a unique chance to create one using just miniature cards. The answer is in a simple formula: multiply the population of the city by the sum of the hearts that the cultural buildings and green spaces you have been constructed!

How can we make the citizens happier? Maybe build tree houses or make available a best higher education? But don't forget about the economy, because the happiness of citizens often goes hand in hand with it. However, opponents do not sleep! And if you add giant monsters who want to destroy everything in their path, and especially a park where people go after a working day, then the task of building a dream city will no longer sound easy.

—description from the publisher (translated)

•••
Город счастья: Делюкс издание – это основная игра Город счастья в комплекте с дополнением Город счастья: Грозилла

Знаете ли вы, как построить город счастья? У вас есть уникальная возможность построить такой, используя всего лишь миниатюрные карточки. Ответ заключается в простой формуле: перемножьте численность населения города на сумму сердец, которые приносят построенные вами здания культуры и зелёные пространства!

Как можно сделать жителей счастливее? Может, строить домики на деревьях или сделать доступным лучшее высшее образование? Но не упускайте из виду и экономику, ибо счастье граждан часто идёт с ней рука об руку. А ведь конкуренты не спят! А если ко всему этому давить гигантских монстров, желающих разрушить всё на своём на пути, и особенно тот самый сквер, куда после рабочего дня стекается народ, то задача построить город мечты уже не покажется лёгкой.

—описание от издателя
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Income, Market, Open Drafting

name: ROCKet ROLL
description:
A Deck-Building, Dice-Rolling Race to the Stars

The success of the space program is literally in your hands! Build a completely unique deck from your opponents to be the first to launch a rocket into outer space. Lift off by rolling your Technology, Equipment and Rocket Fuel dice, which you can upgrade and modify throughout the game. The first one to reach 40 in Launch Points wins!

—description from the designer

name: The Show of Pride: The Anglo-Zulu War
description:
The Show of Pride is the first game in a system of rules aimed at reproducing the colonial military engagements of the 19th century. It allows you to play all the conflicts between the colonizing European nations and their indigenous adversaries, according to fairly simple principles favoring playability while retaining the historical interest of the combats.
This basic volume focuses on the Zulus and their European enemies, more precisely the first part of the Anglo-Zulu War of 1879.

name: シン・デレラ (Cinderella)
description:
The story of how Cinderella used magic to find happiness with a prince has become a legend that still thrills young girls today. In modern times, A ball is held and the girls of the town pursue their dreams of catching the prince's eye and becoming modern-day Cinderellas.

However, magic is now shunned, and relying on the help of wizards is a huge risk these days. You are a girl who takes on that risk and challenges the ball. But be careful, if you stand out too much, you might be suspected of being a witch's minion.
Cinderella is a shedding card game where all cards dealt at the start of the game are face down and players aim to win by reducing the number of cards in our hand that are only five.
publishers: あーきっと.ゲームズ (Archit Games)

name: Eater
description:
Area majority game.

The board can be of any shape or size, but the standard board is intended to be a hex board with 36 intersections.
The pieces are double-sided pieces like those used in Othello or Reversi: 36 pieces are needed and each player has 18 pieces.
The aim of the game is to increase the size of the group and to hold a larger group than the enemy at the end of the game.
All you can do on your turn is to place your pieces at the intersections of the board. Pieces connected by ruled lines form a group and grow in size. However, only groups with an odd number of pieces can survive, so any even groups of that player remaining after the end of the turn are removed from the board.
Depending on the placement of the pieces, an enemy piece can be flipped over like in Othello by pinching it in a straight line to become your piece (multiple pieces, multiple directions are possible). By eating enemy pieces (Eat) they grow larger like an amoeba.
The game is over when two players have finished placing all their pieces. At that point, all even groups on the board are removed.
The player with the largest group wins.

The key to the game is that no even-numbered groups can survive.
Test play can be done with Othello pieces.

—description from the designer

name: Ich sehe was, was du nicht siehst ...
description:
10 picture cards are laid out on the table. Players take turns as the clue giver. The clue giver picks a colour in one of the pictures and says "I spy with my little eye something [colour]." The other players simultaneously look for cards that contain this colour. Whoever finds the correct card first gets to keep it. First player to gain 3 cards wins the games.

The game contains 40 cards in a compact tin box.

name: マルサのお時間 (Marsa's Time)
description:
The story is set in Showa Japan during the height of the bubble economy in the 1980s.The battle between the National Tax Bureau Inspection Department, commonly known as "Marsa", and malicious tax evaders begins now!

In this case, player Marsa and her friends will be divided into two teams and conduct an internal investigation. Assemble the investigation information and complete the internal investigation report before the other team

name: Night Parade: A Yokai Cleansing Word Game
description: A word-building game about clever word choice, dice management, and set collection. It’s Oban at the Onsen! You are a new-hire for a yokai bathhouse. Your assignment: to cleanse yokai. Greet your guests, manage your tub, build clever words, and become Employee of the Year!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Treasures of Bornem Abbey
description:
Embark on a historical journey within the venerable walls of Bornem Abbey, the centerpiece of our new board game, The Treasures of Bornem Abbey. Players assume the roles of abbots competing to acquire the most prestigious collections of stained-glass windows and ancient manuscripts from the monumental Abbey library.
Set against the atmospheric backdrop of the Abbey, the game unfolds on a dynamic 3x3 grid, representing the central courtyard encircled by the hallways through which the abbot figurines navigate. Players move their abbots along these corridors, strategically selecting rows or columns from the grid to acquire the most coveted artifacts. Utilizing abbot cards, players can execute sequences that emulate "The Rule of Saint Benedict." Successfully aligning their plays with these revered guidelines rewards players with powerful bonus cards, enhancing their ability to dictate the course of the game.

Scoring in Treasures of Bornem Abbey demands both tactical acumen and foresight, as players must assemble their collections according to specific patterns to amass points. However, strategic depth is added through the penalty system, where players must minimize the point discrepancies between the Cistercian Chapter points on their played and collected cards, adding a layer of challenge that reflects the historical complexities of monastic life.

—description from the designer

name: Bamse: Kompis-spelet
description:
It's time for Lille Skutt to harvest his carrots. He fears that he won't make it before the lake freezes over and the carrots also freeze.
His friends Bamse, Skalman, Farmor, Nalla-Maja, and Vargen will help him.
If the lake freezes over, the game wins. If the carrots are saved, the players win.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory

name: AIRCROPS
description:
The near future where technology has advanced.
Aiming to harvest vegetables more efficiently, people began growing vegetables in the sky.

Players become vegetable farmers, tilling the land, growing and harvesting vegetables.
Aim to earn more coins than your rivals.

—description from the designer

name: Walk The Plank: Piratas ao Mar
description:
The Piratas ao Mar("Pirates at Sea") expansion for Walk the Plank increases the battle for survival, adding 5 new actions to help keep your pirate alive while pushing other players' pirates directly into the Kraken's mouth!

Will explosions, lost souls, jokers and scoundrels guarantee your victory?

A Expansão “Piratas ao Mar”, para o jogo Walk the Plank, aumenta a disputa pela sobrevivência, adicionando 5 novas ações para ajudar a manter seu pirata vivo enquanto empurra os piratas dos outros jogadores diretamente para a boca do Kraken!

Será que explosões, almas penadas, curingas e malandros vão garantir sua vitória?

name: Monster Motel
description:
Monster Motel is a fun game for 3-6 players with bluffing, hidden roles and a lot of fun. The objective is to get one of the motel rooms and not be one of the 2 people who are left without it, so in each game there will be 2 people who lose and the rest will be winners :-). Each turn you will play a card in your room and perform the action or play it secretly. At the end of the game each player will have one final card left. Then of those cards, the highest number and the lowest number will have no room and will lose the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Monster Motel es un divertido juego de 3-6 personas con faroleo, roles ocultos y con muchísimo pique. El objetivo es conseguir una de las habitaciones del motel y no ser una de las 2 personas que se queden sin ella, por lo que en cada partida habrá 2 personas que pierdan y el resto serán ganadoras :-). En cada turno jugarás una carta en tu habitación y realizarás la acción o la jugarás en secreto. Al final de la partida a cada jugador le quedará una carta final. Entonces de esas cartas, el número más alto y el número más bajo no tendrán habitación y perderán la partida

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Bounty Bashers
description:
Engage in a clash to bring an end to a century-long conflict by assembling a formidable team of six elite champions from the land. Each hero boasts distinctive stats and abilities, fostering a myriad of strategic avenues to dismantle your opponent's stronghold.

The objective is simple, topple your opponent’s main castle by navigating one of your Bounty Bashers through the treacherous battlefield and to their crown piece. Each encounter pits your piece against theirs, demanding strategic maneuvering to tilt the odds in your favor. In the frey, both contenders roll the dice to determine their attack, with various attack types, making some pieces excel over certain foes, but not all. Success hinges on mastering the delicate balance between offence and defence.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Role Playing, Zone of Control

name: The Color Difference "IROCHI"
description:
This is a simple card game that anyone can enjoy. The rules are simple. Players take turns to turn over cards in the deck. When all three colors on the flipped card are different, the player says “Irochi! quickly. The player who says it the fastest wins a card. There are three colors on the cards: the color of the background, the color of the letters, and the meaning of the letters. Red, blue, or yellow. Can you judge them at a moment's notice?　It is a game where you can't help but laugh when you play. Please try it!

—description from the publisher

name: COLOR STACK
description:
COLOR STACK is an abstract game for two players in which the dice serve as pawns. The objective is to roll four different colors of dice: red, blue, yellow, and green. The board is randomly generated with cards, so unlike chess, the strategy changes each time.

Each player has three dice of two different colors in his or her hand. On his or her turn, the player chooses one of the following two actions.

Move his or her dice as many times as the number of eyes on the board.
Change the number of eyes on your dice to the number you want.


For example, a dice with a 6 can be moved 6 squares, and a dice with a 3 can be moved 3 squares.

The dice must be moved by exactly the number of eyes, but once a square is passed, it cannot be passed.

If there is another dice on a square with exactly the same number of dice, it can only be stacked on top of it if it is “stronger” than the dice on top of it. The dice on top of the dice are moved together with the dice on top of the dice.

Dice have a strength, the smaller the number of dice, the stronger the dice. In other words, the harder the dice are to move, the stronger they are. The exception to this rule is 1, which is weaker than 6.

When the strengths are the same, they can be stacked. So, to be precise, if the strength of the dice you are moving is greater than or equal to the strength of the dice in the square you are stopping on, you can stack the dice.
The key to strategy is the placement of the dice. Since you cannot pass through a square once you have passed through it, dice with large eyes cannot be utilized unless there is a large space available.

It is important to place your dice well to block the opponent's dice movement.

Let's begin!

—description from the publiser

name: Team GB: Ready Set Win
description:
Ready Set Win is a thrilling Team GB game that's all about forging a winning team and going for gold in the finals! Players enter the world of Team GB by stepping into the role of an ace coach to lead their athletes to victory.

Contestants must build the strongest possible team by collecting sports cards and optimising their deck. This means carefully choosing how to spend Training Cards to maximise their team's effectiveness across 6 different sporting categories.

As players build their teams, taking cards and moving through the deck, Finals Cards come into play. They are laid on the board and move down the track until it's time for the big event.

Players with the strongest teams win medals! There are medals to be won in 6 categories, so finding the perfect balance is all the challenge. Once the finals have been played it's time to score up each player's medal count - the person with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

name: STACK TEN
description:
① Contents
15 white blocks, 15 black blocks, 1 tile,
1 stick(2 parts), 1 instruction manual, 1 box.

②Purpose of the game
STACK TEN is a simple 2-player game. Players take turns stacking the blocks in their hands, aiming to stack more blocks of their color at the same height as the stick.

Place the tile in the center of the table.
Place a stick next to it to check the height of the stacked blocks. Assemble the stick from two parts.
Each player places 15 biocks of their color into the body or lid of the box.
Each player chooses 5 blocks from their own block in the box so that their opponent cannot see them. After each of you has made your selections, we will publish them at the same time and keep them in your hands.


④Game Flow

Each player takes a turn. The player who wins the game by Janken (rock-paper-scissors-game) is the first player to make a move.
The first player starts his/her turn. On your turn, you choose one of the selected blocks and stack it on top of the tiles. The following rules must be observed.
Blocks cannot be placed diagonally.
Blocks cannot be placed outside of the tile area.



Place the block so that the bottom side touches the tile or block below.

No part of the block should be floating in the air.
Do not exceed the height of the stick.

If a player breaks a stack of blocks while placing them, that player loses.
If a player breaks a stack of blocks while placing them, that player loses.
If neither player can place a block, both players choose 5 blocks from the box, reveal them at the same time, and place them in their hands.
When either player has finished stacking their blocks, both players select 5 blocks from the box, reveal them at the same time, and place them in their hands.
The game ends when there are no more blocks in the box and no blocks can be placed on each other.


⑤End of game
The player who has the most blocks of their color at the same height as the stick (minimum 10 blocks) wins. If the blocks have the same area, the player with fewer blocks remaining wins.

That's all for the explanation. Let's get started!


—description from the publisher

name: Any Last Words?
description:
Any Last Words? is a game where players take turns to place down letters and race to complete the spelling. Whoever completes the spelling of a word first wins it, but before they win other players also get a chance to challenge the word by trying to extend it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Spelling, Team-Based Game, Tug of War

name: Hegemony: Rome or Cartague
description:
The game is for 1 to 4 players, and there are 4 factions: Patricians and Plebeians representing Rome, and the Council of One Hundred and the Barcids representing Carthage.

The two basic mechanisms of HEGEMONY are the action system and the card game.
Each player, in each round, performs an Action, choosing from the 6 possible (7 for the Council). Additionally, they can play cards from their hand.
The First and Second Punic Wars, which pitted Rome against Carthage for control of the western Mediterranean, were of extraordinary scale. Rome's ultimate victory has decisively influenced our culture. These wars are undoubtedly among the most important in history. HEGEMONY covers the period from the beginning of the First Punic War (264 BC) to the end of the Second Punic War (201 BC), including the interwar period (240-219 BC).

The game was intended to simulate history faithfully, with two goals: simple rules and short-duration sessions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Dice, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Mysticana: Nine Perils
description:
Nine Perils is playable with Mysticana: A Foundation Deck core cards, and its rules are included in the core wallet.


The prophecy foretells nine great perils, warnings of coming doom. As a seer, you must peer into the future and find a path to avoid these perils.

Nine Perils is a solo-only game of limited information and anticipating the future to avert nine disasters using the Mysticana deck. Using your hand of cards (based on the difficulty chosen) play against the central timeline of 9 peril cards. Each turn you’ll flip one of the peril cards in the timeline face-up, draw a new card into your hand, then play a single from your hand into a free space in a separate row below any peril card. After 9 turns, compare each peril’s rank and element against the adjacent card’s rank and element. Each of the perils must be successfully outmatched to win!


Nine Perils is a quick but puzzly solo game of arranging a sequence of events that will avert nine disasters.

Mysticana is a Foundation Deck: an 18-card deck that includes multiple core games using just the base cards with even more games added through small expansions. The deck features cards with 6 ranks across 3 suits (elements) which have a “rock-paper-scissors” hierarchy. While each game might make use of the deck’s design in different ways, the flexible foundation enables new games to fit in seamlessly alongside previous entries.

name: Mysticana: The Path Ahead
description:
The Path Ahead is playable with Mysticana: A Foundation Deck core cards, and its rules are included in the core wallet.


In every corner of the realm, travelers engage in a timeless game of deduction and chance.

The Path Ahead is a guessing game for 2-4 players that uses the Mysticana deck. Each round, the active player guesses whether the next card drawn will be stronger or weaker than the currently showing card (accounting for rank and suit). A correct guess moves play to the next player; an incorrect guess earns a consequence card. These may count against the player’s score if not used to make a set of matching consequences. At the end of each round, players add up any consequence cards they still hold and add it to their running score from previous rounds. The game is over when any player hits 20 points, with the lowest-scoring player the ultimate winner.


The Path Ahead is a light game where players take turns guessing whether what lies ahead on the path is stronger or weaker than what they’ve already encountered.

Mysticana is a Foundation Deck: an 18-card deck that includes multiple core games using just the base cards with even more games added through small expansions. The deck features cards with 6 ranks across 3 suits (elements) which have a “rock-paper-scissors” hierarchy. While each game might make use of the deck’s design in different ways, the flexible foundation enables new games to fit in seamlessly alongside previous entries.

name: Mysticana: Sorcerers' Showdown
description:
Sorcerers’ Showdown is playable with Mysticana: A Foundation Deck core cards, and its rules are included in the core wallet.


Two sorcerers clash in battle, each spell and counterspell growing less predictable as they wear down.

Sorcerers’ Showdown is a dueling-like game for 2 players using the Mysticana deck. In the first round, players are dealt 8 cards and choose 6 to battle with, setting aside 2 to hold onto for the next round. The first player then plays a card to start a clash. The other player responds with a card of their own, matching the element if possible. The clash is evaluated by rank and element, with the winner capturing both cards. Should an Avatar (rank ⟐) win a clash, the winner steals a pair of previously captured cards from their opponent. Clashes are played and resolved until both players are out of cards. Should one player have all of the captured cards, they win! Otherwise, players take the 2 cards set aside at the beginning of the round and draw a hand size that is 1 card less than the previous round to continue the duel.


Sorcerers’ Showdown is a game of outplaying your opponent, calculated risks, shrinking hands, and rising chaos.

Mysticana is a Foundation Deck: an 18-card deck that includes multiple core games using just the base cards with even more games added through small expansions. The deck features cards with 6 ranks across 3 suits (elements) which have a “rock-paper-scissors” hierarchy. While each game might make use of the deck’s design in different ways, the flexible foundation enables new games to fit in seamlessly alongside previous entries.

name: Hidden in Plain Sight Series
description:
A series of thematic deduction games where secrets are hidden in plain sight for all to solve using our proprietary card holders and decoding forms.

But here's the twist: while everyone sees everyone’s secrets, your own remain a mystery.

Library Escape: An eccentric billionaire has locked you in his library. Utilize your astute deduction skills to find a hidden escape code in a random book.

Zoo Heist: Players step into the shoes of elite detectives tasked with solving a daring crime - the theft of precious animals from the city zoo by the infamous Zoo Crew.

Word Sleuths: Enter the world of Word Sleuths, a clever deduction game where players must unravel their own secret words carefully hidden in plain sight. Each player faces the challenge of decoding a successively longer word within a limited number of guesses.

Mailbox Mix-Up: In this game of postal chaos, gather your decoding skills to reclaim your stuff missing before your rivals get theirs.

Covert Critters: Play the role of an animal with amnesia as you question your way through remembering who you are.

Secret Shoppers: Shopping for stuff at the grocery store, guess what you bought in disguise and for how much.

All games use the same mechanic, just goals and the themes change. Secrets are hidden on racks that face outward from each player such that everyone can see each others secrets but each player cannot see their own.

Using questions with answers recorded on dry erase deduction forms, players follow the clues to deduce and/or eliminate secrets.

—description from the publisher

name: Panzer Grenadier: Dragon's Teeth
description:
Breaking the Siegfried Line, 1944

On 11 September 1944, a patrol from the U.S. 5th Armored Division crossed the German border, beginning a campaign that would last three and a half months and cost over 140,000 casualties as the Americans tried to break through the Siegfried Line defenses, known to the Germans as the West Wall.

Dragon’s Teeth is a complete Panzer Grenadier game based on these epic battles, as America took the fight into Nazi territory. German resistance had crumbled during the long retreat across France, but it now grew much more resolute on German soil, while the Americans had gained combat experience and sought to end the war.

Dragon’s Teeth includes 495 die-cut playing pieces, most of which originally appeared in our long out-of-print Battle of the Bulge game. There are also four heavy cardstock maps, and 42 scenarios organized in our popular story-arc format with historical background to put the scenarios in their context and battle games to tie them together.

Dragon’s Teeth comes in our Playbook format: everything you need to play, except dice, inside a book.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Godaigo: Secret of the Five Elements
description:
Far above the oceans, the lost island of Ukashima hides amongst the clouds, wracked by alchemical storms and shifting tectonics.

Every century, the mages who have been cursed to this place must fight to escape.

A race to weild the alchemical power of Earth, Water, Fire, Wind, and Void will find themselves at home once again.

Godaigo: Secret of the Five Elements is inspired by the Japanese Buddhist philosophical concept of Godai, or Five Element Theory, with gameplay inspired by Magic: The Gathering, Isometric Hex Gaming, Roguelike Exploration, and Building Games.

In Godaigo, players must explore the board to gather Elemental Scrolls, and be the first to cast one of each type to win the game.

To do this, the players must also acquire spell components called "Elemental Stones" and arrange them on the board in specific shapes.

This challenges players spatial strategy skills, and creates a game experience that is pleasing to the eye.

Additionally, these stones have their own unique abilities which affect movement and gameplay.

For example, an Earth Stone can be used to block a path or cut off a resource, or a Wind Stone can allow players to move more freely around the board.

Spells (or "Scrolls") can interfere with an opponent's strategy, or be used to manipulate the state of the board in your favor.

Godaigo: Secret of the Five Elements provides the fun of spellcasting card games, but does not require additional booster packs. The randomized board state makes each playthrough a unique experience.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Race, Resource to Move

name: The Happy Heads Card Game
description:
Happy Heads Card Game is designed to promote emotional wellbeing and resilience among children and their families. The core of Happy Heads lies in its aspiration to encourage open discussions about emotions, making it easier and fun for children to express themselves and for parents to understand and support emotional development.

Gameplay involves players, typically a mix of children and adults, taking turns drawing Beastie cards that they need to help using the items or actions in their hands. The game includes a variety of card types such as Beasties representing personalities to discuss, Items portraying wellbeing exercises and actions such as Yoga and place switching.

The goal of Happy Heads Card Game is not just to win by collecting as many Beasties and Comforts as possible, but to help children and their adults to build stronger emotional connections. Facilitating meaningful conversations about feelings and strategies for handling different emotional states, helping players develop key life skills like empathy, communication, and emotional regulation.

The Happy Heads Card Game is simple and proven impactful but prioritising fun and playfulness to support in the destigmatisation of mental health and wellbeing.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game

name: Liberum Veto
description:
Liberum Veto allows players to travel back to the times of the Golden Liberty of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth and take part in the Great Game for the Throne of the Republic.

Players embody the leader of one of the four factions trying to seat their candidate on the throne. Become the leader of the cunning Radziwiłł faction, the honorable and chivalrous Wiśniowiecki faction, the roving Adventurer faction, or the influential Court faction led by Jan Kazimierz.

The choice is yours - the Throne of the Republic won't wait forever.

Fight for it in Confrontations with other factions - lead Intrigues in the Palace, or Agitate for your candidate on the Election Field. Every path is good to win the battle for power over the Commonwealth.

name: Nasty Ones
description:
Nasty Ones is a card game in which you summon colourful creatures, battle others and ultimately be the last player standing.

It's complex enough for strategy but not too complex that it'll leave your brain fried trying to learn how to play.

There's over 200 unique cards, so each game plays differently.

Nasty Ones involves playing cards (creatures, items or spells) with players attempting to reduce other players health to 0 (usually by attacking with their creatures). One of the key gameplay features is that whenever you lose Health Points you gain Nasty Points, which are used to play cards, allowing you to take revenge and potentially gain the upper hand after you have been hit with a heavy attack. Every card has a unique ability and games usually last less than an hour.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Escape Game: Abenteuer in Paris
description: For fans of puzzles and detective games, there is a brand new, incredible adventure full of mysterious events to solve! Against the backdrop of beautiful Paris, players embark on an adventure where they must solve puzzles and collect clues to solve the mystery, just like in an escape room. Includes a set of playing cards, a game board and numerous mysterious objects to help players through the adventure. The game is designed for one or more players, where everyone can take on the role of a real detective.

name: Farplace: The Game – Board Expansion 2
description:
The second double-sided board expansion for Farplace the Game featuring two new boards to change the routes taken in playing the game. Themed SLITHER and THE MIDDEN with snake and rat illustrative text.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Race, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection

name: Des Souvenirs plein le Ciel
description:
The memory of your grandparents is playing tricks on them, and some of their most precious memories are gradually fading away.

Embark on a journey aboard your paper boat, sailing from cloud to cloud to help them remember the good times they've had. The goal of the game is to reach the numbered spaces of your color on the edges of the board, in ascending order.

Each time a space is reached, a memory card is collected. The first player to gather their 6 Memory cards and reconstruct their memory wins the game.

name: Dockfighters: The Ale Wars – Bomber Expansion
description:
The bomber expansion includes:


x2 Messerschmitt BF-682 D-3 "Milkcow" (Bomber of the Royal Bavarian Air Force) [Wingspan 88mm/3.5"]
x2 Heinkel 992 C-3 "Pit Ghost" (Bomber of the Free State of Saxony Air Force) [Wingspan 80mm/3.1"]


All miniatures are magnetized and comes in a wooden box.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Claim Action, Victory Points as a Resource

name: MegaMart Mogul
description:
Having mastered the local supermarket economy with your friends, it's time to take the next steps in your retail management careers. Now you're vying to become the MegaMart Mogul! Competition is fierce, and only one of you gets the job. And with growth comes growing pains. More employees, more threats, and more bureaucracy will all need to be handled as you work to lead your team.

You'll begin with a small stash of cash, a core group of loyal and enthusiastic employees, and some product. After that it's up to you to manage those assets as you build your retail empire.

MegaMart Mogul twists the deck building mechanic, giving you control over the flow of cards from bank to deck to market to shared supply. Money flows out of your deck when spent, and into your bank before it returns to your deck. Staff cards have multiple uses - which one will you activate? The game rewards players who know how to best manage the constant flux of their decks, plan their turns, and make the best use of the hand they are given.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Income, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection

name: Gifts Galore: Christmas
description:
Gifts Galore is a festive group gifting game that levels up the fun of opening holiday presents together with your friends and loved ones.

Work your way around the board answering festive trivia questions as you open presents and mystery gifts, on your way to winning the Surprise Prize!

Includes alternate rules for playing at parties, with coworkers, and throughout the holiday season!

—description from the publisher

This game has the same rules as Gifts Galore: Новый Год, but with a different theme and a different set of questions.

name: Ouisti' Plouf
description:
Flip over the right Hippo tiles to get all your Ouisti' across the river without making a splash!
Roll the dice, move you monkeys on backs of hippos tile and resolve the effect. Remember where are good and bad effects to improve your movement and cross the river before other players.

name: Uchu Kantai Keikaku
description:
A world inside some kind of sphere.
Will the sphere be a reliable structure, will there be an unknown force that threatens them, and will they be able to survive the conflict between the Emperor and the Holy Kings? The player takes on the role of the leader of a faction and competes for victory points. Combine sustainable ships according to your forces with operators, which are artificial life forms that control them, to form a fleet and take on the challenge. Depending on how the strategy is resolved, your position will be determined by whether you are an emperor or a holy royalist. With 48 cards, it is a lightweight sci-fi + draft + set collection + expanded reproduction game that can be played in about 15 minutes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Set Collection, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Band Of Blindmen
description:
Band Of Blindmen brings the strategy of a game like Chess or Drafts, the unknown of a game like Stratego and a simultaneous action mechanic that brings the game to life and makes prediction critical.

Set at a clearing in the woods the game has you plan the moves of your elite but visually impaired men in their attempt to secure supplies.

Protect your king or queen piece and control supply squares while attempting to kill off your opponent's pieces over a series of 9 rounds.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, King of the Hill, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bingsu Master
description:
Bingsu Master, a game of chance and mind, where luck and memory are intertwined. With tools and actions your bowls will grow, amongst spills and mishaps be careful you know. Taste the shaved ice, a sweet sensation. Freeze your foes with cold domination. Victory awaits those who dare to partake, choose cards wisely for the path you'll make. Stay sharp and nimble on your feet, sneeze and witness your lead vanish a frosty defeat.

—description from the publisher

name: Swapsies
description:
First player to collect 5 matching circles win.
Everyone starts with 3 circles. Put the rest of the circles into a pile.

One move per turn. Either draw a circle from the top of the pile or swap a circle with another player.

—description from the publisher

name: The Age of War
description:
The Sengoku Jidai - "age of warring states" - was a period of almost constant civil war in Japan from around 1467 to 1615 AD, during which warlords, or daimyo, vied for control of the archipelago.

Whether you want to recreate a small clash between warbands or a large pitched battle, this rulebook will provide you with all the tools to relive the atmosphere and flavour of the period, reconstructing the Dynamics and tactics of armies very distant from the Western way of conducting war.

These rules will allow you to lead the different factions of the time into battle, or to create your own clan to become the new Shogun of Japan!

Inside you will find lists for Samurai (14 different clans), Sohei, Ikko Ikki, minor factions such as Ronin and Wokou Pirates and finally those of external enemies such as the Chinese and Koreans.

—description from the back of the rulebook
categories: Civil War, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Pirates, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Codenames: 10 jarig Jubileum bonus set 2020 NL
description:
A set of 10 extra cards with (regular) Dutch words for the 10th anniversary of the Dutch version of Codenames.

Set is marked with NL05

name: Das Wetter
description:
Your child will learn about the weather while playing with this educationally valuable game..
The aim of the game is to correctly put together 9 weather boards - each made up of 6 to 7 picture parts that match the given term, e.g. "storm", "rainy weather" etc.
The middle pieces and the matching pieces with the word are distributed to the players in equal numbers.
Whoever completes all of his boards first is the winner

name: Kleos: Tides of Fate
description:
Conflict has arisen among the Olympian Royalty, while Hades watches with envy from his kingdom below. A new island kingdom has emerged with powerful ties to the mainland and a gate to the Underworld. Poseidon lays claim to the island, and Hera responds with a challenge on Zeus’ behalf. Hades summons his armies and claims the land based on its connection to his realm, while Demeter joins simply for a chance to strike at the Gods for the anguish they caused her.

Kleos: Tides of Fate is a standalone expansion to 2021's Kleos. It contains everything you need to play, featuring a new game board, 4 new playable gods, new miniatures, and entirely new cards for each deck. It can be combined with the gods and components from Kleos (2021) for a new experience.

Kleos is a lightly asymmetrical game of strategic combat, card play, and area control. It combines hex-based combat with your favorite card game elements for a dynamic experience.

Play powerful blessings and curses to gain advantage. Summon Minions onto the board or use them as upgrades, serving as mounts or sacrifices to bolster their allies.

Take the role of a Greek God, call forth your champion, ready your armies, and use every divine power you possess to win at all costs!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Take That

name: Captain for a Day
description:
Peter Pan recently seized command of The Jolly Roger, but his restless heart longed for adventures across Neverland and worlds beyond. Before even a week at sea, he knew he needed a trusted First Mate to take charge when he was away.

To find the most capable, Peter devised a fiendishly fun contest. He ordered the Lost Kids to take turns as Captain of his vessel–a new Captain for each new day. Each Captain’s first task would be to decide which of the others should gain powerful advantages for their quest.

As one of the Lost Kids in Neverland, your goal is to wisely use your resources to gain the most Command before Peter returns. You’ll do this over several rounds (days). Each round will have two phases.

First the Captain for the round will offer Peter’s deal to the other players. Deals promise powerful benefits. The players have to decide how much they’re willing to give up for the deal. The Captain has the tough decision of who gets it.

After that, each player will take a turn. They will choose to either gain more resources for future rounds, or they’ll use what they have to gain Command through adventures in Neverland and actions on the Jolly Roger.
After a set number of these rounds, Peter returns and the winner will be determined.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Mike Petty Games, Roll and Write Revolution

name: Park Life: Hedgehog
description:
It was a beautiful day in Hawthorn Heath. People were dancing, reading, playing. Suddenly the weather changed. No one was ready… Except for you, a clever merchant.

Sell umbrellas when it rains, ice cream when it’s hot, tea and coffee when it’s cold, kites when it's windy, and masks when it's hazy. Park Life is trick taking game with 5 weather-based suits.

But customers are savy, so only the merchant with the last lowest price will make the sale. The lowest value card on suit wins the trick, but it is also is worth fewer points in the end.

You also have opportunity costs. Every sale makes you feel like going home, so you discard extra cards face down when you win a trick. You can quickly make small sales, but you’ll go home before others, giving them the opportunity to make huge sales alone! This well-balanced hand management action economy avoids perfect information and fills Park Life with rich choices.

The merchant who has made the most money at the end of the game wins! For solo and co-op, there are set point goals needed to win.

—description from the publisher

Although very similar to Park Life: People, this design isn't different in aethetics but also by its deck composition (5 suits numbered 1-10) by its scoring (done after every round), by the reset of the cards after each round, by its winning condition (2 round wins to win the game). It is considered more family-friendly.
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trick-taking

name: Three Hoorays for the King: The Battles of Adwalton Moor, Stratton and Cropedy Bridge
description:
Three Hoorays for the King is volume 3 in Roberto Chiavini's series of games on famous battles of the English Civil War. Thee Hoorays for the King portrays three battles of the English Civil War, fought in 1643 and 1644, and all won by the Royalist armies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Boldness and Courage Unto Them: The Battle of Marston Moor
description:
Boldness and Courage Unto Them is volume 4 in a series of games by Roberto Chiavini on famous battles of the English Civil War. The English Civil War is a series of low complexity games
covering the period from 1642 to 1650.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Dockfighters: The Ale Wars – Fortress Expansion
description:
This expansion includes:


Rules and missions
A giant fortress tower full of air defence weapons, built for only one reason; to protect something deep below...
6 Rotatable segments:
Antenna Array
3 Directional Ground to Air Missiles
Flak Battery
Radar
Radar Jammer
Heavy Flak

Defense Wall (including artillery): x6 curved walls, x6 straight walls, x3 underground hangars


Height is 161mm/6.3"

This expansions comes in a wooden box.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Claim Action, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Dockfighters: The Ale Wars – Special Conditions & Objectives Expansion
description:
The Special Conditions and 3D Objectives expansion includes:


Rules and special objectives cards
x6 Target Balloons, 21mm/0.8"
x3 Air Mines, 30mm/1.2"
Flying Grandstand, 60mm/2.4"
x2 Scout Blimps, 46mm/1.8"
x3 Radar Masts, 77mm/3"
x2 Express Trains, 45mm/1.8"
Guided Ballistic Missile, 42mm/1.7"
Bridge, 45mm/1.8"
x2 Prototype Fighters, 52mm/2"


All aircraft are magnetized and the expansion comes in a wooden box.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Claim Action, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Dockfighters: The Ale Wars – Airship Expansion
description:
The Airship Expansion includes:


Rules, missions, and alternative airship sheets
BZW-2 "Ironhead" Battle Airship for All Factions, 165mm/6.5"
CL160 "Atlas" Cargo Airship for All Factions, 90mm/3.5"
Aruba Pirate Airship, 136mm/5.3"
New Airship Systems:
x8 Cargo Boxes
x4 Heavy Flak Systems
x4 Radar Jammers
x4 Harpoons
x4 Artillery Systems
x4 Railguns



All miniatures are magnetized and the expansion comes in a wooden box.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Claim Action, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Dockfighters: The Ale Wars – America Expansion
description:
The America Expansion includes two new factions: Texas (Yellow) and FSAS (Federation of Southern American States, Purple):


Rules, Aircraft Sheets, and Campaign Missions
x2 Airships, Texas (133mm/5.2") and FSAS (102mm/4")
x16 Aircraft Miniatures
x14 Airship Systems


This expansion comes in a wooden box and all miniatures are magnetized.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Claim Action, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Eternal City
description:
Background:
In the timeless expanse of an ever-thriving Rome, history has taken an alternate course. Defying the whispers of downfall that echoed through the ages, The Eternal City stands stronger than ever with its marble edifices casting shadows over three millennia of unbroken rule. As the fading health of the Emperor looms over the empire, the stage is set for a epic struggle among the Imperators vying for the throne's mantle. Each Imperator must assemble a Cadre of loyalists and champions drawn from the diverse tapestry of Roman society. From the elite Praetorian Guards to the elusive Thieves, every choice carries weight, shaping not only the outcome of battles but the very fate of the empire itself. As the Bank of Aureus overflows with the lifeblood of the city, fortunes rise and fall as Imperators strive to amass the wealth and influence needed to secure their claim to the throne. Yet, amidst the clash of steel, one truth remains: in the Eternal City, only the strongest will ascend to rule.

Overview:
Recruit a variety of Fidelis (Loyalists) to form a strategic Cadre (Army) that will protect your Imperator (Commander). Aquire enough funds from the Bank of Aureus to afford the cost of your Fidelis actions. Weaken your opponent’s Cadre until only their Imperator remains. Remove them from their power position with one final attack. Last Imperator remaining claims the throne of the Eternal City.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Memory
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers

name: Civil War Board Games #1: The Civil War Begins
description:
Civil War Board Games #1: The Civil War Begins game is set during the American Civil War. It's a 2 player game where players are attempting to capture 3 enemy spaces on the board. They do this by rolling the dice and adding or removing counters to the board. When they add counters to a troop icon they are able to "fight" the other player's spaces by using Rock,Paper,Scissors' as a determiner of who wins the round.

Background/Context: During the Civil War, women played vital roles both on the home front and directly on the battlefield. With men leaving to fight, women took over responsibilities traditionally considered masculine, such as managing farms, businesses, and even operating as spies for both the Union and Confederate forces. In this game it allows players to fight for control of the United States and also see how women had to help out in the men's old jobs.

Objective:

When a player adds 3 counters to 3 separate enemy spaces, they win.
OR, when one player has beaten all the other player’s troops.


Gameplay
Instructions - Setup

Union – place a blue counter on all of your icon spaces. Place 5-10 blue counters in your stockpile icons.
Confederate – place a red counter on all of your icon spaces. Place 5-10 blue counters in your stockpile icons.


Instructions – Gameplay

Each player rolls the dice and follows the instructions for each number, listed on the gameboard.


Extra Gameplay Notes

Players have extra counters they add to the game from their stockpile.
When a player rolls the number 1 or 2, they remove a counter from the other player’s side, and give it back to the


enemy’s stockpile.

When a player rolls the number 3 or 4, they take a counter from their own stockpile.
When a player rolls a 5 or 6, they do NOT take the counter from their stockpile. They must use a counter already on


the board to capture an empty enemy tile.

When a player rolls a 6, they must have a counter on the troop to fight. They need to play ‘Rock, Paper, Scissors’ to remove the other player’s counter and replace it with their own. The winning player must move its own troop into the enemy territory. (It does not get an extra counter to replace the icon it moved from).
Red and blue counters cannot occupy the same space, unless you roll a 6 and are in the middle of a ‘Rock, Paper,


Scissors’ fight. Variations

Players can choose to play the game where you are able to stack counters.
Players can vary the amount of counters they begin with on their board.
Play the game where the players do not put the ‘taken’ counters back into their stockpile.


—description from the designer
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play

name: Cactus Town: Tools Promo Card Set
description:
Tools are action cards, which have a single use. They are party specific, as the action card back is color and icon coded, the same way as the party's other action cards.

You gain a tools card at the beginning of the game and have additional tool cards available in your tools stack. After use, tool cards get discarded, but you can gain new tools from your stack when losing a duel. Yes, you read correctly, losing will give you a benefit. This is an optional balance mechanism that will strengthen you in case of bad luck with the dice. If you run through all your tools, you form a new tools draw stack with the discarded cards.

This promo contains the initial tools (1 per faction, a total of 7). Another 2 tools per faction (14 tools) were unlocked as stretch goals in the campaign.

This promo card pack is multi-language, including English, German, French and Spanish.

name: Pantheum: Demigods of Olympia
description:
Reign as an Olympic God recruiting your own team of powerful Demigods to outwit your godly siblings. Command, compete, and create a new world!

The war between the Titans and Olympians has left the world barren and empty. As humans begin to settle Farms, Cities and Temples, Zeus calls upon the gods to reshape the desert land. Play as one of the major Greek gods tasked with adding Forests, Mountains, and Rivers according to your Divine Plan.
But watch out, the other gods have a different vision for how the world should be reformed.

Combine area Control Mechanics by moving your god around the map to influence different areas and an Engine Building system of recruiting powerful Demigods to augment and enhance you abilities each turn. The winner is the player who can score the highest by reshaping the world to according to their secret plan and hiring powerful Demigods.

—description from the publisher

name: Survivors of Anvil
description:
In Survivors of Anvil, players take on the role of survivors after a plane crash in the winter wilderness known as Anvil. Your goal is to be the first to reach the mountain and call for help by gathering the necessary resources. In order to succeed, players must prepare for the unpredictable winter weather and environmental events by managing health and resources. During a turn, players may choose to explore, build, scavenge, hunt, and steal from other players.

Includes: 7 unique environments to explore, 10 different loot tokens, 54 event cards, unique resource management mechanics, vibrant art style, and cover art by Miguel Coimbra.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Hexagon Grid, Negotiation, Push Your Luck, Race

name: La campagne de l'armée du Nord 1870-1871 (The North Army Campaign)
description:
This is a historical simulation of the last fights of the Franco-Prussian war from November 1870 to January 1871. One player takes the role of the French Republican forces lead by general Faidherbe trying to reduce the pressure on the siege of Paris and threatening the Prussian line of supply running from Germany to Paris. The other player is in command of three strong German corps who must prevent this threat and destroy the French Army.
This is an operational game, with hidden corps, division, columns or dummies evoluting on the map featuring the northern part of France, from Rouen to Lille and Amiens, one turn for one week. The map represents all major cities, fortresses, main roads and railroads, based on point to point movements. Infantry, cavalry, artillery and siege artillery units are placed on boards for each nominative combat force on the map. Their status is follow-up on this board ; full or reduced strength, supplied or unsupplied, their tired level – rested – tired – exhausted -. Normal and railroad movements are done through activation shits. Initiative may switch from one side to the other, depending on the number of combat forces moved on the previous turn. There are three combat resolution tables ; pitched battles and skirmish, depending of the sizes involved in the fight, and a specific siege table. Reconnaissance and retreat are possible before fights which are never mandatory. A dozen of random events bring chrome and allow uncertainty.
La campagne de l’Armée du Nord (The North Army Campaign) contains two independant scenarios The opening fights for Amiens (2 turns, 1 hour) and the Campaign (10 turns, 5 hours). Victory points are earned by controlling objective cities or winning pitched battles.

—description from the designer

name: De Lampionnen van Lanzhou: promotegels 2019
description:
A set of four promo tiles for Lanterns: the Harvest Festival, released in 2019 by White Goblin Games in the Netherlands (different from the 2015/2016 promo tiles).

The tiles provide more aesthetic variation in the platform artwork. Before you add all four new tiles to the game, you are encouraged to first remove one tile of each platform type from the base game.

name: Space System Error
description:
An "escape room" style game, with multiple puzzle cards that need to be solved and then combined to solve a meta puzzle that connects them all.

The pack contains a series of puzzles which connect to create an answer to a master puzzle you must solve to unlock C.L.E.D. (Captain’s log Entry Device) which has been password protected in an alien language and discover the whereabout of Captain Landon Plannet.

It’s a super game and takes experienced puzzlers around an hour to solve. For those who aren’t as experienced in puzzles, you may need a little longer – average solve time 90 minutes for less experienced puzzle solvers.

You can play the game in a small team, as the puzzles are printed on individual cards, meaning you can work together on different puzzles at the same time, and combine answers to create the master password. There's no time limite either, so you can do 2-3 cards, stop, then do another 2-3 later.

If you have a larger group of friends, you can buy multiple copies and run the game in groups simultaneously and see who solves it first? It can easily become a “team escape experience”.

—description from the publisher

name: Home Front Heroes
description:
Love Escape Games? Enjoy fiendish puzzles?

This game is packed full of puzzles and fun and great for solo play or with a small group.

A fascinating escape room style adventure set in the 1940s. Challenge yourself as you attempt to access a secret black market organisation!

A great game to enjoy whether you are a solo player or part of a small group.

Find the people behind the Blackmarket threatening the Homefront

You must solve the puzzles and find a secret password in order to be admitted to the criminal underworld.

It’s a super game and takes experienced puzzlers around an hour to 90 minutes to solve. For those who aren’t as experienced in puzzles, you may need a little longer – average solve time 2-3 hours for less experienced puzzle solvers.

You can play the game in a small team, as the puzzles are printed on individual cards, meaning you can work together on different puzzles at the same time, and combine answers to create the master password. If you have a larger group of friends, why not buy multiple copies and run the game in groups simultaneously and see who solves it first? It can easily become a “team escape experience”.

name: The Dream Thief
description:
From 2020 to 2024 there was a series of murders along the I-90 between Cleveland and Louisville. Over the course of 3 years, police investigated 28 homicides which all conformed to the pattern. Each victim was staying in a hotel or motel close to the I-90, and was killed with a single bullet from a Colt 45 shortly after retiring to their room. A feather, later determined to be from a dream catcher, was left at each murder scene.

Can you solve the case and catch the serial killer?

There are a variety of puzzles in the box as well as narrative, combining the best of both worlds to create an exceptional self contained game. You need to engage with both the puzzles and the narrative in order to eliminate suspects as you progress through the case.

This game does not require access to a computer and is designed for solo play, or for a small group.

name: Level 7 [Escape]: Cerebral Override Module
description:
This is a promotional Item card for Level 7 [Escape].

The text is "Pass a 5 Intelligence challenge to move any player, guard, or clone one tile. This counts as a challenge action."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Level 7 [Escape]: Adrenaline Promo Card
description:
This is a promotional Adrenaline card for Level 7 [Escape].

The text is: Gain 2 Fear at any time (Shield +3) / Gain 3 Fear at any time. Any player can reroll any number of dice from one roll of his choice. / Discard at any time to raise or lower your fear by 1.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Diversity
description:
In Diversity, players take on the role of recruiters for large companies committed to diversity and inclusion. The aim of the game is to build a team of employees with different skills and experience for great vacancies, reflecting the diversity of our society. The game is challenging and fun, and is a great way to learn more about the importance of diversity in the world of work.

—description from the publisher's website

A number of companies are revealed, each with job vacancies for different professions.
During the game, each player acquires possible employees of the most diverse classes, genders and professions, placing them in a puzzle in front of them. Once a player has managed to gather orthogonally adjacent possible employees on their table, fulfilling the requirements of one of the companies with current vacancies, they can "hire" one of these, which will generate points at the end of the game, and reveal a new company, with new job vacancies.
At the end of the game, each person employed generates points and the categories most in demand by the market, additional points.
mechanics: Contracts, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Pattern Building

name: Oh No! There Goes Tokyo!
description:
Construction is booming in Tokyo! But there's a Kaiju on the loose that smashes any building in it's path!

Players buy property cards that allow players to build. Buy blocks to build skyscrapers. The higher the building, the more the blocks cost, but the taller the building, the more rent you collect!

However, there's a rampaging Kaiju (represented by a windup monster toy) that might knock over your buildings. You choose the path of the monster - it might be helpful or harmful depending on which way the unpredictable Kaiju decides to move!

Fortunately, you can insure your buildings to reap great rewards if it is knocked over. You can also buy sushi cards that pay off at the end of the game.

The player with the most cash after five rounds of play, wins!

—description from the designer

name: Japanime Tactics: Granblue Fantasy – Djeeta Starter Set
description:
In Japanime Tactics, you can assemble a team of your favorite Granblue Fantasy characters like Djeeta and Io by combining their ability cards into a deck, then battle your opponent's team on a modular board of interlocking map tiles.

Each round, players use their cards to attack and defend with their characters. Any card can be used by any character to provide bonuses for matching colors and action types, but characters can perform powerful unique abilities by using their specific cards.

During a battle, each player has a unique objective such as rescuing a hostage or destroying supplies and must use their team to attack their opponents and interact with the terrain to score the most points before all players run out of cards.

Japanime Tactics: Granblue Fantasy – Djeeta Starter Set contains the characters Djeeta, Katalina, Io, and Vira, and it's playable on its own in a simplified 2v2 mode. By combining this set with other Japanime Tactics sets or boosters, you can play the full 4x4 game.
mechanics: Command Cards, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Set-up

name: Jaw Breaker Card Game
description: The object of Jaw Breaker is to match cards in order to knock out an opponent's tooth from their playing surface. Your goal in the end is to knock out all players teeth and have the last tooth or teeth standing.

name: Mord in Palermo: Das Mafia-Rollenspiel
description:
The game Murder in Palermo is a card-based role-playing game in which the players take on secret roles. Now it is up to them, the residents of Palermo, to act together or each pursue their own plan to ensure justice at the end of the night.

A dreamy stroll through the warm nights of Palermo. But the romantic facade is deceptive. The Cosa Nostra has the Sicilian port city firmly in its grip and a Mafioso may already be lurking around the next corner. If a citizen of the city doesn't defend himself, he may be... dead the next night.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: ブラッククリスマスポーカー (Black Christmas Poker)
description:
ブラッククリスマスポーカー (Black Christmas Poker) is a card game using mah-jong/poker combinations

36 cards of three suits : red, green and black. Cards go from A to 7, with two of each card in red and green, and one of each in black, plus one special black card.

On your turn, you draw a card either from the facedown deck or from a faceup discard, and then you discard.

You win if, after drawing from the deck or the discard pile, you have a complete set. Sets are composed of three combinations : run of 3 cards of the same suit, 3 cards with the same number or three cards, 2 cards from the same number. To have a complete set, you must have at least two combinations of 3 cards and one of 2 cards.

You also must announce when you only need one last card to form your complete set.

At the end of the round, the winner earns some points depending on how you completed your set. You also can win some bonus points.

With two games, you can play up to seven players.

name: マタタビおかいものゲーム (Fur Furtive Alley)
description:
Players try to have the most money at the end of the game.

On your turn, you, as a buyer offer some money face up, and other players try to convince you to take their card(s) in exchange. When you chose someone, you take their offer facedown, and they become the next buyer.

Player(s) not selected by the buyer receive some tokens that can be offered to the buyer, or can be used to see if the transaction is fair when you're the buyer. If it's not, the seller has to give you tokens until the deal is fair. If they can't, they're out of the game.

The game ends when someone is out of cards, the player with the most money (and still in the game) wins.

name: 우리동네고양이 (My town cats)
description: A card-based cooperative game where you play as one of seven cats and use their individual abilities to find food and shelter.

name: Link City
description:
In Link City, build a city by matching ideas!

In this cooperative party game, players create the biggest possible city in 6 exciting rounds, trying to have the most connections between the Location tiles and score points.

In each round, a different person takes on the role of mayor. His or her mission: secretly connect 3 new locations to the sites marked by 3 building studs. The twist? The other players then talk together, trying to make the same choices as the mayor.

Harmony is the only way to validate the mayor's decisions and expand the city! Take up the challenge, unlock bonuses and admire your unique and unusual city!

—description from publisher

name: QUATTROMANIA
description:
Quattromania is a strategic board game for two players, offering an innovative twist on the popular game Connect Four. The game rules allow for easy immersion while still providing room for strategic thinking and enjoyment. Below, I'd like to highlight some of the game's strengths:

Sustainability: The entire game, including the board, game pieces, and packaging, is made from recycled plastic, promoting not only environmental friendliness but also awareness of sustainable gaming practices.

Fun and Strategy: Its resemblance to Connect Four allows players to quickly grasp the game, while the rules and longer playtime of 10-20 minutes ensure a tactical and entertaining experience.

Practicality: Quattromania impresses not only with its gameplay but also with its practicality. The game pieces are taken out of the board at the start, and the game tidies up itself during play. It's highly durable and easily transportable in its game sleeve.

Aesthetics: With its striking graphics and colorful game pieces, Quattromania not only provides enjoyment but also boasts aesthetic appeal. After the game, the remaining pieces create new patterns, making it suitable as a decorative element in the living room, perhaps as a "coffee table game."

—description from the designer

name: Amist: Mutant Control
description:
Dreadful mutations have taken the world by storm. Some are more resistant to its effects, while others fall victim to the primal instincts of the animals their DNA was spliced with. As one of the survivors who has limited control over their mutations, you and the rest of the colony that has banded together must research the mutant's DNA for a cure if humanity has any hope at survival. While gathering DNA samples, players must also withstand the treacherous wastelands, craft vital items, and secure locations to build back a civilization worth fighting for. Each player must prove their capabilities by earning the most Reputation Points in hopes of becoming the leader of the colony. Dare to enter a world of mutants to save humanity?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Move Through Deck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Alpha Clash: Cosmic Conquest
description:
Cosmic Conquest is a fast-paced 2-4+ multiplayer dice rolling game filled with combat and strategy. It features a unique combat system using a mixture of dice, cards, and Contender abilities.

Players will assemble a team of three Contenders to fight for galactic supremacy! With incredible art, repeatable gameplay, and collectible miniatures, players will not want to miss out on the fun!

Etch your name into the history books as the champion of the upcoming Alpha Clash in Cosmic Conquest!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action Timer, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Modular Board, Victory Points as a Resource, Zone of Control

name: Ancient Realm: Leaders – Set 3
description:
The course of history can be steered by powerful leaders. Achieve their goals alongside other major milestones to make the most of their singular talents.

Leaders - Set III introduces 6 renowned leaders from major eras in history.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Ancient Realm: Leaders – Set 2
description:
The course of history can be steered by powerful leaders. Achieve their goals alongside other major milestones to make the most of their singular talents.

Leaders - Set II introduces 6 renowned leaders from major eras in history.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Vine
description:
Grow your beanstalk from the ground up to absorb more light, propagate, and produce green beans ready for harvest. This light engine-building card game leverages an action point system used by players to compete to develop the highest-yielding garden of pole beans. Cut back your plants to grow more veggies throughout the season, develop additional root systems to absorb more sunlight, and let your vines climb high to produce the most points by the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Connections, Income, Market, Take That, Tile Placement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Avengers Affiliation Pack
description:
Players can begin assembling their team of earth's mightiest heroes with Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Avengers Affiliation Pack, which repackages the Avengers-affiliated characters found in the original Marvel: Crisis Protocol Core Set, including Captain America, Captain Marvel, Black Widow, and Iron Man in one accessible box. Players looking to get into the game or expand their Avengers roster will find the miniatures and Stat Cards for these characters along with copies of the Avengers Assemble, Ricochet Blast, and Second Wind Team Tactic Cards featuring new art, giving them everything they need to form a battle-ready Squad straight out of the box.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Cabal Affiliation Pack
description:
Players can begin gathering their own Cabal in Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Cabal Affiliation Pack, which repackages the Cabal-affiliated characters from the original Marvel: Crisis Protocol Core Set, including Red Skull, Crossbones, Baron Zemo, and Ultron in one accessible box. Players looking to get into the game or expand their Cabal roster will find the miniatures and Stat Cards for these characters along with the Cosmic Invigoration, Dark Reign, and The Age of Ultron Team Tactic Cards from the original Core Set featuring new art, giving them the foundation for their Cabal squads.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Old Biddies
description:
Old Biddies is a cat themed bidding game. It's not important to be an old woman, or to even like cats. You just need to win.

The Aha Moment - Vizzini would be proud.

You are playing Old Biddies and a lot of cats come by. You want those cats so you bid your highest card. But wait, aren't the other people going to bid their highest card too? If you bid your lowest card and let everyone else fight over the cats, you will have the advantage on the next bids until you spend your highest card. But everyone knows that, and they may bid low also. Perhaps you should play a middling card and beat their low cards? Or just put out a Porchlight and wait to see what they bid? Ah heck, just make it rain!

Old Biddies is a very simple mechanic with a few power cards thrown in to make it interesting. Additionally, if you win the most days in a round, you earn a round bonus so even small numbers of cats can have an impact. And lastly, he who controls the Catnip bag, controls the ties. No matter who ties, the player with the Catnip bag decides who wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Bluffing, Card Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Japanime Tactics: Granblue Fantasy – Gran Starter Set
description:
In Japanime Tactics, you can assemble a team of your favorite Granblue Fantasy characters like Gran and Lyria by combining their ability cards into a deck, then battle your opponent's team on a modular board of interlocking map tiles.

Each round, players use their cards to attack and defend with their characters. Any card can be used by any character to provide bonuses for matching colors and action types, but characters can perform powerful unique abilities by using their specific cards.

During a battle, each player has a unique objective such as rescuing a hostage or destroying supplies and must use their team to attack their opponents and interact with the terrain to score the most points before all players run out of cards.

Japanime Tactics: Granblue Fantasy – Gran Starter Set contains the characters Gran, Lyria, Rackam, and Noa, and it's playable on its own in a simplified 2v2 mode. By combining this set with other Japanime Tactics sets or boosters, you can play the full 4x4 game.

name: Holiday Hills
description:
In Holiday Hills, players collaborate to transform the town square into a dazzling winter spectacle, adorning trees with twinkling lights and festive decorations. Elves and humans work and live together in a town that loves to celebrate Christmas. But this year, everyone has procrastinated too much and each team only has one day to get Jingle Bell Square decorated in time for the annual parade!
