Each turn, players will move either Elf or Human as far down the track as they wish. They'll gather a decoration from the shop they land on and then either take as many decorate actions as they passed over, or pick up as many presents as they passed over and add them to their meeple. Each elf/human can only fit so many items in their bag, so be sure to decorate often!

Throughout the game, players will be adding trees to squares in town, adding various decorations to their and other players' trees, and placing dice presents under trees. All of this is to complete scoring objectives and become the best decorator in town!

Compete to create the most enchanting display and spread holiday cheer in this delightful decorating adventure!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Track Movement, Worker Placement

name: Campeones: Oliver y Benji – El juego de cartas
description:
Prepare yourself for the adrenaline-pumping experience of Campeones, Oliver y Benji. The card game. Dive headfirst into the electrifying world of football where every card in your hand can be the game-changer. With the match unfolding in two heart-pounding parts, the sole mission is to outscore your opponent with goals.

Draft your dream team before kickoff by strategically selecting player cards that promise greatness. The game's arsenal boasts 90 cards, featuring teams, fans, match plays, and nerve-jangling events.

Throughout the game, the thrill intensifies as you draw cards, unleash strategic moves, and execute game-changing actions like skillful passes, spectacular shots, and impenetrable defenses. Utilize cards and tokens strategically to elevate your team to new heights.

As you buy cards to strengthen your squad, feel the rush of accumulating team points and devising new strategies. Immerse yourself in the heart-stopping moments of passes, shots, and defenses, where card values, tokens determine who emerges victorious from the fray.

Special cards, such as yellow cards, red cards, and the referee, add intrigue and strategy to the game, while events like injuries can change the course of the match. Campeones, Oliver y Benji. The card game offers a unique experience where strategy and chance blend in every card played!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Income, Open Drafting, Tags, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Cavern Shuffle: Maze of the Minotaur
description: Based on the classic Solitaire, Cavern Shuffle is a solo-player dungeon delver game where the player must level up their party in order to uncover the dark twists and turns of the dungeon. Using familiar mechanics, players will uncover useful Items, overcome Obstacles and defeat the Boss Encounter to win!

name: Crystalline Creature Hunters
description:
Delve into the dungeon to defeat pairs of Crystalline Creatures to steal their treasure.
Players press their luck by taking numerous turns Delving into the Dungeon: rolling dice against increasingly difficult odds to collect gems and treasures without busting.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Koi Koi Solitaire
description:
Shuffle the deck and deal out 8 cards to the table and to yourself.

You start off the usual way by matching from your hand with a card on the table, followed by drawing one from the deck and matching it or placing it on the table. (drawn cards never go into your hand.)

In this version you are playing against the deck. After you go, the deck draws one card to play as if from their hand, matching any cards that are available or place it on the table. Then draw a second and repeat the previous option.

Play like this continues until you or the deck gets a valid combo, you may choose to koi koi, but the deck never does and immediately ends the round with the points. For added fun you can allow the deck to koi koi on some possible combos like 10 chaff and/or 5 seeds as these ones are easier to score in the coming turn and adds a challenge for the player to try and score something before they do.

Place all cards the deck claims across from you on the table to keep track, just like you do on your side.

Play a set of 3, 6, or 12 rounds like the traditional game. And keep track of both sides trying to beat the deck. For a hard mode give the deck a starting 10 points and beat them by the end of all rounds

House rules that can add to the possible combos.
Full month: getting all four cards of one month, either at the start when dealt or during the game. scoring 6 points.
Joined hand: getting a full hand of 2 cards each from four different months in hand, immediately ending the round. scores 6 points.

name: Corps of Discovery: Mega Foggy Map Pack
description: These maps are all for the new mode we unlocked where you can play the Fog concept in each of the other chapters. Adds 4 more per Chapter for a grand total of 20 more maps! To be clear - you NEED the Fog Expansion to make use of these maps!

name: Corps of Discovery: Mega Map Pack
description: 24 new maps - 4 more maps per chapter.

name: 水果险中求 (Fruit Insurance)
description:
A grand fruit-collecting competition is fervently underway on Fruit Island, but mischievous monkeys on the island are also eyeing those delicious fruits. Players must adjust their picking routes to avoid the monkeys' pursuit and ensure that every hard-earned fruit is safely delivered to the warehouse.

—description from the publisher

name: 企鹅历险记 (Penguin Adventures)
description:
In Antarctica, penguins are invited to a Christmas party. This journey poses challenges for the penguins as they have to climb towering icebergs, cross wide rivers, and navigate through floating ice sheets while occasionally encountering polar bears blocking their path. To brave the bitter cold, they decide to wear beautiful and warm scarves before setting off determinedly.

—description from the publisher

name: Snatch the egg
description:
Keep your eggs close and fight with dragons.
Once the deck runs up the game is over and whoever has the most dragon eggs- wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Propaganda Wars
description: For the PnP game of Propaganda Wars you will need 5 six-sided dice, two pencils and the game board in the instructions. It is a Yahtzee-inspired head-to-head battler. It was created during the Erasmus+ project Gamify+: Enhancing Organizational Capacity through Hybrid Gaming during activities introducing participants to the PnP games principles and how to theme your design with media literacy education in mind. The following focuses on propaganda. Players represent two sides of an ongoing information-based conflict. Their possible attacks are defined by the well-known combinations of dice values, in this case, named after the most common propaganda mechanisms. To win one needs to drop the opponent's HP to zero.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Educational, Political, Print & Play

name: Across the World by Air
description:
Across the World by Air is an Australian wartime game where players race from 4 different starting place on the globe and race towards Melbourne, Australia.
Players follow a coloured path across the world, moving by the roll of a dice. Players many encounter obstacles along the path that may hinder their progress.
As the players travel along their route to Melbourne they will encounter other cities which the player must land on by the exact number on the dice.
First to reach Melbourne is the winner.

name: Level 7 [Escape]: Event Promo Card
description:
This is a promotional Event card for Level 7 [Escape].

The text is:

Spawn a guard on every tile that has a player with 3 or more threat. "Attention all personnel: Escaped subjects reported in Gamma sector."

Spawn a clone on every tile that has a player with 6 or more feat. "If you don't calm down, they'll find you."

Each player rolls as many dice as his current Strength and discards five cards minus one for every Strength icon rolled. "This place is falling apart."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Level 7 [Escape]: Gamer Promo Card
description:
This is a promotional skill card for Level 7 [Escape].

The text is: Gain 1 fear to reroll one die.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Pounce
description:
In Pounce, players become cats aiming to catch prey totaling 8 food value. Each round, a new prey is turned over and player simultaneously selects Sleep, Stalk, or Pounce. Players who Pounce must place their Pounce action card on one of the revealed prey. If only one player chooses it, they can catch it by discarding Energy cards from their hand. If multiple players Pounce on the same prey, they must fight over it using Intimidation and Hiss cards. Sleeping lets you refill your hand of cat cards, and Stalking gives you an advantage in your next fight.

The cat deck is filled with many different cards, split between Energy (used to catch prey), Stars (e.g. Hiss, Scratch, Catnip, which can be played once at a specific time), and Skills (e.g. Fishing (allows you catch fish), Intimidation, Sharp Vision, which can be played multiple times). The game is fast-paced and highly thematic.

The game also comes with a mini-expansion that adds event cards to the prey deck.

name: Rock Paper Scissors Wizard Croc
description:
Rock Paper Scissors Wizard Croc is a fast-paced and strategic twist on the classic game of Rock, Paper, Scissors. In this card game, players engage in epic battles – multi-turn competitions where Rock, Paper, and Scissors meet Wizards, Crocodiles, and Wild cards (oh my!).

How does this evolution make the game more fun?


New elements, like the Wizard and the Crocodile, expand battle options and outcomes, providing players with more choice and helping to make game play different each time.
A back-and-forth play structure replaces the classic one-and-done game, elevating the importance of strategy and longer-term thinking, while adding an educational component to the game.
Wild cards make for wild times, with unexpected surprises that can change battle momentum on a moment’s notice.
The Rock Paper Scissors roots make this new variation easy to learn (rock still beats scissors, paper still beats rock, etc.) and the familiar base facilitates cross-generational appeal.
There are multiple ways for 2-4 people to play. The variations – one-on-one, multi-round battles; tournament-style play; and group play – enable players to mix things up based on personal preference, number of players available, amount of time available, and age range of the players.


—description from the publisher

name: Legend of Gonia
description:
Legend of Gonia is a strategy game where your objective is to destroy your opponent's Akrios or annihilate their Tribe.

Deploy your Warriors into the Gonia arena and take control of the tiles. With the powers of Spirit Cards, attack from a distance, cast magical spells, or perform special movements to win the battle! Release the Djinns to exert constant pressure on your opponent and turn the tide in your favor!

Craft your Deck with finesse and dominate the Battlefield in an epic duel, where synergy between Spirits and your Warriors will be the key to victory.

Unleash the power of cards and become the Master of Gonia.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Template

name: Vector
description:
In Vector, you'll race against the stars as you gather resources to save your civilization from your galaxy's dying star in the polyomino engine builder.

Each turn, players use action selection to move their ship across their galaxy to harvest resources to add to their ship, mine currency to aid in recruitment, or visit the hub to add crew members, additional ships, or nobles.

The player with the most Valor before the star goes supernova, is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Ghostland
description:
Jurassic Park meets Ghosts in this Co-operative boardgame about a theme park gone mad! It's opening day at Ghostland, a theme park that contains actual ghosts! However, havok has immediately broken loose, and the ghosts are attacking guests left and right.

It's up to you and your friends to stop the ghosts, build Field Generators to contain them, and finally face off against the most sinister ghost in the park, the infamous Rex Garrote!

Ghostland is based on the popular horror book series by the same name by Duncan Ralston.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Finale Ending, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Reinhardt Joraku
description:
This is a doujin game produced for sale at Japanese game shows. In order to get one, you needed to order the game in advance and then it could be picked up at the show. These were not available to the general public.

Ginga Gunyu Densetsu Ichi or "Reinhardt Joraku" (Reinhard takes the Capital) reproduces the Legend of the Galactic Heroes conflict using the "Sengoku Gunyuden" system. It is a campaign game with a map that stretches the galaxy. The game comes with an 8-piece 34"x 45" map, rules, two sheets of counters, and four tables/charts. You need to assemble the map and mount the counters.

Scenarios include “Twilight of the Gods” and “Mar-Adetta.”

There is also an expansion for the game called "Frontier Conquest." However, both can be played as stand-alone games.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: 1980 Sixtina
description:
In 1980 Sixtina, you will be restorers competing to excel in the meticulous task of revitalizing the majesty of the Sistine Chapel. Following the Vatican's guidelines, you should employ various techniques according to the requirements of each area to be restored. However, the discrepancy between the Vatican's criteria and the judgment of a skilled restorer could lead to controversial restorations that are valued more by experts than by the Vatican institution itself. Prepare yourselves to embark on a challenge where art and history intertwine in every brushstroke!

The restoration of the Sistine Chapel in 1980 marked a significant milestone in the preservation of the Renaissance artistic legacy. This ambitious project, led by a team of experts, embarked on the daunting task of returning Michelangelo's masterful frescoes to their original splendor. Over several years, meticulous cleaning and consolidation work allowed the vibrant palette of colors and intricate details hidden beneath centuries of dirt and degradation to be rediscovered. The restoration of the Sistine Chapel not only revitalized one of the most iconic masterpieces in art history but also inspired a renewed appreciation for the importance of preserving the world's cultural heritage.

name: Alley Cat Ninjas
description:
Deep in the heart of Feline City lies an alleyway that has been the center of a long war waged between two clans of cats who follow the way of the ninjas. At stake is the supremacy and control of the alley. With so much blood spilled and no end to the war in sight, both clans have agreed to engage in a duel of throwing stars. Whichever clan is the most accurate at throwing, will have sole rule of the alleyway. The losers with lick their wounded pride and find another place to live. Which Alley Cat Ninja clan will be the rulers of the alleyway?

Alley Cat Ninjas is a two player, table top dexterity game where you will flick or push your throwing stars to land on your opponent’s targets (coins) and score points. Players will sit directly across each other and alternate turns launching their throwing stars. Be careful though, if you throw it off the table, you will lose an opportunity to score. With each hit, you will move your points marker accordingly. Whoever reaches 12 points first, wins the game!

—description from the designer

name: Zoomies
description:
A Puzzly Game of Clever Canines

In Zoomies, you’re a dog walker helping your pups at the dog park make friends, become the leader of the pack, collect bones, and get the zoomies. Your goal is to score the most points by matching a dog tile to the middle of the table and placing a scoring token on that tile. Tokens give you points based on adjacent dogs, bone icons, and more.

Play your dogs right and you can add points to a previous token while digging up a whole new way to score. At the end of the game, score each token to see who’s top dog.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Kobbbrix
description:
In Kobbbrix, you take control of robotic space snakes in a desert world, where you need to consume dimensional energy vortices to survive.

The game offers a challenging experience, with 3 levels of difficulty, where 1 to 4 players must work as a team to strategically and efficiently place pieces, creating the best combinations, avoiding unwanted pieces, and preventing snake collisions. As the game progresses, the challenges increase and players need to enhance their cooperative skills, managing pieces and data as best as possible to achieve victory.

Besides the cooperative mode, Kobbbrix can also be played competitively in a 1-on-1 versus mode. In this mode, each player must consume more dimensional energy vortices than their opponent while making the best combinations and avoiding collisions.

—description from the publisher

name: Escape From Zombie City
description:
Escape From Zombie City is a race to get out of the city as zombies are taking over. Players will fight zombies and find weapons, quick cures, backpacks and other fun items along the way. As players fight zombies, they will earn points as they kill the zombies.

If a player gets bit by a zombie 4 times, they become a zombie and chase everyone else. They do lose all of their points and any cards they are holding. This player does not have a chance to win the game, but they can stop the other players from winning the game as well.

The city is a bit of a maze and does have blocked roads. Players are trying to get to an extraction zone that's on the opposite side of the city. When a player reaches the extraction zone, they start a four turn counter and hover above the city in a helicopter that allows them to shoot zombies as they wait for more players to get to the extraction zone. When the four turn counter is over, any player that didn't make it to the helicopter gets left behind and automatically loses the game. Points are added up at the end of the game to see who the winner is.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Line of Sight, Point to Point Movement

name: Terror na Cabana
description:
Ah, the school bell goes off, for the last time in the school year, classes are over. Vacation, the magic word that echoed through the heads of all young students stops being a vague term and finally gains meaning; Time to close your notebooks and open your imagination to the possibilities.

Four friends already had everything planned: A cabin, a weekend, and everything that came to mind. The journey of several kilometers to the heart of the forest amidst the mountains, where screams echo, and yet are not heard.

In Terror na Cabana, players compete against each other, trying to survive, while being chased and eliminated by classic monsters from horror stories. The last player left alive is the winner.

name: Offshore AWA Sydney: Hobart Yacht Race Game
description: Offshore simulates one of the world's great ocean yacht races - the AWA Sydney - Hobart Bluewater Classic. Using charts, dice, instruments, cards and calculator, each player tries to get his or her yacht to Hobart first. This game has a combination of skill and luck. And just like the real Sydney Hobart there is a line honours winner - the first boat to cross the finishing line, and a Corrected Time Winner - the winner on handicap. The game may be played at two speeds - standard and fast.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Cultus
description:
The long war has finally come to an end.
However, the day when the people of this frontier territory can return to their peaceful lives is still far away.
For their sake, we must rebuild the devastated city as soon as possible.
Don't forget to fulfill your true purpose...

Cultus is an abstract strategy games in which players will take turns moving around the board to collect funds, rebuild the city with their building cards and monuments while score victory points from various point source such as the monument abilities or their plan card.

name: Starbeast
description:
Life has been extinguished across the universe. Starbeast has destroyed any life he has come into contact with. Now the resistors, a band of humans, elves and orcs must use their unique talents to stop Starbeast and return peace back to the Universe.

Starbeast is a game for 4 players with a unique 1v3 set up. One player takes the role of Starbeast and the others of the 3 Resistors. This game uses strategy, resource management and cooperation during timed turns. Players create and battle units, strategically set up bases, recruit characters and trade resources.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Miniatures, Real-time, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Flicking, Hand Management, Real-Time, Resource Queue

name: Runner Tactics
description:
Runner Tactics is a game for two players that combines elements of tactics games like Final Fantasy Tactics and field goal games like American Football or Rugby.

A player wins either by crossing into the opponent’s end zone, or by attacking and removing all of the opponent’s pieces.

There are 10 unique pieces. Large command tiles are used to assign movement and attacks in secret from the other player, while the small game tiles will execute those moves on the game board. Each player places a blue cube for movement and a red cube for attack on each command tile. After both players are ready, the vision guards are removed, and the moves are executed simultaneously.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Children's Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Sports
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Movement, Movement Template, Moving Multiple Units, Open Drafting, Pattern Movement, Score-and-Reset Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Turnip
description:
Welcome to the world of Turnip! It's time to get your farm in check and prepare for the annual Turnip-Off! In this bluffing game, 3-5 players will compete as turnip farmers trying to take the most turnips to market. Will you stay pure and plant turnips the right way, or lie your way to sweet turnip victory? Stash cards, catch fibbing players, gather turnip tokens, and play the highest total of cards to slide into victory each round. It's your sacred duty to win, and don't forget to pay the Turtle Tax!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Renaissance
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Deduction, Push Your Luck

name: Super Snipers: Light and Shadow Mini Expansion
description:
This expansion for Super Snipers introduces two new Snipers:

J@[\]u5 is a mind-hacker capable of shutting down their opponent's powers for short periods of time and stealing their basic ability when enraged!

SUBHUTI is a monk with a Basic Ability that becomes less potent the more hits he lands but an Adrenaline power that becomes more powerful with every shot he takes.

This expansion comes with 10 Cards (1 Basic Ability, 1 Adrenaline ability, 1 AI Basic Ability, 1 AI Adrenaline Ability, and 1 Reference Card per character), and 6 acrylic Hiding Discs.
mechanics: Chaining, Pattern Building, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Manatee Sanctuary
description:
Hungry Manatees, Playful Manatees, Common Manatees, attract them all to your ever growing habitat to create the best Manatee Sanctuary and win the game!

Manatee Sanctuary is a family weight game in which players will draft cards using an "I split you choose" method over the course of 3 rounds. Once the draft is complete players will decide whether to use their cards for their top action, thereby attracting manatees and producing food, or grow their sanctuary by tucking the top portion of the card under their ever expanding board creating more room for manatees and increasing their food production. There are many different types of manatees in the sea each with their own effects and after each player has finished using their cards everyone must feed all their hungry manatees! Once all manatees have been fed players will score points based on the number of manatees they have, their type, and the round they are in. At the end of 3 rounds whoever has the most points wins!

Manatee Sanctuary comes with multiple modules and play option for family's and hobby board gamers alike!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Environmental, Territory Building
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, I Cut, You Choose, Multi-Use Cards, Pattern Building

name: Imposter Syndrome
description:
Impostor Syndrome is a hilarious game of bluffing, blending in, and BS! Each round, players will have to pick a person and modifier card from their hand to compete in a randomly selected challenge. The twist? One of you is an Impostor, who doesn’t know the challenge when they pick their competitor! The challenge is revealed once everyone has selected their cards, and now everyone must present their argument for why their competitor is the perfect candidate for this challenge. Keep a careful eye on your opponents! You’ll only score points for correctly identifying the sneaky Impostor. And if you’re the Impostor…? Don’t let anyone know that you know nothing!

—description from the publisher

name: Gooblet War
description: Players pick 1 to 3 tower cards (each with a grid of 7 blocks) and draw a hand of 6-12 gooblet cards for each tower, taking turns adding cards to their towers to harvest resources, add to the tower's defenses, or attack an opposing tower. The goal is to be the first to destroy all an opponent's towers.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Resource to Move, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: ХОХОХО
description:
HoHoHo is an asymmetric dueling strategy game with paper-and-pencil mechanics, moving through the territory and building a path that reproduces the Christmas atmosphere.

On his turn, Santa can move 1, 2, or 3 spaces to get to houses with children, give gifts, and get to the South Pole as soon as possible. Grinch, in his turn, prevents Santa - he plants giant super-fast-growing Christmas trees, green like himself, which block Santa's way. Who will win in this competition for Christmas cheer?

There are also other marks on the map - mountains, different types of houses, and Wormhole tunnels that can help Santa fold the space-time continuum.
Options for placing children in houses and poles on the map make each game unique and create many possible combinations.
The game contains 2 expansions, which will also allow you to diversify the next games.
And what symbols to use on the map will not let the players forget the name of the game!

—description from the designer

ХоХоХо — це дуельна асиметрична стратегічна paper-and-pencil гра на переміщення по території та побудові шляху у сеттінгу та атмосфері Різдва.
У свій хід Санта може походити на 1, 2 або 3 клітинки, щоб дістатись до будиночків із дітьми, подарити подарунки і якнайшвидше дістатись Південного полюса. У свою чергу Грінч перешкоджає Санті, а саме садить супер-швидко-ростучі велетенські зелені, як сам Грінч, ялинки, які перешкоджають шлях. Хто переможе цьому двобії за різдвяну радість?

На карті є також інші позначки - гори, різні типи будиночків та тунелі-червоточиниб які допомогають Санті скласти просторово-часовий континуум.
Розташування різної кількості дітей у домівках та полюсів на карті додає реграбельності кожній новій партії. Є варіанти доповнення та розширення карти. А якими позначками користуватися гравцям на карті не дасть забути назва гри!

—description from the designer (Ukrainian)
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Race

name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: A Gathering of Heroes
description:
With the evils of the Shadow Deep clawing at his borders, the King of Alladore sent out a call to every realm, a summoning of heroes to come and stand against the darkness. In truth, he had little hope that his plea would be answered, and it is true that no large armies have come to Alladore’s aid, but help has come! Mainly they came in ones and twos, or small unassuming groups, but they came. Spellcasters, mercenaries, knights-errant, desert nomads... heroes from the lands surrounding Alladore have come to stand with their brothers and sisters. Individually, they seem an insignificant force, but with their skills and special abilities added to those of the rangers, they might just tip the balance!

The 192-page hardcover Rangers of Shadow Deep: A Gathering of Heroes features:


Advanced Character Creation including new Traits and Limitations that players can use to bring greater tactical and narrative variation to their rangers.
Ten ‘Archetypes’ that players can use to create new characters, representing the heroes that have come from the lands around Alladore to join the fight against the Shadow Deep.
Collects five previously stand-alone supplements for the game: Blood Moon, Temple of Madness, Ghost Stone, Incinerator, and Menagerie.
Fifty-two unique enchanted weapons.
A bestiary featuring all the creatures from the core rulebook and all the collected supplements.
Copious new artwork from the visionary of the Shadow Deep, Barrett Stanley.


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Fil Rouge: Vieux Chêne Demo
description:
Players work together to recreate a visual story by using illustrated cards. Players can freely talk (without showing their cards to the others) and try to elaborate a coherent story by adding cards to the middle of the table. The main appeal of the game is the narrative creativity it initiate, the emotional bonds players experience when listening to each-other.

Vieux Chêne (Old Oak)

As we walk, I understand why this activity is essential to him. I believe that for him, hiking is about offering a simple encounter with yourself in the present!

name: Plantje Boom
description: In Plantje Boom you collect as many animal species as possible with your tree cards. The more different species you collect, the more leaves grow on a tree. The winner is the player with most leaves on their tree.

name: Fluttr: Spin the Bottle
description:
The most played party game throughout history around the world has evolved. Meet Fluttr, a hilarious reimagined version of Spin The Bottle, designed to bring people together in unexpected ways. A few minutes into playing Fluttr, strangers become friends and sparks start flying.

Fluttr is the only game that makes you feel butterflies!

First, you grab a Challenge card and read it out loud. Chances are you’re about to get very close to another player, the question now is, which one of them?
That’s when the bottle comes in and the butterflies start fluttering.

How racy are the Challenges? Just enough to test your chemistry with other players. Also, they’re very interpretative, which means that you decide how far you take them, and this depends a lot on who the bottle picked for you. That’s what makes Fluttr unique. You’re not really playing against anyone. Instead, everyone is having a great time and enjoying a good dose of feel-good chemicals derived from human physical interaction, without the awkwardness that it could generate under other circumstances. It’s all part of the game.

Now you can also bring Fluttr with you wherever you go, with the Fluttr Spin The Bottle app.

name: Slip It In
description:
Get everyone talking in this party game that transforms boring chitchat into hilarious quests to insert random phrases into your conversations. More than just a game, it's a social experience that can be played anytime, anywhere.

Can you sneak 'slippery when wet' into a weather discussion or work 'deep fried Twinkie' into a restaurant order without getting busted? Slip It In and find out in this game perfect for
nights out with friends, dinner parties and game nights!

How to play:

Each player starts the game with 5 slips of random phrases.
Players must try to slip their phrases into natural conversation without getting busted.
The first player to successfully "Slip It In" five times wins the game!


—description from the publisher

name: The Ghost Lift
description:
In this simple card game, be the first to empty your hand of cards by playing them into the central "elevator" pile.

Cards have to either be played in ascending, or descending order but this can change depending on the cards played!

Cards left in your hand once another player empties their hand become penalty cards. If you keep the same numbered penalty card across 3 rounds you'll lose!

The game is fully language independent.

—user summary

ルールは簡単！「上昇／下降を繰り返す場札」に手札からカードを出して手札０枚を目指そう！
特殊効果カードを使って途中で反転！上昇／下降の流れを変えて他人を妨害しよう！
残った手札の数字がペナルティになる！優先的に捨てないと脱落するかも…

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Jomsvikings
description:
In this tactical game with deckbuilding elements, 1-4 players become one of the Jomsvikings - an elite mercenary group capable of accomplishing even the most impossible tasks. You set off to different planets of the Nine Realms to gain glory while figthing anything your employers want you to fight!

The game consists of 3 rounds, during which players fight the chosen monsters (each of them separately), but can either help or hinder other players. Each round takes us to a different planet, with various conditions, that can impact combat. By investing in new cards and new equipment it can become much easier to defeat them, but the ultimate goal lies in collecting the glory points (received for defeating the enemies, finding the valuable artifacts, and using the abilities skilfully).

Jomsviking can be played solo, in 2-player coop mode, or in 2-4 player free for all.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Fatal Encounters
description:
Fatal Encounters is a story-driven murder mystery game that brings authentic investigation mechanics to the tabletop. Each case begins at the crime scene, just like a real investigation. Our unique puzzle challenges you to analyze evidence and reconstruct the sequence of events, creating the "story" of the crime scene.

From the crime scene, advance to the next stage: the suspect network. Follow the leads by building a crime board complete with red twine and sticky notes.

Immerse yourself in three distinct case modes: Homicide, Serial Killers, and Cults. Each mode offers different deduction tactics and case strategies, enabling you to track down and capture elusive killers.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Papaya
description:
It's summer time, you work at a beach, and try to inventory all the objects lost by the tourists.

Papaya is a competitive card game in which you have to estimate the number of one object on the table.

You know only the exact number of an object in your cards. And you know , for the other cards, only the type of object with the Verso oh the cards.

At your turn you can denounce the previous player or announce a superior number of an object.

The winner of the turn win all the cards which can have this object. 1 point per card at the end of the game.

You can also announce PAPAYA ! if you think that we reach the exact number of one object.

There are special effects cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Deduction, Hot Potato

name: Bulbous: Bael's Grotto
description:
Bulbous: Bael’s Grotto is a Roll & Write adventure where players assume the role of ancient guardians of hidden forests. In these forests, little creatures can be tamed by grabbing their favorite treat: bulbs.
It’s a game for 2 players, that takes around 20 minutes to play, from ages 10 and above.

Game Setting

Bael’s Grotto is a mysterious place located in the forbidden region. Elder legends tell stories of mysterious creatures and succulent bulbs from the depths. For the fearless Baelfungious, there’s no room for idle chatter! Embark on the exploration of the grotto and lead a group of four Baelfungious to find and savor the irresistible bulbs.

—description from the publisher

name: Make That Flight
description:
A micro-deck-building screw-your-neighbor race to the gate.

Make That Flight is a fun social game that involves building your best deck to get you to your flight first. Over three rounds you will trade, steal, and give away cards to get the quickest time so you are the first to Make That Flight. Navigate the four phases (Transportation, Check-In, Security, and Gate) of your journey best to win the game!

The Aha Moment

After Round 1, you're sitting pretty with 150 minutes and no bad cards. Then in round 2 your "friend" trades you a Missed Flight card for your "No Worries" card in Transportation! Now what?!?! Luckily you have Round 3 and you pass the "Missed Flight" card back to your "friend"...success!! Unfortunately now you have to draw a Gate Card to finish your story.....what will it be? Golf Cart Ride, No Worries, Bad-Timed Bathroom break.........whether you make it or not all depends on this card. And the card you flip over is................

—description form the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Deduction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events

name: Backyard Butterfly
description:
An educational life science board game for kids and their families. Find and raise monarchs and learn about their life cycle. Backyard Butterfly is a game played in 4 stages:

Stage 1: Hunt for eggs. Roll the leaf shaped die and flip over 1-3 leaf tiles until you find an egg. Place an 'egg tile' on your milkweed board. Move on to stage 2 on your next turn.
Stage 2: Feed your hungry caterpillar. Action sequence:

Roll leaf die to populate leaf tiles onto your milkweed board.
Roll both caterpillar dice. Move your caterpillar meeple around the milkweed board twice with the goal of landing on leaf tiles to eat.
Place any eaten leaves onto your leaf tracker board.


Continue with this stage until your leaf tracker board is full.
Stage 3: Chrysalis Coin. Flip the coin (twice per turn).
Green side- continue to wait.
Orange and Black side- your monarch butterfly is ready to emerge! Move on to stage 4!
Stage 4: Your monarch has emerged and flys away! Place a monarch butterfly token in the sky above the leaf tracker board. Butterfly tokens represent points earned. Begin your next turn back at the egg stage.

There are two additional gameplay variations:
'BB Helper' walks parents through how to teach even the youngest gamers to play a game with multiple actions and stages in a way that is intuitive and fun.
'Field of Milkweed' is a competitive version of the base game where all 4 milkweed boards are placed together to form a field. All resources are up for grabs and nature can strike at any time. Nature being an additional d12 rolled at the beginning of the caterpillar stage causing havoc.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: L'Ordre De Veiel: Les Miraculés D'Alenmur
description:
The Les Miraculés d'Alenmur expansion is made up of 7 heroes, 6 of whom feature French content creators.

Etrigane, Bob Lennon, Sheshounet, Pressea, Benzaïe and Ganesh have all agreed to join the Order of Veiel!

Each new hero you will discover has been designed in close collaboration with each of the participants and according to their respective wishes and expectations. Everyone has already tried ODV and enjoyed it!

Of course, as well as adding more and more heroes, it's also important to us that each creation offers a new way of approaching the Order of Veiel, with new mechanics.

—description from the publisher

name: Birds On A Wire
description:
Birds of a feather sit on wires together!

Utilize the elements of the scenery to make matches and gain control over the telephone wires. Have the highest number of birds at the end of the game to win!

Watch out for hazards like squirrels and downed wires. Strategize to cover up your opponents birds. Stake your claim to the telephones wires in this fast-paced and infinitely re-playable area control matching game!

—description from the publisher

name: Dragon & Unicorn Collector
description:
Your goal in Dragon & Unicorn Collector is to collect the most exotic...dragons and unicorns. Yes, exactly what the title promises. The harder the creature is to collect, the more points you get for capturing it. You also earn extra points for collecting a dragon and unicorn from the same region.

How do you capture these creatures? Roll the super magical sparkle dice and match the symbols to collect the dragon or unicorn.

name: Mystery Jass
description: The legacy of your grandfather is waiting for you. But you will only find this if you can solve the mysterious puzzles that hide in the Jass cards. If too tricky, hint or SOS cards will help you.

name: The Hunters A. D. 1492: Wasserburg Dockers
description: Take on the dockers and their infamous leader Jonas "Stronghand" Ebmer in this mini-campaign featuring new scenarios, enemies, events, and equipment, which can be played as an extension of the main campaign or as a standalone experience.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The Hunters A. D. 1492: Heroes Set 1
description:
Two new playable characters are called to join the hunt: Chloe the Witch and Guido the Crossbowman. Chloe is a highly perceptive and experienced caster who uses her magic to detect and anticipate incoming attacks, aid her allies with long-lasting beneficial effects, or curse her enemies. Guido specializes in dealing large amounts of damage from a safe distance and rallying his party to victory.

Contains:
1x Guido miniature
1x Chloe miniature
1x Guido board
1x Chloe board
45x Guido action cards
45x Chloe action cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: AROISK Motor Racing Board Game
description:
“The Greatest Motoring Game of Skill Ever Invented”

An antique Car Racing Game dating from the early Twentieth century c.1910’s.

The game plays on a large, two-fold game board and uses six Racing Car pieces and a dice. It is stated that “the cars move by an entirely new method, no dice or mechanical device being employed.” It therefore appears to be an early ancestor of the better known Formula 1 by Waddingtons.

The Racing Circuit depicted on the board has corners marked “Mountjoy” and “Gough”, indicating that it is based on the Phoenix Park Circuit in Dublin, Ireland.

Made in England by H. P. Gibson & Sons, London, later known as Gibsons.

Similar to:

Formula 1

name: The Hunters A. D. 1492: Heroes Set 2
description:
Embrace the shadowy underbelly of society with two new bandit-themed playable characters: Franziska the Brawler and Siegfried the Cutthroat. Franziska is a former noblewoman-turned-rogue who relies on manipulation and dirty tricks to lower the enemy's morale and support her fellow party members. Siegfried is a deadly assassin who specializes in dual-wielding daggers and other short weapons to deal quick and decisive blows to his prey.

Contains:
1x Franziska miniature
1x Siegfriedminiature
1x Franziska board
1x Siegfriedboard
45x Franziska action cards
45x Siegfriedaction cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Top Tier
description:
Top Tier is a light party game based on the internet phenomenon of tier lists. Each round, one player will be the Tier Wizard, and secretly draw a category card from the deck. This will be the category they are ranking all the contenders in for this round –anywhere from who would be best at fighting a bear to who would have the most unread emails in their inbox! Without knowing the category, the remaining players will pick 8 contenders for the round. These can be characters, celebrities, or even personal friends. The Tier Wizard must rank the contenders by how good they’d be in the category, and once they’re done the category is revealed, but not their rankings! The rest of the players must do their best to rank the 8 contenders the same way the Tier Wizard did, scoring points for every card placed correctly! If you can get all eight contenders right, you’ll truly be Top Tier!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Ordering, Player Judge, Questions and Answers

name: Suite Dreams
description:
Suite Dreams is a cooperative game in which the players will have to rearrange dream cards, which are in six suits numbered from 1 to 11.

A number of cards (which varies depending on the chosen difficulty) is placed in a face-down row on the table. The players each have several actions (the amount of which varies depending on the number of cards present and the player count) to secretly look at a card and replace them face-down somewhere in the row, trying to place them in ascending order. When all players used all their actions, the cards are all revealed and if they are in ascending order, the game is won.

The game comes with several variants, including a training mode, the Nightmare Master mode in which they have to rearrange as many cards as possible, and a hidden traitor version when one of the players is secretly the black sheep, trying to sabotage the row.

name: Las Ligas de la Ñ: Los Juegos de la X
description:
King Alfonso X the Wise has organised an exceptional cultural contest - the Games of the X, similar to the Olympic Games of Ancient Greece in Olympia and the twelve challenges of Caesar in the great Colosseum. Which contestant will get the most medals to obtain the magnificent X of eternal wisdom?

During his life, Alfonso X has sponsored and translated works of different disciplines in his court, such as law and politics (Fuero Real de Castilla, Espéculo, Setenario and Siete Partidas), history (Estoria de España and General estoria), art and music (Cantigas de Santa María and Cantigas de escarnio y maldezir), games (Libro de los juegos, that includes chess & variants, alquerque, dice and tables games, nine men’s morris or the mil game…), science and magic (such as Tablas alfonsíes and Libro complido en los judizios de las estrellas, both about astronomy and astrology; Lapidario, about natural properties of the stones; and Picatrix, about hellenistic magic), and sapiential literature (Sendebar or Libro de los engaños, Calila e Dimna, Liber Scale Machometi and Bocados de oro).

Las Ligas de la Ñ: Los Juegos de la X (The Ñ Leagues: The X Games) is a board game played by 2 to 8 players that contains 15 playable characters of the Middle Ages and Renaissance (Alfonso X, Wallada, Ramon Llull, Christine de Pizan, Maimónides, Urganda the Unknown…).

In this new Ñ game (seventh in the series), the players play as one of the characters to obtain X number of medals (5 for a short game, 7 for a semi-fast one and 10 for a long game). During the game, the players move on the board to reach special squares (sacred relics and category squares) to obtain medals in different ways, either on minigames played after each round or by using the characters' or relics' special powers. In every round, the players take turns to do their actions (one of the following three: 1. Moving, 2. Using a character’s power or 3. Using a relics’ power).

Each category (discipline) has its minigames (Art, Medieval sciences, Fantasy, Games and Politics). For example, the discipline “games” contains, among others, chess and its variants, nine men’s morris, dice games, table games and card games.

Each character has unique powers and a range of movement (following a line or diagonally). The Ñ is a neutral character which can be used by every player to win its favour or to put it against the opponents.

Even though the game is played on a 64-squared board (like chess), the players move on the intersections (like in go), making it an 81-squared board. Every player starts at the letter X in the middle of the board and can move according to the characters’ pace to every square.
categories: Book, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Medieval, Music, Novel-based, Party Game, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game, Square Grid, Tags, Turn Order: Progressive, Voting

name: Ό,ΤΙ ΝΑ ΝΑΙ
description:
A hilarious party game where you'll agree to disagree!
Who snores the loudest? Alexander the Great, Peppa, Einstein or Lady Gaga?
Up against the craziest combinations of characters you've ever seen, ask the wackiest questions and watch your opponents struggle to agree!

name: Dragon Hunting
description:
Dragon Hunting is a card game that players use spears, men and ballista's to shoot dragons. The players use gold to purchase what they need to attack the dragons. There are four types of Dragons and each dragon kill gives the players points and gold. At the end of the game the players count up their points and see who the best Dragon Hunter is.

—description from the designer

name: Flag-Stones
description:
An abstract game for two players. The pieces have space for a flag to be inserted. As you move pieces, the direction on the flag determines in which direction the piece is moved. Alternatively, if you want a piece to go in a different direction then you must spend a turn moving a flag into a different direction.

Object of the Game: To convert two Flag-Stones into Corner-Stones by occupying the 'Home Corners'. The first player to do so is the winner.

How to Win: The first player to convert two flagstones into cornerstones is the winner. Should neither player be able to convert two flagstones into cornerstones, the winner is the player who has managed to convert one cornerstone.
The game is drawn if:
(a) Neither player can complete a cornerstone, or
(b) If both players can only complete one cornerstone each.

The game includes rules for playing traditional games Draughts and Fox & Geese.

name: Moonstone: Ribald the Troll
description:
Single large miniature made in fine quality resin.

Contains:
1 x Ribald Miniature and Stat Card

This miniature is multipart and requires assembly.

name: BelloLudi Vietnam
description:
Welcome to the skirmish game BelloLudi Vietnam! We are so happy that you have taken an interest in wargaming. These rules have been developed especially for people who have no previous experience in wargaming, yet like to play games. BelloLudi have created a ruleset of just fifteen pages, a little more than the game of RISK. From page 21 onwards, we included some, advanced, rules. You will not be needing them at first, but we can imagine that you would like some variations as your experience grows. Start with that page when you have a few battles under your belt.

BelloLudi Vietnam! is designed as a multiplayer game but will work just as fine with only two players or even solo. The same goes for the number of miniatures involved. It is possible to start with around 20 miniatures, but that can easily be expanded. We hope that playing BelloLudi Vietnam! will encourage you to create your own armies. Similarly, the distances are given in inches for use with 28mm scale soldiers. Feel free to adapt to centimetres should you not have the space or when you use a smaller scale of miniatures.

This ruleset simulates battles in the period of 1955 to roughly 1975, the age in which the worlds’ nations fought various conflicts. The most famous being the Vietnam War. The rules will work for skirmishes in this conflict, but also in other conflicts in this period. They cover the Vietnam War, Israeli Arab conflicts and the various wars of decolonisation.

Modern combat uses the tactic of ‘Fire and Manoeuvre’ in which the enemy was pinned in place or disorganised by the concentration of fire from the infantry and artillery. Once this was accomplished, other elements of the unit could deliver the coup de grâce. These tactics meant that command and control (C2) were essential on the battlefield. Every unit would have its own specific task and if they executed their tasks in unison, success was often achieved. The aim in this game, is not to annihilate the enemy’s units to the last man, but to inflict enough damage that morale is reduced and the unit will become shaken or will run away in panic and consequently removed from the tabletop. This can be achieved by a clever combination of movement, shooting and dashing charges. The tactics are based on teamwork within a group, as well as between groups and as such, the whole army.

Your role will be that of a commander of a small group of soldiers. Should any disagreement arise concerning the rules, we suggest you roll a dice. The one who rolls the highest number is right, for now.

—description from the publisher

name: It's High Noon
description:
Imagine yourself in the wild west, where the best shooter wins the duel...


Fold this piece of paper in half to start the game.
Fold the corner and fold the paper in half. crumple the end so that the paper resembles a drop - this is your bullet.
Take your ball by the sharp end between your index and middle fingers so that your hand imitates a revolver.
Stand back to back with your opponent and take 3 steps forward.
Turn to each other, keeping the hand with the bullet near your pocket.
On the count of 3, both players throw the bullets at each other.
If the bullet hits the leg or hand, for the next round the player must bend the limb and not use it. If you have to bend both legs, you sit during the next round. If you lost both hands, you throw the bullet with your mouth. The one who shoots all the limbs off first wins. If the player gets hit in the head or chest, it's an instant defeat.


—description from the designer

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Deathgorge – Rimelocked Relics Rivals Deck
description:
In the Deathgorge’s depths lie blood-magic artefacts encased within ancient ice. These Rimelocked Relics are the treasures of lost civilisations – weapons and artefacts held fast in the Everwinter’s arctic clutches. Only a burning desire can thaw the magical hoarfrost to free them, though many warriors attempt more exotic and dangerous methods to unleash their terrible power.

Get stuck into Warhammer Underworlds or mix up your game with the complete Rimelocked Relics Rivals deck, usable by any warband – including those from past seasons. These cards can be used as a standalone deck in Rivals games, mixed with a warband's unique cards for Nemesis games, or used to build a deck from the ground up in Relic games. This deck doesn’t include any spells, so warbands from any season can put it to good use. Each card is brand new to the game, focused on acquiring extremely powerful upgrades – but you'll have to thaw them out before they can be used...

This deck contains a 32-card universal Rivals deck consisting of:

12x objective cards
10x gambit cards
10x upgrade cards
1 plot card
1x background card that includes a deck list of the Rimelocked Relics cards


These cards can be used by any warband as a complete Rivals deck, or as part of a custom-built deck. You'll need a Warhammer Underworlds warband, including their fighter cards, to use the contents of this deck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Against the Covenant: Three Scottish Battles of the English Civil War
description:
Against the Covenant is volume 6 of Roberto Chiavini's series of games set in the English Civil War. The three mini-games in this volume portray the battles of Tippermuir (September 1, 1644), Aberdeen (September 13, 1644) and Kilsyth (August 15, 1645.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Hopton vs. Waller: Three Battles of the English Civil War
description:
Hopton vs. Waller is volume 5 in Roberto Chiavini's series of games set in the English Civil War. The three games portray the battles of Cheriton (March 29, 1644), Lansdown (July 5, 1643) and Roundway Down (July 13, 1643).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Speed8ing
description:
Speed8ing is a fast-paced, fun 8-sided dice rolling game. With 3 different game modes and a quick setup time, this will be a game you can get out again and again with family and friends.

OBJECTIVE:
Roll dice to fulfill objectives and have the most points on your objective cards at the end of the game (when the deck of objective cards runs out)

GAMEPLAY:
Each player plays with their own set of dice. Players roll / reroll dice simultaneously until they have 8
dice (including any dice on shared cards) that match the objective. Objectives that don't mention color (and have black dice pictured) don't require a specific color.

As soon as a player has dice that match the objective card, they can claim the card and flip it to the Special Ability side*. The special ability may be used once, then flip it back to the objective side and keep it for end of game scoring. (Diamonds are points)

At any time, players can assign or reassign a die to a color of their choosing if the # of the die matches the # on their color card. (Any # of dice can go on a single color as long as they are within the # range)

Once all the objective cards run out, players total the points printed on their objective cards and the winner is the player with the most points!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pantsertrain! Free Ride
description:
Pantsertrain! Free Ride is a fast tactical wargame in one page!

Build your own armored train and let it rail you to victory!

Find the most unbalanced railcars combination or try winning a duel via exotic build!

No matter where you are or where you go - split page in two and play, needing nothing more than a pencil and an eraser. Have a nice ride!

—description from the designer
categories: Fighting, Print & Play, Trains, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Points, Pattern Building, Player Elimination

name: Good Dog, Bad Zombie: Unlikely Allies 2nd Edition
description: Unlikely Allies is a mini-expansion featuring playable characters including a cat (Boots), pig (Truffles), goat, and parrot (Perry), each with their own unique powers, adding exciting new dynamics to your gameplay.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Good Dog, Bad Zombie: Weird Smells 2nd Edition
description: Weird Smells brings unique missions to the game and new powers like "roll over" and "fetch" that all dogs can utilize. Plus, you'll team up with the formidable Slayer, capable of decimating hordes of zombies in one fell swoop.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Good Dog, Bad Zombie: Puppy Pack
description: With the Puppy Pack, you'll wrangle adorable yet chaotic puppies whose boundless energy will not only bolster human resilience but also repel zombies.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Fractured Sky: Rift
description:
The Rift expansion adds a brand new set collection mechanic to Fractured Sky, offering long term strategy, and higher stakes battles. The more of a color you can collect, the better an offering you can present to the numen.

Concentrate your efforts on completing sets in order to take advantage of their multiplied rewards. The outcome of combat has never been so consequential.

Late game objectives gain an even greater impact on chances of winning. The desire to complete sets provides more transparency to your actions... or better conceals your bluffs.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Constrained Bidding, Deduction, Set Collection

name: Paint it Black: The Attack on Lang Vei February 6-7, 1968
description:
“Oh, hell, they have tanks. They’re right on top of us!” –First lieutenant Fred McGrath’s final radio broadcast from Lang Vei.

When the Communist forces of North and South Vietnam launched the 1968 Tet Offensive one component was the siege of Khe Sanh. The fortified hilltop positions at Khe Sanh were located near the border of North and South Vietnam. An important strongpoint to the south and west of Khe Sanh was at Lang Vei. It was from Lang Vei that US trained Montagnard and Laotian natives would launch raids into communist held territories to disrupt the “Ho Chi Minh” trail by which the Communist insurgency throughout South Vietnam was supplied, and to capture prisoners for intelligence. Destroying the US outpost at Lang Vei was key to Communist success in the siege as well as their larger war effort.

The Communist offensive was launched by the 24th Regiment of the 304th Infantry Division (one of the formations that had fought at Dien Bien Phu fourteen years earlier). The assault force would also include Soviet built PT-76 tanks of the NVA’s 198th Tank Battalion of the 203rd Armored Regiment, the first these types of weapons would be deployed by the Communists in the war, as well as heavy artillery batteries in North Vietnam. The battle here would usher in a new phase of the Vietnam conflict. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Command Cards, Dice Rolling

name: Screwball Scramble 2
description:
Time ticking, heart racing! Will you make it through the maze on time? Screwball Scramble 2 tests your coordination and skill on a topsy-turvy journey through a table-top maze full of brand new surprises. Control the action with clearly marked buttons; twisting, turning, guiding and triggering the obstacles in different ways to guide your screwball through each one.
From zany zig-zag steps to a fantastic Ferris wheel maze, and from the crazy corkscrew challenge to a catapult blast and much more, it’s a wild course full of fun to conquer before you ring the finish bell! Play solo or take on family and friends on game nights! Fastest through the maze wins!
For even more of a challenge, connect Screwball Scramble 2 to the classic Screwball game (sold separately) by using the included bridge. Now you have an even more exciting maze that doubles the fun!

A NEW TAKE ON A FAVORITE FAMILY GAME: Screwball Scramble 2 dishes up all kinds of new challenges as players try to guide the marble through a brand-new maze
SOLO PLAY AND FAMILY FUN: Play on your own or take on family and friends – Fastest player wins!
DEVELOP HAND-EYE COORDINATION: Use skill and patience to control the sliders, wheels and buttons that operate each obstacle, honing motor skills as kids master each task
DOUBLE THE FUN: Screwball Scramble 2 is compatible with the original TOMY game (sold separately); lock the two mazes together with a connecting bridge for a super-challenging game!
GAME NIGHT EXCITEMENT: Interactive game for 1 or more players ages 5 and up – No batteries required!


—description form the publisher

name: 5 Dice Games
description:
A collection of five dice games using custom dice.

In "10 Pin Bowling", players will roll the bowling dice, each blank face represents a pin that has been knocked down. A die face showing a pin represents a pin still standing; these are dice are rerolled once to complete a frame.

In "Jackpot", each player puts an ante into the pot to start. On their turn a player puts one more unit into the pot and rolls the 3 jackpot dice, claiming units from the pot based on their result, as in a slot machine.

In "Spot Dice", players roll standard dice and follow the rules of casino craps.

In "Poker Dice", the players attempt to make the best poker hand with the five poker dice. After an initial roll, the active player may stand pat or reroll up to three of the dice.

In "Put and Take", two custom dice are used, with faces (1,2,3,3,4,A) and (P,P,P,T,T,T). Each player puts an ante into the pot to start. On their turn a player rolls both dice. If a "P" is rolled, the player must put a number of units into the pot equal to the other die. (An "A" signifies that the amount must equal the size of the pot.) If a "T" is rolled, the player takes a number of units out of the pot equal to the other die.
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Punish Me, Daddy
description:
Punish Me Daddy is a game specifically designed to embarrass your friends (and yourself, baby). Each player takes turns drawing a Dare and a Twist card, they must then do them at the same time. If they succeed, they get to keep both cards for 1 pt.

If the player fails to, refuses to, or cannot do the combination, the player must draw and do a Punishment card. If the player can't do or refuses to do the Punishment, that player loses all the points they've accumulated so far and must start over from 0.

Want an example? Dare, "Act like a Karen that needs to speak to the manager". Twist "Strip to your Underwear."

On to the second example: Dare, "Crawl across the room pretending to be a slug". Twist, "Be blindfolded". It’ll be challenging, embarrassing, and even psychologically difficult to overcome. That’s why you can refuse to perform the challenge and draw a “Punishment Card.”

Exactly, here’s some examples: “Get sprayed down by a hose”, “Get tickled by everyone else for 15 seconds”, or "Flash everyone playing."

The more challenges you complete, the more points you accumulate. Master the embarrassment and win the game.

name: Battles of Kursk: A Solitaire Wargame
description:
The Battle of Kursk started on 4th July 1943 around the city of Kursk in western Russia. German forces made initial advances in an attempt to control key areas before the main offensive, called Operation Citadel. The Germans planned to attack from the north and south simultaneously, in an attempt to pinch off the Kursk salient. After the German offensive stalled, the Soviets launched a counteroffensive on 12 July 1943: Operation Kutuzov. By August 1943, their second counteroffensive, Operation Polkovodets Rumyantsev, was launched. The Soviets built a formidable defence, causing the Germans to delay whilst they built up their forces. In the end, Hitler diverted his forces to central Europe following the invasion of Sicily by the Allies. The Germans were unable to launch another strategic offensive on the Eastern front for the remainder of the war.

In Battles of Kursk, you will be commanding a range of Soviet units in order to achieve a variety of Objectives in small scale skirmishes as part of the main Battle of Kursk.

As with all my “Battles” games, the aim here was to produce a fairly traditional hex and counter wargame experience with clear and straightforward rules and a manageable “opponent” which will not take up too much time or effort to operate, but which will give the Player a formidable challenge.

The game contains the rules and charts, 12 battles with full colour maps and suggested counters (to be cut out and mounted on card).

Playing time: 20 to 50 minutes per Battle.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Dice, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Deep Regrets: Lamentable Tentacles Mini Expansion
description:
18 additional fish cards to add to the base game, all featuring far too many tentacles and everybody's favorite great old one.

Not compatible with the solo mode.

—description from the designer

name: Sinonyms
description:
The (under)world's favorite adult party game. Where sinners become winners! player/team rolls the die and lands on 1 of 3 different footprints, black all players/teams call out SINONYMS in direction dictated by card. Devil's Dual footprint, team who rolled picks another team to duel. Red, follow directions on the space. there are black and red word subject cards, the red ones are adult themed.
Play continues until a player/team fails to call out an acceptable SINONYM within 10 seconds. When that occurs, the unsuccessful player/team is eliminated from the round. The last player/team to call out an acceptable SINONYM within 10 seconds wins the round, rolls the die, and moves closer to an escape from the underworld. But beware of Cerberus, Satan's temperamental three-headed pooch!
There are also guardian angel and fork you cards that can be played to help/hurt you.
Can also be played as a card game without the board.
categories: Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Misty Valley: Secrets of the Valley
description:
In this expansion pack for Misty Valley, you can find new inhabitants from the valley, new mechanics, and tons of replayability!

Bartering Badgers expands the main mechanics by adding explorers next to a tile; it allows you to take a token resource on one of the mini-games for each resource.

—description from the designer

name: Woof Days: Annoying Fireworks Promo Card
description: A special promo card available only on Kickstarter and at Farplace Games stalls at events - adds a new card to Woof Days. You can rearrange all your dogs onto different days using this card, helping you place your remaining dogs in hand.

name: Strategie: Würfel-Schach
description:
The figures (1 king, 4 shooters, 8 cavalry, 12 footers) are placed on the game board in two opposing, outer rows of spaces marked by a red colored line, in any order. A dice is rolled alternately once. The meaning of the throw is as follows:

For throws with 1, 2, 3 or 4 points, the same number of any figures move or capture. (Each figure may only be used once in a roll.)
If the dice shows 5 points, then the king alone has to move and capture.
If 6 points are rolled the player loses a turn.


The pieces move or hit in all directions on all spaces.

Capturing is made by moving a piece onto the space of an opponent's piece. (The latter is then removed from the game). There is no obligation to capture. You are not allowed to move or capture across occupied spaces.
According to their kind, the figures move or capture as follows:

Footer: 1 or 2 spaces.
Cavalry: 1, 2 or 3 spaces.
Shooters: like the footers, 1 or 2 spaces.


The shooters can also shoot 1, 2 or 3 spaces. This means that they can take an opponent's piece that is in the direction of their capture without moving onto that piece's space. (This “hitting from a standing start” applies to one move.)
The King moves or captures 1 or 2 spaces. He can also shoot 1 or 2 spaces like the shooters.

The game is won if: the enemy king is captured, or your own king moves to the outermost row of the opponent's deployment space behind the colored line, or the enemy can no longer move.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Static Capture, Variable Set-up

name: Teraphobia
description:
In Teraphobia you take on the role of the monsters and hunt down the humans and their precious souls. But hurry, the other monsters are not sleeping.
With the help of your attack cards, you intimidate the poor souls and take away their courage. Each soul card that you control
has soul points on the back. With these points you can conquer territories for yourself.
Each monster requires 3 special territories
and as soon as it owns these, it is considered to be home.
The first player to home two monsters wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Horror, Mature / Adult, Territory Building

name: Creatures of the Night
description:
When a former classmate bursts into your office frantically asking you to help find her missing daughter, Elizabeth, you have a hard time saying no. The only catch-you will have to go to New Orleans in order to track Elizabeth down. According to her mother, Elizabeth has become heavily involved with the vampire subculture in the Big Easy. Her mother believes she disappeared as a result of that involvement. You've heard that there are people who dress and act like they are actual vampires, but your knowledge on the subject doesn't go much further than that. This definitely sounds like a mystery you can sink your teeth...or... fangs into. So, grab a crucifix, head to NOLA, and walk among the Creatures of the Night.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder at Market Hill
description:
In 1965, my Uncle Percy admitted to killing a journalist called Randall Tomlinson by pushing him in front of a train. After Percy was freed from prison, I developed a close bond with him, and it became increasingly apparent to me that he might have admitted to a crime he didn't commit. Unfortunately, Percy recently passed away without taking the opportunity to restore our family’s reputation. Motivated to uncover the truth, I've begun to delve deeper into his case, convinced there is more to the story than meets the eye. I now need your help as a private detective to identify the real killer.

PHYSICAL EVIDENCE - Inside the case file, you'll find police reports, suspect photos, witness statements, and more.
SEARCH THROUGH AN ONLINE FILE DRIVE - In addition to the physical evidence supplied inside of the case files, you'll need to access an online file drive to prove the prime suspect innocent or guilty - but it's not easy...you'll need to be a smart investigator to gain access to the online portal!

A GREAT NIGHT IN - With approximately 3 hours of game play (depending on your skill level) and a difficulty rating of 4.5/5 this "whodunnit" style thriller will provide a fun night in for all who choose to participate. If you can't crack the case without a secret clue, hints and answers are available online.

—description from the publisher

name: Under Evil
description:
At some point in the early 20th century, what were believed to be only Fantastic creatures of terror, appeared by surprise in different parts of southern Europe. Corpses begin to rise from their graves and vampires along with werewolves attack defenseless citizens.

Did these creatures already exist and were they hidden, or have they emerged now for some reason?

Four survivors decide that it is time to take action and they will be the ones to attack and look for the origin of this chaos; Jack, Aby Olsen, Kris Lazar and Xelen team up equipped with weapons of their own creation to fight these evil creatures.

Under Evil is a cooperative board game with interaction involving objects and scenery. Through various chapters, it unfolds a story of suspense, action, and survival. Under Evil will bring out the attitude of each player —the greedy, the generous, the cowardly, or the brave— determining the game’s progress. It’s an intuitive, fun adventure that’s easy to play, even for those who aren’t experts in this type of game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Astrophobia
description:
Astrophobia is a PvP, turn-based, combat board game with character creation. You start with a random weapon and a random trait and from there you must find the best strategy to defend yourself from your opponents. Inspired by Berserk and the Souls games, Astrophobia is set in a dark fantasy world mixed with the horrors of space. The combat is body-part-based and losing each one has different consequences.

The game includes a total of 177 cards, which feature 30 unique weapons, 25 unique traits, 2 sets of 36 unique sorceries, 2 sets of 12 unique board events, and 2 sets of 13 unique lucky cards, 8 different player tokens, 10 board event tokens and a 10x10 grid square board. Each card has written lore for the player to explore.

The objective of the game is to be the last person standing, and you do that by either killing or disarming the other players, or by running away and letting them get caught in a dagger rain. Astrophobia's random nature can lead to both epic and silly moments and you must improvise in every situation.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Multi-Use Cards

name: Русский Манчкин 2: Комическая гонка
description:
Wherever you are, kill the monsters until you lose your pulse, and you will be neither hot nor cold. Well, in Mother Russia, please choose clothes according to the weather. While picking raspberries from the bush and drinking cold kvass, always remember that winter is coming. You won’t notice how the summer days fly by, and then another one. And who can live well in Rus'?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Где бы ты ни был, мочи монстров до потери пульса, и тебе будет ни жарко, ни холодно. Ну а в Матушке России изволь подбирать одёжку по погоде. Срывая малинку с куста, да попивая холодный квас, всегда помни, что зима близко. Не заметишь, как летние деньки пролетят, а за ней и ещё одна. И кому на Руси жить хорошо?

—description from the publisher

name: Winston: Nineteen Eighty-Four
