description:
Winston Smith, the protagonist of the novel "Nineteen Eighty-Four" by George Orwell, works at Minitrue, rewriting history and systematically eliminating all records of unpersons — but his longing for freedom leads him to believe that it is possible to overcome one's own fears...and escape!

Winston: Nineteen Eighty-Four is a solitaire game in which you will have to travel from Minitrue to the Golden Country before the game rounds end.

—description from the designer

name: 99 Ninja: Mini Promo Expansion
description:
A mini expansion for Micro Dojo included in the English language version of 99 Ninja.

Adds three new buildings to the game that can be gained and lost in a tug-of-war to gain extra points.

name: Kundalini
description:
Open your chakras and release the power!

Make good use of the extraordinary powers you attained through all those long years of austerities, devotion and meditation and try to accurately read the mind and heart of the person in front of you.

Who will qualify as the best student?

Kundalini is a Tug of War game for two with a lot of bluffing going on.

The object of the game is to gain the favor or the most prominent Gurus at the Kundalini Academy so so you can gain access to the final teaching and unleash the Kundalini Energy within you.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, I Cut, You Choose

name: Sakura Front
description:
Breathtaking in full bloom!
Pick a number from 0 - 10 to catch sakura in bloom.

Cherry blossoms bloom with the coming of spring.
Sakura is the Japanese term for cherry blossoms and Hanami is a flower-viewing tradition to appreciate the captivating yet transient beauty of sakura. Strive to have the best Hanami experience by seeking out optimal times to view sakura in spectacular bloom.

The player who declares the highest number among the players gets to experience Hanami and gains points. The game is played over 9 rounds, and the player with the highest earned points will be declared the winner.

nb The designer and publisher kindly released this game in 2020 as a remotely playable game based on Sakura Front Cards (update pending).
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Hora Est
description:
The game Hora Est is played in three rounds in teams of two. The goal of the game is to describe as many words as possible every turn within 30 seconds to your teammate. The team with the most points wins at the end of the game.

Special cards exist to give a unique twist to the way this game is played. Such as the Carel Stolker card that allows your team to distract the opposing team during their turn.

This game is associated with Leiden University and was made to celebrate Leiden University's 444th birthday.

name: This Humble Planet
description:
This Humble Planet is a 2-5 Player strategic terrain-matching game that functions in 3D! Take turns placing beautifully colorful game-pieces to expand the natural terrain! Create Vast Oceans, Fascinating Forests, Massive Mountains and Rolling Fields to secure the most Victory Points and win!

Build it up and don't hesitate to think off the table! This Humble Planet plays and functions in 3D, make plays by placing blocks on top of one another to expand the game upwards and earn bonus Victory Points!

Build with strategy! Each block can be rotated and played in a variety of ways, build atop your friend's blocks to change the landscape recreate a stunning world!

—description from the publisher
publishers: From The Ground Up Games Ltd.

name: Scoville: Pepper Party Promo Pack
description: These optional cards were available during a limited pre-order window and can be added to the recipes to choose from to increase variety and provide new challenges!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Auction

name: The Queer Agenda: Music
description: Channel your inner Liza, Cher, and Dolly with The Queer Agenda: Music, which adds forty new question and answer cards to The Queer Agenda base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: The Queer Agenda: TV & Movies
description: The Queer Agenda: TV & Movies adds forty new question and answer cards to The Queer Agenda base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: The Queer Agenda: Broadway
description: Immerse yourself in the dazzling world of Broadway with The Queer Agenda: Broadway, which adds forty new question and answer cards to The Queer Agenda base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: The Queer Agenda: Career
description: The Queer Agenda: Career adds forty new question and answer cards to The Queer Agenda base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: The Queer Agenda: Brands
description: The Queer Agenda: Brands adds forty new question and answer cards to The Queer Agenda base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: The Queer Agenda: College
description: The Queer Agenda: College, which adds forty new question and answer cards to The Queer Agenda base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: The Queer Agenda: Dating
description: The Queer Agenda: Dating adds forty new question and answer cards to The Queer Agenda base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Счастливое число: Мини-дополнения (Long Shot: The Dice Game – Mini-Expansion)
description:
This compilation includes four expansions for Long Shot: The Dice Game:

Track Events Mini-Expansion
Horse Set 4 (Boot) Mini-Expansion
Horse Set 5 (Hot Dog) Mini-Expansion
Horse Set 6 (Jockey) Mini Expansion


•••
В данный комплект входит четыре дополнения для игры "Счастливое число":

Набор лошадей «Сапог» — это 8 карт лошадей с новыми разнообразными способностями.
Набор лошадей «Хот-дог» — это 8 карт лошадей с новыми способностями, связанными с действием «Касса».
Набор лошадей «Жокей» — это 8 карт лошадей с новыми способностями, связанными с экипировкой жокея.
Мини-дополнение «События» — это 8 карт событий, привносящие новые правила и добавляющие новые действия. На каждую партию выбираются 2 из 8 карт события.

name: Fraction Formula Game
description: It’s a race to “1” with this 4-player fraction game. Draw a card and find the corresponding fizzy fraction tile. Drop the tile into your cylinder. “Hold” if you think you're as close to one as you'll get without going over or draw another card if you think you can get closer by adding another fraction tile. The player who gets closest to 1 wins the round. The included multilingual guide also includes instructions for using the game pieces as a fraction math manipulative.

name: Barony (Second Edition)
description:
In Barony, players are ambitious barons trying to extend their dominion over the land! Who will succeed and become the new ruler?

Gameplay is simple. On your turn, perform one of six actions to expand your territory and diminish your opponents':

Recruitment: Add two knights to a city, or three knights if the city is adjacent to a lake.
Movement: Move one or two of your knights one space each. If you move a second knight into a space with an opposing pawn or village, remove those tokens and take one resource from the village owner.
Construction: Remove one or more of your knights from the game board and replace each with a village or stronghold, gaining one resource.
New City: Replace one of your villages with a city and earn 10 victory points (VPs).
Expedition: Remove two knights from your reserve, placing one back in the box out of play and the other on any empty space on the edge of the game board.
Noble Title: Discard at least 15 resource points, then upgrade your title: baron to viscount, then count, marquis, and finally duke.


Once any player has gained the title of duke, finish the round, then tally the VPs, with players scoring for resources still in their possession, their rank in the game, and the number of cities they built. Whoever has the most VPs wins!

This new edition of Barony includes the Barony: Sorcery expansion and all-new asymmetric player powers.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Night Soil
description:
Night Soil is a very mature game about sanitation in Tudor London.

As the exemplar of cultural progress in Europe, Tudor London (1485-1603) is at the spear’s edge of cultural and technological development. However, as modern plumbing is still generations away, the city is gradually filling up with human waste, making it a terribly fragrant place to live.

Players are competing Night Soil companies. By night, Labourer cards will be used to carefully manoeuvre waste cubes through the narrow streets of London to turn a profit and to recruit workers. By day, these workers can be sent out into London to advertise, garner favour with local businesses, or to improve their company’s assets. However, crowds of workers do tend to add to the waste problem...

At the end of the game, the player who has managed to make the most money wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Income, Pick-up and Deliver, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Magic Academy
description:
At the Magic Academy, all final-year students must compete in the Five Crystals Tournament. They have to use the magical equipment they've acquired during their studies to win. The student who collects the most Crystals wins the tournament.

Players acquire a random number of cards on their turn and must play a number of cards determined by a dice roll. Then, they may either study in one field or challenge another student for a Crystal. Some action cards add more interactions to the game.

When a player has studied enough to gain access to the corresponding Crystal, they take it, regardless of who previously owned it. The game finishes when a player gets their fifth Crystal or when there are no more cards in the pile.
mechanics: Deduction, Random Production, Set Collection, Take That

name: RELATIVITY
description:
RELATIVITY is a strategic board game for anyone who wants to fight their idea of gravity and wants to accept the challenge of reaching the most points in a game.

By going along the faces of the cubes that make up the ABSTRACT STRUCTURES you will touch the faces and score points, but it won't be so simple, because you will have the difficulty of understanding which path is the best by playing on sheets that go against all perspective logic.

The game is easy and intuitive, although the abstract structures can confuse the perception of the sheet map. Simple and intuitive rules.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Three Dimensional Movement, Track Movement

name: The Stonewood Mystery
description:
Follow the clues and solve the case of Emily Williams, a teenage victim whose murder has rocked the tight-knit community. With a list of suspects including a boyfriend, a best friend, a disgruntled neighbour, and more, you’ll have to use your detective skills to figure out who did it.

Featuring detailed profiles of each suspect, a plethora of evidence, and multiple witness statements, “The Stonewood Mystery” unsolved murder mystery game case file offers hours of immersive gameplay and a thrilling mystery to solve. Can you figure out who killed Emily Williams and bring the killer to justice?

name: The Necrohamster: Looting Hell
description:
Delve into Hell, loot powerful artefacts, and recruit demons in the expansion to The Necrohamster card game!

This expansion includes 45 new creature cards (13 unique designs), a new Title card, 3 new Artefact cards as well as a bunch of other exanimate cards required to play the game. Looting Hell also expands the player count up to 2-6 players (with just one copy of the base game required).

The main themes for Looting Hell are delving into Hell and pilfering powerful artefacts. Artefacts are unique cards that start under no-one's control, and are acquired by summoning their corresponding creature. These artefacts are powerful cards, and much coveted by all Necrohamsters. If another player subsequently plays a card that allows them to take that artefact, then they will take it from the player who currently possess it.

Also included in Looting Hell are numerous denziens of Hell, new creatures and monsters that all Necrohamsters can recruit to their cause. There are also new skeletal, spirit, and zombie reinforcements. These are cards which synergise with the both base game and expansion, opening up new combinations and avenues of play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Wars: Legion – Range Troopers
description:
Star Wars: Legion – Range Troopers features seven Range Trooper miniatures that give players a durable new Imperial Special Forces option that can stride into the thick of battle while unleashing their powerful E-10R Blaster Rifles. These miniatures are joined by a heavy weapon miniature that further accentuates the unit's potent firepower. Able to easily traverse difficult terrain, the Range Troopers are accompanies by six upgrade cards that invite players to augment them to fit their own strategy.

—description from the publisher

name: Jumbles: The Grocery Store
description:
Twenty-four cards featuring items you might find in your local grocery shop. The names on the cards are in the form of anagrams.
Before a party, the cards are placed around a room where they can be easily seen. guests are provided with a score card and invited to solve the anagrams, placing the correct name on their score card. The host states a time when the search is ending. Score cards are handed into the host who then checks them all. The guest with the most correct names is declared the winner.
mechanics: Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Real-Time, Set Collection, Spelling

name: The Plot Thickens: Adventure Edition
description:
The Plot Thickens is a storytelling game for quick-thinking, imaginative folks just like you and your friends. The object is to take your hand of story cards, (people, places and things) and lay out the tale of your character, and their fate! You’ll earn plot points for every card you use to build your story, and every time you interweave with other’s narratives.
The storyteller with the most points gets to craft the ending as main character, while the person who connected the most to their cards gets to name the epic as the Author. What will your story be?

In the Adventure edition you'll explore unchartered territories, interact with the wildlife and try to claim hidden treasures!

The different genres of The Plot Thickens can be combined to increase the player count and give you more story options.

—description from the publisher

name: Wallaby
description:
Do you know that wallabies are small kangaroos, right? There you go!
These little wallabies just found a field full of tasty plants, with only an old battered scarecrow to protect some ... they jump & bounce all over, to see who eats the most!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Pattern Movement, Programmed Movement, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Alpha Clash TCG: The Awakening
description:
The Awakening serves as Alpha Clash TCG's first set! Due to recent events on Earth, the Awakening has transformed humans into Alphas, creating a fight for supremacy. Leaving nothing in their wake, the Alphas continue to battle until one remains.

This set features 5 Contenders including Magnate, Moxie, Clarity, Torque, and Mean-Streak. Each Contender offers a unique play style and thrusts players into the action. Who will come out on top as the champion?
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Alpha Clash: Clashgrounds
description:
Clashgrounds is the second set of the Alpha Clash TCG featuring a new comic book art style and brand-new support.

The Harbingers have arrived! As servants of the Progenitors, they have come to test the Alphas and lay waste to Earth.

Adding seven new Contenders into the mix with Conquest, War, Pestilence, Death, Haven, Machina, and Mean-Streak gives players new options and play styles.

Haven introduces a new game win condition through her Backpack - this set put its stamp on the Alpha Clash!
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Alpha Clash: Year of the Dragon Draft Box
description:
Year of the Dragon is the first Draft Box for the Alpha Clash Trading Card Game featuring 197 different cards and 20 new alternate arts. Each draft box supports 8 players and contains prizing, Contenders, tokens, and packs for each participant.

This Draft box serves as a functional reprint of Sets 1 and 2. The Rising Empire Studios team hand selected all 197 cards and placed them into the draft box for an incredible draft experience!
categories: Book, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Misfit Heroes
description:
After a bizarre interdimensional event of massive proportions, Earth as we know it has been forever altered when a fantastic realm merged with ours. The result is a land called Absurdia, where magical beasts live among ordinary people and vice-versa. There’s no going back to the way things were in this place of improbable combinations from monster-accountants to cosmic wedding planners.

In Misfit Heroes, players are organizing crews in hopes of claiming influence to win over the hearts and minds of the citizens in nearby regions. The character cards players will use are different every time you play! Before a game, the cards you will use are created by placing each character transparency together with an attribute card in a card sleeve. You’ll never know what new characters are in the deck, and the combinations are almost endless! During play, each character card will give the players special actions, such as earning money, drawing more cards, and most importantly, gaining influence in the mountain, forest, sea, and city regions of the kingdom. When a player has collected 6 influence they may claim a region of the corresponding type, which scores them points. The player who best uses their characters in combination and gains the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Village Pillage: Dark Arts and Crafts
description:
Life in the village has always revolved around turnips. Growing them, hoarding them, stealing them...some say they can even be eaten!

But recently this simple life has been disturbed by rumors of magic, of dragons, and of a SECOND type of vegetable. Some call it heresy, others call it a pumpkin. You call it opportunity.

Harness the power of these lumpy orange gourds to conjure beasties, transmute turnips, and show those others villages what TRUE villagery looks like!

Dark Arts and Crafts adds a whole new deck of spell cards to Village Pillage, each with a powerful effect. These cards can only be cast by using a brand new resource: Pumpkins! To help gather these powerful veggies, you start with a brand new set of starter cards.

In addition to the above, a new collection of Market Cards can be shuffled into the deck to expand the variety of villagers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming, Humor, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: The Battered Bastards of Bastogne: Panzer Dice 4, in the Bulge
description:
The Siege of Bastogne was a confrontation between American and German forces in the Belgian city of Bastogne, which was part of the larger Battle of the Bulge during World War II. The siege lasted from December 20 to 27, 1944, when the besieged Americans were relieved by elements of General Patton's Third Army.
For their incredible feats, courage and endurance, the soldiers of the 101st Airborne Division were called by the press of their time “The Battered Bastards of Bastogne.”

Panzer Dice 4, In the Bulge, is the fourth part of the classic Roll and Write solitaire game, Panzer Dice. This time set in the Battle of the Bulge and is made up of four titles, of which two are German missions and two are American missions about this chapter of the Second World War.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Print & Play, World War II

name: What do you Meme?: Mostly Uncensored
description:
The What Do You Meme? Adult Party Game is fun for friends from the social media generation. This is the Mostly Uncensored version. Contains no profanity. However due to mild adult themes and language, viewer discretion is advised.

This party card game is simple to teach and quick to play. Every player selects one of the caption cards from their hand to accompany that round's image and plays it in secret. The judge then selects which caption they think is the funniest, and that caption's player gets a point. You can play to whatever score you like.

Contents: 360 caption cards, 75 photo cards, 1 easel, and Bonus Rules
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Lords of Heaven
description:
Vie for control of Jerusalem and the supremacy of the Middle East as one of the four major powers of the medieval world: the Latin Christian Crusaders, the Orthodox Christian Byzantine Empire, the Shia Fatimid Caliphate, or the Sunni Seljuks. Refight and change the history of the two first Crusades!

Lords of Heaven is an area control and card placement game for 2-4 players. You, the leaders of each of the four asymmetric factions, will play events and up to 60 historical character cards to take your actions such as build units, fortresses, and temples, move troops, fight battles, and develop your Middle East holdings.

The game is a clever combination of rivalry and cooperation between two blocks of factions – Christian and Islamic – where combat and conquest are not always the best ways to achieve success. Politically nuanced and deeply steeped in its early crusades setting, Lords of Heaven will offer a couple of short scenarios and a campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Arabian, Card Game, Medieval, Negotiation, Religious, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, King of the Hill, Semi-Cooperative Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Pandamonium
description:
Pandamonium is a lightweight board game designed for 3 to 6 players. It's played over 4 rounds of simultaneous play where you'll be drafting cards to collect tributes for the Panda Lords.

It packs a dash of luck, a pinch of strategy and a punch of Pandamonium into a quick hour, making it an ideal choice for family gatherings, friendly get-togethers, or any occasion that calls for a dose of fun.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: UPO: The Rich Cat
description:
UPO the cat is seeking a tycoon to accompany him. Are you clever enough to become the greatest, wealthiest, and most successful financial manager?

In UPO, players will try to earn money to fulfill their achievements and to pay all their debts. Earned achievement and money will score points. However, your score will be reduced by the remaining debt you still have.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Xấp Sắc
description:
Xấp Sắc is a game inspired from traditional Vietnamese Culture. The game is simple but very deep, easy to teach but hard to master.

The starting player begins to play one or more cards to create a column of a row that is one of these combinations: A pair, three of a kind, four of a kind, 3 cards straight, or 4 cards straight.

In the clockwise order, players have to play card(s) to create a row or a column that is equal to higher in rank than the previous play. If they don’t want to or can't, they must pass. If all players but one passes, that player becomes the leader and can play any combination. Then the game keeps going.

Everyone will continue to play until one player remains with cards on hands, then the game ends and they score points.

—description from the publisher

name: Knitting Circle
description:
Knitting Circle is a stand-alone follow up to the hit spatial puzzle game Calico! In this gorgeous puzzly tile-laying game for the whole family, players are knitters competing to create the coziest, most beautiful assortment of garments. Rounds are simple - collect yarn from the central basket and knit it into garments while trying to get your color combinations and patterns just right! Earn victory points by completing garments, adding buttons, and fulfilling bonus scoring goals. Along the way, your furry feline friend can help you out by reaching their grabby paws into the bag to secure you the best yarn! With variable scoring goals, and dozens of unique template cards, each game of Knitting Circle brings a new spatial puzzle to your table!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Market, Matching, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Rondel, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Holy Moly: New Testament 홀리몰리 신약성경
description:
Let's match the order of the books of the Bible.
A game played using the order of the New Testament and card colors.
It uses a very simple and familiar mechanism.
As long as you can read, you can play, and the player who first lays down all their cards to have an empty hand wins.

The front of the card has the book name, chapter, and verse of the Bible, and the back has the corresponding Bible verse.
The goal of this game is not to memorize Bible verses, but to get familiar with playing with the Bible.

A Bible verse deeply engraved in your heart during childhood
can be a great strength during the most difficult times of your life.

—description from the designer

name: Holy Moly: Old Testament 홀리몰리 구약성경
description:
Let's match the order of the books of the Bible.
A game played using the order of the Old Testament and card colors.
It uses a very simple and familiar mechanism.
As long as you can read, you can play, and the player who first lays down all their cards to have an empty hand wins.

The front of the card has the book name, chapter, and verse of the Bible, and the back has the corresponding Bible verse.
The goal of this game is not to memorize Bible verses, but to get familiar with playing with the Bible.

A Bible verse deeply engraved in your heart during childhood can be a great strength during the most difficult times of your life.

—description from the designer

name: 街コロライフ (Machi Koro: Life)
description:
The newest title in the Machi Koro series. In Machi Koro: Life, instead of building up their cities, players will be collecting "Hearts" through engine-building cards representing different aspects of life such as hobbies or jobs, in an effort to ultimately exchange these hearts for "Dream" points depicted on a different kind of cards in display.

The core mechanics of rolling one or two dice and activating Blue/Red/Purple cards remain essentially the same, and one can either buy another engine-building card or a card with "Dream" points after rolling the dice and obtaining the corresponding amount of "Hearts".

The player to be first to obtain 8 "Dream" points will have attained their ideal life and wins the game.

name: Diktat: Suprématie
description:
The Suprématie ("Supremacy") box contains additional factions for Diktat, such as the Edification Directorate, capable of building Complexes on stack slots, or Harmony, which uses the fear instilled by Others in the minds of citizens as a source of power.

In addition, the Others faction is reinforced with specific counters and three "Aberrations", specific Others with special abilities coming into play as soon as their counters are revealed.

—description from the publisher (translated)

La boîte "Suprématie" contient des factions additionnelles pour Diktat, comme la Direction de l'Édification capable de construire des Complexes sur des emplacements de pile ou l'Harmonie, qui utilise la peur instillée par les Autres dans l'esprit des citoyens comme source de pouvoir.

En outre, la faction Autres se voit renforcée de pions spécifiques et de trois "Aberrations", des Autres spécifiques aux capacités particulières entrant en jeu dès que leurs pions sont révélés.

—description from the publisher

name: Gifts Galore: Новый Год
description:
Gifts Galore is a festive group gifting game that levels up the fun of opening holiday presents together with your friends and loved ones.

Work your way around the board answering festive trivia questions as you open presents and mystery gifts, on your way to winning the Surprise Prize!

Includes alternate rules for playing at parties, with coworkers, and throughout the holiday season!

—description from the publisher

This game has the same rules as Gifts Galore: Christmas, but with a different theme and a different set of questions.

name: Mushroom Mages
description:
Collect as many complete sets of different kinds of mushrooms as possible.
On your turn you will roll the die and gather mushrooms of one single colour.

Mages allow you to manipulate the die or the display in order to collect more mushrooms or for more variety to choose from.
Their support is very valuable, but it only lasts until you cover them up with more mushrooms.

When everyone is familiar with the game, you can add the optional Miraculous Mushrooms Module to spice the game up a bit.

—description from the designer

name: Startup High
description:
With Startup High, you're not just playing a game – you're living the startup journey. Picture yourself as the founder writing your own startup's destiny. From the first spark of an idea to the sizzle of success, every move you make counts.

This is a strategic board game having elements that reflect the experiences and challenges of a startup founder in a fun way. Players take on the role of an aspiring founder and make decisions relevant to being entrepreneurial.

 The players have been incubated with their startup ideas and to make their dreams into reality, the founders face an interesting dilemma: what is more important to them; time or money? Using the saved-up resources, the founders have to hire team members across different divisions, leverage their network, and navigate through market forces, to grab the right opportunities!

Startup High isn't just a board game; it's a gateway to understanding the entrepreneur's world. Feel the adrenaline of uncertainty, the thrill of innovation, and the sweet taste of success. Will you rise to the top through calculated risks and bold decisions? The future of your startup is in your hands.
Get ready to roll the dice (not literally), make strategic moves, and let your entrepreneurial spirit soar in Startup High. Unleash your inner founder, and ‘dive deep’ into the game!

—description from the designer

name: Castelo Interior
description:
A board game that makes reference to the addresses described in the book The Interior Castle, by Santa Teresa d’Ávila and, thus, consists of advancing through the mystical stages of the soul to reach heaven. Divided into a maximum of 3 teams, with at least 2 players in each, the houses advance as letters are answered through mime, drawing, quiz, tips... guaranteed fun with lots of instruction and spirituality for family and friends , catechesis.

The game contains: 1 board, 750 cards, 1 easy/hard dice, 1 card dice, 1 numeric dice, 3 pawns, 7 special cards, 1 rule manual and 1 sheet with answers. Each team will consist of 2 to 8 players.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Novel-based, Religious
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Karvi: Solo
description:
With these solo rules you can play Karvi alone in two different ways using the same core mechanic.
Both variants let you play the game using the normal rules, but against a simplified opponent.
Neither variant requires any additional components.
The Highscore Mode is a beat-your-own-score for you to learn the game and improve your
score. It uses simple rules where the opponent blocks spots and removes some cards and tiles.
The Battle against the Völva adds some opponent rules and is intended to give you a challenge
where you have to beat the opponent‘s score.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Track Movement, Turn Order: Time Track, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Moose Match Mayhem
description:
Be the hit of the party when you bring your family & friends through this ridiculously fun and wild ride through the Northern backcountry! Race to collect three sets of moose, bears, or squirrels but watch out for Yetis and avalanches - or your matches will disappear into the wild!
Each player takes a card from the stack. Everyone chants "Moose, Match, Mayhem!" while flipping their card over, and immediately races to select the best card to make a match. The first player to collect three sets of matching animals, wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Wild Wild Taco
description:
Wild Wild Taco has more of all the specials you love from Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza! Special action cards from the original game plus NEW characters are combined with ALL-NEW rules. In this game, the taco is wild while the specials are not...unless two are played in a row!
Players take turns flipping over their card while saying, "Wild, Wild, Taco." When a card played matches the one before it, everyone does the corresponding action and races to slap the pile. The first to get rid of all their cards wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Gifts Galore: Новый Год – Малыши
description:
Want to play with children under 8? Gifts Galore has you covered with an expansion deck!

Whenever your Малыш (Little One) lands on a question spot, draw from this deck to ask them an age-appropriate trivia question so they can fully join in on the fun.

name: Gifts Galore: Christmas – Little Ones
description:
Want to play with children under 8? Gifts Galore has you covered with an expansion deck!

Whenever your Little One lands on a question spot, draw from this deck to ask them an age-appropriate trivia question so they can fully join in on the fun.

name: The End of a Reign: The Battle of Naseby, June 14, 1645
description: The End of a Reign is volume 7 in Roberto Chiavini's set of games on famous battles of the English Civil War.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Montrose Triumphs: The Battles of Auldearn and Alford
description: Montrose Triumphs is the 8th game in a series of ten games by Roberto Chiavini on famous battles fought in the English Civil War.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: You Know It!
description: A trivia party game where, aside from trying to answer the questions right, you can get points by betting on how many of the group know the right answer, know knows the right answer and who doesn't know the right answer from a bunch of five questions.

name: The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls – 6th Anniversary Edmund Booster Pack
description: To celebrate the sixth anniversary of Four Souls, Edmund McMillen and Maestro Media joined forces to craft three exciting new booster packs for The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls, with the 6th Anniversary Edmund Booster Pack being one of them. Enjoy fifteen new cards inspired by Edmund's other games...
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Alliances, Bribery, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Thunderstone Quest: The All-Consuming Hive
description:
A new expansion for one of the best Deck Builders of all time! Quest number 17: is your party ready for the All-Consuming Hive?

Not since the Eruption has the land around Thunderstone Keep felt such violence as massive worms broke forth, shattering mountains and upending entire towns, climbing high into the sky before hardening to form towering citadels in the surrounding countryside. But no one could have been prepared for when these new structures opened across their sides, unleashing terrifying insectoid creatures to seize what life they could find and drag it back to their homes. Now you must venture inside these living towers to rescue the captives and bring an end to their queen’s influence upon your world. The belly of the beast awaits!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Cube Express
description:
Welcome to the dawn of a new era in which steel rails carve pathways through vast landscapes, connecting bustling cities and driving the engines of progress. Welcome to Cube Express, where you'll embark on a thrilling journey through the heart of the industrial revolution.

In Cube Express, you step into the shoes of visionary railroad magnates, tasked with expanding your network of tracks across the landscape of the 19th century as steam engines roar to life and cities swell with newfound prosperity. As you lay track and expand your network, you'll transport passengers, resources, and goods to their destinations, fueling the engine of progress, expanding cities and reaping the rewards of your enterprise. Competing companies vie for dominance on the rails, and the market value of your shares hangs in the balance.

Cubes are the currency of progress in Cube Express, each one representing a vital piece of the economic puzzle. Whether they signify passengers eager for transport, resources ripe for production, or lucrative contracts waiting to be fulfilled, every cube holds the potential to shape the destiny of your railroad empire.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Band Wars
description:
Band Wars is a card game for 3/4 players in which the aim is to form your own band and play at concerts of different importance.
The Musician cards depict the members of the Band and must be placed in the Tour Bus of the Board.
When you draw a Musician, you must decide which instrument to make him play and place him, accordingly, on the corresponding Tour Bus space on your board.
Try to limit the competition from other bands, to win silver and gold records up to the platinum record.

name: Dice Tales: Knight's Adventures
description:
Become the mighty knight, embark on an epic solo journey in Dice Tales: Knight's Adventures. In this immersive sandbox game, you’ll put on the armor of a valiant knight, venturing across the kingdom lands. Your brave action in one location will echo in the others, shaping your destiny and changing the course of your adventure.

The choice is yours, decide where you want to go in each round to gain fame and glory. Compete in grand knight tournaments, rescue ladies in distress, explore evil dungeon, embark on adventure tract, try to make your path to fight the fearsome dragon, or come to one of the towers to increase your fame with one of the adventures.

Throughout your travels gather a fortune in gems and gold, and use them to your advantage. Encounter a cast of characters including merchant, ranger, and knight. Sharpen your skills in combat and defense, and gather a quiver of arrows to aid you in your noble adventures. Embark on a knightly adventure and shape your destiny.

Dice Tales: Knight's Adventures is a Roll and Write game created specifically for solo players. You will roll the dice and decide where you want to go each round trying to write your story and gain fame. Game offers diverse paths to victory.

Dice Tales: Knight's Adventures is a game where every choice carves a path to greatness. Will you rise to become the realm’s most celebrated hero? The dice are cast, and your tale awaits!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: La Squadriglia degli Assi
description:
La Squadriglia degli Assi simulates biplane battles during the First World War. Are included all the planes that flew on the Italian front during the First World War.
it is a new edition with more modern rules of the 1994 edition.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Arrivano i Francesi!
description:
Arrivano i Francesi! simulates two battles in Italy during the Napoleonic wars: Montebello (1800) and Campotenese (1806).
This is the Speciale 2024 of Para Bellum magazine.

name: Quella volta che...
description:
Quella Volta Che... is an engaging narrative party game with cards, winner of the Italian Game Jam in Bergamo 2023. This game is perfect for fun-filled evenings with friends, where laughter and creativity are always in the spotlight.

How to Play:
Players take turns drawing a card from the deck, each containing unique prompts to create a story. The narrator of the turn must use these prompts to tell an intriguing and surprising story. Meanwhile, the other players listen carefully and try to predict the outcome of the story.

Game Objective:
The main goal is to have as many stories guessed correctly by the other players as possible. Each time someone correctly guesses the outcome of the narrated story, both the narrator and the player who guessed earn points. The game continues until all stories have been told or until players decide to end the session.

Key Features:

Creativity and Improvisation: Each card offers unique prompts that stimulate players' imagination and improvisational skills.
Social Interaction: Perfect for breaking the ice and creating a fun, participatory atmosphere.
Suitable for Everyone: Simple and intuitive rules make the game accessible to people of all ages.

—description from the publisher

name: Whakaari
description:
Whakaari is an exhilarating party game for 3 to 8 players, and the proud winner of the Italian Game Jam in Naples 2022. Set on a treacherous lava lake, players must jump from platform to platform in a thrilling race to the finish line.

How to Play:
Players take turns to check the status of the platform they are on. Depending on the state of the platform, they may need to draw an event card and resolve its effects. If the player survives the event, they can then play one of their cards to jump to another platform. The length of the jump is measured using the sides of the card.

Special Abilities:
Each player has a unique special power that can be activated to regain ground on their opponents. These powers add a strategic layer to the game, allowing for dramatic comebacks and exciting turns of events.

Game Objective:
The goal is to be the first player to reach the finish line, navigating the perilous platforms and outsmarting opponents with clever use of cards and special abilities.

Key Features:
Dynamic Gameplay: The combination of event cards and strategic jumps keeps the game fast-paced and unpredictable.
Special Powers: Unique abilities for each player add depth and strategy to the game.
High Replayability: The variety of event cards and special powers ensures that no two games are the same.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Flicking, Measurement Movement, Race

name: Pigeons
description:
Pigeons is a hilarious and strategic party game for 2 to 6 players where the goal is to eliminate pigeons and cover your opponents' balconies with guano. It's a fun-filled competition of avian antics and tactical play.

How to Play:
Each turn, players use their cards to either eliminate pigeons or attract new birds to their opponents' balconies. There are various types of pigeons, each occupying different areas and possessing unique special abilities that add an element of surprise and strategy to the game.

Game Objective:
Players aim to accumulate the most trophies by the end of the game. Points are tallied by counting the trophies earned and subtracting the piles of guano on their balconies.

Key Features:

Strategic Depth: The different types of pigeons and their special abilities require players to think tactically about their moves.
Interactive Fun: Players constantly interact by sending pigeons to each other’s balconies, ensuring an engaging and dynamic gameplay experience.
Humorous Theme: The whimsical theme of pigeons and guano adds a lighthearted and entertaining aspect to the game.

—description from the publisher

name: The Elite Grand Enigma
description:
As the lead investigator, you are summoned to unravel the mysterious death of Isabella Novakova, a renowned socialite found dead under puzzling circumstances. The Elite Grand Enigma challenges players to navigate through a labyrinth of clues, conflicting alibis, and hidden agendas.

Amidst a cast of six unique suspects, each with their own secrets and connections to the victim, your task is to dissect alibis, analyze forensic evidence, and scrutinise witness statements. From a disillusioned bartender with dreams beyond the hotel, to a high-profile politician caught in a scandalous web, each character brings a layer of complexity to the case.

name: Porca Vacca!
description:
"Porca Vacca!" is an exciting card party game for 3 to 8 players, with game sessions lasting between 30-45 minutes. The goal is to be the last player standing by eliminating all your opponents through strategic card play and careful hand management.

How to Play:

Shuffle the deck of cards and place it in the center of the table.
Each player draws a card on their turn.
If a player draws a green, yellow, or blue card, they must immediately apply its effect.
If the drawn card is of another color, it is added to the player's hand.
If a player ends their turn with 5 or more cards in hand, they are eliminated from the game.
Game Objective:
The objective is to outlast all other players by managing your hand and using the effects of the cards wisely to eliminate opponents.

Key Features:

Quick and Easy Setup: Just shuffle the deck and start playing.
Strategic Depth: Players must balance between applying card effects and managing their hand size to avoid elimination.
Interactive and Dynamic: Constant player interaction keeps the game engaging and unpredictable.
Fast-Paced Fun: The game’s quick rounds and simple rules make it perfect for parties and gatherings.

—description from the publisher

name: Ayrumã
description:
Ayrumã is a trick-taking game with an astronomy theme from the native Brazilian people. Even ahead of the knowledge used by Europeans in the 17th century, the Tupinambá people used observation of the skies in their daily lives with a precision compatible with current scientific knowledge, such as the influence of the moon on the movement of the tide.

This inspired our game where each participant will take on the role of leader of a tribe, progressing in different aspects of their daily life, and thus earning victory points. After 3 lunar cycles, the chief of the tribe who best managed his tribe's knowledge is the winner of the match.

—description from the designer

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Creatures: Nukalurk King
description:
This miniatures set is part of the Nuka World wave for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare!

‘A hail of gunfire for the king, baby.’
Of the Nukalurk Royal Family, the King is the least imposing, but far from the least dangerous. Far more agile than his blushing bride, the King possesses a bestial intelligence and a domineering will that allows him to keep his queen’s progeny in check.

Though they tend to let the more common Nukalurks deal with the messy work of catching and eviscerating their prey, the Kings are more than capable of supporting them from range with a sonic scream that can turn your brain to jelly and melt out of your ears. Makes you feel for misbehaving Nukalurk hatchlings, my dad couldn’t scream like that and my ears still hurt.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Creatures: Nukalurks
description:
This miniatures set is part of the Nuka World wave for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare!

‘At the very least, they’re easier to see coming now…’
Mercifully unique to the advertisement plastered ruins of The World of Refreshment, Nukalurks are a bizarre mutation to the ‘standard’ Mirelurk, suffused with the delicious hue of Nuka-Cola Quantum and a healthy blue glow.

Somehow, Nukalurks are more violently territorial than their original-flavour cousins, and more than one Nuka-enthusiast has been dragged below the surface of the Nuka-World river by these crustacean terrors.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Hagraven Coven
description:
For some, the pursuit of power is worth any price. A monstrous blending of human and bird, Hagravens are the result of a ritual to sacrifice their very humanity for increased magical prowess. Twisted and vicious, they shy away from civilisation in the forsaken corners of Skyrim. Adventurers should be wary of them, for they wield deadly magic and fight with terrible talons.

For use with The Elder Scrolls: A Call to Arms Miniatures Core Rules and Chapter 4 Card Pack. Expand your game with other Starter and Expansion Sets also available now.

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Draugr Lords
description:
The oldest and most powerful of all their brethren, the DRAUGR LORDS are the leaders of the undying legions:

RED EAGLE, the ancient hero of the Reach who led an army to defeat an Empire.
SIGDIS GAULDURSON is the powerful wielder of the legendary Blackbow.
CURALMIL, the legendary Alchemist who guards a fabulous treasure.
OLAF ONE-EYE, an ancient, legendary, dragon-slaying High King of Skyrim.
THE GATEKEEPER, a guardian of an even greater foe, she stands between Adventurers and the secrets of the ancient Dragonborn.

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Robots: Eyebots
description:
This miniatures set is part of the Nuka Worlds wave for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare!

‘Don’t like Eyebots, always get the feeling that someone’s watching me.’
Eyebots. Are. Everywhere. A fact no less true in Nuka-World. Bobbing through the air blasting adverts and lasers in equal measure as they go. As prevalent across Nuka-World as everywhere else in the Wasteland, even more so in the Galactic Zone, Eyebots are the irritating, difficult to hit gift that keeps on giving.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Creatures: Gatorclaw
description:
This miniatures set is part of the Nuka Worlds wave for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare!

‘Because clearly a Deathclaw wasn’t bad enough!’
When Old Dr McDermont had a cloning machine, he made a big mistake. By combining all the best aspects of the Jackson chameleon and the American alligator, he created one of the worst creatures to ever tear a Raider in half. Thankfully, he didn’t live long enough to see his voraciously hungry children break out of their home and out into the big wide world, sadly, because they ate him. Circle of life, I suppose.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Raiders: The Disciples
description:
This miniatures set is compatible with both Fallout: Wasteland Warfare and Fallout: Factions, as part of the Nuka World wave for Wasteland Warfare and Season One of Factions..

‘Don’t get caught? Does that matter if everyone knows you’re just waiting for an excuse to kill them?’
Fizztop Mountain may have once been a nice place to visit, once. Now it keeps its namesake alive by being packed to the brim with mountains of corpses. A lot like The Pack, most Disciples would describe their perfect Sunday as one full of blood and murder, though they tend to try and at least pretend they’re not thinking about flaying the skin off everyone they meet most of the time. Fans of quick and efficient kills, the Disciples are thrill killers extraordinaire, always eager to move on to their next ‘project’.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Raiders: The Operators
description:
This miniatures set is compatible with both Fallout: Wasteland Warfare and Fallout: Factions, as part of the Nuka World wave for Wasteland Warfare and Season One of Factions.

‘They say money makes the world go round, with the way Operators make money, it’s going to be an empty world.’
Without wanting to give them any props, the Operators are a well organised group, more like a crime syndicate than a raider gang. They follow orders, take on jobs, make their own gear and most of all, remain professional. Well armed and armored, Operators don’t kill for fun (unlike the other gangs of Nuka-World), they kill for profit, or out of annoyance, which is occasionally fun. I guess they also kill for fun.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Raiders: The Pack
description:
This miniatures set is compatible with both Fallout: Wasteland Warfare and Fallout: Factions, as part of the Nuka World wave for Wasteland Warfare and Season One of Factions.

‘The Pack are a lot like eating centuries old candy, bright, exciting and probably going to kill you.’
Brightly coloured, bedecked in whatever interesting knick-knacks they can tape to themselves and wholly ruled by their moment to moment instincts, The Pack are less of a gang and more of… well, a pack. Following their Alpha to the end, members of The Pack tend to be spurred on to random acts of violence throughout the day, not too worried about the reason why, just if it’ll be fun or not. Every choice they make tends to follow that logic, fun over all other things, sadly for everyone else, they think fighting is really, really fun.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Dragonborn Heroes
description:
The path of the Dovahkiin has many branches, and one wielder of The Voice may be very different to another:

The DRAGONBORN RANGER excels at use of bow and stealth, while their opposite is the DRAGONBORN BERSERKER, whose attacks are unmatched in their ferocity.
The DRAGONBORN SPELLSWORD matches arcane and martial talents, whilst the DRAGONBORN THU’UM WEAVER focuses on mastery of The Voice.
The DRAGONBORN CHAMPIONS OF BOETHIA and MEHRUNES DAGON use the powers of The Voice to further their patron’s mysterious goals.

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Robots: Starlight Theatre Staff
description:
This miniatures set is part of the Nuka Worlds wave for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare!

‘Weaponizing Nuka-Cola is a sin, godless robots! How dare you waste what I could drink!’
In the lovely Starlight Theatre, you could have once sat down and enjoyed slow service, flat cola, and cold food. Despite the centuries, not a lot has changed, bar the chances of death due to highly pressurised Nuka-Cola being fired through your skull - that’s increased by about 5%. Manned by all forms of Robotic help, Nukatrons and Mr Frothys of all varieties can be found still serving the various corpses that act as the theatre’s only guests for the last 100 years.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Robots: Space Sentry
description:
This miniatures set is part of the Nuka Worlds wave for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare!

‘I don’t care how dumb it looks, my caps are always on the Sentry bot.’
The Model X9000 was meant to demonstrate the next wave of Robotic warfare, a sleek, child friendly model that was meant to draw the eye and then reduce all hostiles within a 1 mile radius to glowing radioactive ashes. The models on display at Nuka World were meant to act as an attraction for the public, but it’s not overly common for attractions to be armed with gatling lasers, at least not to my knowledge.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Companions
description: The Companions are an ancient kinship of the greatest and bravest warriors, that also hides a dangerous and savage secret. The Companions are led by the veteran KODLAK WHITEMANE, ageing, but still deadly. Shield-brother to the Dragonborn, FARKAS excels with heavy armour and is a stalwart companion. Second only to Kodlak, SKJOR leads the secretive organisation called The Circle. AELA THE HUNTRESS embraces her savage side and is without equal as a hunter. The secret of the Circles is their ability to transform into either the terrifying WEREWOLF BRUTE or SAVAGE.

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Unaligned: X-01 Power Armor
description:
This miniatures set is part of the Nuka Worlds wave for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare!

‘Yup, it’s a lovely bit of Power Armor, but no-one’s bored enough to slog all over the park for those cores I’m telling ya.’
Many thought that the T-45 was to be the height of Power Armor technology, boy were they wrong. In an arms race that surprised exactly no one, numerous companies threw their lot into Power Armor manufacturing, even the good old Nuka-Cola Corporation went as far as putting together a suit with help from Uncle Sam. Well you know what they say, nothing sells soft drinks like imminent warfare!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – The Silver Hand
description:
The Silver Hands have but one purpose - to eradicate the curse of lycanthropy, by whatever means necessary:

KREV THE SKINNER is their uncompromising, battle-scarred veteran.
The SILVER HAND WEREWOLF HUNTER specialises in fighting the savage beasts backed up by the SILVER HAND WARRIORS.
The SILVER HAND HEALER uses potions and herbs to bolster her fellow warriors and keep them free from deadly diseases.

name: Fallout: Miniatures – Mr. Fuzzy
description:
This miniatures set is part of The Wilds of Appalachia wave for Fallout: Miniatures.

‘If you ever get down to Camden Park, you’ll probably meet Mr. Fuzzy. Not a clue who’s inside that freaky-ass suit, but can’t help but find their enthusiasm infectious.’

Mr. Fuzzy is more than a mascot. Mr. Fuzzy is an ideal. A transcendental being that exists only to bring joy and cat puns to this world. So, surely, it must be the darkest of days, because Mr. Fuzzy has abandoned us, leaving only a representative in his stead. At least, that’s how the woman currently wearing his ceremonial outfit sees it. Best leave her to it, it’s nice to have at least one point of consistent joy in this wild Wasteland.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Creatures: Ghoulish Remnants
description:
This miniatures set is part of The Wilds of Appalachia wave for Fallout: Miniatures.

‘It’s weird seeing them out in the streets, Ferals still wearing whatever rags they had before everything went to shit. Makes you remember that they were people once, something more than the crazed things they are now.’

Before the bombs dropped, most people were simply doing their best to ignore the impending doom brought on by the war. They dressed in the trappings of a normal life, their sunday best, work uniform, whatever kept the days rolling by. When a wave of nuclear radiation washed by, and their minds began to vanish as quickly as the world around them - the only scraps of their identities left were the clothes on their backs. Everything else is a faded memory, hidden behind an unquenchable, unknowable rage.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Arnbjorn, Dark Brotherhood Predator
description: Exiled from the Companions because of his “unorthodox” methods, ARNBJORN, DARK BROTHERHOOD PREDATOR is a bestial and savage agent of the Night Mother. As a former member of The Circle, he is able to transform into the fearsome ARNBJORN, WEREWOLF and savage his enemies with his fearsome claws and deadly bite. In either form, he is a formidable foe, or a steadfast ally.

name: Fallout: Miniatures – Cult of the Mothman: Mothman Eclipse
description:
This miniatures set is part of The Wilds of Appalachia wave for Fallout: Miniatures.

“Red eyes, glowing deep in the forests. I can see them watching me, always watching me. But when I try to find them all I find is emptiness, and a distant noise - a buzzing that burrows into my mind.”

The Mothman has seemingly endured since long before the great war, a creature that moves through the wilds of Appalachia upon buzzing wings. Whereas cults have followed in its wake, the Mothman is not a singular creature, instead there are many of its kind across the wilds - each varied and unique in its own actions and personalities. What they want is a mystery to most - though Priests and Cultists gather in ritual to try and divine deific action from their passing. Each Mothman is an unknown, a creature that persists through all things.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Fallout: Miniatures – Cult of the Mothman: Followers
description:
This miniatures set is part of The Wilds of Appalachia wave for Fallout: Miniatures.

“See, as best as I can tell there’s two flavours of those crazy Moth cultists, Red and Purple. Purple keep to themselves, nice and simple. Red though, well, keep your distance, that’s the best advice I can give.”

Despite the name, the Cult of the Mothman is actually broken into two sects - the Enlightened, and the Followers of the Winged One. Whilst the Enlightened are generally peaceful, the Followers hold nothing but animosity towards those outside of their order - seeing outsiders as invaders of their sacred lands, as vermin. And what does one do when vermin have infested their home? You exterminate them.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Fallout: Miniatures – Cult of the Mothman: Clergy
description:
This miniatures set is part of The Wilds of Appalachia wave for Fallout: Miniatures.

“I’ve seen them out there, bedecked in wooden totems, flailing in maddened worship around effigies and fire. There’s so many of them these days, we can only pray they ain’t setting up for another crusade….”

Gathering in places of prayer, arrayed about totems of red-eyed moths, the Cult of the Mothman can be found across Appalachia, dedicating their beings to the deific namesakes of their worship. Fanatical in their belief, the Cult bears arms against those they deem as apostates, unworthy of their lives due to their heresy against the Winged Ones. With Priests and Prophets at their head, the Cult's numbers are almost as indefatigable as their zeal.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: What On Earth Are You Talking About?: VS. Expansion
description:
VS is an out-of-this-world expansion to What on Earth Are You Talking About?, and this time it’s you versus your opponent in a real-time space race!

With two similar earthly observations on each card, teams race each other to guess their concept first without accidentally guessing the opposition’s concept!

Think you can translate BAPTISMS into something an alien can understand, without anyone guessing DROWNING? Prove it in VS!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: What On Earth Are You Talking About?: NSFA Expansion
description:
Warning!!! If you observe humanity for any length of time, you’re sure to see something that is not safe for aliens.

This NSFA expansion for What On Earth Are You Talking About? compiles all the dirtiest, raunchiest and grotesque concepts found on Planet Earth. We've also included a select number of red herring concepts - because once you start thinking like a filthy human, it's impossible to stop.

In What On Earth Are You Talking About?, you are an alien competing against a rival research ship to be the first to locate intelligent life amongst the stars. Instead, you've found Earth. You will be describing “quintessential” human concepts to your teammates, trying to have them guess each concept as quickly as possible. But there’s an extraterrestrial twist! You can only use words that begin with the letters on the Translator Cards, making you talk like an alien!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Pentris
description:
Candies! Fruit! Popsicles! Stars!

Take the tile that will help you the most! Make it fall and rotate on your slide, and form the biggest group of same-colored candies!

Don't leave spaces, you need to fill in rows! Watch for special symbols: Popsicles and Stars can get you big points if you can place them well! After three rounds, the game is over... Did you make the best slide and score the most points? If you did, you're the winner!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Wild Gardens: Community Expansion Pack
description:
Get ready to step into the limelight and become the next big thing in Wild Gardens with the community pack! The content inside was voted on by our fans as the most requested ingredients and recipes. The Community Expansion Pack includes 8 new guests, tantalizing recipes, a new location, and a new solo adventure.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Retrieval, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, End Game Bonuses, Events, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Score-and-Reset Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Wild Gardens: Media Expansion Pack
description:
Prepare for an electrifying cast of characters packed into this expansion! 8 beloved personalities from the tabletop world have arrived in Wild Gardens, each bringing their own unique abilities to the table. With 18 brand new cards, including new guests, tantalizing recipes, a new location, and a new solo adventure, the Media Expansion pack is bursting with exciting new content.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Retrieval, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, End Game Bonuses, Events, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Score-and-Reset Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Wild Gardens: Team Expansion Pack
description:
Hold onto your sun hats, because the team behind Wild Gardens is here and ready to shake things up! Get ready to unlock new combos and tantalize your taste buds with delectable recipes as you discover more about the people who helped bring Wild Gardens to life. With 18 brand new cards, including new guests, tantalizing recipes, a new location, and a new solo adventure, this pack is bursting with exciting new content. This is an expansion to Wild Gardens, base game not included.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Retrieval, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, End Game Bonuses, Events, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Score-and-Reset Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Deadholt: Don't Stray!
description:
"At first, the cries of survivors were few and far between. They clung to hope and fought and wept. There was no one to bury. Nothing to see. Just roots, everywhere..."

Deadholt is set in a brutal, post-apocalyptic universe where, after a small asteroid impacts Earth, a strange invasive alien species is introduced to our planet. Taking the shape of a colossal planet-wide forest, now called "The Holt", this species knocks humans down from the top of the food chain, making them retreat behind the walls of cold, rusty metallic settlements.

In Deadholt, you play as a Guide. A veteran of the Holt's tireless threats. Your objective is to gather the most currency (Metal Scrap) by safely escorting batches of clients to their desired settlements, selling the valuable loot you find along the way and by facing ravenous mutated beasts...all while fighting off other guides who are trying to beat you to it!

The game is asymmetric and highly interactive. It mixes strategy with a dose of luck to keep things fresh and exciting, while strongly enforcing player agency instead of completely taking it away. The game's systems and the number of variables at play will provide an endlessly replayable experience each time you and your group pick it up.

The main focus with Deadholt is creating an intriguing and immersive experience for players by blending flavor with the mechanics of the game.

Lose yourself in this unforgiving world and prove to everyone around the table that you've got what it takes to master its secrets!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Events, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Multi-Use Cards, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Tower of Trivia: Race to the Top!
description:
It's time to aim high in this unique trivia game! With 520 general knowledge questions to play from, teams take turns to try and climb up the tower by correctly answering the questions on the cards. The questions get trickier the higher up the tower you go. With just two minutes on the clock, will you be able to reach dizzying heights, or will you get stuck on a level as the time ticks down?

Played over three rounds, teams score points based on the difficulty of the questions they are able to answer before the timer runs out. Higher difficulty questions can only be unlocked if the lower level questions are successfully answered, thus climbing the tower. An incorrect answer drops you back down to the easiest tier of questions, which are worth fewer points, forcing you to climb back up if you want to increase your score faster (at the risk of dropping back down again).

name: Blueprints of Mad King Ludwig: Promo Card Pack 1
description:
What kind of monarch could you possibly be without a proper room to celebrate the glory that is you? Fear not for the Lords of Bezier have delivered room schematics of such divinity to make you weep with antici...

CONTENTS
1 Wine Tasting Room
1 Book Nook
1 Time Out Room
1 Sax Serenade Room
1 Ruby Ring Room

Rooms from the Promo Card Pack 1 were designed by Tantrum House, the Game Boy Geek, and 2 gamers from the community: Bailey Osborne & Griffin.

...pation

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Rockeees
description:
The gravity game made from recycled fridges.

Stack 'm - don't drop 'm!

Rockeees are nestable plastic blocks.
Each block has different 17 sides - so they can be stacked in many ways.

Rules:
Each player takes his own set of Rockeees. You start building one pile. You go on turns. You drop the pile, you lose. (A bit like Jenga).

Or you could have two players or two teams and set the challenge who builds a tower of 6 Rockeees in the fastest time. You can make it more difficult by placing the first Rockeee for both teams in one of 15 positions.

name: Magneterra
description:
Embark on a cosmic adventure in the rugged world of Magneterra, a distant planet characterized by its towering mountains, deep valleys, and flowing rivers. This unique terrain, enriched with rare elements, is the birthplace of the mystical Tochon Magnets—ancient artifacts infused with immense magical energies. Drawn by the allure of these powerful entities, human Mage Warriors have come to Magneterra, driven by a thirst for magical knowledge, each aspiring to become the most powerful mage.

Magneterra introduces an innovative game mechanic centered around the fascinating properties of magnetism. Players begin the game with the ability to attract Tochon Magnets from the shortest pillars on the game board, utilizing specially designed figurines that interact with magnetic fields. As players gather more magnets, their magnetic powers increase, enabling them to draw from increasingly taller pillars. The ultimate challenge lies in being the first to claim the Tochon Magnet from the tallest pillar, a feat that not only requires strategic maneuvering and skillful play but also crowns the winner as the supreme Mage Warrior of Magneterra.

However, the quest for magnetic supremacy is fraught with danger. The native Thians—part metal, part flesh giants—and their loyal Ankylocat companions fiercely defend the Tochons. These formidable opponents roam the landscape, determined to thwart the Mage Warriors and preserve the natural balance of their planet. As tensions rise, players must decide whether to confront these monsters directly or find more cunning ways to navigate the perilous terrains and claim the ultimate magnetic prize. With every move fraught with peril and opportunity, who will emerge victorious, and at what cost? The battle for Magneterra's Tochon Magnets is about to begin!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Cognizant
description:
Cognizant is a solo or co-operative tactical deck-builder. Play as giant biomechanical mecha through a series of encounters crafting a unique deck and unlocking other powerful equipment along the way.

Players will choose from one of four playerboards known as "Echoes" and build an initial deck called a configuration indicated on the back of the Operations and Configuration card. This initial deck is built from a mix of basic action cards and signature action cards that are specific to each "Echo"; These are used to attack, move, defend, or trigger other abilities in combat to defeat enemies. Next, players will choose the starting stage map and populate it with encounter tokens based on the chosen difficulty. Players win by completing the three stage maps and defeating each stage boss enemy.

A secondary Endless mode is available to play, during which players will complete ever increasingly difficult encounters gaining points from unlocking cards and other upgrades. Each stage completion adds additional difficulty for players to overcome. The goal of this mode is to play until you are inevitably defeated and see how high a score you can accumulate.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Minimap Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Dislocated
description:
A simple and fast abstract game for one player about some of the problems posed for military, government and non-government organizations when they are tasked with assisting large numbers of people on the move. The people shown in this abstracted model are moving away from some kind of threat - a battle or invasion, a disaster, a violent mass movement, some kind of monster protected by copyright legislation, etc.. The United States Department of Defense calls these people Dislocated Civilians or DCs; the Department of State calls them Internally Displaced Persons, and other organizations variously call them refugees, evacuees or other descriptive terms. 

The game is played in turns. In each turn cards representing groups of DCs will be drawn from a deck of ordinary playing cards and placed at the top of a notional grid of spaces arranged in rows and columns, while other card groups move downwards towards the bottom of the grid. Think of columns of people moving down the Lines of Communication, away from whatever started them moving.

The player will move their unit counters representing organizations and services to place them with groups of cards, and then roll dice to obtain a score that will allow all, some or none of the cards in the groups to be removed from the game (signifying that their primary needs have been addressed, so that in the short term at least they may be considered safe or healthy or settled).

But the needs and demands to be satisfied are larger than the resources and services available, so some cards will exit off the bottom of the Field; these cards are “lost”. The game is over when all the cards have made their way through the Field, and the Player’s level of success depends on the total values of cards that were lost.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Move Through Deck, Pieces as Map

name: Hexer, reino del caos
description:
Hexer is a dice management game. In it, you are a wizard who must obtain the golden discord apples from the goddess Eris. You must use your magic to move 5 souls along her temple to achieve the goal, before the other wizards can do it. Beware! winning a battle will not always lead to victory.

Eris´s temple is the main board of the game. On predetermined spaces will be placed 8 golden apple and 10 colored souls (5 of each color per player).

Each round, players will roll 5 dice and then reroll any number of them up to one time. Then, each of them secretly place one by one over each soul symbol on he/she personal board behind a screen.

When all dice are placed, each player remove his/her screen. Each souls´s willpower (dice value) will be compared one by one with its color counterpart. The one with a greater value will move forward and the one with the lowest will be move backwards. The willpower of 1 it´s a wild, so it can be move on step to any direction. If there is tie between souls´s willpower, neither of them can be moved (even with 1).

If a soul reach a space with a golde apple, it is placed over the player´s board on that soul space. That player´s soul can´t be moved for the rest of the game, but it´s will power will keep affecting the movement of it´s opponent soul counterpart.

After all the souls will power are compared, a new round begins.

When a player reach up to 3 golden apples with his/her souls, game ends immediately.

Here in Hexer the Eris temple it´s full of surprises. Areas that can´t be reached by a wild will power, wormholes that teleport your soul to another corner of the board and much much more.
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Moving Multiple Units, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Relative Movement, Score-and-Reset Game, Static Capture, Sudden Death Ending, Tug of War

name: A Summer To Die For
description:
Take on the role of a detective, tasked with solving the murder of construction company owner Neil Collins in a local park in Mercia-upon-Tame. With multiple suspects to investigate, players must use their deductive skills to sift through physical evidence, witness statements, and red herrings to determine who is responsible for the crime.
