From a drug dealer with a history of violence, to a business rival with a hidden agenda, to a homeless man with a mysterious past, every suspect has their secrets and motivations that players must unravel.

—description from the publisher

name: Benefits and Burdens
description:
Benefits and Burdens is an immersive detective game set in the shadowy corners of Amberwell, where players are thrust into the heart of an enigmatic disappearance. Players take on the role of detectives tasked with solving the perplexing case of Liam Davis’s sudden vanishing.

Structured as a non-linear narrative, the game empowers players with unrestricted access to a wide array of evidence from the get-go. Sift through digital footprints, comb through various types of communications, and analyse a collection of items and documents that could hold the key to unraveling the mystery. Analytical skills and attention to detail will be paramount as you navigate through the evidence, piecing together clues and drawing connections.

At the core of the investigation lie four suspects, each with their own complex web of motives and secrets. It’s up to players to delve into their backgrounds, scrutinise their alibis, and determine how they fit into the bigger picture of Liam’s disappearance. The game challenges players to think critically and question everything, as appearances can be deceiving, and the truth is often hidden beneath layers of lies and misdirection.

—description from the publisher

name: RIVUS
description:
RIVUS board game uniquely combines historical simulation with strategic card play elements, offering players a deep dive into 3,000 years of history where they become the architects of time, capable of reshaping the rise and fall of civilizations.

At the beginning of each turn, players select two Victory Goal cards. A player can win the game by fulfilling the requirements specified on either of the selected cards.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Medieval, Political, Prehistoric
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Map Addition, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Galactic Renaissance: Astute Diplomats Game Up
description:
This tiny expansion for Galactic Renaissance adds the astute diplomat specialist card and minis to your game, as well as a new planet.

The astute diplomat minis will force other players to retrieve emissaries/ insititutes as their first disorder option onb the planet they are on.

name: Galactic Renaissance: Warmonger Game Up
description:
Add disorder to your game with the Warmonger Game up, introducing the warmonger specialist card and minis, as well as a new planet.

Warmongers will lower the stability of planets they're on, and will add a new disorder option to your arsenal.

name: Kettii
description:
Kettii is a 2-die Strategy Board Game that can be played by 2 to 4 players each moving 3 pieces around circular rings until they reach their homes in the center of the board.
The game involves avoiding and eliminating opponents so that players can reach their homes first.
The first player to reach their home wins.

Board Layout
The board consists of 4 player bases at each corner coloured red, blue, yellow and green, each with 3 slots where each player's pieces start off.
There are 3 concentric rings that players must go through to reach their home, which is a large circular area in the center of the board divided into 4 colors for each player.
The board has 2 colored lanes for each player that connect the player's base and home. The lane in-between these 2 colored lanes with arrows pointing inward is called a rising lane and allows players to move to another ring.

Game Play
The game starts by each player rolling the 2 dice in a clockwise manner.
The player who rolls a 6 on any of their two die can start and move any of his/her pieces into play. They can then move the value of the other die on the piece(s) in play.
After rolling, a player can move the value of any die on any of the movable pieces in play until all the values on the 2 die have been used.
If a player is has no pieces in play after rolling, the game's turn moves to the next player.

Players keep moving their pieces clockwise until they find their rising lane - at which point they can move to an inner/higher ring and continue moving clockwise until they reach their home.

If a player's piece lands on an opponent's piece after moving their dice value, the opponent's piece is displaced and sent one ring back/outside maintaining the lane they were in i.e the opponent's piece moves 40 steps back.
If an opponent is displaced from the outer most ring, they return to their base.
However, opponents cannot be displaced from their safe zones. Any of the colored tiles on the board are safe zones for all players i.e no piece can be displaced from these regions. Additionally, the rising lane of a specific player is a safe zone for that player alone i.e, a blue player cannot be displaced from the blue rising lane, but can be displaced from any other player's rising lane.

Players can reroll in any of these cases;
- After rolling a double i.e the same number on all the die.
- After a roll that enabled a player to leave their base.
- After a roll that enabled a player to reach their home.
- After displacing an opponent's piece.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Liski
description:
One day, the fox family decided to go on a picnic. It's worth preparing well for such a trip! You will need a blanket, toys and snacks so as not to play on an empty tummy. The mother fox asked her children to pack everything they would need. However, you need to do it as soon as possible, because the adventure begins in a moment! Liski is a quick card game that develops reflexes and observation. Includes 5 additional variants, designed to both educate and entertain.

There are 5 variants of the game, here is a quick summary of each:

Each player receive the same set of items on the cards. When the task card is flipped everyone has to choose matching cards from their hand and place them in a grid 2x2 with correct orientation to fulfill the task. The first player to do it receives the task card and the round is over. The first player to win 5 rounds wins the game.
At the beginning of the game the item cards are placed at the table in a grid 3x3. The active player has to flip two cards that are the same on the other side. Almost like classic memory... but! The cards are not onesided, both of the sides show items, so when the player reveals non-matching cards they do not flip them again and just leave as they are. The game ends when there are no cards to refill the grid and whoever collected the most is the winner.
Only task cards are used. The players place the cards from their hands to cover the card on the table. Each matching symbol provides 1 point. After all the cards are played whoever gathered most points wins.
Four task cards are placed in the middle in a grid 2x2. Now all the players together have to build the same configuration but with a item cards. This should be done three times and the game is over.
Two task cards are revealed and the players quickly count the most present symbol. Then they need to play a matching item card(s) from their hand. The first player to do it receive the task cards. After the task cards are depleted the game ends and whoever gathered most wins.


—description from the publisher

name: Galactic Renaissance: Micro-portal Expert Game Up
description:
This game up tiny expansion introduces the new micro-portal Expertspecialist card, as well, 45 portal glass tokens and a new planet.

The micro-portal expert will allow you to move emissaries in multiple manners during regular turns or a disorder phase, while the glass tokens offer a premium visual addition.

name: Galactic Renaissance: Pocket dimensionalist game up
description:
Add the pocket dimensionalist specialist card to your game, as well as a new planet and 5 player bags with faction icons.

The pocket dimensionalist will allow you to place your emissaries in and out of a pocket dimension represented by a player bag

name: Galactic Renaissance: Cosmic Rabbit game up
description:
Add the famous cosmic rabbit to your game with its specialist card, miniature, and a new planet.

The cosmic rabbit is a powerful specialist that has several effects. However, its card is shuffled in the specialist deck after you've played it!

name: Skim Session
description:
In Skim Session, you and your friends are having an awesome skimboard session competing for waves and tricks! You need to venture into the deep tide to find out who is the best of all.

TAKE CARE!

You could take a WipeOut at any time and need help!

In deep tide, the player cannot see the available cards, unlike in shallow tide. The most valuable tube cards in the game are found in the deep tide where there is a greater chance of catching WipeOut!

name: The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls – 6th Anniversary Community Booster Pack
description: To celebrate the sixth anniversary of Four Souls, Edmund McMillen and Maestro Media joined forces to craft three exciting new booster packs for The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls, with the 6th Anniversary Community Booster Pack being one of them. Enjoy fifteen new cards designed by the community of your fellow players...
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Alliances, Bribery, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls – 6th Anniversary Alt Art Booster Pack
description: To celebrate the sixth anniversary of Four Souls, Edmund McMillen and Maestro Media joined forces to craft three exciting new booster packs for The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls, with the 6th Anniversary Alt Art Booster Pack being one of them. Enjoy fifteen new cards that feature a whole host of amazing guest artwork...
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Alliances, Bribery, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Shuffle Dungeons
description:
Shuffle Dungeons is a cooperative dungeon crawler for 1-4 Players. All players work together to fight monsters, build a route through the dungeons, and fight the boss waiting in their lair.

Players will loot and equip powerful items to survive the dangers that lurk around every corner. Fighting deadly monsters, crossing dangerous traps, unearthing mystical wards, and discovering powerful shrines are some of the many things to discover in the dungeon.

Defeat the boss to escape the dungeon and be victorious!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Map Addition, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: The Third World War: Alternative naval ruleset
description: Paper Wars 106 has an alternative set of naval rules developed by Dominic, Greg Warren, and Eric Farago. Some rules include adding and adjusting naval zones, a map overlay depicting the new Danish Straits naval zone, allowing the Soviets to send raiders to interdict NATO supply lines (affecting the number of NATO stacking points that are unsupplied), and having the Soviet and Polish naval divisions break down into regiments.

name: Evenfall: The Crystal Path
description:
Once again, the World-Tree opens its gateways and the supernatural awakens. But this time it doesn’t just mark the beginning of a new era. With the dawn of a new era, magic that was once believed to be lost flows through the land via the Crystal Path, drawing in new clans from far and wide. There is much to discover but the goal remains the same: Fight to secure a place on the magical throne!

This expansion to the base game Evenfall contains two new clans, a Crystal Path and many new Rituals, Specialists and Places of Power to explore. With a new catalyst - the crystal - you will unveil a new form of magic. Parts of this expansion can be modularly integrated into the base game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Chaining, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Alpaca: Expansion Pack 1
description:
The first Alpaca Bonus Pack arrives to enrich your games with two new cuddly Alpacas:

The Pirate Alpaca-Arrr! I am the last generation of a long dynasty of pirate alpacas, and I keep the family tradition alive: bury treasures!

The Alpaca Diver - My great passion is diving to explore the sea depths and bring interesting things to the surface.

The Pack contains 2 new types of Alpacas (for a total of 8 cards to add to your deck) plus a summary card with the abilities of the new Alpacas!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: A Most Fearful Sacrifice: Pipe Creek – Meade's Last Stand
description:
Pipe Creek is an expansion for A Most Fearful Sacrifice (AMFS), The Three Days of Gettysburg using a fresh method of simulating Civil War combat with the award-winning Black Swan system introduced in AMFS. Though only using a portion of the forces that fought at Gettysburg, Pipe Creek adds most of the cavalry that fought at the East Cavalry Field and includes some “What If” troops for the Army of Northern Virginia.

Pipe Creek allows players to see what could have happened if Meade had left Gettysburg under a variety of scenarios. Two are based on the Confederate’s July 2nd attack being successful and Meade deciding to pull back to his pre-planned line. The third scenario is completely up to the players and has Meade refusing to fight at Gettysburg and making his stand at Pipe Creek with a fresh army. The fourth scenario, however, is played solely on the maps for A Most Fearful Sacrifice and allows gamers to replay Pickett’s charge but make it significantly more powerful.

Longstreet didn’t think that 15,000 men could break the Union line, but what if Lee had given him 23,300 troops! Is that enough manpower for Longstreet to be successful? Replay the In Magnificent Style scenario in A Most Fearful Sacrifice using additional the regiments supplied in Pipe Creek and find out!

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Line of Sight, Variable Phase Order

name: Thingstead
description:
The year is 1130. An assembly is about to be called to elect a new chieftain of your Viking village. There is only one opponent who could threaten your election. Over the next few days you must balance your time between the clans and the Thingstead (where the elders are gathered) in order to ensure the votes go to you instead of your rival. At the end of the game, the elders of the Thingstead call a vote and decide a winner.

The battle for power has begun. Who will the Seven Elders choose to be the next Chieftain? Manage your hand of cards, play them wisely and win your place as leader of the tribe without dealing a single blow of the axe!

Players take turns completing one action at a time. The eldest player goes first. Available actions are:

A. PLAY A CARD TO THE THINGSTEAD TO INFLUENCE AN ELDER
B. PLAY A CARD TO A CLAN TO GAIN FOLLOWERS AND SPECIAL POWERS

After a player plays their card, they draw another one from the face-up row of 3 cards, or from the top of the draw deck. Then it is the opposing player’s turn.

Game continues until one of the following conditions is fulfilled:

One Player has locked 3 Elders or the draw deck is empty and both players are out of cards.

To calculate the final score, players add up the points gained from influencing Elders and for each Clan they control.

The player with the most points is the winner! In the case of a tie, the player with the most Followers among the Elder cards wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards

name: Holotype: Coprolite Promo Card
description:
Have you ever played a dinosaur game and been struck by the distinct lack of dinosaur feces? Well, now you can add some fossilized dino-poop, scientifically known as coprolite, to your game of Holotype.

This card is an additional Trace Fossil worth +5 at a cost of 1.

This card was included with Game Trade Magazine # 292.

name: The Vale of Eternity: Artifacts
description:
The Vale of Eternity: Artifacts is the expansion for the Vale of Eternity. This expansion adds more cards (creatures) to the deck with brand-new effects, and Artifacts to select during the Hunting phase.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Everwilde
description:
Everwilde is an asymmetrical area control game that simulates the progression of unique and fantastic species throughout multiple eras of time, each defined by an extraordinary scenario of its own. Your species' population must compete against other players to thrive in one of the many everchanging ecosystems of the Everwilde.

You must eat to survive, but that will not always prove to be a simple task. Your species will need to constantly move and adapt in response to the constant challenges of each new era and the various adaptations of your opponents. It may be possible to live in harmony with your neighbors, or they might try to make you their regular meal. Whether you live off the land as an herbivore or hunt your opponents as a carnivore, each of the dozens of species possesses its own unique traits and behaviors.

The game is played across one of many different Worlds, each offering their own exotic scenarios and defining events, ensuring that each game is a new and exciting experience.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Set-up

name: WealthFlow Sandtable
description:
The WealthFlow SandTable is a boardgame that combines traditional Chinese culture with Western wealth thinking to help participants improve their ability to use wealth. Founder Tang Qianjiu.

During the sandtable simulation, users can learn how to use the five elements of time, energy, connections, ability, and money.

Sandtable Rules:

1. Three-layer status
The WealthFlow SandTable simulates three different life states through three levels:
Setback flow (S-Flow): not going smoothly, constantly wasting energy and money
Ordinary flow (O-Flow): Ordinary, ordinary life
Victory flow (V-Flow): smooth, rapid wealth appreciation

2. Winning method
Phase 1: Participants purchase and accumulate assets in the O-Flow, with passive income greater than total total expenses, non-negative energy and no loans, thus moving from the O-Flow to the V-Flow.
Phase 2: Becoming a “winner in life” in the V-Flow by comply 3 role as below
Dreamer: Realize your dream (stay in the dream grid and pay the money and energy needed to realize it)
Philanthropist: has invested more than 10 million in charity.
Wealth Creator: Having assets of 100 million (with no bank debt).

3. Wealth Coach
The number of participants in the Wealth low Sandbox is 2 to 6, one of whom acts as a wealth coach. The role of the wealth coach is to explain the rules of the sandtable, maintain order, and collect and distribute "money and energy."

4. Personal deduction
The WealthFlow SandTable can be used by individuals as a tool for "self-growth" to help individuals grow their wealth.

Players are trained in financial intelligence, emotional intelligence, awareness quotient, adverse quotient, health quotient and playfulness/entertainment quotient, and are helped to plan and manage their energy, time, and life, so that they have the ability to identify and respond to risks and opportunities.

name: Jarama: The Battle For Madrid
description:
Immerse yourself in the heart of the Spanish Civil War with Jarama: The Battle For Madrid, a captivating two-player simulation game that recreates the pivotal Battle of Jarama. This operational showdown pits the Nationalist forces, led by General Varela, against the determined Republican defenders, as they clash in a desperate struggle for control of Madrid.

The Battle of Jarama, fought from February 6 to 27, 1937, marked the third and bloodiest attempt by the Nationalists to capture Madrid, the heart of the Republican resistance. As the Nationalists sought to sever Madrid's lifeline to the Mediterranean port of Valencia, the Republicans stood firm, determined to protect their capital and the cause of the Republic.

In Jarama, each player assumes the command of either the Nationalist or Republican forces, maneuvering their troops across the battlefield in a tactical dance of conquest and defense. The game utilizes a very particular chit-activation system, ensuring that each decision carries weight and every move has the potential to alter the course of the battle. The chit-activation systems makes this game suitable to be played solo by playing both sides of the conflict.

As the Nationalist player, your primary objective is to cut off the Valencia road, effectively isolating Madrid and crippling the Republican war effort. To achieve this, you must skillfully employ your forces, utilizing their strengths and exploiting enemy weaknesses. Seize historical key cities and hills along the way, for they will not only bolster your strategic position but also provide valuable victory points.

If you command the Republican forces, your mission is to halt the Nationalist advance, protect the vital Valencia road, and ultimately launch a counteroffensive to push the enemy back to their starting positions. This will require unwavering resilience, strategic planning, and the ability to adapt to the ever-changing tides of battle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Jovian Wars
description:
Jovian Wars is a near future tactical space battle game played on a tabletop with miniatures and dice. Each player builds a fleet of models and then commands it in a tactical game by maneuvering around the battlefield, attacking enemy ships, and attempting to defeat their opponent by completing scenario mission objectives to gain victory points.

What Jovian Wars is not: a physics simulator. It is first and foremost a competitive wargame inspired by space opera and mecha animation.

When possible, aspects of physics inform the mechanics, but the primary focus of these rules is to create a fun and immersive game that can be played in 3-4 hours competitively.

To that end, Jovian Wars is played on a 2D surface, typically a 48" x 48" table. The experience of playing in 3D is represented in the rules in many aspects such as models being able to move and shoot past/through each other.

This game includes large capital ships and small space fighters including Exo-Armors (Space Mecha) battling it out in a future Earth solar system wide conflict. The Scale of the Exo-Armor and Fighter models are 1/1000. Capital Ship models are approximately 1/4000 scale. Note that this is an approximation and is not exact.

—description from the publisher

name: 蟻の巣コロニー (Ant Nest Colony)
description:
Ants are social insects that are familiar to us.
This game is a tile-laying game in which you extend your nest deep underground to recreate the ecology of ants, and increase the number of ants (colonies). The basic rules are simple so that even children who are new to board games or who like insects can play.


Choose two cards from your hand of three, connect the path, and place them in the nest.
The tiles you place will increase the number of ants or attack other nests.
The person with the most ants at the end of the year, through spring, summer, autumn and winter, wins.


However, the stronger the tile, the fewer paths there are and the higher the risks, allowing you to experience the difficulty of making choices and the fun of competing with your opponents.
publishers: ぶれけけゲームズ (Burekeke Games)

name: Grab The Mic
description: It's the karaoke party game for people who can't sing! Warm up those vocal chords, belt out some tunes, and unleash your inner superstar with Grab The Mic! Flip a word card, think of a song that uses that word, race to Grab The Mic and sing that song!

name: Get Wet Categories
description: Get ready for some high-stakes drama with Get Wet: Categories! You'll be put on the spot to give an answer that fits into one of 200 categories. But be careful... answer incorrectly, give a duplicate answer or hesitate and you'll get wet! So stay sharp, stay dry, and soak up the fun!

name: Hen Party
description:
It's the ultimate party starter! Transform any bridal party into an epic adventure with Hen Party! Packed with hilarious icebreakers, dares and challenges, it’s guaranteed to have everyone in stitches!

Separate the cards into 4 piles: Level One, Two, Three and Forfeit cards. Take it in turns to pick a level card, you can choose the difficulty.

If you successfully complete the challenge, you score the points! If you fail you have to do a Forfeit card! When the timer runs out, count up the points on all your cards. The winner is the player with the most points!

name: AIDA
description:
It is a mystery game that can be played with one card.
It's a game that looks at the distance of the questioner's fingers and guesses the two numbers selected by the questioner.

name: Monopoly Canadian Tire
description:
Monopoly Canadian Tire celebrates the 100 years the company has existed in Canada. The property cards are cities and the railways and utilities are distribution centers and services. The money features Sandy McTire, a figure appearing on Canadian Tire "money" (coupons worth 5 cents to $2) since 1961. Unlike most versions this version is bilingual.

Play remains the same as in other Monopoly games. Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.

name: Rivals of Rock
description:
In Rivals of Rock, you are a musician and the leader of an ambitious, hard-working rock band in a small town with an up-and-coming music scene. A world-touring rock festival is coming to your city in a year, and they're looking for one band to headline the festival!

Over the course of three seasons, you will build up your rock band by recruiting and leveling up musicians, rehearsing to gain skills and write songs, and performing your songs at different venues to gain fans, popularity, and other juicy rewards in hopes of gaining more fame than rival bands.

When performing gigs, you have to carefully consider which songs to play at different venues based on the rival bands you're competing against and based on what the audience at the venues want to hear. Rock 'n' roll isn't all sunshine and rainbows, though. You also have to keep an eye on your musicians' needs and maintain a healthy level of band drama compared to rivals. At the end of the game, the leader of the band with the most fame wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: I.I.T.A.P.: It is the Apocalypse, People!
description:
Well, it happened. It's the apocalypse, people. Due to [classified] mutants have taken over the country. The last ship is leaving soon and Your rag tag group of survivors must scavenge the lands looking for valuable materials to ... Ensure... That the ferry captain lets you on board. Only one group will leave for the new land.

3 to 6 players scavenge, trade, beg, and backstab each other in this casual, family fun, resource management card game. Players send out scouts to collect cards in the hopes of finding the rate fresh fruit to bribe the ferry captain. The player with the most fresh fruit at the end wins. But, beware there are mutants about! In addition to wandering mutants other players can unleash even more mutants from their hand, or mutant cages!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Trading, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Mad Ads
description:
Product slogans, that you try to guess what your friends linked it to. IE Go Ahead, Make a Mess,did they link to Squirt Guns, Toilet bowl Cleaner, Laxatives, or a Vacuum Cleaner.

Laugh hysterically as you create crazy, zany ads with your friends and family.

All playing at the same time, Each player looks through his 5 Ad Slogans and decides which slogan should be used to "sell" one of the 4 products on the product card. The first player "Ad Exec" reads his slogan, the other players "consumers" vote on which product the Ad Exec is trying to sell. When ready, they hold up the number of fingers corresponding to the product number they think he is trying to "sell". If you are correct, you get 1 point, and the ad exec gets a point for every correct consumer. Play continues to the left.

Winner is the person with the most points after a pre-determined number of rounds. If there is a tie, play one more round. Suggested number of rounds 3-4 players, 8 rounds. 5-6 players, 5 rounds.

name: Ryte2Wyn
description:
Player with the most cards on the right... wins! Ryte2Wyn So easy, even a bridge troll can play!

Deck includes 50 unique Ryte2Wyn game cards, showcasing 10 vibrant characters including: 0-Little Gnome, 1-Scary Ghost, 2-Water Fairy, 3-Party Goblin, 4-Bridge Troll, 5-Amazing Amazon, 6-Stone Giant, 7-Strong Knight, 8-Bearded Wizard, 9-Red Dragon.

—description from the publisher

In this reformulation of the classic "War" card game, players have 2 cards for each turn's battle. At the game's start, players agree whether the cards will be added, subtracted, or multiplied to get that player's hand value. Player with the high value hand wins and puts the higher card of the two in a pile at his right hand side, retaining the other as one of the two for the next hand. The losing players discard their lower card to their left hand side and retain the other. This tends to provide a catchup assistance mechanism.

While this is positioned as better than flash cards for memorizing math facts, it is in fact a functional game with a fantasy artwork that engages younger kids. There are no decisions or strategy choices in the game, so the game play complexity is analogous to roll and move type games.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Arcane Dice Machine
description:
While exploring a hidden cave, two teams of minions find the remnants of an arcane, rune-covered machine. They begin to build it from the pieces laying around.

Place your dice strategically to score the most points by creating rows of three dice.
mechanics: Layering, Pattern Building, Stacking and Balancing

name: Monster Training
description:
In this game, each round you travel to a town to take part in a monster fighting tournament. While traveling you hunt, capture and train monsters that you’ll use in the tournament. You can hold up to three monsters at a time. Along the way you find items and run into other people on their way to the tournament who you can practice with before you get to town. When you get to the town at the end of the traveling phase of a round, you may shop, steal food, and win or lose gems on side games. When ready, you then battle in the town’s tournament.

The game includes a single player mode of varying length, three multiplayer modes, three levels of difficulty, and a daily challenge. The rule book is 50 pages but only about 20 pages are needed to play the normal game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ミニシヴィライゼーション (Mini Civilization)
description:
A 32-card flip and write civilization building game created by mor!_boardgame.

Each player becomes the leader of a civilization and aims to make their civilization the most prosperous.

Use limited resources efficiently, care for nature, develop your economy, interact with other countries, and engage in warfare to leave a lasting legacy of your civilization.

The cards you hold in your hand will dictate how your civilization progresses;
Food determines the size of nations, industry brings power, science develops learning and economies ...... and lastly, art creates culture.

Can you overcome natural disasters, economic and political war, and a struggle to maintain resources in order to lead your civilization to prosperity?

—user summary

カードはたったの32枚、120分の重量級紙ペンゲーム。文明の始まりから終わりまで、世界史を紡ぎましょう。
手元に並ぶ4枚のカードで文明の力を描くそのシステムは、間違いなく新しさであなたを驚かせます。
食料が国の規模を決め、産業が力をもたらし、科学は学問と経済を発展させ……その先で、全ての結晶たる芸術が文化を生み出します。
飢饉、天災、戦争……あらゆる厄災に備え、乗り越え、1000年の時を経ても歌われる文明を残すのがあなたです。

　人は火を起こし、火は文明を起こした。大地を飾った数多の文明が滅び去ったが、今もまだ、壁に刻まれ、石に掘られ、絵に描かれ、子供たちの枕もとで歌われている。

　各プレイヤーは文明の指導者となり、自らの文明が最も繁栄することを目指します。
　繁栄の度合いは得点という尺度で示され、8ラウンドが経過するか、いずれかの文明の得点が規定の8点に達したラウンドでゲームは終了し、その時に最も繁栄していた文明の指導者がゲームの勝者となります。
　限られた資源を効率的に使い、自然を慈しみ、経済を発展させ、他国と交流し、時には争いながら……文明が滅びてもなお語り継がれる芸術と文化を歴史に刻んでください。それこそが繁栄の証なのですから！

　手元に並ぶ4枚のカードと1枚のシートが紡ぎ出す革新的な国家運営システムが、かならずあなたに新鮮な体験をお届けします。

　4枚のカードは毎ラウンド、数字の小さいカードから順により小さいカード同士の差分だけの資源を4種類(芸術、科学、産業、食料の順)を生み出します。上の4枚であれば、一番小さい数値のカードは0との差分になるので芸術を２つ、それ以降は科学を３つ、産業を3つ、食料を2つ生み出します。この4枚のカードをより大きい数値に変えていくことで国家の生産力は成長していきます。

　国家は芸術を成長させることで後世に誇る文化を生み出し、反映し、歴史に残ることを目指します。ですが芸術を育てることは非常に困難です。常に文明の4枚の中で最も小さい数値が芸術となるということは、食料から順に国家を少しずつ育て、様々な歴史をつづりながら全てを成長させていかなければ、一足飛びに芸術の花だけを咲きほこらせることはできないのです。

　未来には隕石が降るような天災や大地が割れ果てるほどの干ばつと飢饉が待ち構えています。何度やっても変わらないシートなのに、何度やっても隕石や干ばつや自然があなたの文明にどんな影響を及ぼすのかは異なります。

　何をやってもままならず、最善には程遠い治世しかできないかもしれませんが、それは他のプレイヤーも同じこと。神でなくとも、世界一の指導者であればよいのです。1枚のシートに圧縮された国土と歴史を楽しんでいただけますように。

—description from the publisher

name: Aréna Mesterei CCG
description:
The world's only non-random collectible card game.

In the game, you have to control monsters to fight your opponent.

Create the front line and boss line, then evolve your monsters and defeat the opponent's 3 monsters.

As the game progresses, you can choose from more and more abilities, using your field cards you can strengthen the abilities of your monsters so that you can more easily win over your opponent.
mechanics: Action Points, Advantage Token, Chaining, Deck Construction

name: VAULT-E Wins: A Dice Game to Sharpen Your Math Skills
description:
This dice game, enhanced with action cards, allows you to sharpen your math skills while having fun. Add, subtract, and in advanced levels, multiply and divide your dice numbers to reach your targets. Action cards in higher levels add a strategic dimension to the game.

—description from the designer

name: Fairfax's Revenge: The Battle of Langport, July 19, 1645
description: Fairfax's Revenge is volume 9 in a series of games by Roberto Chiavini on famous battles of the English Civil War.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: The Lord of Hosts: The Battle of Dunbar, September 3, 1650
description: The Lord of Hosts is the tenth and last title in a series of games by Roberto Chiavini portraying famous battles of the English Civil War.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Punish Me, Daddy: Extreme Edition Expansion Pack
description:
An even more twisted and extreme version of the game.

Split cards into Dares, Twists, and Punishments. Shuffle the 3 stacks before starting.
Choose a player to go first.
The player must draw a Dare card and a Twist card.
The player must do the Dare and the Twist at the same time.
If the player succeeds, they get to keep both cards as a point (1 Dare and 1 Twist = 1 Point).
If the player fails to, refuses to, or cannot do the combination, the player must draw and do a Punishment card.
If the player can't do or refuses to do the Punishment, that player loses all the points they've accumulated so far and must start over from 0.
Move on to the next player in a clockwise motion.
Continue until there’s 1 last standing player.

—user summary

This Extreme Edition comes with even more hilarious combinations, focused specifically on being brutally extreme. Will you get hurt? Definitely. But that's the point. (Also, we're not liable for anything you get yourself into while playing this. Just a heads up.)
Card examples:
Dare: Put a 6" piece of duct tape on the hairiest part of your body, then rip it off.
Strip naked and let each player draw something anywhere they want on your body. Anywhere.
Twist: Squeal like a pig.
Make really seductive faces at everyone you make eye contact with.
There are also some that are plot twists, like keep your dare or draw a new one, but if you fail, you must draw 2 punishment cards.
Punishment: Let every player whip you with a belt 10 times.
Streak across the street while yelling "I'm naked" over and over.

—description from the publisher

name: Collect a Lotl
description:
Axolotls are special salamanders that love shade and like to hide. Therefore, in your pools there are large stone structures for the axolotls to hide under. It's up to you to give these axolotls a nice spot in your pool! In Collect a Lotl, you play axolotls tactically in the general basin and collect the axolotls in your personal basin. The more axolotls you have of the same color on a water map, the more points you receive!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Collect a Zombie
description:
Zombies stroll through the city looking for a new resting place. To the residents' horror, they find zombies in the dog basket, in the trunk or even in bed! Your job is to lure the zombies to your graveyard so that peace returns to the city! In Collect a Zombie, you play zombies tactically in the graveyard and collect the zombies on the right grave cards in your personal graveyard log. The more zombies you have of the same color on a grave card, the more points you receive!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Pirates of the High Teas
description:
Pirates of the High Teas is a whimsical set collection game in which players are pirates competing to win their Captain's treasure by serving the most delicious afternoon tea. Players collect and match dishes with tea cards to serve the Captain a perfect meal. To acquire these dishes and teas, players select actions through a strategic worker placement mechanism on the pirate ship that determines turn order and number of cards.

But don't forget, as pirates, there are lots of ways to break the rules! Players can smash their dishes together, creating ridiculous combinations that still pair perfectly. They can also use their cannon to blow up the available cards, send their monkey to steal a card off the top of the deck, and deploy a parrot to smuggle a single card directly to the Captain for points. Pirates of the High Tea is a fun lightweight strategy game of piracy and pastries. Pinkies up me hearties, yo ho!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement

name: Looot: New Longships and Shields
description:
A set of 2 new longships and 4 New shields to add to the game.
Add the 2 longship tokens to the the draw bag during set up.
Every player also gets 1 of the shield in their colour. During the game, players can now use this new shield power as well as the other 3 already found in the base game.
Playing the new shield allows players to place their viking on any ressource spot, ignoring any adjancency rules.

French version of the promo found in Plato Magazine 165
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: The Split
description: Siena Sudlow thought she was living the popstar dream, until she becomes embroiled in a scandal she never saw coming. She needs to escape and has locked away a secret message in an online vault and left 7 clues to unlock the vault – who’s up for cracking the case?

name: Monsterjagd in Gruselbruch
description:
In this funny game, monster hunters (you!) help the monsters to pacify the town of Gruselbruch. Each round, the monster pointer is increased by the number of monsters on the table. Afterwards a new monster comes into the city which must be defeated along with any older one. To do this, all dice must be rolled at the same time and the items rolled or secured item token from the last rounds must be placed on the corresponding symbols of the monsters.

If a monster is defeated (no free normal symbol slots), you get one point. If even the individual optional symbol field on the monster is still covered, you get two points instead.

For every two Grandpa symbols on the dice you can reveal a helping Grandpa card. The Grandpa dice can be re-rolled at any time if they are not needed to get useful items.

Unused dice can be converted into item token that can be used in the next round as long as you can store them.

The game ends when 10 victory points have been reached or the monster pointer has reached the last field. You win in the first case.

name: Absolutely Clueless
description:
The game where players create their own clues.

It’s the new fun family game where players take turns to create their own one-word clues to the hidden word.

If the clueless player guesses the hidden word from another player’s clue, then BOTH players score points. But the more clues needed to guess the word means less points are scored unless you’re in a DOUBLE or TRIPLE point round.

Fail to guess the word before the marble lands on the final score track space and FATE will play its part!

name: Goldrausch Galaxie
description:
In this beautifully decorated game, you use tools to explore asteroids and unearth galactic treasures that earn victory points. But be careful: there are pitfalls, aliens and bot glitches.

The game initially consists of 9 stacks of 9 cards each. In each turn, 2 of 6 tools are available. Only 3 tools can be used at the beginning.

Each round you choose two of the available tools and then reveal 3 face-down cards. You can use the tools at any time to collect score cards or to protect yourself from attack cards. If you reveal an event card, it is executed immediately and then removed from the game.

The game ends when either a player has collected all 3 Holomap Fragment cards or when 3 Black Hole cards have been revealed. The player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Full Disclosure: Strip, Truth or Dare Game for Lovers
description:
From the Publisher:
Want to have a sexy night you'll never forget? With "Full Disclosure" you'll not only disclose all your naughty little secrets, you'll also learn all about your lover's kinks, desires and fantasies - all while getting stripped down in the buff. Our naughty spin on the classic truth or dare game features 120 enticing truth or dare activities and a whole lot of naughty extras. Do you dare to play?

Decide who spins first, spin, and land on one of the 5 strip activities to determine how many articles of clothing to remove and how. Continue until both players are naked.

Now take turns drawing the Truth or dare activity cards, reading the card aloud, and performing 1 of the 2 options on the card. Once completed the next player chooses a card and so on.

Bonus Sex Spin: once players are in the buff and disclosed all their naughty little secrets, its time to take it to the next level of sexual fulfillment. Spin the spinner numbered 1-10, which corresponds to positions on the bonus sex card. Each player spins once to select a position for the night, and then both players will perform the two selected activities.

Game would probably be considered a cooperative game, as if played correctly you both win, and are guaranteed pleasure for you and your lover.

There are additional options listed for how to play the game. You can also decide on points for the truth or dare and most points after a set number of cards wins, and winner gets to decide the fantasy reward.

name: The Game of Fantasy Affairs
description:
Engage in adventurous affairs with your lover.
The game of seductive fantasies, creative kissing, and intimate foreplay for two lovers.

You and you lover travel around the board engaging in adventurous afairs while acting out a number of different roles and foreplay.

Players control the length of the game by quickly earning Fantasy tokens through foreplay and roleplay actions. After five tokens are earned, the game ends and sexual fantasy begins. First player to get 5 tokens wins

name: Disgraced House
description:
In Disgraced House, players control Samurai cat clans competing to outclass their rivals. Players will strategically select which of their representatives to send to various events and can spend Fate tokens to transform their representatives into alternate ranks! Each year concludes with a Disgrace event where each clan sends their final representative hoping not to have the highest ranking attendee, a social blunder that would bring shame to their house for the following year.

In this easy-to-learn trick-taking game there are no suits, which frees players from complicated play restrictions. Instead, players simply choose to play High (equal or greater than the highest card) or Low (the lowest card they have). To win the seven-hand contest, players must spend their Fate tokens wisely, pick the right tricks to try to win, gain intel on opponents’ cards, and maneuver to end with the right card for each critical Disgrace event.

—description from the publisher

name: ded.
description:
ded. is a whacky social deduction game that features three decks of cards: role cards, action cards, and personality cards. The groups is split in two teams, the Reapers and the Neighbors.

In ded., the neighbors are being killed off by the treacherous Reapers. The neighbors need to identify and eliminate the Reaper before all the neighbors are murdered.

ded. is played in rounds, each round consists of a Reaping where players can be killed, protected, and saved. The second part of each round is the Town Council, where the players vote to eliminate the Reapers.

The game ends with the Reapers eliminating all the Neighbors, or the Neighbors eliminating all the Reapers.

name: Bork!
description:
A crazy chaotic collect 5 card game about cute dogs and collecting bones.

Keep your friends close and your frenemies closer as you attack protect and collect your way to victory!

—description from the back of the box

Game play:
Play dog cards to collect bone cards, steal them from other players or protect your own. If you collect 5 bone cards, you win.

name: Disappearing Act
description:
Each year the forest fairies host the most remarkable festival. The highlight of the festival is the bubble tournament. Champions from all over the forest kingdom gather to collect the most magic bubbles from the each of the treetop platforms.

The champions blow bubbles out on to the platforms not knowing which colour bubbles will emerge. All they need to do is combine enough bubbles of their colour to collect them. As the competition gets closer to the final, some cheeky fairies even nudge a few playful hedgehogs onto the platforms, to pop bubbles as they appear.

Can you become the fairy champion at the bubble tournament this year or will you leave empty handed?

In Disappearing Act, players compete to pop as many of their bubble tokens off the board before the bag is empty. By combining bubble tokens of the same colour to the appropriate level, players can remove stacks of their tokens… beware though. When creating stacks of your own colours, you may also create stacks of colours for your opponents too. The player with the most bubble tokens of their colour off the board wins the game.

Use powerplay cards to gain rule breaking benefits but beware each one you trigger will cost you some points at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Set Collection, Stacking and Balancing

name: Altinha
description:
It has to be a joke! Playing high and low with a card and flicks!??

That's right, now you can carry the ball in your pocket and play high and low anywhere!

Remember to register who owns the ball and go in search of your new high and low record! Want to share the ball with the crowd? So play high in a group and look for a record as a team!

The player or group that manages to tap the card the most without letting it fall wins the game! So don't let the ball drop!

name: Signal
description:
Players take on the roles of Experts seeking to understand the Alien player, who is seeking to be understood. The Experts will create and transmit 'signals' to the Alien, who has certain rules for how to respond that must be deduced by the Experts. Once the Experts understand these rules, they can ensure that they come to agreement with the Alien, succeeding cooperatively.

On a turn, the Experts arrange black and white pieces on a mat to represent a graphical signal, discussing and debating how and what to send. Once finished, the Alien then replies by using pre-set rules only they can see to add, remove, and adjust the signal, both to be helpful and to try and reach an agreement- represented by a pre-set signal that they are trying to achieve with their limited response capabilities. As the Experts analyze and understand the Alien, they can use limited guesses and a few hint-like abilities to discover what signal they can send that will result in agreement. The Alien even has a little leeway in how they respond- they want to be understood.

After succeeding at the first round, Experts then reset and continue with the same Alien, except new rules are in play on top of the previous ones, showing a deeper and deeper familiarity with the Alien player. After three rounds of successful agreements, all players win cooperatively, and receive a score based on leftover guesses and unused abilities.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Induction, Pattern Recognition

name: Vegas 3478
description:
Vegas 3478 is a game of luck in which players want to run out of cards as quickly as possible.
Each turn, the active player rolls a small roulette wheel present in the game, and the result of this will give the possibilities of action for this player, ranging from discarding cards of a certain value from their hand to making their opponents draw cards.
Some high-risk plays also exist in roulette, allowing players to bet to try and win the round immediately, but risking their opponents doing so.
When a player runs out of cards in their hand, everyone else must add up points for the remaining cards and a new round begins.
The game ends when one player reaches a certain number of points. At this point, the player with the fewest points is the winner.

name: Damsels
description:
It's time to turn the tables on these dragons!
Each damsel lures dragons into their OWN dungeon. To determine which dragon goes to which damsel, the damsels secretly assign mini poker hands to each dragon. High hand takes the dragon and adds it to their dungeon.
Each round a new display of dragons to lure is presented.
The first damsel to fill their dungeon with all 6 types of dragons wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Slumber Party Pillow Fight
description:
You are going to through the best slumber party ever! And that means getting a lot of guests and the most popular guests to come to your party.
Then you make your guest pillow fight your opponents' guests, so they leave.
Each turn players play one card into their tableau-their slumber party. This card represents 1 guest, and that guest has a pillow power you use to attack your opponents' slumber parties.
Play out the deck and when the deck runs out, whoever has the most guests wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Caveiras de Sedlec
description: Caveiras de Sedlec is the boxed Brazilian version of Skulls of Sedlec, containing the base game plus the 10 first expansions in a bigger box than the wallet original version.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Cards Against Simpsons
description: This is a Simpsons-themed Cards Against Humanity clone. Follows the standard Cards Against Humanity rules.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: 커피 러시 프로모: 파주 장단콩 (Coffee Rush: Paju Jangdankong Promo)
description:
Coffee Rush has released two promo cards in 2024 Paju spiel.

When setting up the game, return two random order cards to the box, then shuffle the promo cards together with the order card deck for the base game.

name: bid3
description: Three player only and three suits, with a rock-paper-scissors relationship. Must follow. High card of lead suit wins, unless RPS trumping occurs. After 3 tricks, bid with a card from your hand (rank=bid) how many tricks you’ll win. Goal is first to win three hands. Winner of a hand is a hierarchy - all tricks, no tricks, hitting your bid, most tricks.

name: The Mission: Faithful Odyssey
description:
Missionaries embark on a journey across the world evangelizing. With 40 missions to play and an ever-changing game dynamic this game offers a replay value. Play, build, travel, and trade in this worker placement game. Journey and build with the custom made 3D pieces across the board, our beautiful world, strategizing your way to victory as the greatest missionary. Watch out as your opponents may use distraction cards to slow you down on you travels. Play a miraculous card to change the very fabric of the game. Be the first to complete 2 mission trips by connecting your your trip with crosses and upgrade the beginning and endpoints with churches. On your turn draw a card. Choose one of 4 actions: play, build, travel, trade. Set out to be the first to complete your mission trips.

—description from the designer

name: Миссия Черепашки (Mission Turtles)
description:
Little turtles just came into being and need to reach water as soon as possible! Their path will not be easy, as they are so small, and the coast is grassy and pebbly here and there—not to mention that crawling on the sand is not easy at all! And to top it off, a stealthy pelican is waiting for a misstep to disturb them.

In Миссия Черепашки ("Mission Turtles"), players help baby turtles make their first journey: to reach the water despite all the obstacles.

name: Хранители ключей против Дракона (Key Keepers vs the Dragon)
description:
In the game Хранители ключей против Дракона ("Key Keepers vs. the Dragon"), the players need to find the right keys to all the locks and save the Princess until the Dragon climbs to the top of the tower.

The game's rules are straightforward yet strategic: players roll a die and strategically choose which key to try on the lock of the corresponding color. They then flip the lock and check if the key fits. Each lock has only 1 unique key, and there are 16 of them in the game.

The locks are arranged so that the keys can only be inserted from the backside. Therefore, players will not only have to try their luck but also memorize which keys are needed to the already-tried locks.
At the same time, the fearsome dragon rises to the princess if the Dragon side falls on the die.
The player's goal is to open all the doors in the tower and get to the princess before the fearsome Dragon.

All players act together, win or lose together, so the game is ideal for the youngest players and will teach them to memorize the location of the right components and enjoy saving the princess as a family.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Nekojima: Torii Pack
description: On Nekojima, the landscape of Cat Island is transformed by the construction of the Torii, the sacred portal. But that's not all: the famous lucky cat, the Maneki-neko, wanders from neighborhood to neighborhood. Is this your lucky day?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Single Loser Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Micro Midgard: Yggdrasil Mini Expansion
description: The Yggdrasil Expansion is a mini expansion that adds new custom meeples and Blessing abilities to the existing game.

name: Aquatica: Duellum
description:
New Aquatica in a duel format: deeper, meaner and more intense.

Choose a Turtle King or a Squid Queen and improve your underwater realm by playing action cards and assembling locations on three-layered boards. After decades of turbulent times, it is time to unite the underwater world under the fin or tentacle of a single ruler!  

New layer of depth is brought to the game by the dynamic market on a vortex board.  

Be careful! The game can end not only when all players achieve their goals but also based on who is the fastest to collect the crowns. Tension is added by the tug of war mechanic.

Also, mantas will finally have the company of equally charming squids and turtles.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tug of War

name: Tea Garden
description:
Tea Garden is a game of talented debuting designer Tomáš Holek, who is also working on his designs for the biggest Czech publishers. The key elements of the game are deck-building and worker-placement, Maybe the most intriguing is the resource management part though. In Tea Garden, you will pay with tea leaves. Those can be either green or black (fermented) – the value of green leaves decreases each round, but the value of black leaves increases. But you can’t gain black leaves directly, you can just change the green leaves to the black leaves. This simple mechanism is vital to the unique dynamics of the game that it’s so easy to fall for.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses

name: Karak II: Imperium
description:
The first expansion for Karak 2 brings a number of new features, most notably the player vs player mechanics and the new Imperium mode. In the new mode, players compete for the Emperor's Crown, which brings great power but also great responsibility, in addition to the usual objective. The expansion also introduces five new heroes, two new monster types and several new landscape types.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Modular Board

name: Karak: Goblin – Nexus
description:
Expansion for card game Karak: Goblin that adds two new game modes: alternative boss fights and Survival. Boss Fights that use new boss action card decks are now much more exciting and dynamic (the expansion also adds two new bosses to the roster). Survival mode is played simultaneously and players have to face the waves of ever stronger opponents (this mode use draft mechanics) while there is no respawning. In addition to these, the expansion also adds two new heroes and new potion type.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Witchdom
description:
In Witchdom, you will lead your own clan of witches into which you will recruit talented sorceresses. Their task will be to acquire magical resources, items, potion recipes and new initiates. Each apprentice must pass a final exam and brew one of the mysterious potions. Only in this way can she become a rightful member of your clan. The game of Witchdom is a card-driven game in which you’ll need in particular good timing and tactical thinking to win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards

name: Banda pand i kawałki bambusa
description:
Search, compare and catch the panda. In each round, one player rolls a die, then each player tries to collect the panda card that best meets the condition indicated by the die. After comparing the results on the back of the cards, one player becomes the winner and takes the card. The player who is the first to collect the right number of cards wins.

—description from the designer

name: Thunderstone Quest: The All-Consuming Hive
description:
Quest number 17: the all-consuming hive!

Venture into living caverns crawling with primal foes to rescue the captives before it's too late!

A new game mechanic is also introduced in this quest: Static Captive cards are a new Reward in the dungeon, offering you great benefits for bringing captives safely back to the village!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Пілоти: KBP Бориспіль (Sky Team: KBP Boryspil)
description:
An additional airport for Sky Team.

The expansion represents KBP Бориспіль (Boryspil) airport located near Kyiv, Ukraine.

Available as pre-order promo for Ukrainian edition of the Sky Team (Пілоти).

name: OctoWords
description:
OctoWords is a flip-and-write word game.

In the first phase, players will flip letter cards, allowing them to choose 4 letter pairs to add to their page. After adding 8 letters, they will then flip 8 word cards, and use these to create a crossword on their word grid.

Then, in the second phase, players will fill in their own cross word with the letters they chose, to create as many words as possible.

When everyone is done, words are scored, bonuses are assigned, and a winner is announced!

The game is scalable for different age and skill levels.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Spelling

name: Busted!
description:
Get your character as big as you can. These women want to appear bigger and will do so by any means necessary. They'll use padding, botanicals, and even tattoos!

But you have to keep your methods a secret, or you opponents can expose you and knock you down a size.

In this card game the cards are dual purpose. They can either upgrade your size, or attack your opponents to expose them or knock them down a size.

The first character to get to and keep the largest size wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Melding and Splaying, Multi-Use Cards

name: Rail Line
description:
Rail Line is a simple yet clever card game set in the world of trains calmly puffing throughout the landscape.

Each player becomes one of the railroad tycoons of the Industrial Revolution - your tracks will slice through the landscape, steam trains puffing in their wake. In practice, it's very simple - players play cards, with each card having three tracks that build on each other, crossing and intersecting in various ways.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pieces as Map

name: Atoll
description:
Atoll is a winning design of the 1st season of Czech board game design contest turned into reality show called "Den deskovek". It's engine building game in which your goal is to build the best possible ecosystem in which the population of fish and other creatures will thrive, and which will attract new species.
A central concern for you in managing Atoll is a variable called fatigue - whenever you use a special coral ability or increase the population of one of your cards, that card becomes fatigued. However, some cards allow you to remove fatigue from other cards and others allow you to increase population without fatigue, and finding these options can be the way to victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Square Grid, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Nutventure
description:
Nutventure is a children's game by the debuting author Eliška Holubová and Albi’s very own Marek Vejborný. The players will take control of squirrels trying to hoard nuts for a winter. They will move on and around the 3D-tree using 3 coloured dice and try to plan their movements to avoid the predators – fox and owl – that can scare them and strip them of their loot.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Movement Points, Movement Template

name: Clue: Ghostbusters
description:
Your team of paranormal eliminators answered the call and raced to a farmhouse in Ecto-1. Now work together to roast some ghosts and solve a spooky mystery.

Typical Clue game, with a Ghostbusters flair, farmhouse locations and the addition of paranormal cards which you draw if you roll a magnifying glass on you movement roll. With the paranormal cards, you and another player either battle a ghost, which if you win, you can name a ghost and if someone has that card they place it faceup. Or you have a PKE Surge!, where you and another player battle to determine a location. If you win, you name a location and if someone has it they place it faceup.

Based on the 2021 movie "Ghostbusters Afterlife"
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Valerius
description:
Millions of years ago the planet Valerius was once the jewel of the galaxy, filled with an abundance of resources and home to a grand civilization known for its advanced technology.

Suddenly, a massive asteroid slammed into its surface, tearing the planet apart. From this destruction arose a thousand moons, each carrying the shattered remnants of Valerius' golden age.

With the promise of a new life and the chance to unlock the mysteries of a forgotten civilization, aliens from across the universe flocked to these moons forming moon colonies. As the colonies continued to evolve and adapt, they developed the technology needed to stabilize the mother planet and harvest Valerius' untapped resources essential for the advancement of their own worlds. This race to the top ignited an epic interstellar war, where each species now fights fiercely to claim the riches and secure their future among the stars. The battle rages on, with the fate of the entire galaxy hanging in the balance. Will your civilization survive? The battle is on.

TO WIN
As the leader of a moon, players must hire alien mercenaries to extract resources from the planet, while engaging in battle with rival moon colonies who also attempt to advance their civilizations. To win, be the first player to collect 21 Vallerium.

—description from the publisher

name: Fall of Berlin, 16 April - 2 May 1945, The End of the Thousand Year Reich
description:
Fall of Berlin, 16 April - 2 May 1945, The End of the Thousand Year Reich is the second game in Michael Taylor's Russian Front Series. It is an operational-scale game covering from 16 April to 2 May 1945 in the area around Berlin: from the River Oder, Frankfurt an der Oder and Seelow in the east, and from Torgau and the River Elbe in the south-west, through to the forests north of Berlin at the northern edge of the map.

There is some subtlety in play to generate the correct strategy. Designer Michael Taylor said: “….. you will probably lose badly until you figure out the right strategy”. There are three options for playing the game. The Basic game is 7 turns long; the Extended game is 9 turns; and the third option is a 3-player game with 2 Russian players competing against each other (which can be either 7 or 9 turns).

Game scale: About 12-18 km per hex; 2 days/turn (except for 1st turn which covers 16 April 1945 only); 7 or 9 game turns long. German units are mostly depleted divisions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Fang den Zoo
description:
Objective:
Return all the monkeys to their enclosures within a set number of rounds before time runs out.

Setup:

Place the forest plan in the center and arrange the base station and 12 monkey enclosures around it.
Distribute 24 monkey/forest tiles facedown in the forest.
Depending on the difficulty level, place 1-3 banana tiles as time markers on the base station.


Gameplay:

The Director starts at the first empty enclosure. The Keeper indicates whose turn it is.
Active players reveal as many forest tiles as there are missing monkeys in the current enclosure. Finding the right monkey places it in the respective enclosure.
Incorrectly revealed monkeys can be repositioned to facilitate future searches.
After each turn, all revealed tiles are turned facedown again. The Director moves to the next enclosure needing monkeys.
Crossing the base station removes a banana tile, reducing the number of rounds.
The game ends when all monkeys are correctly placed or no tiles remain in the forest.


Difficulty Levels:

Easy: 3 banana tiles, 4 rounds.
Medium: 2 banana tiles, 3 rounds (recommended).
Hard: 1 banana tile, 2 rounds.


Note: This cooperative game can also be played solo.

—description from the publisher

Ziel des Spiels:
Bringe innerhalb einer festgelegten Rundenzahl alle Affen zurück in ihre Gehege, bevor die Zeit abläuft.

Spielvorbereitung:

Legt den Waldplan in die Mitte und platziert rundherum die Basisstation sowie die 12 Affengehege.
Verteilt 24 Affen-/Waldplättchen verdeckt im Wald.
Je nach Schwierigkeitsgrad legt 1-3 Bananenplättchen als Zeitmarker auf die Basisstation.


Spielablauf:

Der Direktor startet am ersten leeren Gehege. Der Wärter markiert, wer am Zug ist.
Aktive Spieler decken so viele Waldplättchen auf, wie Affen im aktuellen Gehege fehlen. Der Fund eines passenden Affen führt zur Platzierung im entsprechenden Gehege.
Falsch aufgedeckte Affen dürfen umpositioniert werden, um die Suche in späteren Runden zu erleichtern.
Nach jedem Zug werden alle aufgedeckten Plättchen wieder umgedreht. Der Direktor bewegt sich zum nächsten Gehege mit fehlenden Affen.
Überquert der Direktor die Basisstation, wird ein Bananenplättchen entfernt, was die Rundenanzahl reduziert.
Das Spiel endet, wenn alle Affen korrekt platziert oder keine Plättchen mehr im Wald sind.


Schwierigkeitsgrade:

Leicht: 3 Bananenplättchen, 4 Runden.
Mittel: 2 Bananenplättchen, 3 Runden.
Schwer: 1 Bananenplättchen, 2 Runden.


—description from the publisher (German)

name: Monopoly: Metallica World Tour
description:
Wherever You May Roam...
Metallica and Monopoly have collaborated once again to bring you an all new, second edition of this American classic. This time we're celebrating life on the road, including the World record breaking, Whiplash-filled year of 2013 when Metallica became the first and only band to perform on all seven continents. Tour around the globe with your collectible token to some of the band's favorite cities in North America, South America, Europe, Asia, Australia, and Africa. You'll even find yourself trapped under ice in Antarctica!
Purchase property with your Metalli-bucks, acquire all the cities on one continent, and add arenas and stadiums to increase your value. Land on one of the "Carpe Diem" or "Shortest Straw" spaces and be rewarded with sticks, picks, and snake pit passes, or fined with parking and stage repair fees. Travel the world, Metallica-style, while building your real estate empire! Hit the Lights!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Shapes
description:
The game has a simple rule: play a card from your hand that matches the colour or shape of the one on the table.
With short rounds, Shapes helps kids learn through play, enhancing motor skills, focus, and emotional resilience along the way!

Shuffle the deck and deal 3 cards to each player. Place one card face-up in the middle of the table.

Taking turns clockwise, each player must play a card from their hand that matches the colour or shape of the card on the table, placing it on top of the pile. If a player cannot make a match, they draw a card from the deck and pass their turn.

The first player to run out of cards wins the game.

name: Stop Singa
description:
Fridge, Fork, Fruit... STOP!
Grab a question, read it aloud, and draw a letter. Take turns answering the question, and keep the game rolling. Stay alert – shout "STOP" to test your luck if you get stuck.

Game Instructions

Objective:
The goal of this game is to answer questions creatively and avoid accumulating points. The player with the fewest points after 10 rounds wins.

Setup:

Separate the cards by their different backs (QUESTION cards, LETTER cards and STOP cards).
Take a paper and pen for scoring.
Choose an object to mark turns and give it to the first player.


Gameplay:

Starting the Round:
Flip over one QUESTION card and read one of the questions out loud.
Flip over a LETTER card.

Answering:
Everyone who has an answer to the question raises their hand.
The first player answers the question first, followed by each player taking turns clockwise.
The round ends when a player cannot answer the question. That player gets a point.

Special Action * "STOP":
Players can also say "STOP" and try their luck with the Stop cards if no hands are up.



Ending the Game:

After 10 rounds, the player with the fewest points wins!


Scoring:

Keep track of points on the paper.
Players earn points when they cannot answer a question.


Winning the Game:

The player with the fewest points at the end of 10 rounds is declared the winner!

name: Worta
description:
In Worta, you step into the shoes of a farmer!
Grow your garden by planting vegetables, and strategically use rabbits, foxes, droughts, and barns to have the highest vegetable production by the end of the game.
However, no farm is complete without animals, and in this game, they might determine the real winner!

Game Instructions

Objective:
In this game, you are a farmer striving to cultivate the best garden. Your goal is to gather animals and grow vegetables to earn the most points.

Setup:

Separate the decks.
Give each player 2 distinct vegetable cards (place them face-up on the table) from the blue deck.
Deal each player 2 additional cards from the blue deck.


Gameplay:

Drawing Cards:
On your turn, draw 2 cards from the blue deck.

Playing Cards:
Play 2 cards by discarding them onto the pile and utilising their power.



Scoring:

Every vegetable you cultivate in your garden adds 1 point to your score.
The game ends when a player gathers 4 different animals. Completing this set adds an additional 4 points to the total score.


Winning the Game:

Count the points from your cultivated vegetables and any bonus points from gathered animals.
The player with the highest total score is declared the best farmer in the county!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Farming

name: If Mona Lisa
description:
Step into the role of a curator in this art game.
Build unique collections by combining paintings according to their groups. Make strategic decisions about which art pieces to spare or trade, all while pursuing your objective.
Earn points for each painting added to your gallery and strive to curate the most valuable exhibition to win.

72 paintings recreated for kids, full of colours and fun.

Game Instructions

Objective:
In this game, you are a museum curator tasked with creating an assigned exhibition. The goal is to curate the best collection of art pieces and earn the most points.

Setup:

Separate the cards by their different backs.
Give each player 1 Exhibition card and 5 Painting cards.
Your play area is your museum, where you will place the collections of art pieces to exhibit.
You can exhibit any collection, even if they are not part of your exhibition objective.


Card Breakdown:
The game consists of 72 cards divided into 6 categories of paintings:

Still Life
Sacred and Myth
Portrait
Landscape
Masters
Genre Scene


Each category has 12 cards:

Paintings: 5 points
Masterpieces: 10 and 15 points


Creating Collections:
To create collections for display, players must assemble either:

3 cards of the same category, or
3 masterpieces from distinct categories.


Art Market:

On the right side of your play area is your Art Market, a place to put your surplus cards or any other cards you want to trade.


Gameplay:
1. On your turn, draw 2 cards by collecting from the deck or trading on the market.
2. Before ending your turn, you can display collections in your play area.

Winning the Game:

The first curator to complete their Exhibition card earns an additional 15 points and ends the game.
The winner is the curator with the most points from exhibited art pieces.

name: Scooby-Doo!: Hotel Mal-Assombrado
description:
This is a game of hidden roles.
Each player receives a role at the start of the game, which must be kept secret. While most of the players are hotel staff, trying to unmask the villains, the few villains want to remain incognito and generate doubts in the other players.
In addition to a role, each player is dealt a hand of random cards, which can contain traps, Scooby Snacks, monsters and clues. In the complete deck there are more monsters than other types of cards.

On your turn, you must choose one of the characters from the Scooby-Doo gang to carry out their action, which ranges from simply changing cards in your hand to making players put down unopened cards on the table. When this happens, all the played and unopened cards are shuffled and revealed, one by one, until a monster appears, causing the villains indicator to move one space towards victory. However, if any clues are revealed, the Scooby gang that walks towards discovering the villains.
So, through bluffing and clever use of their cards at the right times, the hotel staff try to discover the identity of the villains and the villains try to arouse suspicion about other players.

The game ends when a villain is discovered or when the progress indicator of the villains or the Scooby gang reaches its final space.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game

name: Peleliu: Island Without Mercy, September-November 1944
description:
Peleliu: Island Without Mercy, September-November 1944 is Volume IV in Michael Taylor's Island War Series. Peleliu is a simulation of the US invasion of the islands of Peleliu and Angaur, in the Palaus (east of The Philippines) in the Fall of 1944. Peleliu is one of the many battles in the Pacific that is often overlooked. The battle, however, rivalled Tarawa, Iwo Jima and Okinawa in its ferocity and savagery.

The game has three Scenarios: Peleliu (15 September to 27 November 1944, 27 Turns), Angaur (17 September to 22 October 1944, 14 turns), and the Peleliu Campaign including both islands (15 September to 27 November 1944, 27 Turns). Because of its small size and shorter length, the Angaur Scenario is a good introductory scenario for those who are new to the Island War system.
