Peleliu is mainly a 2-3 player game, where one player controls the Japanese ground forces (both army and navy), and where 1-2 players control the US forces (USMC and US Army). Because the Japanese units are initially face down, and because there are some Japanese Dummy units, there is some hidden information in the game which means that 2-3 players are best. However, the game can be played solitaire.

Game scale: About XX miles per hex (YY meters/hex); 2 to 3 days/turn; the game is 14-27 game turns long; units are battalions and companies.

Provisional Contents of Peleliu:
One 11” x 17” color paper map of Peleliu;
one 8.5” x 11” color paper map of Angaur;
140 counters (0.6” counters);
15 pages of rules;
2 player aids.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Advanced Persistent Threat
description:
Welcome to the world of strategic cyber warfare, where nation state hackers engage in a constant battle for global network dominance. Can you become the ultimate Advanced Persistent Threat?

Players begin by choosing an Adversary card to represent them and placing the rest back in the box.

The game consists of Staging Servers, Production Servers, Software, Malware, Exploits and Zero Days.

To begin, players take a Staging Server, Small DDOS Zero-Day card, and reference card and place them on the table in front of them. This is your Network into which you will be playing cards

Shuffle the remaining cards and deal 5 to each player, placing the rest of the deck face down in the center of the table.

Decide who goes first and take turns going clockwise around the table.

Each turn is made up of 4 steps.

First, check your Network for any cards with mandatory or optional “beginning of your turn” effects. These trigger now.

Second, draw a card from the deck and place it in your hand

Third, play one card from your hand.

Production Servers, Staging Servers, and Software are played into your Network. Malware is played into other players' networks, and Exploits can be played for an instant effect. When playing any card, read the effects out loud and perform their action.

Software and Malware card effects apply to the whole Network.

Software has positive effects and can only be installed above a server that does not have any other Software or Malware installed above it

Malware can be installed on top of Software canceling out the Software effect.

If a Server is Uninstalled, Deleted, or Stolen, any Software or Malware installed above that Server are also discarded or stolen with it.

If a Server instructs you to “return this card to your hand” only the server card is returned. Any cards above it are discarded.

Exploit cards can be played for immediate effects and must then be discarded

You can also play as many Zero-Day cards as you want, during any players’ turn

Fourth and lastly, discard down to a maximum of 7 cards

The first player to have 6 servers in their network wins!

If the deck runs out of cards before any player reaches 6 servers, the player with the most servers wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Move Through Deck

name: Card Scramble National Lampoon’s Christmas Vacation
description: Based on National Lampoon movie and characters. Collect card sets of movie scenes to move through board. Different movie scenes require different number of cards-forward moving spaces. First to finish wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Immer Voran!
description: A variant covering the battle of North Cape, an attempt by the German battleship Scharnhorst to attack convoy JW55B.

name: Flopnik
description:
Players become developers of rockets launching artificial satellites. Outwit other researchers and become the leader to ensure a successful launch. It's a bluffing and deduction card game for 2 to 5 players.

—description from the publisher (translated)

プレーヤーは人工衛星を打ち上げるロケットの研究者になります。
他の研究者を出し抜きリーダーとなって打ち上げを成功させましょう。
ブラフと推測が鍵の2〜5人向けのカードゲームです。

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Score-and-Reset Game
publishers: Peanuts Design (ピーナツデザイン)

name: The Sixth Realm: Echoes of the Cavern
description:
The ancient curse stirs deep below the Sixth Realm. As the poisonous fog returns, the six races unite once more to uncover the source of the curse and break it. Their research led them to a vast underground cavern, and inside they discovered the ancient runes that both detail the curse, and the way to dispel it.

Each section of the curse board is paired with a certain Envoy and Seal type. As those elements are gathered by players, the cursed enegy at the center of the board spreads to their regions, giving scoring penalties to affected players.

The Prophecies of the cavern are visions of the future as seen detailed in the ancient sigils. When a player satisfies the condition of a Prophecy, they will be able to remove curse tokens from the inscriptions, limiting the spread of the curse and earning victory points for their heroic deed.

Desperate times call for desperate measures. Queen Tabitha realizes that this is a time to call in the experts with Royal Summons to save this new realm. These allow players to gain several envoys at once, giving them more control over the colors they take. These Royal Summons will then need to be paid off, before another one can be issued.

name: How Brave is Mave?
description:
How Brave is Mave? is a quirky card and dexterity game designed to entertain the entire family. Similar to Jenga and the Water Cup Challenge, this game features a goat named Mave and is played off the edge of a table. The objective is to keep Mave from taking a nosedive off the path during your turn. If Mave falls on your turn, you lose and everyone else wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game
mechanics: Auction: Dexterity, Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: FaceTap
description:
All the faces are scattered on the table.
When an emotion is revealed, the game kicks off!
Players need to find the identical ones – and fast!
Beware, someone might spot them before you!
This fast-action card game is ideal for helping kids learn about emotions while enhancing coordination and agility.

Game Instructions

Objective:
The goal of this game is to find sets of three cards with the same face. The player with the most cards at the end wins.

Setup:

Separate the cards by their different backs (white deck and black deck)
Spread the white deck face-up on the table.
Shuffle the black deck and remove 2 cards.
Flip over the top card of the black deck to show everyone.


Gameplay:

Finding Matches:
Look at the flipped-over card
Find 3 cards on the table with the same face
Tap the cards, say their colour, and take them for yourself.

Continuing Play:
Continue flipping over cards from the black deck and finding matches.
Repeat the process until the black deck is empty.



Ending the Game:

When the black deck is empty, count the number of cards each player has collected.


Winning the Game:

The player with the most cards is declared the winner!

name: Pool of Feelings
description:
The goal of this game is to introduce young kids to card games while helping them learn about and share their feelings. The game can be played in four different ways.

1. Learning about Feelings
Kids explore different feelings by looking at the expressions on Singa's faces. The objective is to collect as many cards as possible, but the real goal is to learn about feelings and have fun!

Setup:

Separate the decks by their different backs (red and black).
. Spread the colorful cards face-up on the table (red back).
Shuffle the rest of the cards, stack them, and place them on the table (black back).


Gameplay:

Take one card from the black deck and say: "I feel ... (name of the feeling)".
Ask the child to find the same feeling on the open cards.
If the child finds the matching face, hand over the card from your hand and compare them.
If the child doesn't find it, the adult shows the matching card from the table and takes both cards.
When the pile is over, count the cards!


2. Finding the Feeling
Kids learn about feelings while also memorizing their corresponding expressions. This game enhances memory, attention to detail, and recognition of feelings.

Setup:

Separate the red deck by their different backs (red and black).
Spread the black-backed cards face-up on the left side of the table.
Spread the red-backed cards face-down on the right side of the table.


Gameplay:

Pick one of the feelings on the table and say: "I feel ... (name of the feeling)".
Flip over a red card and see if the feeling matches.
If it matches, claim both cards for yourself and pass your turn.
If it doesn't match, close the card you just flipped and pass your turn.


3. How Was Your Day?
This game offers a way to explore the feelings both you and the child experienced throughout the day in an easy and fun way. Are you ready to embark on this journey together? The objective is to use different faces to encourage engaging conversations.

Setup:

Separate the red deck and set it aside.
Spread the black deck face-up on the table.


Gameplay:

Take one card from the pile and say: "I felt ... (name of the feeling) today when/because..."
Take the card for yourself and then encourage the child to do the same.


4. Telling a Story
In this game, you will craft a story together using your imaginations. The goal is to collaborate on telling a story while guessing the feelings indicated by the other player.

Setup:

Separate the decks by their different backs (red and black).
Spread the colorful cards face-up on the table (red back) and remove the rest of the cards (they can be used as a guide, if necessary).


Gameplay:

The adult starts the tale by saying "Once upon a time..." and begins talking about the place and the main character.
Let the adventure roll and remember to keep the child engaged.
When ready, add a feeling to your story. Pick a card that matches the feeling you want, then say, "The (name of the character) feels... (show the card)".
If the child guesses the feeling correctly, give them the card and invite them to continue the story from where it left off. Encourage them to do the same.
If they guess wrong, reveal the feeling and take the card for yourself. Continue the story, and when ready, select another card to repeat the process.

name: General Election! The Board Game
description:
A social assessment game.

Players take on the role of a political party seeking election in the 2024 UK General Election. Each round, one player acts as the Voter and selects from the policies presented by the other players. Players earn votes for putting forward the policy selected, and for correctly predicting the Voter's intentions.

Dixit Meets Politics.

—description from the designer

name: Datos No Opiniones: La Historia de la Selección
description:
How many seconds passed between the Hand of God and the Goal of the Century? How many matches did Messi play for the national team before scoring his first hat-trick for Argentina? Or what is said to be the "fatal minute" for the national team?

Datos No Opiniones: La Historia de la Selección includes facts about achievements, feats, life (and some blunders) of Argentina's National Team and those who crowned it with glory!

On your turn, you are going to grab the first question from the deck and, without seeing the answer, you are going to place it to the left or right of the card you used as your starting point. If you think the answer is a greater number than the one in the data row, you put your card on the left and, if you think it is smaller, on the right. When you have chosen where to put the card, you turn it over to see if you were right. If the card is placed correctly, it's the next player's turn, if it's wrong, you take it out and keep it. If you place two cards wrong, you are immediately eliminated.

As the game progresses there will be more cards in the data row and you will have to take them all into account when placing the question that comes your turn.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Deliverance: Council of the Fallen
description:
The little town of Fallbrook, once haven of demons and threshold of apocalypse, is doomed.

Despite the victory of the Angelic Host over the great serpentine beast, they could not stop the cataclysmic earthquakes that shook the town to its’ very foundations. A sinkhole opened in the wilderness just beyond the edge the town has revealed a castle old as time, and uncovered a new plot. Demons sworn to a secret rebellious sect: The Council of The Fallen.

Now a saint has returned to Fallbrook. Guided by heavenly visions, and prophesying doom. Walking alone and facing insurmountable opposition against forces both spiritual and corporeal, he has few bulwarks against failure.

Except you. His guardian angels.

Deliverance: Council of The Fallen is an expansion to the acclaimed Deliverance board game, featuring 6 new playable angels, new minions and Princes to battle, a challenging Campaign that further explores the mysteries of Fallbrook, an arsenal of new cards and effects that add even greater variety and replayability to the base game, a 5th player mode, and more. Delve deeper into the secrets of the demon infested castle, and determine the fate of Fallbrook through your choices.

In this expansion to Deliverance, experience a branching campaign where your ultimate level of victory depends on your choices and secondary objectives earned throughout the campaign. Will Fallbrook be destroyed? Who will survive its destruction? Or will you triumph and see it granted total deliverance?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Religious
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Fradinate
description: A set collection card game where you produce the perfumes you have collected and earn rewards. Each turn players will potentially collect perfumes, use a once-per-game refresh card, or sell perfumes.
publishers: End of the Century Games (世紀末Games)

name: Hegemony: Lead Your Class to Victory – Rapid Resolution promo
description:
A promo card delivered at UK Games Expo 2024.


Rapid Resolution
Spend 1 Influence to call for an Immediate Vote on a Bill already proposed by another player. Place this Influence on your preferred Vote Result area on the board before drawing Voting cubes. (Award Victory Points as normal, based on who proposed the Bill.)
categories: Economic, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Voting, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Pizza Roles
description:
Pizza Roles is a ten-minute "filler" hidden roles game where your role is what you want on your pizza but are too timid to say. Play simulates a conversation about what kind of pizza to order with each player vying for what they want while trying not to seem overbearing.

Eight Topping cards represent the game state. Gameplay consists mostly of moving these Topping cards back and forth between the "not on the pizza" zone and the "on the pizza" zone. Each player is dealt a secret Role card showing their objectives in the game and a small hand of Conversation cards they can play to manipulate the Topping cards.

Players take turns either playing a Conversation card from their hand to change the Toppings or choosing to pass. Players can always choose to pass, but the game will end as soon as the majority of players pass in succession.

When the game ends, players reveal their secret Roles and any Toppings in the "on the pizza" zone will score. Points are totaled and all players with a positive score are joint winners. Sometimes, everybody wins!

There is also a cooperative mode with slightly modified rules: Players must work together to make sure that everybody is happy with a pizza because if a single player loses, ALL players lose. Luckily, players make two pizzas instead of one and only score using the best pizza for each Role.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game

name: Greenlight
description:
A game for people who will never make it in Hollywood.

The object of Greenlight is simple: come up with the best movie idea. Players develop their movie ideas by selecting cards that complete a one-sentence synopsis of the movie. Each round, one player acts as “Studio Head” and chooses their favorite movie to greenlight. The player with the most greenlights at the end of the game wins.

Greenlight is a game for people who have no business being in the movie business.

Greenlight is a game for you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: BANG! Dice Explosion
description:
When the stakes rise, there’s only one solution: a stick of dynamite! Light the fuse and inflame your game nights with BANG! Dice Explosion.

Includes:

BANG! The Dice Game
BANG! The Dice Game: Old Saloon
BANG! The Dice Game: Undead or Alive
4 brand new BANG! The Dice Game characters: (Flint Westwood, John Pain, Big Spencer, Teren Kill, AKA "the Brave Four")


—description from the back of the box
categories: American West, Bluffing, Deduction, Dice, Fighting, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Status: A Victorian Affair
description:
In Status: A Victorian Affair, players are transported to the opulent world of Victorian high society, where they strive to achieve maximum social status. Set in 1888 London, the game challenges 1-4 players to furnish elegant homes, attend lavish events, and maneuver through the intricate social hierarchies of the era. Designed for ages 12 and up, it offers a rich, immersive experience that captures the essence of Victorian life.

Players use worker placement mechanics to take actions such as shopping for antiques, generating income, participating in auctions, and attending or hosting events. Success depends on balancing the refinement of their homes with their social engagements. The game ends when a player reaches 10 social status points.

The beautifully designed components and historically accurate artwork enhance the immersive experience, bringing the world of Victorian aristocracy to life.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Timer, Action/Event, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Income, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Block & Swipe: Canadian Sights Edition
description:
Embark on a journey and explore some of Canada's most iconic sights.

This game allows players to immerse themselves in the beauty and diversity of Canada's landscapes and landmarks. From the majestic Rocky Mountains to the stunning Niagara Falls, players will have the opportunity to discover and appreciate the country's natural and cultural treasures.

Collect pairs of cards based on iconic Canadian locations, then use Block cards to defend your stack while using Swipe cards to steal your opponents'! Be the player with the highest stack when the last card is flipped over to win!

name: It's Kind of a Fun Story: Pride Pack – Expansion Pack
description:
Extra cards for a game made by actual queer people, for actual queer people.

It’s time for coming out stories, celebrating your growth as a part of the LGBTQIA+ community, and forcing your friends to get into quick drag, for points! Add this deck to your copy of It’s Kind of a Fun Story for a Pride party that you don’t have to wait until June for.

—description from the publisher

name: It's Kind of a Fun Story: Girls Trip – Expansion Pack
description:
We’re bringing shocking truths and thrilling stories to this all-girls getaway.

Unwrap this pack of cards that skip the small talk and make your next girls’ night unforgettable (without the random dares to leave 20 eggplant emojis on a stranger’s social media account). Dish about relationships, sisterhood, and which one of your friends is just a little too into astrology.

—description from the publisher

name: It's Kind of a Fun Story: Straight To Hell – Expansion Pack
description:
Sex, lies, and a rant about that one piece of $%!& you’ve had it up to here with.

This pack filled with taboo and R-Rated cards will instantly turn your copy of It’s Kind of a Fun Story into an after-hours party. Uncover the risqué and hilarious thoughts in your friends’ heads as you reveal your own tantalizing tales.

—description from the publisher

name: Million Dollar $ix
description:
Players compete to be the richest Millionaire!

There are 52 playing cards and 10 million dollar cards in the deck. 2 rule cards one English and the other French.

Each player gets 4 playing cards to start develop your strategy to acquire the most million dollar cards in each round. When your 4 playing cards are gone you grab 4 more from the deck and keep going till all the Millions are gone.

6 rounds, 10 hands in each with battles when 2 or more players play the same highest value card. Creative bets can amp up these battles!

The million dollar cards get totaled every round and the player with the most millions at the end of the 6 rounds is the winner (The Millionaire)

This game can also be helpful for children learning monetary value.

name: Solar Tactics
description:
An introductory, print-and-play, war-game inspired by Avalon Hill classics like Tactics II and Blitzkrieg. Two players face off as the Red and Blue planet commanders in this classic surround and overwhelm style game of conquest. Simple combat resolution, random fleet activation, and thoughtful transport management combine in this beginner friendly game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Variable Phase Order, Zone of Control

name: Effortless: Hunted Expansion
description:
Shadows gather and danger prowls the land, as new Threats emerge to terrorize the realms. From sinister creatures that haunt the silent forests to dark forces that stalk the bustling cities. Even the remote hideaways and the traveling caravans are not spared from their wrath.

The Hunted Expansion adds additional scoring through the Threat system as well as the ability to play Effortless cooperatively!
At the end of each round, a threat will emerge and all players will simultaneously fight the emerging Threat. Players will earn Greatness if they are able to defeat the threat. If they go it alone, they will score even more Greatness! The new Grit Cards help with the defeat of any threat and represent a combination of bravery and expertise in dealing with Threats.

In this time of peril, unity becomes your greatest strength. Will you band together to overcome the darkness?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Effortless: Altered Expansion
description:
Magic courses through the land, altering all it touches. From Orcs on rugged peaks to Dwarves in ancient caverns. Elves beneath the canopy of age-old forests and Gnomes nestled within verdant hills. This power bestows extraordinary abilities, deep knowledge, and unparalleled skills.

The Altered Expansion introduces asymmetry to the game, providing players with unique abilities and starting attributes. Will you be an Orc Cleric or a Fairy Barbarian?

At the start of the game, each player will be dealt a Race as well as 2 Classes to choose from. Races provide players with modifiers for their attributes while Classes provide you with a unique ability.

What will you do with these gifts?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Alamo Ruleser
description:
This is a set of minimalistic rules - brief enough to fit on a ruler, whence the name - for refighting the Alamo, aimed at convention play. It is an updated version of a 1980s original.

The Mexicans try and seize the place while minimizing their losses; the Texians try to sell themselves dearly enough to turn the Mexicans' inevitable victory into a Pyrrhic one.

—user summary

name: On Air: Play Like a Deejay
description:
Party game. Play like a dee jay
The game focuses on the art of improvisation and bluffing, adding an intriguing and competitive element.
He tackles the exciting task of breaking news stories and introducing songs with skill. To be successful, it is essential to demonstrate considerable skill and dexterity, as the deception can be exposed by opponents.
Only one of the players knows in advance what this information will be and has the opportunity to make a premeditated choice. The others will have to improvise a connection only after choosing their song, when the "director" on duty will read the news or message to everyone.Once everyone has demonstrated their best improvisation skills, we will vote simultaneously on who we think actually already knew the news before choosing the song. getting points if you guess correctly or are designated as the best improviser.

name: Table Curling
description:
Table Curling is a fast-paced P&P game where you'll need to score victory points with the dexterity of your fingers.

The game lasts for 3 rounds, with the following actions:

With your finger, push the pencil towards the zone with victory points. Control your power so that the pencil stops in one of the zones with victory points and doesn’t go out the field.
If the pencil stopped in one of the zones with victory points, use this pencil to write down the number of points in the cell of the corresponding round (I, II, or III). If the pencil stops before or after the victory point zones, write 0 points in the appropriate cell.
Put the pencil on the "Start" zone and pass the turn to the next player on the left.


After all players have made their turn in the last, third round, count each player's total points for the 3 rounds.

—description from the designer

name: Mad Gardeners
description:
A garden war is on the rise and your are ready to take over the entire neighbourhood and proof yourself worthy as the Best gardener in Gardenville!

Surrounded by mad gardeners, you are determined to win the race and be the first to earn 250 gold by planting seeds, harvesting crops and selling them for the highest price at the Marketplace. Along your way you will discover that your neighbours carry a heavy bag of unpleasant tricks that can either ruin your harvest or boost their own garden - so put on your mad gardener and dive into a hectic garden brawl!

Mad Gardeners is a light strategic game that combines elements of farming with deck and engine building.

—description from the publisher

name: Lost in Adventure: The Labyrinth
description:
Lost in Adventure is a cooperative game: all players are on the same team and they win or lose together. Your goal is to fulfill all the Prophecies and complete the adventure with as many Favors as possible.

In Lost in Adventure, you will explore an unknown world together, where your every action impacts how the story unfolds. You discover the game scenery as you go, placing cards side by side, talking to characters you meet, collecting clues, and using objects wisely: Your decisions will affect the adventure and lead you to one of the possible endings.

This first adventure is called "The Labyrinth". The myth of the labyrinth has fascinated the whole world for centuries. Now you can become the hero of the story and dive into the search for the Minotaur, in an adventure that is on the edge between legend and reality.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Map Addition, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Until Proven Guilty: The Starry Sky Necklace
description:
Until Proven Guilty is a narrative cooperative game inspired by legal-drama novels, videogames, and TV series.
Players experience the story of Peter, a brilliant, yet novice lawyer, who will be suddenly involved in complicated criminal trials.
Will you be able to help Peter defend his client?
Read the charges and present irrefutable evidence to convince the jury and get to the bottom of the case.

—description from the publisher

name: Rumors of Gold: Loner
description:
Going it alone, they keep their head down and options open.

A basic difficulty variant setup and gameplay card for Rumors of Gold, where you must use all 3 dice on your turn.
categories: American West, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Escape Master
description:
Escape Master is a fast-paced real-time speed card game that blends elements from classic speed card games like Dutch Blitz and modern games with a theme and storyline. The game experience was designed for maximal fun, screams, and fierce competition.

Escape Master is set in the Vapor Isles where each player takes on the role of an Escape Leader. Each Escape Leader competes to set the most captives free from the clutches of the Doom Master while committing the fewest blunders. Too many blunders and the Doom Master discovers and destroys the only way of escape ending the game.

The basic mechanic is simple. Players play numbered cards in ascending or descending order on stacks as fast as possible in order to be the first player to play every card in their hand. Any cards left in a player's hand at the end of a round count as blunders against them. The player with the fewest blunders when the blunder breaking point is reached wins. Special cards such as traps and dead ends add a twist to the game making it more difficult for players to escape. Various card combinations and asymmetric Escape Leader abilities also add an additional level of complexity and fun to the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Japanime Tactics: Granblue Fantasy – Volume 1 Expansion
description:
Japanime Tactics: Granblue Fantasy – Volume 1 Expansion contains the acrylic standee and stat card for a random character, as well as six associated action cards.

This character can be used in a game of Japanime Tactics: Granblue Fantasy or in any Japanime Tactics title.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: The Very Hungry Caterpillar Rainbow Picnic
description:
Briarpatch's The Very Hungry Caterpillar Rainbow Picnic Game game helps young children practice color recognition, patience, gross-motor skills and vocabulary.

Draw a card and choose a colorful food item from the picnic that matches. Be the first to fill your rainbow with 6 different colored foods and win the game!

A perfect game for screen-free fun and preschool children Ages 3+. Creativity and curiosity are two key building blocks for a lifetime of learning, this game is designed not only to amuse and delight but to inspire fun, playful discovery.

—description from the publisher

name: National Parks Trivia
description: A card game with 390 questions about National Parks in the U.S.A. Includes 200 question cards, and five 10-second challenge cards. Most cards have an easy and a hard level to choose from. Question categories include Plants, Animals & Water; Geology & Astronomy; Tourism; and Cultural History. Instructions include standard rules for individual or team play plus a shorter "Weekend Getaway" mode and pub trivia rules.

name: Mint-Tin Monster Mash-Up
description:
Take on the role of 1 of 4 Mad Scientists and create your Monster Champion by smashing together 2 out of 24 fantastical creatures.

Mint-Tin Monster Mash-Up combines dice, tactics, timing, and deceit into a portable dueling game that’s easy to learn and plays in 15 minutes!

Each Monster Card in the game has a Monster front on one side and a Monster back on the other. Players will assemble a unique creature by combining a front and back. The combination will not only determine its battle stats, but also create a unique "if-then" power that can be triggered to sway the tide of battle.

Players will roll dice to determine their Attack. Energy and special powers can be used to manipulate the results.

Once the dice are locked in, players simultaneously reveal a hand signal. They can add 0-5 Attack by "Boosting" (spending Energy), or they can Defend to reduce their Damage and regain Energy equal to their intelligence, or they can hit the "Panic Button" and force both players to re-roll. BUT, if a player Defends against a Panic Button, they auto-kill their opponent's creature.

The loser of the battle takes damage equal to the Arena level plus any special attack damage. The Arena gets increasingly deadly until a battle is resolved. When a Monster is killed, the player's Mad Scientist flips over to their more powerful form, giving them an advantage in the next Battle.

The first player to kill 3 of their opponent's Monsters wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dice Clash
description:
Take on the role of 1 of 6 Women Warriors battling for their chance at immortality.

Dice Clash simulates the back and forth of a battle using a clever dice placement system that is simple to learn but offers tactical depth.

Players get unique Warriors with their own 9 space Battle Grids, 6 Black Dice, 2 White Dice, and a Red Die. The Dice form their Die Pool.

Turns consist of playing a single die from your die pool to one of the open spaces on your Battle Grid. The value of the die interacts with the space you play to determines the attack and defense value of your die. Players must defend with a value higher than their opponent's attack. But attacks of 6 or greater can be parried with a Defense of 1.

Playing white dice allows you to re-roll your remaining die pool. Your red die activates your unique Warrior power.

Play continues until a player loses because they can't respond to an attack. The loser flips their warrior and their grid to their damaged side where they have more powerful options for the next round. Play continues until one Warrior wins 2 Battles.

Dice Clash was inspired by and re-implements the dice placement system in Scuttleball by Crossbow Games (Jonathan and Ryan). Art is by Super Snipers artist, Hwa Siang.

—description frpm the publisher
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sugarpow: Night of the Nomstrosities
description:
Night of the Nomstrosities is a Co-Op mini expansion for Sugarpow: Dice Battle Royale. Draft your candy fighters from the main game and work together to defeat the big boss bad guys, the Nomstrosities!

—description from the publisher

name: Ludoteca Disney: 101 Dálmatas
description:
Cruella de Vil and her infamous henchmen, Horace and Jasper, have kidnapped all the dalmatians in London! To make the search for the adorable puppies even more difficult, Cruella decided to hide them in various locations across the city's neighborhoods. Kicking off the rescue mission, a team of fearless investigators has been assembled, and each volunteer must search two neighborhoods in the city. The one who finds all 101 Dalmatians will be the great hero of this story!

In 101 Dalmatians, you control two groups of 5 cards called neighborhoods. The neighborhoods are positioned on the table between the players, so each player has one neighborhood to their left and another to their right. On your turn, you decide whether to replace one of the cards in one of the neighborhoods beside you, perform the action of one of the cards in your hand, or discard a card. Throughout the game, the cards in the neighborhoods will be revealed or replaced, so that at some point, all the cards in a neighborhood are revealed. The game ends at the end of the turn in which all the cards in both neighborhoods controlled by a player are revealed. All still hidden cards are revealed, and the values of each neighborhood are summed. Your goal is to sum up 101 dalmatians with all 10 cards from the two neighborhoods beside you. If no one sums 101 Dalmatians, the winner will be the one who sums the most puppies without exceeding the total of 101.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ludoteca Disney: Branca de Neve
description:
After a day's work in the mine, nothing is more fair for the seven dwarfs than a lively party with their friend Snow White. However, there's a small problem: each participant has a different musical taste! Debating between lively or soft melodies, they can't agree on the ideal songs for the party. Your mission is to help these adorable characters compose the perfect songs for their celebration!

Snow White is a cooperative game where players must compose the party's songs at the seven dwarfs' house. On your turn, each player must choose an Instrument Card from their hand and play it in the area below any of the Characters in play. Each Character's music has a Melody rule that must be respected for an Instrument Card to be in it. To win, it's necessary to complete the songs of all Characters.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ludoteca Disney: Rei Leão
description:
In the Lands of the Kingdom, the legacy of the Lion King is threatened by Scar's betrayal and his alliance with the hyenas. Simba, Nala, Timon, and Pumbaa must gather their friends to restore peace. The bonds of friendship and the courage to face dangers are the key to gathering the necessary forces. The fate of the Kingdom Lands lies in the paws of these unlikely heroes as they confront the shadow of betrayal and fight to preserve the eternal cycle of life.

In Ludoteca Disney - Rei Leão, on your turn you must play a card from your hand to capture a card from the table. You must form with the captured cards a collection of allies and opponents to score at the end of the game. The player who scores the most points with their collection will save the Kingdom Lands and be the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Captivate
description:
Captivate is a fast-paced tabletop card game of strategy, skill, and memory for 2-4 players.

Flip over cards and capture them to score points, but watch out - your opponents have plans of their own!

Captivate is quick to learn, even for a large group, but difficult to master. There are many features to keep you and your friends playing over and over again.

Who will come out on top?

Combine multiple decks for exciting team battles, and to increase the number of players to 5+

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Number, Puzzle
mechanics: Hand Management, Layering, Matching, Memory, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Pieces as Map, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Static Capture, Tile Placement

name: Heritage Farms
description:
This is a Mint Tin Game based off of the classic riddle of the farmer who needs to get his Chicken, Fox, and Corn across the river with only space for one in the boat at a time. If you leave the Chicken and Fox alone, the Chicken will get eaten. If you leave the Chicken alone with the Corn, the Corn will get eaten. The twist in this game is that you can stick the other player watching over your resources along with theirs. Players compete to be the first to get 2 sets of Chicken, Fox, Corn across the river!

On your turn, you may load 1 Farmer and 1 Good into your boat to move across the river. If this leaves the card without any Farmers (your's or your opponent's), "Nature's Law" takes place: Foxes eat Chickens there, and Chickens eat Corn there. If a player loses 3 of their goods, they lose immediately.

When delivering your Farmer to the Market, you reveal the Market Bonus there. You collect it when your Farmer leaves that card. Market Bonuses provide powerful one-time abilities like moving your opponent's boat, allow you to place 2 Farmers on a card, move a good up or down a card, or move a Farmer up or down a card.

The first player to get 2 sets of Chicken, Fox, and Corn to their Markets wins.

Advanced Mode adds Zombie Chickens and Poisoned Corn! These new good types "infect" other goods as they move and change the rules of "Nature's Law". Zombie Chickens eat Foxes when left alone, and Poisoned Corn kills Chickens.

The Solo Mode of the game places you in the challenging position of helping your incompetent cousin, Elmer, while still trying to get your goods across the river. In this mode, you lose if either you OR Elmer lose 3 goods, or if Elmer gets his goods across first.

—description from the designer

name: Verdant Arizona
description:
A 1-2 player Mint Tin game that has you competing to collect cacti and organize them in your cactus garden. The fun of this cut-throat puzzley game is the card selection mechanism which not only sets you up fro the card you want, but determines which cards are in reach for your opponent.

—description from the publisher

name: Dessert Wars Card Game
description:
In Dessert Wars, the stakes are high as you battle for sweet supremacy! Your mission: collect the most glowing reviews for your dessert store. But watch out, your competitors are aiming for the same glory. Sabotage their efforts with scathing negative reviews and amplify the damage using powerful marketing cards.

Each player runs their own dessert store, taking one action and drawing one card per turn. The game ends when the deck is exhausted or a player gathers three sets of stellar reviews. (A set is four cards).

Fight fiercely, strategize cunningly, and ensure your dessert store reigns supreme in Dessert Wars!

—description from the designer

name: Fantasy Map Maker: The Continent
description:
Create a large fantasy map by combining four regional maps made using the Fantasy Map Maker system.

Highlights include:

Main Quests to pursue across all four maps
the continuation of features from one map to the next
a new Landmark: the Port, which allows possible corrections and improvements to a previously completed game sheet
a modified Feature Wheel


—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Events, Line Drawing, Map Addition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement

name: Черепашки-ниндзя: Цитадель Шреддера (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder's Citadel)
description:
The construction of an interplanetary ship has been completed in the cellars of the Shredder's citadel. Now Shredder intends to leave Earth and destroy the civilization of the utroms. Leonardo, Raphael, Michelangelo and Donatello must break through the ninja army of the Foot clan and stop their most important enemy.

Shredder's Citadel is a cooperative board game in which participants play together against the playing field. The Oroku Saki estate is attacked by all four turtles, the players divide them among themselves. The role of the fifth player is reduced to preparing the field and throwing dice for enemies, so it is optimal to sit down at the game together (players have two characters) or four (each has its own character).

The playing field is a section of the Oroku Saki citadel. After landing in the Shredder's chambers on the top floor, the turtles must make their way through two tiers of rooms to the basement, find the launch pad and defeat the villain. This should be done in 10 moves while the starship's engine is warming up. At the beginning of the game, 9 rooms of the citadel are randomly laid out on the playing field: the turtles do not know what awaits them in a particular room until they go inside.

The hero can spend his turn on rest (to restore his health to the maximum), or to move to the next room of the citadel. If this room has not yet been explored by the turtles, its card is turned upside down, where the enemies located here are listed. There are three types of them in the game: ninjas, elite ninjas and combat robots; as well as four "bosses" led by Shredder. The "bosses" are unique and each sit in their own basement room, and the number of ordinary enemies of each type in the room is determined by a roll of dice. Thus, 3-4 opponents and a crowd of 15-20 heads can meet you in the room. All of them will have to be defeated — either alone, or by calling for help from brothers from neighboring rooms. The combat mechanics are quite simple and elegant, although based on the same hexagon rolls. The cycle repeats until the turtles defeat Shredder, are themselves defeated by his servants, or until Shredder escapes the green hands of justice.

There is only one strategy in the game: first, make your way straight down to the basement (fortunately, the enemies along the way are mostly frivolous), then explore it, hoping for luck — with bad throws, even a couple of basement rooms may not be able to clear the enemy from the enemy. April should be sent to one of the rooms, and the support of Splinter and Casey Jones should be saved until the final battle. It is not recommended to get carried away with searching for equipment on the upper floors: you will lose time and effort, but there is little sense from technology.

Present:

Don, Raf, Leo and Mikey;
The randomness factor;
Hordes of enemies.

Missing:

Strategic diversity;
Krang;
Bebop and Rocksteady.

name: TTMC: Tu te mets combien? – Musique
description:
The goal of the game is to be the first to travel the board by answering the questions asked.

The originality lies on the principle of self-assessment of your knowledge from 1 to 10 on a multitude of subjects. Simple things!

A question corresponds to each note, with varying difficulty.
In case of a good answer the team will advance by the number of squares corresponding to its self-assessed score.
In case of wrong answer, the team will remain on the same square until the next turn.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Coco Candy
description:
Collect as many treats as possible, respecting the mixtures requested!

You have to collect the cards one by one, following
the instructions.
There are 8 different objects on the front side; and on the back side, a green zone and a red zone. Players must find cards on which the objects in the «green» zone appear AND where the objects in the «red» zone are absent.
A game of observation and speed.

name: Deep River
description:
Guide salmon or eels across the river and lure the hungry Bear into your rival's territory to win the game.
Turn after turn, engage your fish in the river by cleverly placing them on the tiles, the effect of which will make the bear advance towards the opposing territory. Be patient and skillful to place your fish in the best locations.

name: Golden Creek
description:
Discover the plans of your adversaries to raise the biggest loot!

Off the coast of an archipelago of three islands, legend tells that a royal ship was shipwrecked. Your crew of pirates are out to collect the most precious treasures, brought in turn after turn by the tide. You're not alone in this area, and you'll need intuition and perspicacity to foil your opponents' traps.

Players take on the role of a pirate and are provided with cards representing a pirate ship or an explorer ship. Players face three islands on which treasures accumulate.
The pirates play simultaneously. At each turn of the game:
Each player secretly chooses the island they will approach, either on an expedition to recover the treasure, or on an attack to plunder the enemy boat.
Then the players reveal their card and apply the actions defined in the rule, winning or not the loot present on the Island.
The one who brings back the most treasures at the end of the game wins.

name: Cyberflesh
description:
Neither maps nor names exist for this place. They tried to revive technology, but failed. Their harmony, today, is the measure of that failure. Everything dies, and dies anew, in a loop infected by the germ of iteration. Creatures are born, whose only purpose being to be crushed, torn, mangled.
Endlessly. Again and again.
With neither end nor beginning.

In this dungeon crawler with roguelike elements, players will navigate through the Stomach Prison maze trying to find two sirens which, once activated, will open the gate for the freedom. Each turn the players will reveal a maze tile and face what it hides which may be loot (draw from a deck), mutations (draw from another deck), monsters (up to five per tile, spawned through the roll of a die and then draw from a dedicated deck of cards), sirens or events. In the last two cases players will be instructed to read a dedicated paragraph on an event booklet and, sometimes, will be give choices to take tests to attempt. On the other hand, ringing sirens will summon a sub-boss players will have to defeat.
The combat system is based on the "D8-entropy system", in which every attack (both from players and from enemies) is resolved by a modified d8 roll with 8 representing a critical hit and 1 always a miss (modifiers applied due to player and weapons characteristics, mutations or altered status): if the modified result is 8 or more the attack is successful and damage is dealt.
But be careful. Even defeating the last boss won't be enough to grant your freedom, since only one player will be able to escape...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: GRIMLORE: Profane Truths
description: GRIMLORE Profane Truths is an episodical print-and-play word-finding and dice-manipulation game with role-playing aspects. In every episode (or case file), you try to fill several scenarios with letters to form dictionary words to progress in the story and to defeat your opponents. As you progress, the character that you represent gains more knowledge and equipment to help them in their case.
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Spelling

name: Mythic Menu
description:
Players take on the role of a fantasy chef from the Kingdom of Culnaria. Each round, they must combine their current hand of bizarre ingredients into a dish that they feel will meet The Judge's exact specifications. Using dry-erase markers, players can predict each dish's flavor strength, note secret ingredients, and name their newest concoction. Only the best meals will win The Judge's favor and earn the champion a Victory Star rating.

—description from the designer

name: Thanksgiving: John Carver's Carving Board Game
description: In this game based on Eli Roth's hit film, players start by attending an in-store Black Friday sale that gets way out of hand, with people dying in horrific ways in every aisle! But things go from bad to worse because a killer wearing a John Carver mask is also on the loose murdering the townsfolk in droves! Unlike the movie, you are rewarded for dying... A LOT! The player who dies the most is revealed to be John Carver, triggering a final battle between the rest of the players and Carver!

name: Deux Années de Gloire: Two Years of Glory
description:
This installment of the Jours de Gloire series revisits four battles from Napoléon's 1806 Prussian campaign and his 1807 Polish campaign, namely the battles of Iena (Jena), Auerstadt, Eylau and Friedland.

This compilation will feature significant revisions of their original iterations as published by Canons en Carton and in Vae Victis magazine.

The four-game package is expected to contain 4 revised maps, 648 colourful counters as well as rules, scenarios and playaids in both French and English.

To date over 40 Napoléonic battles have been recreated using the Jours de Gloire series rules.

name: Spirit Tamer TCG
description:
Trading card game based on the upcoming Spirit Tamer web game. Train up your Spirits so they learn new abilities, and take out the opposing Tamer (player).

Players start with Basic Spirits and train (upgrade) them for battle! Use Invoke and Sprite cards to teach them new attacks and abilities, support them with Action and Item cards.

Attack the opposing Tamer while defending yourself from the opponent's attacks. The first Tamer to get their opponent's life to zero wins!

—description from the designer

name: A Cure For What Ails You
description:
Choose one of four asymmetric roles (Voodoo Mambo, Hoodoo Root Doctor, Pharmacist, or Charlatan) and work to treat patients made ill by The Haze. Collect the cards the patients need, then roll to see if they survive the treatment. If they do, gain the rewards shown which can be used for role abilities (better healing chances, increased rewards, substitutions, etc.) or converted to Victory Points at the end of the game.

If the players outlast The Haze by curing enough patients, they then compare scores to see who was the best healer; if too many patients die, the game ends early and everyone loses.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Market, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Re-rolling and Locking, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Deadly Secrets
description:
Players will step into the quiet town of Whispering Pines to solve the cold case of Christine Black's murder. There are over 50 pieces of evidence, including police records, newspaper clippings, autopsy reports, interrogations, witness statements, security camera photos, handwritten letters, and more. Player's mission is to examine these clues, tackle four assignments, and finally solve Christine’s mysterious murder.

Each assignment players solve paves the way for a fresh set of clues. As players progress, new envelopes packed with evidence will become available to aid players in diving deeper into the mystery. The stakes get higher with every revelation and culminating when players solve the case and expose the murderer.

name: Cache Quest
description:
Get ready for a super fun board game where you become a geocaching expert. Move your character, solve cool challenges, and discover hidden treasures! Can you collect the most caches and become the champion?

Cache Quest is easy to learn, full of surprises, and perfect for players aged 7 and up.

name: Buried
description:
The legend tells that in this desert, there are mysterious and valuable artifacts. So you will venture into it to achieve the greatest wealth for your people, but you must arrive to your campsite... alive.

Buried is a solitaire game, where the player must dig for precious artifacts and sell them for money (points) or water (action points) and arrive to the end of the path to score!

On your turn you must do 1 Action and then the Desert will take a turn. This will continue until the game ends.

Actions:

Excavate: Choose 1 Artifact Card and take it to your bag, all the adjacent Cards of the same type are added to the bag as well.
Exchange: Choose 2 Artifact Cards on the Desert and swap them.
Advance: Move your Caravan 1 step closer to the Campsite by paying the cost shown on the limit you passed.
Sell: Choose 1 Bag to sell their contents and get as many Water or Coin as their value, but never both!
Overexplot: Pay the the water shown on the sun marker, to have an extra turn!


After you take an action the Desert would refill or slide the artifacts on the board! So the Desert will change every turn!

The game will end in these scenarios:

You reached the campsite! Congrats you brought richness to your people
The cards run out! The campsite is gone and you went left alone in the Desert!
You run out of water and got stuck! You perish of thirst in the immense Desert.


Would you come back home as a hero? Or you will lose yourself by your greed?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Slide/Push, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Europa Universalis: Flavor Pack 1 – Britannia
description: The Flavor Pack #1 contains 9 new Britain and Ireland-themed Events, with 5 of them being alternative Events for England, and 4 of them being generic Events that brings more life to this region of the map.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: HavenwoodZ
description: HavenwoodZ(HWZ) is a story-driven, hand held, choose-your-own adventure game situated in the Town of Havenwood. You will need to survive, complete tasks and avoid getting infected until help arrives.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Print & Play, Zombies

name: A Midsummer Night's Fayre
description:
A fayre has come to town, and all are welcome to enter and partake of its games — but note that this is no ordinary fayre as it is run by elves and fairies.

In A Midsummer Night's Fayre, you play ten mini games, choosing dice to try to achieve the individual victory conditions of those games. Use fairy mischief cards to change the dice...and the outcome of the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Hold Your Ground
description:
A mysterious island has risen from the sea once again, and it's time to battle for control of this chaotic land.

In Hold Your Ground, you use a personal deck of cards to move your battlers to try to gain control of tiles and push your opponents out — but tiles can randomly explode, scattering any battlers onto the surrounding tiles. Eventually only one tile will remain, and only one team will be declared the victor.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Command Cards, Grid Movement

name: Chronicles of the Stellar Drive Empire: Voidpilot's Legacy
description:
Chronicles of the Stellar Drive Empire: Voidpilot's Legacy is a solitaire science fiction tabletop game where players command their ship and lead their crew through dangerous missions and exciting combat to earn their legacy!

Voidpilot's Legacy is a resource management and engine building tabletop game using cards, dice, and markers. Players win by surviving 8 runs through their included Event deck, after which they tally up their Legacy Points to determine how they did. Future playthroughs use the Legacy Points to grant boons.

Players lose the game when their ship is destroyed (their ship's hit points is reduced to zero), they lose all of their crew members, or they run out of fuel.

Throughout the game, players participate in various Events, including exciting combat with adversaries that scale in difficulty as the game progresses, salvage and mining missions to collect resources to spend on ship upgrades to become more powerful, and exploration where players can find and develop new colonies. Players can also choose to upgrade these events, increasing later difficulty and potential rewards.

Using a thematic Heroism mechanic, the player can choose to take ship damage or sacrifice crew members at critical moments to increase their chances of success during their missions! Balancing hull, crew, and risk is critical to winning the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Market, Re-rolling and Locking, Resource Queue, Resource to Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: A Bunch of Fun Guys
description:
In the mycological bidding game A Bunch of Fun Guys, players use foraging cards to collect mushroom cards to fulfill recipes. Do you want to get only one mushroom but have first pick of the choicest truffles? Or are you willing to take whatever is leftover for a chance at three mushrooms — or even four? Some mushrooms will let you take special actions when you collect them. Complete the most recipes to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Contracts, Selection Order Bid

name: Bonsai: Wabi Sabi
description:
Wabi-sabi is a Japanese aesthetic that celebrates the imperfection of things.
When applied to bonsai, the viewer is encouraged to watch with their heart instead of their eyes, to understand the beauty of their constant changing.

This expansion for Bonsai contains 5 modules that can be combined together or used separately:

New Shitakusa Tiles that double the score of Goal tiles;
New Goal tiles;
New content for the 5th player;
New type of Zen cards, for even more choices;
New solo challenges.


—description from the publihser
mechanics: Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Moon Death + Dragons
description:
Moon, Death + Dragons is the ultimate dice collection, bursting with four fantastical games
Each games is suitable for between 2 to 6 players, with more players the better! Each player starts with 20 gold pieces and through a mix of skill, gambling and the luck of the dice, play continues until one player lose all of their gold or the winner takes it all.

All games have endless replay-ability and are perfect for game nights filled with laughter and fun.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: DC Super-Skill Pinball: Harley Quinn Ball
description:
DC Super-Skill Pinball: Harley Quinn Ball brings the excitement of pinball arcades to your table, with no reflexes required!

Join the infamous Harley Quinn as you hit bumpers, drop targets, gain skill shots, activate the multiball, and play minigames on the backglass! About to lose a ball? You can even "nudge" the table — but be careful not to tilt. Challenge your friends, or play solo to try to beat your high score! The game features four tables inspired by iconic moments and team-ups in Harley's history!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bingo, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Aliens vs Humans
description:
Exciting new game that combines strategy and dexterity, offering an unparalleled gaming experience for all skill levels.

How to Play:

Sides Selection: Players roll a die to determine their faction.

Deck Distribution: Each player shuffles their deck and draws three cards.

Gameplay: Players take turns placing cards, attacking with tokens, and drawing new cards. Humans start the game.

Winning Conditions: Humans win by hacking the alien mothership, while aliens win by landing three spaceships on Earth.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Dexterity, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: Star Trek: Star Realms
description:
Star Trek: Star Realms is a complete star ship combat deck-building game for 2-4 players. Build your fleet! Romulan, Klingon, Dominion, and Federation ships are yours to command. Play head-to-head or up to four players in multiplayer modes that offer versus and cooperative experiences.

In Star Trek: Star Realms, you start with a Personal Deck of cards representing your armada. On your turn you will play cards from your hand to gain Trade, Combat, Authority, and other effects.

Trade is used to buy ship and Location cards.

Combat is used to attack your opponent and their Locations.

Authority is your score.

The first player to reduce their opponent’s Authority to zero wins the game!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase

name: Dead Reckoning: Port of Call
description:
Command new ships and crew, use fearsome firepower, and gain glory with new achievements in Port of Call!

Port of Call is an expansion for every Dead Reckoning player, providing greater variety and additional paths to victory for experienced players, and only a few simple rules for newer players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Pirates, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Layering, Modular Board

name: Risiko Oceano
description: A new edition with two game modes to challenge you head-to-head or make your game of Risk more exciting! New and adrenaline-filled strategies, new scenarios and worlds to explore: get ready for even more fun challenges with your friends!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Dead Reckoning: Sea Dogs Expansion 3
description:
Sea Dogs from the Port of Call campaign.

This is the 3rd expansion of the “Sea Dogs” module, to be played with the Port of Call expansion. To use it, shuffle these 12 New Sea Dog Illustration cards into your existing Sea Dogs deck.

If you are not playing with the Port of Call expansion, remove the Commander, Old Salt, Blue Jackets, Chief Officer, and Quartermaster–these Sea Dogs all use mechanics from from Port of Call.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Layering, Modular Board

name: Fashion Police
description:
A revised edition of “The Fashion Game” produced in early 2023 in Japan, Fashion Police has players put on the badge to judge the fashion sense of the others at the table, identifying who dressed for which occasion. But being a critique isn’t enough! At the same time, you must design your outfit for your occasion. Did you dress for the Stone Age in the latest fast fashion treads? Clad head to toe in faux fur for the beach? Don’t get caught failing to dress for the occasion!

Fashion Police is a party game that offers three game modes (including both competitive and cooperative play). Regardless of which ruleset you choose, players are first given a theme/occasion (60 unique ones including tacky tourist, apocalypse, Monday at the office, too young for your age, etc.) for which they need to design an outfit. Players then place, layer, combine, rotate, flip, etc. their randomly drawn pattern cards (60 unique options) under clothing templates to create their look—creativity knows no bounds! Players finally guess who dressed for which occasion to score points.

Adopting the mechanics of popular word-based party games, Fashion Police creates lively, organic discussions over player answers and designs without the exclusivity some of these language-dependent games have. Laugh as you learn just how much you (don’t) get fashion in this easy-to-learn game for all ages and groups!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Lone Wolves
description:
Players assume the leaders of wolfpacks in Lone Wolves, vying over regions to become the Alpha. To assert your dominance and ensure victory, dispatch wolves to territories. The stronger wolf wins and thus strengthens your pack’s position; but despite gaining a scar from the battle and becoming a lone wolf, the weaker learns from the experience, improving your pack’s status for the next encounter. In your struggle, know when to bare your teeth, but also when to go it alone.

Lone Wolves is a two-player dueling game with trick-taking and area majority elements that is played over thirteen rounds (tricks). Players start with thirteen cards, and each trick consists of players playing a single wolf card, of which there are five suits each with cards 2–7 (thirty cards). The cards, however, are played into one of five territories of your choosing, each awarding points to the player that controls it at the end of the game. The value of the card represents the strength dispatched to that territory. The winner of the trick’s card remains faceup and then flips the wolf of the other player to its lone wolf side (strength of 1); whereas the loser gains a scar token with an effect (i.e., awarding points for specific cards played into territories, altering strength values, affecting points awarded in territories, etc.) that can be placed in a territory.

Distinguishing itself from most trick-taking games, however, the trump suit in Lone Wolves is dynamic, shifting as the game progresses! Once all scar tokens have been obtained from one territory, the corresponding becomes trump; and once it happens a second time, the trump suit changes yet again. The push and pull of knowing when to take or strategically lose the trick means that there are no weak hands, just weak leaders!

—description from the publisher

name: Okinawa: The Last Battle of World War II
description:
You’re on the island of Okinawa, and this is the last battle of World War II. The fighting is intense; the casualties are high. And now it’s up to you to lead your soldiers to victory using dice to activate and upgrade actions on your rondel as you capture objectives, defeat the Japanese army, and save the day!

Each game consists of four objectives that you must survive and capture before time runs out. On your turn, you'll spend dice to move to and activate different action cards to deal damage, find enemies, heal, etc. Knowing when to push forward into hostile territory and upgrading the right cards at the right time will turn the tide in this famous final battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Rondel, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tricorn and Bonnet
description: Miniature wargames rules for refighting the battles of the Jacobite Rebellions from 1689-1746. It is designed to be played on a gridded board with model soldiers with two or more players.

name: Circle of Blood: Rivals
description:
The mysterious city of Gormalak is living dangeoruos days. Hundreds of beasts and nightmare creatures emerge from its depths, and no one is safe.

Take a deck and explore the Black City, wield your influence, and fight for supremacy in the city. Each card represents one of the many troops, characters, equipment, spells, locations, and abilities you can use to achieve victory.

Circle of Blood: Rivals uses a gameplay system based on simple and easy-to-learn concepts that can be grasped in a single game. As players explore the game's possibilities, they will find that its simplicity gives way to a depth of mechanics that is both interesting and challenging.

The goal of the game is to earn more Renown Points than your rivals, with the winner being the first player to reach 25 or more points. Renown Points can be earned by attacking the Locations of rival players or by ensuring that they have no Locations in play.

Circle of Blood: Rivals is a project based on a setting with years of work in concept design and world-building. This card collection is conceived thanks to the AI technology developed by the team at Midjourney, combined with the digital art expertise of Miguel Ángel Lozano, one of its designers.

Each illustration has been guided, selected, and meticulously edited by real people. The firm intention of the studio behind this game is to expand the human team of artists and designers working on the project, but for that, we need your help at this beginning stage.

—description from the publisher

name: Tapple: After Dark
description: Tapple: After Dark is an adults[only version of the party game Tapple, in which players are given a topic and challenged to name a word that fits that topic. You have only ten seconds to give an answer, and once you do, the starting letter of that answer is now out of play for everyone until the end of the round.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Dinostone Duel: Deep Blue
description:
Standalone expansion for Dinostone.

Adds more cards and introduces 2 new abilities - Freeze & Trident
Also adds new concept of each player having "stamina" (life bar for direct hit attacks)

Cards for Solo play are also included in this expansion
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Move Through Deck, Rondel

name: Talisman: Alliances – Fate Beckons
description:
As you might be able to guess from the name, this expansion introduces COOPERATIVE PLAY to the Talisman world for the first time. When the fate of the world is threatened, your enemies become allies – you must band together in alliance as you play your favorite fantasy adventure game in an entirely new way. Do you have what it takes to win – or fail – as one?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mariestad Klimatspelet
description:
The Mariestad Klimatspelet ("Mariestad climate game") is a strategic board game about creating a sustainable city. The players take the roll of an actor in the city and play project cards to make the city climate neutral.

Build green energy, reduce car traffic and expand green areas. But make sure you have the necessary money, contacts and research needed to make all of the projects work.

The climate game shows how we can build sustainably, while highlighting many of the challenges that we face along the way. The game has over 100 project cards based on real life concepts and ideas.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Tags, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Chronicles of Paldon
description:
In the once-prosperous city of Paldon, a catastrophic event caused by scientist Tobern Macquer Shadowstahl’s experiment with time-altering technology shattered the city's advanced machinery and erased valuable knowledge. Now factions of intellectuals and politicians debate the risks and benefits of restoring the city's technology. Amongst political conflicts, engineers and scientists secretly navigate alliances and forbidden knowledge to restore the marvellous machines of Paldon.

The game

Following the catastrophic event, the fate of Paldon is in your hands. Explore forgotten knowledge and dispatch your assistants to gather resources. Choose your sympathies; aligning with factions can yield valuable rewards. Master the art of machinecrafting. Become the most renowned inventor and restore Paldon´s advanced technology.

In Chronicles of Paldon, each player will act as an inventor with a workshop of their own somewhere in the Paldon city. The task is to repair the city’s marvellous machinery which because of the catastrophe has now malfunctioned. To do this you gather resources, relearn lost knowledge and try to accomplish the remaking. You will be allied with factions that will supply you with useful assistants. But take care, other factions and inventors are not friendly and might try to sabotage your work or rob your assistants.

The player who builds up most reputation will be the winner of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Trading

name: like i like my
description:
In this party game, you'll compete to find something you can say about two wildly different things.


A judge draws a tame card and a wild card and reads them both out loud.
Everyone else has 90 seconds to come up with something that makes sense for both things.
Funniest Response gets a point. First to reach 10 points wins.

name: Casa Fantasma
description:
We were invited to a magical house. Late at night while we are sleeping, a playful ghost and a mischievous cat enter the house and start creating a disorder.
Will you be able to see all the mess they made before everyone else?
In this game someone will play as the Ghost or the Cat, who will move over the cards that make up the house, while the rest have their eyes closed. Then a card will be turned over, and after 10 seconds the others will open their eyes to try to find out which card was turned over as quickly as possible.
Combine your memory and speed to win!

—description from the designer (translated)

Nos invitaron a una casa mágica. Bien avanzada la noche mientras dormimos, un fantasma juguetón y un gato travieso entran a la casa y empiezan a desordenarla.
¿Podrás ver antes que el resto todo el lío que hicieron?
En este juego alguien jugará como el Fantasma o el Gato, que irán moviéndose sobre las cartas que forman la casa, mientras el resto tiene los ojos cerrados. Luego volteará una carta, y pasados 10 segundos abrirán los ojos los demás para tratar de encontrar lo más rápido posible que carta se volteó.
¡Combina tu memoria y velocidad para ganar!

—description from the designer
publishers: Factor Estudios, GG Juegos de Mesa

name: Mythos: The Card Game
description:
Mythos is a competitive strategy card game for 2-4 players, where you build an army of gods, goddesses, and various mythical entities to battle against your opponent(s), gathering essence to power up to victory.

Each turn, you have the opportunity to draw cards into your hand, play cards into your party, and attack/use the abilities of your party. Some actions generate you essence, and gaining 20 essence is all you need to win the game!

Mythos has a heavy emphasis on emergent strategy and creating synergies. Curse opponents with the semi-demons Rakshasas, and then bring them crumbling down using a mighty earthquake with Geb. Grant your opponents ultimate misfortune by summoning the mischievous Yokai, Tengu, then feast on their remains with the ferocious Kali.

With over 100 cards to play with, there is truly no limit to the creativity and strategy you can express in this game!

—description from the designer

name: Foundations of Rome (Maximus Edition)
description:
The city-building board game Foundations of Rome puts you into the role of an architect competing to own land and build magnificent structures! Build domūs and insulae, fountains, foundries, and more to increase your renown - gaining glory for yourself and the empire! With 96 wonderfully detailed miniatures in the base game, Foundations of Rome is a testament to the glory of Rome that you can bring to the table.

Foundations of Rome is the next, and biggest game to date, in the Dice Tower Essentials line and is designed by famed designer Emerson Matsuuchi.

On a player's turn they select from purchasing a new lot, building a new building in the shared city of Rome, or collecting income!

Players collect Glory Points at the end of each round based on the population and commerce they have brought to the city as well as gaining glory for civic buildings that score not only based on their own buildings, but those of their opponents!

With a quick setup time and easy to learn to rules you will be on your way to achieving glory within Rome in no time!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Dutch, Income, Market, Ownership, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: IADS: The Game
description:
IADS: The Game is a table-top air war strategy game. It's an abstraction, but the terminology, general capabilities, and weapon system roles are analogous to some used in real world air defense.

An Integrated Air Defense System (IADS) is an arrangement of weapons used to defend airspace.

DRAFT weapon system unit cards,
