DEPLOY them across the table, and engage in

COMBAT to defend your airspace and dismantle enemy IADS!

—description form the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Dice, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Closed Drafting, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Memory, Modular Board, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Ordering, Score-and-Reset Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Foundations of Rome (Emperor Edition)
description:
The city-building board game Foundations of Rome puts you into the role of an architect competing to own land and build magnificent structures! Build domūs and insulae, fountains, foundries, and more to increase your renown - gaining glory for yourself and the empire! With 96 wonderfully detailed miniatures in the base game, Foundations of Rome is a testament to the glory of Rome that you can bring to the table.

Foundations of Rome is the next, and biggest game to date, in the Dice Tower Essentials line and is designed by famed designer Emerson Matsuuchi.

On a player's turn they select from purchasing a new lot, building a new building in the shared city of Rome, or collecting income!

Players collect Glory Points at the end of each round based on the population and commerce they have brought to the city as well as gaining glory for civic buildings that score not only based on their own buildings, but those of their opponents!

With a quick setup time and easy to learn to rules you will be on your way to achieving glory within Rome in no time!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Dutch, Income, Market, Ownership, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: The Organ Harvester
description:
March 5, 2024, on the streets of New York City, a scent of fear hangs heavy in the air. In the last few days, a dark and sinister pattern has emerged – three lifeless bodies, each bearing the signature of a twisted predator, have been found in the dimly lit alleys of the city. The bodies of the victims, all seemingly healthy people, are covered with cruel cuts while missing organs. With New Yorkers afraid to step out at night from uncertainty and fear of becoming prey to this new serial killer, named publicly as “The Organ Harvester”, you step forward as their last line of defense. Armed with determination and a need for answers, you enter as the lead investigator to find the perpetrator before they claim their next life. The hunt for The Organ Harvester has begun.

—description from the publisher

name: Terraforming Mars: Supermarkets Promo Card
description:
Summer Season Promo 2024 of FryxGames, which you can buy on its own, or get for free if you order something at their webstore during Summer 2024.

Requires 2 city tiles in play. Increase your M€ production 2 steps.
Promo card X68.
categories: Economic, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Подземелья и пёсики (Dungeons and Dogs)
description:
Welcome to the dungeon escape competition! Our brave good boys and girls have to go down into very deep chambers (we don't know who dug them) and fight back against scary monsters! But our participants are not ordinary dogs, but real adventurers. Which of them will collect the most goodies and be the first to leave the dark dungeon?

In this game you will participate in a fantasy competition. Each round you place room cards to build a dungeon filled with monsters and treasure.

The goal of each player is to build the most lucrative way out of the dungeon and escape through it while collecting coins and defeating monsters. The player that collects the most gold coins after three rounds wins — one can find gold coins laying around the dungeon or earn them by completing quests and beating monsters.
mechanics: Map Addition, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Northgard: Uncharted Horizons
description:
Northgard: Uncharted Horizons is the first expansion for Northgard: Uncharted Lands, a game of conquest and exploration set in the age of vikings.

This expansion adds a new dimension to the Northgard: Uncharted Lands gaming experience, with :


New game modules that players can choose whether or not to use in their game, for greater replayability and new strategies,
A single-player mode, widely requested by the community,
New clans, giving players a wider choice of asymmetrical abilities to integrate into their strategy,
New creatures to give players a hard time,
And much, much more!


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Territory Building, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Ninja Slayer Trading Card Game
description:
Ninja Slayer Trading Card Game is a two-player competitive trading card game in which anyone can easily build a deck.
Enjoy playing in Blitz Shield matches, where each player prepares five packs, or Constructed matches, where players collect their favorite cards and build a deck.
The match starts with the first player's turn, and your turns and your opponent's turns alternate until the winner is decided. The first player to deal 10 points of damage to the opponent wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

ニンジャスレイヤー TRADING CARD GAME（以下、ニンジャスレイヤーTCG）とは、誰でも簡単にデッキが組める、2人用対戦型トレーディングカードゲームです。
プレイヤーがそれぞれ5パックを用意して遊ぶブリッツシールド戦や、好きなカードを集めてデッキを作って遊ぶコンストラクテッド戦で対戦を楽しみましょう。
対戦は先攻プレイヤーのターンからスタートし、勝敗が決まるまで、あなたのターンと相手のターンを交互に繰り返します。先に相手に10点ダメージを与えたプレイヤーがゲームに勝利します。

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: Skirmish of Sixes
description:
Skirmish of Sixes is a updated and modified version of the original Skirmishes of Honor.

Skirmish of Sixes is an original system in which fantasy battles take place between 1-4 players. Battles are 15-30 minutes with a traditional format of 6 vs. 6 teams.

You may like Skirmish of Sixes because:


It has a straightforward system to manage combat mechanics including dice rolls, statistics, and abilities.
The rulebook is designed to be printer friendly, coming in full color or black & white.
It's an easy-to-learn tabletop game, with the rules being only 16 pages.
Also included in the file are supplements with a reference sheet, character abilities, character sheets, enemy blocks, and missions. This whole package totals 38 pages, or 36 for the black & white version.
Play with any materials you have as a fantasy/RPG collector.


Whether this be your miniautres, terrain, play areas, and dice. Skirmish of Sixes is miniatures agnostic and works with any scale.

There are options to play solo/solitare, competitively against other players, as well as co-op play.
Comes with seven written missions for different styles of play, including variable difficulty and number of players.
Scripted enemies in solo and co-op that have distinct tactics and mechanics to allow for replayability.
Party creation system including three tiers of units: 1 leader, 2 officers, and 3 soldiers
Equip your characters with weapons, armor, abilities, and magic of your choice.
Rules that allow for random placement of enemies and terrain, so each mission has a different layout.
Optional game rules to change how you play.


—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, King of the Hill, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Measurement Movement, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Random Production, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Re-rolling and Locking, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Single Loser Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Stat Check Resolution, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Pass Order, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Reise durchs Märchenland mit Gebrasa-Wolle
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 80 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Operation Walküre
description:
Operation Walküre is a single-player-only game that recreates the plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler in Nazi Germany during his dictatorial rule.

Players negotiate with the Allied Forces while gaining generals and civilians as allies, with the aim of establishing a new government after Hitler's assassination. The game covers the period from the summer of 1941, when the war between Germany and the Soviet Union began, to the winter of 1944, when Germany's defeat was assured.

The player controls an anti-Hitler unit consisting of generals, counter-intelligence and civilians, whose goal is to find opportunities to assassinate Hitler and ‘eliminate’ him by increasing their influence by attracting key Allied military and intelligence personnel, German generals and civilians to their side. The Hitlerites, on the other hand, are ‘sabotaged’ by the system's manipulation of the SS and by investigating and placing anti-Hitler and collaborators under arrest and surveillance.

By the winter of 1944, as the war draws to a close, the Fatherland must be saved from the ‘dictatorship’ that is pushing the German people to the brink of destruction.
